"Service was top-notch, no complaints there. Food, on the other hand, left much to be desired. Ribs were dry, flavorless. Sides? Fried okra, mac and cheese. Mac and cheese straight from a box. Three-item sampler? Onion straws, fried pickles, burnt ends. Oil puddle underneath. TGIF's ribs put these to shame. Won't be coming back. Service gets a plus one, though."
"Went in, asked for my repaired comp. Employee said, 'Can you?' Rude, uncomfortable. Made me wait 25 min. Terrible exp. Don't go there."
"Rude servers, made us wait for all seven to arrive before seating. Took 25 minutes for drinks, food lacked flavor. Tables packed tight, servers avoided eye contact."

"Food's nothing special. Hibachi's overpriced. Ants crawled off my sister's plate. Waitstaff didn't believe us. Later, more ants appeared. Server wiped table with dishrag, moved on. For $150, expected better service, cleaner atmosphere. Try Ohjah instead. Cleaner, tastier, fresher sushi, better service."
"Ten years with Sprint, never had a 4G phone with decent service. Paid for it every month. Same excuse for five years now - towers not up yet. Don't believe it."

"Went to Wahoo's in Orange County, got some bad service. Been there a few times before, always for lunch, but this time it was around 4 pm on a Friday. Service was terrible, rude even. Asked for a menu and had to flag down the bartender to take my order. Manager told me to move because people wanted to play the video gambling machine. Never had that kind of experience at Wahoo's before. Usually, it's all about the drinks and gambling, but this time it was just poor service. Disappointing, really."

"Staff here? Piss poor. No business being here. Makes me damn angry. Think of all the folks out there looking for work. And they hire these snot-nosed kids? Rude as hell too. Just walked away mid-order. Had to holler to get her back. Food? Nothing special. Tasted like something from the microwave. Twenty minutes for a sub and slice? Pathetic. Ashamed to be spending my time and money here. They need to learn some respect."

"Pros: Good location if you're nearby. Cons: Unprofessional, rude staff (three times). Appointments run behind schedule, even in the morning. Place feels like it's from the 60s, people stare at each other in fear when the AC turns on. Without an appointment, I waited over an hour and was told, 'I don't know' when I asked when I'd be seen. In summary, avoid this place unless you want to endure mental abuse, long waits, and potentially getting sick from others in the freezing temperatures. Go to the 'normal' Summerlin Labcorp instead, even if it's a bit further away."

"Bought a glazed and chocolate-covered donut at Dunkin' Donuts. Both were stale, like they'd been sittin' on the shelf for days. Took a bite of each, then tossed 'em in the trash. You'd think Dunkin' would keep their goods fresher."

"They don't take kindly to dark skin, or those who don't fit their mold. We waited twenty minutes for a meal that should've taken a few. My friend and I, we won't be going back. Thought we'd moved past such nonsense."
"Wild joint. Overpriced grub, and not worth the dough. Employees dressed up, giving free shots, but the chow? No bueno."

"I don't got time for this, but listen up. Rude's the word of the weekend. Waiters, valets, housekeeping - all of 'em. Extremely disappointed. Was lookin' forward to stayin' at "The Paris". Room's dirty (stains), outdated (no iPod plug), chipped-up bathtub. Stayed at nicer joints downtown. And hey, when someone knocks, you better haul ass to the door, 'cause housekeeping'll bust in and catch you naked! Never stayin' here again! That's a fact."

"Bought an $8 Groupon for $16 at Quiznos. Thought it'd be easy for a high school grad to ring it up, right? Wrong. They took off $7.36 pre-tax, then $8 post-tax. Should've been $16 pre-tax, like a coupon. But no. Gypped me out of $1.34 on top of their already high prices. Stay away."
"Food was decent, 7/10. But service? Abysmal. Understaffed joint, no one took our order or offered drinks for 15 minutes. Couple next to us waited even longer. What a damn shame."

"This joint's a real dump. Been here three times, same story each visit. Trash everywhere, building's a wreck. Wait times are ridiculous, especially for a fast food joint. Staff's always stretched thin, looked like they're ready to collapse. Last time I went in, some cook had sores all over his arms. Place is a mess, no leadership, no organization. Surprised it's still open."

"Late one night, we rolled into a joint, hankerin' for some donuts. We ordered through the drive-thru, but when we pulled away, we realized they'd botched the order. No sweat, these things happen. So, we swung back around and asked 'em to swap 'em out. But here's the kicker - they took the donuts we didn't want and put 'em right back on the shelf. Like they were gonna sell 'em to some other poor sap. We had those donuts in our possession for three whole minutes. Lucky for 'em, we ain't the type to go sprinklin' cyanide on our pastries."
"Taxi no-show, twice. Called at 5 am, nobody else needin' a ride. They blew it. Avoid 'em."

"Kokopelli. Affordable, sure. Nice? Not so much. Water fountain, yeah, it's big. But that's where the appeal ends. I went back for a refresh, and let me tell you, it wasn't worth it. Flat, straight, and way too easy. No trees to speak of, and the layout's a snooze. I teed off alone and ended up with a foursome at the 11th. Finished in under three hours, shot in the mid-70s. Not impressed. Skip Kokopelli, folks. Spend your cash at Las Sendas, Southern Dunes, Foothills, Clubwest, Ocotillo. Those courses are worth your time."
"Broth too salty, twice now. Waiter blames us, whole group. Baffled. Want what we ordered. Rude service. Lemon Grass better, nicer waiters, cleaner soup."

Two frozen machine margaritas and two shots of Sammy Hagar's tequila, forty-five bucks. Suggested tip on the receipt, twelve dollars. Place smelled like sewage behind the bar. Left a bad taste, won't be back. Flip the station when I hear his song again.

"I waited three afternoons for no-show techs. Finally, my internet was installed. But they hit me with a $11 monthly fee for wireless. The tech suggested I buy my own router. So I did. When I called Time Warner to register the IP, they told me I'd be charged another $7 a month to use my own router. What a racket. Rotten company. I hope the CEOs get bad breath and their wives ditch 'em for John Mayer."

"I avoid this joint like the plague. Prices are through the roof and the selection's not great either. But sometimes you gotta do what you gotta do, like pick up some milk. Last time I was there, they were out of plain pitas. And let me tell you, the staff ain't exactly the epitome of cleanliness. The cashier had a cold and was blowin' her nose left and right, then she starts touchin' all my grub without washin' her hands or usin' that fancy sanitizer stuff. Gross."

"I'd give this joint negative stars if I could. Worst experience with the owner, Eli. Went in for highlights and extensions. Six-plus hours I spent there. Eli jumped around, doing other clients in between. Finally finished, and I couldn't wait to get outta there. Got home, took a closer look, and my highlights were yellow. Asked if he used a toner, and he said no. Didn't offer to fix it or tone it. Had to go to another salon to get it done right. Extensions started falling out within days. Eli said to come back, and he'd fix 'em, but they all fell out again. Had to go to another salon to redo everything. Asked Eli for a refund, and he only offered $100. Threatened to take him to small claims court, and he gave me $150. Wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy."

"This joint's gotta be the worst Corporate Starbucks I've seen. Service is crap, takes 'em forever to bring my joe, and the place is always a mess. Only reason I come back is 'cause it's close to my digs. Now, I work at the Starbucks in Mandalay Bay, next to the House of Blues, and we may not be corporate, but we got the same standards. When I hit up this place, it takes 'em forever to notice me, even when it's dead. They're either chatty as hell or too busy doin' their own thing to care 'bout their job. Order takes ages, and forget about the drive-thru. They ignore my rewards, charge me full price, and act all snotty about it. Buncha slowpokes, if you ask me."
"Terrible show. Seen better from Cirque. Don't know how this exists. Minimal acrobatics, mostly toplessness and lame jokes. Eighty-eight bucks and two hours down the drain."

"Terrible customer service. AMEX flagged a potential fraud alert. Turns out some crooked cabbie charged me $1,200 for a six-block ride. Called to sort it out, but the agent said it was my problem, not theirs. Told me to ring my credit card company. When I said they told me to call them, she just shrugged and said she couldn't help. Don't waste your time with these people."
"Came here often. Not anymore. Rude staff, dirty tables, mediocre grub. Place has gone downhill. Won't be back."
"Place near my house, I wanna like it. But service? Shit, it's worse than a blind man tryin' to find his way outta a dark alley. Can't they find someone who ain't completely useless?"
"Terrible stay. Dirty room, pubic hair on towel, subpar food. Insect in bed. Never again."
"Service was good, but the corned beef hash? Terrible. Ruined the whole damn meal. Server was polite, but clueless. Plenty of better options around here."
"Stay clear of this joint, friend. Bought a '07 Cobalt from these crooks, 80K miles on it, shoulda lasted longer than four years. Car died this week, nothing but trouble since day one."

"Servings here are near immoral, friend. Share a plate, they'll hit you with a three-dollar fee. Not the worst deal if you're both eying the same sad excuse for a sandwich. Food's quality? Inverse to the portion size, my man. Meat's like cardboard - dry, flavorless, and slapped between two slices of bread. Chicken soup? Forget about it. Yellow liquid with a hint of powdered crap. Sodium's the main flavor. This place is packed, but hey, it's Vegas. Anything goes."

"Afternoon turned sour at this joint. Wife, in-laws, and I stopped by for a bite. Not packed, but still subpar service. Ordered soup, got a cup without crackers. Had to chase down server to fix it. Chicken sandwich arrived with cold, soggy fries. Sourdough bread? Ice cold. Gave 'em hell, didn't take their crap, and won't be back. Denny's looks good compared to this dump. Save your dough, skip this place."
"Four hundred bucks for a little cart of grub? Ridiculous. Vitamins, full price. Buy online, save half. That's the ticket."

"Slow service. Took 25 minutes for three basic tacos. Tacos were average. Mine were too salty, but I didn't bother complaining given the wait and lack of customer attention. Menu's limited and you gotta pay extra for cheese or salsa. Maybe others had a better experience with the burritos, but that's not what I had. No indoor seating. Outdoor seating's a joke - plastic picnic tables that'll fry you in the sun. Inside, you're faced with a server behind a grill and a handful of plastic chairs to wait in. Feels like a western jailhouse, minus the food."

"Airport grub, overpriced and underserved. Asked for a table, got a smart-aleck hostess instead. Menu? Ha! Like pulling teeth. Ordered a ceasar, spinach chicken, kids' chicken, and a burrito that failed to impress. Service? Sub-par, like the food. Waitress didn't bother with our menus, nor did she crack a smile. Leaving a bad taste, like the rubbery chicken tenders. Not worth the cash. Yelp reviews should've been my guide. Lesson learned. They'll hear from me alright."

"Worst of Yelp Awards? This place takes the cake. Logistics for the National Championship game? Disaster. Felt like the first event they ever held. Problems galore. Concessions? None outside. Inside, they ran out of hot dogs, cups, and beer before halftime. Parking lot security? Yellers. Four gates for 70+ thousand fans? Not enough. Jumbotrons? Tiny. Stadium announcer? Barely audible. Replays? Forget it. Escalators? Fit one person at a time. This stadium doesn't deserve a BCS game. Hope it gets yanked."

"Sitting here, waiting for my grub, and I gotta say, it ain't looking good. They gave us some free chips and salsa, but that don't mean squat if they can't deliver the goods. Two other tables got their food before me, and that's just plain wrong. This Chili's joint ain't doing so hot, let me tell ya. You might wanna steer clear, 'cause if you're hungry, you'll be waiting a while."
"Terrible service. No response to calls. Didn't show for hotel pickup. Shut 'em down."
"Charged me two quid for wifi. Place that charges for bread, water, and wifi gets a bad review. Food's average, prices are too. Service is meh. Used to be great five years back. What happened?"

"Avis, worst. High prices, no give on competitor's lower rates. Booked ahead, chose pay now, cheaper. Found better deal with Alamo, half the cost. Cancelled, still charged $25. Should've picked pay later, no charge. Customer service? Don't care. Never again, avoid Avis."

"Convenience led me here twice before. Both visits, disappointment followed. Won't be back. Kids run the show, no manager in sight. Orders forgotten, little concern for quality. Investment gone to waste. Avoid it if you can."
"Cleaners lost a string on my shirt. Disappointed. Time for a new place."

"This joint? Zero stars, easy. First time, I damn near choked on a plastic shard in my salad. Barkeep drops it on the floor like it's nothing. Couple months later, I'm hungry and stupid, so I give 'em another shot. Barkeep's rude, slow, and can't mix a drink to save his life. Friend gets their food, but I'm still waiting after 20 minutes. Ask the bartender, nice as can be, where my pizza's at, and he shrugs and walks off. Ask to see a manager, and they tell me he's too busy. Finally get my pizza, an hour and a half later. Kitchen manager shows up, does his job, talks to me. But that other guy, working New Year's Eve? He don't deserve the job, should be fired."

"Josh was our pool guy. Didn't say much, but when he did, it was always some long-winded excuse. Pool turned green, water tested at Leslie's, zero chlorine. Confronted him, he bailed on us, didn't even tell us for two months. Disappointing, poorly run business."

"TAO Beach? Overrated. Girls get in free, guys pay $20. I was pumped at first, the music outside was tight. Top 40 and electropop, my jam. But you don't need to be inside to hear it, it's loud af. The regular Venetian pool next door is bigger and better. TAO Beach is tiny. unless you've got a cabana, it's not worth it. My friends and I were in and out. The only reason to go back is for the novelty bracelet, sadly. Same deal with TAO the club, small, crowded, and overhyped. First-timers might dig it, but it's meh. Hot girls in the tubs though. That's it."

"This joint's a dump. Don't believe the 'discounted' hype. I checked out Michael Kors, and they wanted $350 for a watch. Same watch at Fashion Square costs $275. Not exactly a bargain. Charlotte Russe had a buy-one-get-one deal for $12.50. Non-outlet store charges $15.50. H&M prices were the same as the one in Scottsdale. Never been a fan of outlet malls, but this one takes the cake for being the real deal worst."
"Place drains, kid. Long lines, poor service. Stand in one line to get fabric cut, another to check out. Damn kids' art project."
"Terrible service. Slow as molasses. Asked the waiter to add a dish, he just shrugged and split. Never knew if he put it in. Took an hour for the grub. Awful experience."

"I Yelp for kicks and to help others choose where to spend their dough. No free stuff for me, ever. Rarely write negative reviews, but Zoe's was a health risk. Manager called, apologized, asked for my address to send a gift certificate. Nice gesture, but unnecessary. Two weeks later, still nothing. Followed up with the customer service rep and still waiting. Poor management, that's what happened to Zoe's."
"Regulars ain't too welcoming if you ain't a Packers fan. But we got great service from our waitress. Place is perfect for them Cheeseheads. Wings were decent, too."
"Tried this joint again. Bad move. Salad was a mess - soggy brown lettuce, runny guac. Not worth the jacked-up price. Neighboring spots like Gadzooks and Chipotle serve better grub for cheaper."
"Crappy place. Saw it on Man vs Food, thought it'd be good. But no, they give us puny, stale crawfish. Not worth it. Don't waste your money, go to Wynn buffet instead."

"Labor Day, 2014. Walk in, plenty of open tables. Hostess says wait time's 15 minutes. I ask why, she says they got big parties comin' in. Food's mediocre, place ain't worth the wait. Won't be goin' back."
"Pizza joint with the gang from work. Pizza? Forget it. Garlic bread, straight from the supermarket. No way I'm comin' back."

"I rolled into Vegas the week before Turkey Day, and the town was dead. Quiet, empty, and just the way I liked it. Pros: My room was silent as a tomb. Didn't hear a peep from anyone the whole time. Location was perfect - off the strip, just how I like it. Decor was top-notch, too. Reason I picked the place. Cozy, no casino, no shows, no late-night bars. Just peace and quiet. Free parking, free WiFi. Cons: The kids running the front desk need a crash course in manners and customer service. Unhelpful little punks. Booked through Priceline, paid in full months ago. Confirmed my reservation, too. Get there after a long drive, and they tell me I owe $75 a night for "incidentals." Never seen a fee that high at a hotel. Didn't have an extra $150 on me. Finally convinced them to charge me $75 for the first night and settle up the rest in the morning. Not exactly the best business practice. Stay somewhere else. Staff's got some 'tude and the place smells like a scam."
"Awful. Just awful. Not Pad Thai. Service? Nonexistent. Had to hunt down someone for the bill. Never again."
"Went to Jamba Juice, eyeing their showcased drink. That's what I wanted, but they were lacking two crucial elements. Never going back."

"Windshield washer fluid. What's in it? Swamp water? Outhouse juice? Don't know, don't care. It's rank. Hubby gets a drop on his shoe, tries to wipe it off with baby wipes. No good. Skunk stench still there. Can't take it. Make him turn around, go to grocery store bathroom to wash shoe. Yuck. Shoes are trash now."

"Decent pizza, but delivery's a bust. Ordered online at 6:50, estimated delivery 7:50. Two miles away, should be quick. Called at 8, told order was on its way. Called again at 8:20, manager was delivering. 8:50, still no pizza. Turns out, order was never pulled. Bad process, bad employees, lied twice. Stick to dine-in or pickup. Epic fail."

"Apple Store? More like Apple Disaster. Especially if you're a Yank. Foreigners flock here, and that's part of the problem. Employees don't give a damn. You walk in, nobody greets you. They know they'll make sales no matter what, so why bother? Tourists'll buy anything, and that's all that matters to them."

"Tropicana, twice. First visit, decent. Second, garbage. Lady at burrito station, trash talkin' Spanish, callin' us slow, stupid. Over a tossed tortilla? Please. Ordered two burritos, switched to carne asada fries. She kept jabberin', didn't know I understood. Everyone laughin', ordered two tacos instead - seso, cabeza. Guy says, 'pay and ill get it.' Tacos reeked, tasted rotten. Didn't touch 'em. Veronica, the culprit. Thrown tortilla, intentional food poisoning? Never comin' back. Other location? Nope."

"This place is a real stinker, kid. Worst store I've ever set foot in. Got some joker named Jason workin' there, and he's about as friendly as a rabid dog. But hey, there's this one salesperson, don't know her name, but she's got her head screwed on straight. She's the only one in the joint who knows what she's doin', and she's got a good attitude. Shame about the rest of 'em, though."
"No flour chips, no point. Just another Mex place. Bummer."
"Terrible food, worst since '95. Service was crap too. Filet mignon? More like cardboard. Never going back."

"Get outta here! First one in at 7:30 am for tires and oil change. Shady service writer tries to sell me his own tires from his personal ride. Shoulda known better. Waited two hours, still not done. Four hours pass, I'm fumin'. They offer me a ride home, finally finish the job eight hours later. Deliver my car to my doorstep, I thank 'em and tip 'em. Two months later, trade my car in, dealership says oil dip stick handle broke off completely. Those bastards at Goodyear knew exactly what they were doin'. Who knows what else they did to my ride? Spreadin' the word, don't wanna see this happen to anyone else. Karma's a bitch."

"I said to myself, 'This'll be the last time I come here.' But, of course, I went back. And, of course, the prices were still too damn high. But what really got me was the cashier, Scott. He had this bored look on his face, like he'd rather be anywhere else. And he couldn't even count my change right. Just dumped all the coins and bills into my hand like it was a bother. Unprofessional, that's what it was. Embarrassing for the store, really."

I've been to this joint plenty of times since it's near my work and easy to swing by during lunch. But, I'm done with it now. It's just not worth the hassle. 

First off, you gotta wait and there's nowhere to sit or stand. It's like a can of sardines in there. Then, the nail techs try to sell you on all sorts of extras when you're just trying to get a simple pedi. 

Last time I went, my pinky toe was mangled and two weeks later, my nails started turning yellow. I wasn't basking in the sun or anything, so it must've been their polish. Once I got it removed elsewhere, my nails were A-okay. 

Oh, and my friend got a gel manicure there and it chipped within minutes of walking out the door. 

I'm done giving this place chances.

"Place was dead slow. Ordered takeout 25 minutes before, still waited 15 more. Wednesday night, not busy. Walked in, straight to counter. Three people there - two old dudes and a lady at the register. They ignored me like I was a ghost. Felt like an eternity, just waiting for my popcorn to finish.

Food? Forget about it. Six garlic knots, small as quarters, cost $2.50. Average quality at best. Pizza? Showed it to me when I picked it up. Looked like a frozen pizza. No variation in the crust, no bubbles, no color difference. Taste? Crust was terrible, sauce barely existed, cheese and toppings skimpy.

Feel robbed. Very disappointed. Won't be back. Drive by on my way home, won't give 'em another dime."

"One star, that's all they get. Screwed up my glasses, overcharged me, and the service was crap. Don't even get me started on the transition lenses. They're covered in tiny cracks and look like crap. Transitions Optical says they're supposed to be under warranty for two years, but I didn't get a certificate of authenticity. So now I gotta get my lenses replaced elsewhere. Stay away from this joint, folks."

"Sushi joint, worst experience. Rude hostess, busted toilets, staff ripped us off. Charged adult prices for my tall ten-year-old, didn't fix it when I complained. Then they hit us with an illegal 18% gratuity. Don't recommend it to anyone."
"Wings and tenders combo, despite the bad reviews. Gross. Cardboard wings, dirty sock tenders. Drenched in oil. Cholesterol OD. Fries, just okay. Disgusting."
"Jiffy Lube, slow as hell. Thought it'd be a quick stop, but it took over an hour. No one in front of me, just a bunch of lazy bastards working there."
"Tried this joint based on Yelp raves. Total letdown. Walked in, thought, 'What the hell?' Decor nonexistent. Lunch and girl's order as unappetizing as surroundings. Won't be back."

"We hit up the San Diego joint and dug it big time. But the Las Vegas spot? Not so much. It was a snooze fest. Staff was meh. You'd think they'd bring the energy in Vegas, but nope. We sat for like 20 minutes before anyone bothered us. Only bright spot was the older gent who served us. He was cool. Rest of the place? Zzzz. Food wasn't even the same. What a bummer!"

"Lunch break done. Food and drink, good stuff. Service, nice. But when it came time to pay, no one seemed too eager. I left the cash on the table and split. Missed the bus, had to wait another 20 minutes. Crap."

"Walked in, thought I was in for a good time. But no, big letdown. They hit me with unsanitized tools, charged me for glitter I didn't want, and my gel polish chipped by the next morning. Sixty bucks for a gel mani and reg pedi that didn't last a day. Friendly, sure, but that don't cut it."

"Bartender, bald and rude. Spoke to manager, got apology and free beer. Hope bartender improves people skills. Place wasn't busy, hour after Dbacks game. Didn't eat, heard good things about food. Baldy Bartender ruined vibe. Like that they have tvs. No way I'd ask him to change station, lol."

"Craftsteak was booked solid, so I settled for Delmonico. Service was good, but not warm and fuzzy. I like my servers like I like my steak - juicy and tender. The rib eye? Disappointing. Not much marbling, tough as shoe leather. My taste buds prefer a smooth ride, not a chewy mess. Surrounded by better options in Sin City, I won't be back."
"Pricey buffet at $21 a pop. Not worth it. Better options nearby. Four Queens served up a mean meal for a mere $9."

"Food? Yeah, there's a lot of it. But let me tell you, I wasn't exactly blown away. It's alright, I guess. Just don't expect anything too special. Kinda feels like Olive Garden on steroids, you know?"

"TK's got some balls callin' himself the All-American, but I reckon he's just full of hot air. Went to see Rev. Horton Heat at I Love This Bar & Grill on Thursday, and while the music was good, the prices were highway robbery. Five bucks for a can of PBR? Eight dollars for a rum and diet? No way, Jose. The grub looked like something outta Applebee's, and the bartender was clueless. Prices kept changin' all night too. Bad service, bad drink prices, good entertainment, but overall, it's a rip-off."

"Wanted to like this joint, went there twice. First time, ordered water, waitress gives me the hairy eyeball, 'You sure you don't want a lemon in that?' Like, what's up with the water? Tastes like crap. Second time, saw Kreplach soup, got excited. But no, they're mass-produced, skinny, not handmade. Don't waste your time. Half sandwich, tiny cole slaw, like they're trying to save money. Corned beef sandwiches, okay, but small for the price. Entrance is a mess, lots of different areas crammed together. Seating area, plain. Not impressed. If this is Tempe's idea of a Jewish deli, it's lacking."
"Terrible service. Great food, though. Ordered, waited 50 minutes, then didn't see the waitress again for 30 more. She finally brought the check."

"The theater ain't so bad, just old and outdated like the Mills malls it came from. I got dragged there on a Thursday night, watched some dumb comedy with a handful of others. Never getting those hours back. Tried using the ticket machines, but they broke down on us. Had to go to the box office, defeating the purpose. The manager let us in, maybe we'll make up a story next time."

"This joint used to be my go-to spot back when it was at von's. Moved to Food4Less, still decent. Closed up shop for a bit, no idea why. Now it's back and I'm stoked. Came in today for my usual, pad thai. Doesn't quite taste the same, and they scrapped the lunch special. Bummer."

"Site's got some issues, pal. Stock levels ain't accurate, and they don't give a damn 'bout lettin' folks know when they're outta stock. You try to get 'em to fix things, they just talk over ya and hang up. That's their way of sayin' they don't want your business. Well, I'm happy to oblige 'em. Screw 'em."
"Went downhill, fast. Been here a couple years, near Chinese place. Not going back."
"Waitress, nice. Open on Xmas eve, good. But, waitress no good at job. Beer, skunked. Fries, slow and cold."

"You wanna die soon? Cover charge, shouldn't be charged, girlfriend gets raped on the dance floor. Two stars 'cause I used to like it. Pool, good music, dancing, reasonable drinks. But after some rough times, fights every week, and a shooting in the parking lot...no thanks. Don't do karaoke, so that part might be alright."
"Tacos? Yeah, they got 'em. Service? Meh. Drunk and hungry? That's their jam."

"Sunday morning, hungover and tired, I drove around South Phoenix for an hour, searching for a Mexican dive joint serving breakfast burritos. Finally, I landed at Fili B's, where they serve breakfast all day. If I weren't so desperate, I might've hit a more familiar drive-thru, but there I was. The food? Meh. Too much cheese, undercooked bacon, and my friends' chorizo burritos were bland and greasy. Normally, I avoid Fili's and opt for its knockoff joints like Rollberto's or Armando's."
"Good spot, nice joint. Grub's alright, not great. Drinks, now those were something else. Creative, I'll give 'em that."

"Lasagna, soup, and salad. Soup tasted like Italian dressing, used to be good. Disappointed, saved it for a refund. Manager hesitant, all the flavor gone, too sweet now. Don't mess with a good thing. Lasagna sweet, small portion, make it myself. Salad great, crispy veggies, drain the lettuce, no sugar dressing. Won't return for anything but the salad, bring my own dressing. Bummer."
"Pants hemmed here. Decent job, but too long. Pinning didn't help. Week-long wait. Absurd cost."

"Food was decent, nothing special. Service was top-notch, though. Friendly folks. Celebrating our one-year anniversary, my husband and I. Would've preferred a place where they let you finish your meal without taking your plate. Busy Sunday, but still felt rushed. Won't be back."
"I asked for a mozzarella and tomato sandwich, some pasta salad, and a drink. Thirteen bucks. Could've gotten a better meal at a real restaurant for that price. But hey, their cookies are top-notch."
"Good beer, bad grub. Cheap eats, though. Nice screens."
"Went there, real disappointment. Hubby had veggie skillet, cold veggies, sad cheese. I got pancakes, Bisquick does 'em better. Never going back, too bad since we're neighbors."

"Tuesday night, I got my nails done here. Nail lady was great, but the joint itself? Not so much. Hairdresser named Barbara, her kids ran wild. Screaming, yelling. Unprofessional. I was in a different part of the salon, still heard 'em. Nail lady said it was normal, kids always loud, Barbara too. I just wanted some peace, couldn't get it. Won't be going back."

"Smoke-filled casino with too much repetition."

I stepped into the casino, and the smoke hit me like a heavy fog. It was everywhere, and it seemed to cling to everything. Even the air felt thick with it. I made my way through the haze, trying to find a place to sit down and play some slots. But every machine I approached was occupied, and the people sitting at them didn't look like they were planning on leaving anytime soon.

I signed up for their rewards program, hoping to get some free play out of it. But all I got was $10, and it could only be used on a handful of machines that were scattered throughout the casino. And of course, those machines were always busy. It was like they were taunting me, dangling the possibility of free play just out of reach.

Overall, this casino was a disappointment. It was my least favorite in the area, and I won't be rushing back anytime soon. The smoke was overwhelming, and the lack of available machines made it hard to enjoy myself. I'll stick to other casinos from now on.
"Brunch was good, service was bad. Steak knife on the can, glad no little girls found it. Disappointed, need a new spot. This place needs to get its act together."

"2.5 stars. Rounding down.

Hype said this Vegas buffet was top-notch. Decent, but not worth raving about.

World buffet theme with Chinese, American, Mexican, Mediterranean, and maybe Japanese stations. Creative, but limited options at each station.

Hubby said crab legs were undercooked. Not impressed by seafood selection, but this ain't no seafood buffet.

Had a juicy roast pork, but nothing special.

Skip it. Go to a real restaurant instead."

"Lunch buffetâ€™s mediocre, best to avoid. I only go for the chaat, but today they said no, kitchenâ€™s too busy. Waitress took our order first, then told us no chaat. Others got takeout, must have called ahead."

"Disappointment stung like a slap in the face. Heard tales of this joint, expected more. Walked in, greeted promptly. Service was top-notch. Place was empty, though. After 9 pm, drinks weren't on special. Eight bucks for a Corona? Pass."

"Sandwich joint in Bryant Park. Good memories. Fresh, hot sammies. Can't beat it. Vegas version? Not so much. Mediocre at best. Line to the door on a Saturday afternoon. Shouldn't be surprised. Time means nothing in a casino. Ordered ham, cheddar, apple on pumpernickel. Took a bit. Ripped it open in the car. Messy. Soggy. Cheddar killed the flavor. Subway does it better."

"Disappointment reigned. Questionable night at a four-star joint, according to Yelp. Quality control? Nonexistent. Freshness lacking, presentation decent. Meat? Dried out, tough. Prime rib, turkey, ribs - all dry, all tough. Asian cuisine? Nauseating. Pizza and ice cream, edible. Won't return."

"Brunch was a bust. Sign said 11-3:30, but that was BS. Downstairs restaurant, maybe. Not up here. We were hungry, so we ate anyway. Appetizer, good. Veggie burger, crap. Frozen patty job. Waited forever for the bill. Corner table, forgotten. Waiter apologized, but too little, too late. Won't be back."

The joint was jumpinâ€™, Sundays no exception. Margaritas at Hefe, then off to Old Town Scottsdale we went. Packed house, felt like a sardine. If it were in a smaller town, maybe more fun. But here? Too many folks crammed into a tiny space. Management should consider a cap on capacity. Ridiculous, thatâ€™s what it was.

"DMV's a pain. Avoid it if I can. Kiosk outside's the way to go. Did my reg renewal at 2 am, quick and easy. Took two minutes, spat out my reg like a dream. Convenient, that. Hopefully, more kiosks pop up. Employees treat customers poorly, like they're stuck with 'em. Lines wrap 'round the building, packed. Snack bar? Yeah, good luck with that."

"Sign of a bad joint when it's dead empty at dinnertime. Menu's a joke, too - bigger than Cheesecake Factory's. Stuck with chicken tenders, my girl went Thai, her mom a salad. Took damn near 45 minutes. Chicken was alright, better than I thought, but not worth the wait. Beer selection? Pathetic."

"Went to this joint on a night when they had some bands playin'. Had a helluva time gettin' the attention of the waitstaff. Finally walked up to the bar and ordered two draft beers, which set me back close to ten bucks. Took 'em a while to notice us, but after 'bout forty minutes, our orders were ready. The appetizer, some kinda Italian burrito, was still frozen solid in the middle. Soups were just okay. Ribs were pretty good, but Jesus, they drowned 'em in sauce. If you don't like a lotta sauce, best to ask for it on the side. Bands were damn good that night, though. Only had three drinks, 'cause that's all they seemed to want to sell me. Couldn't get anyone's attention for more. Seemed like if they're gonna pay a band, they should try a little harder to sell the grub and drinks, y'know?"
"Walked in, happy hour. Looked 'round. Smelled like death. Walked out. Maybe good spot for retirees."
"Staff, friendly. Accommodating, too. Flower arrangement, nice. But pricey. Roses, some dead. Not worth it."

"First-time at this joint. Been to other spots, pizza was great, service was crap. Friends in town, wanted good pizza, not some chain dump. Ordered two pies, they were just okay. Staff wasn't too bad, but drinks sat empty for too long. Waitress disappeared for a bit. Won't be coming back. Other location's better. Proximity to UNLV must be what keeps this place going."

"Place looks like shit. Service slow, grub mediocre, quality down the drain. Dining area? Filthy. Used to be a cheap alternative to PF Chang's. Now it's just a step up from Denny's. You've lost your touch, big time."

"Tight economy, hate to knock a joint. But this place? Empty. Sat alone, grabbed my own seasonings. Waitress/owner, nice but not too fussed about my needs. Babaganoush, decent. Salad, fresh. Kafta kabob, dry. Should've added tzatziki. Lady, pleasant enough. Not eager to please. Three stars, pushing it. Would I return? Maybe, for the lunch deals."

"Terrible value, overpriced tourist trap. Went with friends, server was creepy, snarky. Food was mediocre, eggplant parm was greasy, ravioli was flat and lacking filling, Caprese was fresh and nice. Asked to see car collection, they wanted a cover charge. Skip this place."

"Tight parking lot at this Walgreens. Keep an eye out when walking to your car. Recommend using the drive-through. Had a great experience with the clerk. She earned a star. Otherwise, it would've been a one-star visit."
"Long wait. Hot chocolate, bordering on drinkable. Clearly labeled as "black 56% bla bla bla." Ordered wrong. My casserole wasn't good enough to make up for it. Disappointment."

"Went to this joint with some pals after work. Nice spot, looks over Market Square. Service and grub? Not so much. Happy hour margaritas were decent though, big and strong. Got some apps, half off during happy hour. Sopecitos, empanadas, flautas...eh. Flautas were good, wished we got more of 'em. Service sucked too. Food took forever, one dish was wrong. Sent it back, still charged me. Whole thing was a pain."
"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition." I went, tried the al pastor and lengua tacos. The pastor: dry, lacking sweetness. Lengua: tender, but bland, not enough seasoning.

"Staff was decent, except one. Went during lunch, prepping my bowl. This staffer yells at me, attitude dripping, 'You can't be back here!' She means the space between the two self-serve stations. One's closed, but it's tough to reach the far items. So, I go to the other side, making it easier. She yells from afar, instead of walking over, warning me it's off-limits. Rude! What's the goal here? Go big or go home! Won't be back."

"My buddy had been raving about this joint, so I was let down when I found out it wasn't all that great for veggies or vegans. The burger I ordered was a disappointment, too. It had a sour, sickly sweet taste that made me stop eating it. Hardly ever happens to me, but this place was a bust."
"Omelette, overcooked and rubbery. Not good. Disappointing, considering past visits. Companion's omelette, same issue. Advice? Avoid the omelette, especially for that price."

"I'm a Mexican food snob. Hole-in-the-wall joints are my jam. Had the mini chimis with beans and rice - $10, a bit steep for the quality. Cream cheese and beef, sweet, almost like flaky pastry dough. Refried beans, delish. Wished for chicken ones. Salsa bar salsas, flavorless. Avocado + salsa verde, unique and tasty. Restaurant, super clean, too friendly - four greetings while eating, overkill. Fried ice cream milkshake, worth trying. Might go back for that. Not Carolina's/Los Dos Melinos level."

"Vegas, baby! Arrive pumped, ready to roll. Lose all your dough gambling, can't swing a meal, clubs turn you away, feel like crap. Time to bail. 

Airport's a zoo. Line snakes 'round the room, hundreds strong. Hour or two, finally through security. Phew! 

Gotta hit the D gates. Tram's busted?! Start trekkin' a mile with a hundred pounds of luggage. Checked bag limit's fifty, but you packed way too much junk. 

Finally at the gate. Two-hour delay?! Dammit! 

Recap: Security line's a nightmare, tram's down, gotta hike a mile, two-hour delay. Only perk's the free Wi-Fi. That's how I wrote this review."
"Veggie burger, good. Fries, crispy. Service, bad. Twice now, we've had to chase down a waitress for refills. Takeout next time, no tip needed."

"Good joint, friendly folk. But I gotta say, I've had better. Therapist was real friendly, worked on every spot I asked, but created a knot that's still buggin' me. Nice place, pleasant front desk staff, but a bit steep. You can find similar quality massages for cheaper elsewhere. Was referred here, had high hopes, but maybe my standards are too high. Doubt I'll be back. Nothin' special here, just your run-of-the-mill massage joint."

"Airline staff need better training, that's the truth. Southwest gives two passes max, per customer, per day. Like this: Phoenix to Spokane, connection in Oklahoma City. Two passes, no problem. But then, Spokane to Las Vegas, no change of plane. They give me another pass. Now I'm stuck on a full flight, overbooked. Frustrating, that's what it is."

"Cochinito pibil, a $20 slow-cooked pork dish, was nothing special. Too salty, a bit dry. Spices overpowered the flavor. Sauce drips on the plate, half-wiped off, made it look dirty. But the $7 Modelo beer, now that was something else. Crisp, refreshing, a perfect complement to the mediocre meal."

"The Haymaker used to be my go-to spot, but it's gone downhill fast. I took my friends and family there, but the service and quality have slipped. My glass used to be full, now it's always empty. They don't even give me a refill. The burgers used to come with a nice piece of lettuce, now it's just shredded mess. They stopped offering that great toasted almond iced coffee too. And don't even get me started on the lack of marinara sauce for the mozzarella sticks. But hey, at least they still have those $2 Bud Light drafts during happy hour. That's about the only thing that's still good there. Oh, and the burger? It was medium rare, but they managed to slap a raw tomato butt end on it. And don't even get me started on the single onion ring they gave me. I won't be back unless I hear some serious changes are made."

"We hit this joint pretty often, so you'd think I'd give it high marks. But let's be real, it's not great. We mostly come for the chips and salsa, which are solid. Margaritas are good too. They've got a new pretzel stick appetizer that's decent. Most of the servers are friendly and attentive. But the food? Meh. I've tried a bunch of different dishes and nothing's really impressed me. Sides are usually subpar and the kids' meals are terrible. If it's just me and the hubby, we might stop by for lunch and get the endless chips and salsa with soup and salad. But even those have been lacking lately. Will I be back? Sure, for a drink and some snacks. But if I'm looking for a real meal, I'll go elsewhere."

"Been here a few times. Not impressed. Stylists are alright, nothing special. Prices are decent, but a bit steep for what you get. Biggest issue's the customer service. Called after hours, left messages. They won't call back. If they're too busy to return calls, maybe they don't need my business. Won't be coming back."

"Worst Hawaiian BBQ joint I've been to, no contest. No teriyaki or katsu sauce? Fail. Soy sauce and some glowing red crap instead? Pathetic. Mac salad? Overcooked, mushy, and drenched in low-quality mayo. Missing the carrot shavings too. Chicken? Dry as hell. Can't even taste the marinade. Veggies? Old, dry cabbage. Fake grass in an Easter basket. Menu's confused, Hawaiian BBQ or ghetto Chinese? Friendly elderly Asian couple, quick service, but that's about it. Clean, but nothing special. Won't be back."

"I went to the Milano in '90. It was the coolest bar around, but not anymore. Few customers, lazy staff, loud music, made it hard to hear and relax. They closed the windows to avoid complaints from outside, but the old AC couldn't handle it, and the door to the smoking room stayed open, so the staff could come and go quicker. You reeked of smoke when you left, just like before."

"This joint's usually solid for breakfas', but not today. Unfriendly greeter, average grub. Been around a while, good rep, but kitchen's slackin' and needs a cheerful face at the door. I'll give 'em another shot down the line."
"Friendly staff. Downhill from there. Room 1122? Don't bother. Train, ice machine, AC/heat unit. No sleep. Peeling wallpaper. Outdated decor. Cold food at lunch. No outlets."

"Thrift store fiend, that's me. And this Goodwill joint? Just plain junk. Never been impressed with their wares. Smells like grandma's dead cat when you step inside. But hey, they got some decent older furniture if you're lookin' to fix it up or slap some paint on it. \n\nNow, if you're in the area, hit up the one on 20th and Indian School. Newly built, clean as a whistle, and packed with goodies."

"Lunchtime. We came. Ordered the sweet deal, three for four bucks. Cheeseburger, onion rings, drink. Food arrived fast, too fast. Poorly made burger, too much mustard and ketchup, oozing out. Onion rings, not bad."

"Pizza joint wasn't half bad. Reviews said their pies were decent, so we gave 'em a shot. Ordered a large thin crust with the works. Crust was more doughy than thin, but it'll do. Spent some time in Italy, know what I mean? This ain't no Palermo crust. Mushrooms tasted straight outta a can. Service was meh, kid taking our order had a face like a sourpuss. Owner seemed friendly enough on the way out, though."

"Heard good things 'bout this joint, so gave it a shot. Ordered Thai beef salad, Asian chicken salad, monster meatballs and spaghetti, grilled salmon. Big letdown. Don't even remember the meatball taste. Spaghetti and salad dressings? Bad news. Rice was rock hard. Salmon was alright, but tiny compared to other plates.

Frozen hot chocolate though? Top-notch. Loved it. Made the whole thing better.

Not sure if we just picked wrong, but not comin' back for the food. Just dessert."

"Sat in heat, waited ten minutes for menu and water. Server didn't glance our way, too busy eyeing passersby. Wine list vanished before we could blink, replaced by a curt query about drinks. Politely pointed out the oversight, but his attitude soured the air. Food followed suit - mediocre caprese, dismal calamari. No flavor, no texture. Not a single expression of gratitude or well-wishing as we departed. Unpleasant experience, won't return. Luna Grossa, indeed."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

I ate at this place and it was edible, but that's about it. They called it sushi, but it was just rice and vegetables rolled up. Not impressed. Won't be back.

"2 stars for decent service, but sushi rice is consistently mushy and falls apart. Kabuki in Cali never has this issue. Given this place multiple chances, but seems like they can't get their sushi together. Work on that Alaskan roll, sushi chefs! Maybe LA locations can help improve quality. Table booths appear dirty, walls are grimy, and glass separators are smudged. Sunshade has sauce stains, and table lights are dusty. Not a clean atmosphere. What's happening, Kabuki LV?" (487 tokens)

"Grilled chicken salad, first time at Bravo. Pink chicken, sent it back. Sangria rosa, too sweet, like a daiquiri. Chicken caprese, thin, rubbery, couldn't cut it. Orzo, no seasoning. Disappointed. Won't be back. Two stars for good service."

"This joint used to be my go-to for deals, but now it's crawling with eBay vultures. They've taken over, and it's a madhouse. They're buddy-buddy with the employees, so forget about getting a fair shot. Last time I was there, some eBay bloodsucker even brought the staff lunch. What a joke. I'd rather pay top dollar at Nordstrom than deal with that circus."
"Restaurant was a tourist trap. Food, service, and atmosphereâ€”all subpar. Not worth the dough. Beer cost ten bucks, steak and fries thirty. Girls were cute, but that's where it ended."
"Went there recently. Sushi didn't taste as fresh as I remembered. Doubtful about going back."

"Wings? No thanks. Not worth the cash. You get scraps, bones, and dry meat. No drums either. Flavor's lackin', too much salt, and tastes like Panda Express's sweet 'n' sour sauce. What's the point of bein' a chef if you can't make it taste good or fillin'? I got served bones, pretty presentation, and some sauce on the side. Offensive, really. Where's the meat go? Don't know if I'd be more pissed if they threw it away or used it elsewhere, double dippin'."

"It's a decent joint, I reckon. Been goin' there for a bit now, and the staff's always been top-notch. Food's alright, but not exactly somethin' to write home about. Place is startin' to slip, though. Bathrooms ain't exactly spotless, especially if you show up bright 'n early. Wish 'em well, but I've given 'em enough of my hard-earned cash, and it ain't gettin' any better. Sorry, fellas."

"Place used to be good, now it's not. Service still bad, like everyone says. Portions small, prices high. Food quality downhill. Wonton soup, small pot, imitation crab. Spring rolls, cooked outside, frozen inside. Used to like it here, but now it's poor service, no communication, don't care about customers. Can't recommend it no more."

"Terrible pedicure. Guy who did my nails was decent, patient. Had to pry off old set, fill was fresh. Hurt like hell though, drill slipped and cut me. Nails look good, thin and shaped well. Pedi was a disaster. Scrubbed, cut, filed okay, but massage was non-existent. Barely touched my feet, rubbed shins and knees instead. Squeezed and pinched my toes, slapped bottoms of feet. No idea what she was doing. Sloppy polish job, paint on cuticles uncleaned. Weird, weird, weird. Won't return."

"Slammed by Mill for the ASU game, ended up here. Ordered souvlaki - beef and lamb. Lamb was underseasoned, beef had a better taste but chewy and hard to swallow. Spat out a piece, unfortunately. Didn't feel like I got my money's worth. Veg was bland too. People mostly ordered apps, maybe I missed out. Waitress was great, friendly. Extra star for her. Not sure about coming back with other options around."

"Bouchon, a joint I frequent when in Vegas. Last time I was there, in March, I left a comment on their site, haven't heard back, so I'm posting here too. Food's good, prices steep. What got me was the $7 carafe of house water. $21 for three? Come on! You're charging me for tap water at a place where we're already paying premium prices? Shame on you, Bouchon. I didn't ask for anything fancy, just tap water. They adjusted the price, but still, embarrassing in front of my business associates."
"Oil change took too long. Two hours, watched others get served first. Place was clean, staff was friendly, but management was a mess. Not going back."

"Pomo used to be in Scottsdale, serving top-notch Napoletana pizza in a snooty atmosphere. But the downtown location was different. Modern decor, hipster staff, and a disappointing pie that lacked the flavor and quality of the original. Skip it and head to La Piazza Locale instead."

"The joint was alright. Had some laughs with the girls on a birthday bash, but the bar itself wasn't anything special. It was a multi-level spot with decent drinks, but the decor was a bit much. Felt like a cheap imitation of something classy. The chandelier over the bar was nice, but the plastic one hanging from the ceiling looked tacky. Like someone tried to make it look fancy but failed. Reminded me of those Mardi Gras beads you get for showing some skin. Not my cup of tea. There are better places to grab a drink in Vegas."

"MENU CHANGE: Enjoyed the flatbread tapas at happy hour, but last night they replaced it with Matzoh Ball CRACKERS for full price dinner. Not worth it. $10 for crackers and tiny scoops of hummus, bruschetta and tapenade is too much. Friend struggled to eat the flatbread pizza because CRACKERS can't support the weight of toppings and sauce. Server said it was a permanent change. I'll go to one of the other gastro pubs in town or just walk across the street to Firefly for better food. The fresh brewed beer isn't worth it either, too heavy with a syrupy honey taste. Bleh."

"First time at the store, bought a toy chopper for my kid.  Dead battery, had to bring it back.  Manager helped us out, but he was on a call the whole time.  Waited 15, exchange took one.  Poor quality, poor service.  Not a great first impression."

"Owner's a real charmer. Bid they gave my insurance company was the highest, but it was for a full replace job. Didn't need that much work, just some repairs. Insurance company wasn't having it, so they didn't get the gig."

"Flamingo Hotel's got some issues. First, they got this "Go Room" thing. If you don't get it, you're stuck with a dirty, filthy room. Don't matter if you complain, they ain't gonna do nothing about it. We had to move thrice. First time, some other guest was checkin' in while we were still there. Nobody from the hotel gave a damn about our complaint before they stuck another poor soul with the same problem. Carpet's disgusting, it stinks and it's got stains everywhere. You step in the tub after walkin' on that carpet, you'll leave black footprints. No excuse for that kinda filth, and no excuse for ignoring it and shovin' it onto the next guy. Hotel's old and it smells like it too. They're tryin' to fix it up, but they got a long way to go. With all the nice hotels in Vegas, I can't figure out why anyone'd wanna stay here. First and last time for me. Never been treated so poorly. A kennel'd be cleaner. One good thing though, Junius Johnson, Jr. He's a server in the buffet, been there 30 years. Guy's got customer service down pat. He should teach the rest of the staff. My hat's off to him."
"5/29 - Awful. View was nice, but that's it. Crowd was too much. No place to sit. Tiny dance floor. Glad it was free. Rain would've been better."

"Chedda, that scoundrel, finally came to town. I tracked him down at Zia Records, eager for a taste of his wares. My husband and I both ordered dirt bags, expecting a cheesy delight. But alas, they were flavorless, lacking the very essence of what makes life worth living. I was crushed, my dreams shattered. The burgers were massive, the buns burnt to a crisp, but the tots were a disaster, tasting like plain mashed potatoes with an odd, unsettling sauce. I wouldn't wish it upon my worst enemy."

"Pulled up to the pump, asked the lady for $120 on pump 2 regular. She said it's ready, and if I needed change or a receipt, to come back inside. Went back outside, filled up the tank, and chatted with the fam. When the pump clicked off at $100.10, went back inside for my change and receipt. Asked the lady about the car wash, she said it'll reopen in a month with new pumps and another gas island. Said thanks and left. This place is improving, might give it two more chances."

"Gordon Ramsay's joint, expectations run high. Seen his shows, the guy's got passion. Forty-five minute wait, Friday night, no big deal. Staff uniforms, ridiculous, ill-fitting, unflattering. Change 'em, for crying out loud. Umbrella girls at motor sports events, more covered up than the poor girls working at BURGR. Burgers took their sweet time, forty-five minutes, just okay. Truffle fries, truffle aioli, tasted like garlic, nothing special. I cook at home, burgers didn't impress. Bill came, $150 for two adults, two kids, burger meal. Won't be back, but Vegas' got plenty of Ramsay's joints. Guy's a hard worker, making the most of it."

"Tequila Bar, I found it on Yelp. Cheap drinks, that's what I was looking for. Blue Fishbowl, 128oz for $20, hell yeah! But, no fishbowls, just two plastic pitchers. Bummer. Not even any fish in it. Just soda. But, hey, it was fun. Novelty, you know? Nachos looked good, but I just had dinner. Ordered the southwestern corn on the cob. Curious, what makes it southwestern? Waiter says, corn, you want the corn? Yeah, sure. That's all it was, just boiled corn with a pat of butter. For $3, fail."

"Two apps, calamari and shrimp, both good. Salad, too. But main courses? Awful. Tilapia, dry. Asparagus, overcooked. Wife's pasta, a letdown. Kids' meals, just okay. Dirty atmosphere. Waitstaff, inconsistent. Our guy, neglectful. Asked neighboring waitress for refills. Bottom line? Avoid this place."

"Been here a few times in the past year. Hygienist's always pushing for more work, more cleanings. Got that deep-cleaning crap two months back and my gums are worse off now. Saw the dentist once, she barely looked at me, just told me I needed fillings. Don't think she even cracked a smile. Seen her walk by the front desk, didn't even nod at me. Time to find a new dentist."

"Dos Gringos, trashy vibes abound. Trailer park theme, questionable at best. Two instances: weak drinks, cheap pours, vodka or rum, no difference. Men's room, vomit stench lingers, staff unresponsive. Fun atmosphere, DJ, crowd, dog-friendly. But, puke and poor drinks kill the mood. Tacos, unappealing. Old-fashioned, perhaps. Prudish, maybe. Turned off, definitely."

"Walked in on a lazy Sunday arvo, place was hoppin' with sports fans. Service was alright, not too fussed about makin' small talk. Tips were flowin' like beer at the bloke's tables, oh well. Heard raves 'bout their crispy tacos, but they were just meh. All in all, it was decent, but there's better spots in the hood."

"Crazy Mocha, a joint I wouldn't wish on my worst enemy. Convenient, sure, but that's where the positives end. Chai's too sweet, can't taste the spices, just milky tea. Coffee's weak, like they've been sittin' on it for hours. Service? Meh, not worth mentionin'. WiFi's alright, but that's not enough to save this dump."

"Subway, once a favorite haunt of mine, has since abandoned my beloved chicken pizziola sandwich. Despite my efforts to revive it, they've chosen to discontinue it altogether. In search of a new go-to, I've found myself met with indifference, save for the occasional nod of approval from those who share my taste for the finer things in life. Alas, Subway's Las Vegas locations seem to cater to their own kin, leaving me to wander the streets in search of a worthy substitute. Bring back the pizziola, I say!"
"I'll eat here if a friend insists, but I've gotten diarrhea almost every time. Not worth it. Food's bland and overpriced. Just my opinion, but I know plenty who love it."
"Chicken salad, grilled not chilled, in my sandwich. Fries, room temp at best. Service friendly though. New menu items, brioche buns, pretzel buns, fresh lemonade, salads. That's good."
"Fried tofu, pork, peanut butter dumplings, eggplant. Fried foods, dry and tough. Better versions found elsewhere in Montreal. Only try if desperate for Chinese. Slim pickings in this neighbourhood."

"Casa Grande, pretty lame. Went on a Thursday, thought they'd be open 'til midnight. Waitress said last call at 9:30, place was dead. Beer selection? Basic. Two taps, maybe. Rest are light domestics. Not a beer snob, but give me something better."

"MONTE CARLO. A name that promised much, but delivered little. We requested a non-smoking room, but were led to a smoking room instead. The carpet near the window was cracked, the room was unclean. The hotel's age showed, and its upkeep was lacking. I'll never return, and I question MGM Mirage's ability to maintain their properties. Their customer service needs improvement. Stay at the Monte Carlo if you desire a poor experience and a taste of BARFED OUT EUROPE. Sub-standard, below average."
"Tried out a new groomer in Phoenix. Good reviews, decent prices. Not impressed. Asked for special attention on the dog's tail. Still had mats, face wasn't clean. Won't be back."
"Cold buffet food, can't stand it. Today, everything was cold. Got there too early, maybe. Had to bail, asked for my money back. They gave me a gift card for another time. Nice."
"Peanut butter and jelly cake, hot from the oven. Runny peanut butter, dry cake. Jelly hidden deep within. Grape jelly, warm and unimpressive. Latte, standard fare."

"Place was decent, but not this last time. Had the eggs Benedict, didn't like the hollandaise. Sticking with the blueberry pancakes next time. Boyfriend's meal was good, service was too. Got in quick on a busy Memorial Day morning. But we both got sick later, and it was the only meal we had, so I'm gonna be hesitant next time."
"Place is getting wrecked under new ownership. Staff's overworked, service is slow. Food ain't what it used to be. Memories are all that's left."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

I walked into the joint with high hopes, but they fell short of the hype. LA's got nothing on this place, and I can't imagine how it's considered better. The hot dog casings were hard as rock, and the flavors were lackluster. This spot relies more on its reputation than the quality of its grub.

"Been here twice. First time, great service, mac and cheese, delicious. Today, ridiculous. Called at 5:54, asked about happy hour, yes until 7. Arrived ten minutes later, told no happy hour today. Giving two stars."
"Brunch at its worst. Chain joint in a plaza swarming with families and their noisy broods. Food passable, but not worth the trip."

"This joint didn't impress me much. Not enough options on the menu and my street noodles were just alright. Didn't blow my mind or anything. The only thing worth going back for is the steamed pork buns. That's it. Don't waste your time otherwise."

"Went to Caramel, heard it was great. Small, simple joint. Surprised by its size. Had an Oreo martini, twenty bucks. Don't mind paying top dollar for drinks in Vegas, but this one was overpriced. Maybe it was Hydrox, who knows?\n\nLove the Bellagio, not a fan of Caramel. Take ten steps to the Sports Bar, put twenty in the video poker machine, get a free martini instead. Bartenders at the Sports Bar were way friendlier."

I came to this joint on a Saturday night, thinkin' I'd have me a good time, 'cause Kaskade was spinnin' his tunes. Bought my tickets online, but the line for folks with tickets was a real doozy. We waited and waited, and by the time I made it to the door, it was a whole hour and a half later. By then, the club was packed, and sure enough, the dance floor was closed. No tables to be found either. So, why keep lettin' people in, if there's nowhere to go? Security was tellin' everyone to move along, but where were they supposed to move to? The club's not exactly huge, ya know? They just kept crammin' people in, but there was nowhere to put 'em. And let me tell you, those stairs we had to go down to get inside? Looked like somethin' outta a bad dream. But hey, Kaskade was killin' it, even though I only got to see a bit of him.

"Food's good, but service is shit. Been here twice, both times service was terrible. Last time, food took an hour, and we still gave 'em their damn 18% tip. Manager said he'd give us a hundred bucks for next time, but that never happened. Pros: decent grub. Cons: shitty service, can't keep their word. Not going back."

"I've been to this gym and the one in Phoenix. My friend has a membership, so we've been going together, trying to motivate each other. Sometimes you need that extra push. 

This gym is basic, nothing fancy. It's $10 a month or $20 for all locations, with unlimited guests. 

I'm torn between a 2-star and 3-star rating. I've been a member of 24 Hour for years - nothing fancy, but it has everything I need at a reasonable price. However, my gym has a sauna, basketball court, classes, pool, etc., which Planet doesn't. No sauna! And what's with the loud alarm when someone drops a heavy weight or grunts? Judgment-free gym, but they're judging effort? Doesn't make sense."

"Rude management, waited over an hour for our car, watched others leave left and right. Mentioned it to several people, got lots of excuses, but they lost our car. Would've been satisfied with a drink, spent over $200 on dinner, no apology. Wrote a letter. Waitstaff was friendly, meal was okay, nothing special, Charlotte has better. Relationships matter, they killed mine with this one. Bottom line, food wasn't worth returning for."
"II Vinao, thought it was mismanaged. Turns out, just an off day. Owner reached out, eager to fix issues. Impressive. Will visit again, soon. Five-star potential, no doubt. Keep you posted."

"Lobster Mehhh? More like food court fodder. Setup's lackluster, like a mall's sad corner. Lobster roll combo, fries, drink - not impressed. Not a traditional Maine roll, overwhelmed by vinegar medley. Fries, decent. Lobster mac and cheese, meh. Few chunks on top, not worth the ten bucks. Won't be back."

"Food's alright. Hot dishes ain't warm when they reach the table. Took some good stuff off the menu, that's a shame. Noise is the real issue though. Damn TVs blasting and folks at the bar hollerin'. No peaceful seating. Server said it's like that all the time. Don't go there much, don't wanna take the risk of a game being on."

"I don't get the hype 'bout this place. Folks rave 'bout it, but the grub just ain't that great. Chips 'n' salsa are decent, can't mess that up too much. But my burrito's flavor's lackin', daughter's quesadilla too. 'Hot' salsa tastes like mild, somethin' ain't right. Service is good, bar's got a nice selection, atmosphere's cool. Food? Meh."

"You could easily pass by without notice. Simple tables and booths, open like a deli. Chicken parm sub, per Yelp's advice. A bit dry, but still a decent bite. Not sure I'd get it again. Crinkle-cut fries, nothing special. Good option instead of fast food, but not worth going out of your way."

"Terrible shave at Elliot & Co. Despite the Yelp discount, it wasn't worth the money. I wanted to like the place, but the shave left much to be desired. The haircut was good, but the shave was subpar. Missed spots on my neck and stubble that I could remove with a disposable razor. Nice people and environment, but the shave just wasn't there. Bottom line: not worth it."
"Sally's Beauty Supply. Decent selection, but service was lacking. Manager was friendly, but other staff seemed indifferent. A smile and some enthusiasm go a long way."

"Had lunch at this joint with the fam. Sis-in-law's a big fan, always stops by when she's in town. Place isn't big, but the line was out the door. Ordered the mixed plate - beef, chicken, fish. Beef was meh, chicken was good - tender, moist, de-boned thigh. Fish was nothing special. Portion was huge, couldn't finish it. Maybe try the Mami or Udon noodles next time. Hesitantly recommend it. Would eat there again, but wouldn't make a special trip."

"Stayed at the Excalibur in Vegas last time, met some pals there. Place wasn't cool, overpriced too - $160 a night! First room reeked, like someone poured water on the floor and let it mold for weeks. They gave us another room after an hour, but still too pricey. Casino's in a bad spot, far from the strip. Only close spots are New York New York and MGM. Food's no good either. Not happy we stayed there, won't again."

"Unimpressive joint. Dirty tables, dirty floor. Spilled my drink, and the staff just stood there, watching me clean up the mess. They left a sticky residue behind, and not a single soul bothered to wipe it down."

"Atmosphere was swell. Ordered Chicken Meatloaf, real tasty. Partner had Chicken Royale, flavorless. Side veggies had more zest. Waiter was attentive after grub arrived, but prior, he was MIA. Won't be back."

"Menu looked top-notch, got our hopes up. But what did we get? Frozen hashbrowns, low-grade ingredients. Chicken fried steak tasted like a pig took a smoke break on it. Service was good, but can't say the same for the grub."

"My bad for not checkin' the menu beforehand, but I was pretty damn disappointed in the grub. Came here on a rec, excited for some tapas, bouillabaisse, Spanish, Italian, French food. Instead, just boring ol' sandwiches. Had a Cuban and a chicken sammie. Lame. Vegas is a 24-hour town, for cryin' out loud. Felt pretty down about bringin' my fam here. Restaurant should at least have a few of their signatures, even small portions, on the lunch menu."

"Bought a house in Mesa, got an evaporative cooler with it. Previous owners said Tempe town lake construction cut into the cooler's usage by three months, thanks to the humidity. And now, the dam's busted, so no lake for us. That's a bummer."
"Place didn't impress me much. Heard good things, still gave it a shot. Long wait, like always. Food was alright, nothin' special. Crowded too. I'd pick Gilbert House down the street any day."

"Sunday brunch? Average. Nothing special. Selection? Lacking. Basic breakfast grub and flatbread pizzas. Upstream sets the bar high, but this place falls short. Food's not cold, but could be hotter. Beer? Watered down. Like their other drinks, the Bloody Mary's weak too. Atmosphere's cool, packed, but overhyped."

"Golden Nugget, Fremont Street, Downtown Vegas. Place is decent, drinks are good, service top-notch. Food? Meh. Fish and chips drenched in oil, 'tempura' lobster tastes like funnel cake. Better options downtown, cheaper too. Live it up, you're in Vegas, baby!"

"Burgers? No love here. Like 'em, but not lovin' 'em. Food takes ages, medium burger's well done. Sauces are cool, fries too. Better burger at Serendipity, no contest. Overpriced Carl's Jr., Plymouth's pride. Don't bother, frozen turkey patty's the same. Variety of fry flavors and cuts, that's nice."

"Buraka's Ethiopian grub didn't impress me much. Veg options, sure, but the menu's limited. No individual samplers, just a pricey two-entree combo. I went for the misir wot and black beans, both supposed to be spicy. Server said they were, but they weren't. Not even close. Injera was a letdown too. Mid-meal, they offered hot sauce, but shouldn't the food taste good on its own? Nice patio, but I won't be back."

"I ain't no Beatles fan, so I wasn't exactly pumped for this show. Our seats were decent, but the venue's huge and the 360-degree stage meant we might miss some action. Cirque tried to make up for it with stuff happening on both sides, but it was just too much for me. The soundtrack was solid, though - classic tunes, you know? The acrobats were alright, but nothing special. My buddy dug it, but I was underwhelmed. So, if you're a Beatles diehard, go for it. If you're a Cirque enthusiast, there are better options."

"Meeting facilities subpar. No experience with guest rooms. Two-day training with too few power outlets. Attendees fought for scarce outlets. First day, foul plumbing issue filled building with sewage stench. Property unable to resolve. Unpleasant."

"Disappointed, I ordered kare-kare. Meat was tender, but veggies were mush. Lechon kawali was decent, came with gravy and rice. Might give 'em another shot, despite A/C breaking down on a scorching day."

"Listen up, folks. I gotta tell ya about this so-called 2 Star "award" hotel. First off, the rooms are top-notch, real nice. Great view, too. But that's where the good stuff ends. This shuttle business? Forget about it. It's a joke. You gotta check the schedule before you book, or you'll be waiting around for hours. And don't even get me started on the taxi fare. Forty bucks, no tip. What a ripoff. And don't believe the hype about the "complimentary" stuff. It's all just a bunch of two-for-one deals. Not worth it. The buffet? Forget about it. We stood around for 15 minutes and didn't even move four feet. And the pool? Closed till March. Try getting a drink at the Hostile Grape? Yeah, good luck with that. It's closed three days a week. And shopping? Forget about it. You're stuck out in the middle of nowhere. Next time, I'm sticking with Green Valley Ranch or South Point."
"Good eatery. Cheap. Beer. Nice spot. Shame about the grime. Carne asada tasty. Service adequate. Dirty, though. Kitchen likely worse."

"Hash House A Go Go's massive portions are fit for sumos and competitive eaters. The food pile's a sight to behold, where quantity trumps quality. We sampled the Fried Chicken and Bacon Waffles, Andy's Sage Fried Chicken Benedict, and a House Salad.

The Fried Chicken and Waffles were average. Crispy chicken, but lacking juice and seasoning. The waffles could've used more bacon flavor; we would've settled for plain bacon strips.

Andy's Sage Fried Chicken Benedict stacked three dishes atop each other. Fried chicken and mashed potatoes, a biscuit with gravy, and an eggs and bacon scramble with spinach, tomato, and mozzarella. Each bite varied, but flavors blended together.

The House Salad? Standard iceberg lettuce mix. Nothing special.

For a true diner experience, share a plate at Hash House A Go Go."

"Terrible crepe experience. Ordered cheese and prosciutto, but it was thick and doughy, not hot enough. Prosciutto was too strong, couldn't cut it with the flimsy fork they gave me. My BF's veggie crepe was also doughy and thick. Coffee was awful. Won't return. Parking is easy and free in the Paris parking structure. Place was busy later on, don't know why. Employees' stereotypical Parisian outfits were amusing."

"Went to this place three times now. First time, a year ago, with two buddies. We hit the walk-up counter since the wait for a table was an hour. Ordered small frozen hot chocolates. Not impressed. Tasted like a chocolate shake with sprinkles. Maybe it's better inside? Don't know. 

Second time, met some pals in town. They were having dinner (I didn't eat, just had a snack). Food looked great, portions decent. 

Third time, few weeks ago, with my sis and some friends. Ordered frozen hot chocolates. My sis got a large one to share, but it was way too much. Service was meh - cashier slow, drink maker overwhelmed. Maybe I'll give it another shot, wait it out, and eat inside."

"Never should've messed with the recipes. Been back twice since new management took over. Gotta give 'em one more chance. Place has lost its magic. Service just ain't the same no more. Talked to some workers, they seem like good folks who could do better. Gonna give 'em another shot."
"Peking duck, not bad. Walnut prawns, too sweet, like dessert. Crab, tasted like garlic ash, overcooked. Service, friendly. Shame about the restaurant. Paying the price now."

"Bountiful Baskets, a year of baskets, and the quality's slipping away. Was never great, but now it's really gone downhill. Produce goes bad fast, too much of it. Same old apples and lettuce every week, got tired of 'em. Bought a case of honeycrisps, thought they'd be sweet, but they were small and went bad quick. Maybe my fault, shoulda checked 'em out sooner. Bountiful's all about quantity, that's their thing. But I'm done with it, time to look into something else."
"Food took an hour, nice view though. Muffins were crap, biscuits and gravy good but needed meat. Burrito was meh, French toast sandwich was decent. We'll be back, but not here."

This joint wasn't worth a damn. The opener was the only decent thing about it. If he hadn't been there, I might've walked out. Thirty-nine bucks for an hour show? Ridiculous. In New York, it's twenty-five bucks for two and a half hours. The service was terrible too. Couldn't even get a drink. They had a two-drink maximum, but it felt like they were trying to limit us to one drink per visit. Waitress took forever to come back and demanded payment upfront. What a joke. Wednesday night or not, that price tag is too high for such a crappy experience. My advice? Avoid this dump and wait for a weekend if you want some real comedy.

Moe's serves unremarkable grub. It doesn't hold a candle to others in its classâ€”Qdoba, Chipotle, et al. The victuals were fresh, but lacked pizzazz. Burritos were puny, with scant fillings. My main gripe was the price. No way a burrito of that size, with that meager amount of rice, beans, and meat, should cost north of seven bucks for the regular size. I've had larger, tastier burritos for around five bucks. A small soda for two-fifty? Ridiculous (free refills, though).

You do get chips and salsa with your order. The chips were decent. Salsa, just okay. One strange thing: my wife ordered a Triple Lindy burrito in a bowl. It came in a white box. When you try to toss it, you can't fit the box in the trash can due to its odd design. Brainiac move...

Amusing names for their burritosâ€”Homewrecker, Art Vandelay, etc. Good stuff! Moe's won't be near the top of my list for returns. Better options abound. Rating: 2.5.

"Food's good, but service is horse shit. Third time here and it's the same story. Long wait for grub, then they bring out the wrong order. You ask for a bowl, they take their sweet time, and when it finally arrives, it's still not right. Management? Don't make me laugh. They don't give a damn about customer satisfaction. Just grab your food to go and avoid the hassle."

"Sushi Crescent and Sushi St-Denis, owned by the same folks, I gotta say this one's my least favorite. Service is near nonexistent, which is a problem in an all-you-can-eat joint. Fish doesn't taste fresh and the staff couldn't care less. If you're hankerin' for sushi, walk five minutes further and fill your belly at Sushi Crescent. I know it's the same owners, but I've never had issues there."

"July 4th, we showed up early for our reservation. Place was packed, tables empty. Waited over 20 minutes to be seated. Hostess said they were still seating folks from 20 minutes before our time. Got an outside table, finally got water 10 minutes later. Dinner was mediocre. Hubby had seafood, some clams weren't open, no pasta. Daughter's pasta was okay, sauce was good. I had fatty lemon chicken. Asked for breadsticks, never got 'em. Outside, steamers were overwhelming, couldn't see, and my daughter got drenched."
"Food, barely mediocre. Beer, warm. Greasy, bland fare. Fast food, better. Half the price, too."

"Spent a weekend, didn't enjoy it. Marriott Rewards member, got better service at a Fairfield. Room wasn't cleaned, called twice. Light switches were busted, all or nothing. Elevator access was a joke, key card often failed. No bill portfolio, despite several calls. System down, left a message elsewhere. Skip this place."

"The PO's got a sweet setup with an Auto Postal Center. Just walk in, grab some stamps or ship a package, and breeze out. But the package hopper's always full, can't open it. I've rung the bell, banged on the door, tried to tell the counter jockeys, but never get a response. What's the point of makin' it easy to send stuff if we can't actually send it? Frustrating as hell. Answer the damn bell, it's called service.

Another time, Saturday morning, the APC's broken. Everyone's waitin' in line, me included. When it's my turn, I tell the worker the APC's down. She's clueless, says, 'Oh, that's why it's so busy in here.' I'm the first to tell 'em about the tech issue? Unbelievable. I'm tryin' to support the PO, don't wanna lose this service, but come on, give us a little customer service, huh?"

"Rossario's? More like a disappointment. Lasagna? Nope, just a mess of noodles and sauce. Chicken Puttanesca? Two bites and my husband's hopes were crushed. Salad? Forgettable. Three words: Ugh, Ugh, Ugh."
"Busy joint, worn-out gear. Didn't dig it."

"High hopes for this place, thought it'd be like Salt River. Visited last night, didn't quite live up. Prices for swag and snacks, ridiculous. But the real issue, the scoreboard. Sitting lower level, first base side, couldn't read it. Too small, not well lit at night, third taken up by ads, no stats for batters, lineup on left side useless. Parking lot, no signs for exit, entrance blocked. Never seen a park without distance signs. Disappointing."

"Went on the indoor ride, shared a gondola with strangers. They were quiet, not up for fun. Guy had a big wart on his temple, couldn't look away. Gondolier was great though, friendly, chatty, nice voice. Ride itself? Meh. Not worth the cost. Outdoor one's supposed to be better, skip this one."
