Waiter knew about my issue but didn't say squat. Owner didn't come over either. They took the dish off the bill, but that was it. Didn't leave me feeling too eager to come back."

"Went to Ditka's. Food was good. Shrimp cocktail, perfect. Pork chop, wonderful. Burgers, great. Dessert, tasty. Chef, on the ball. Waiter, horrible. One of us arrived first, waited 10 min, no service. Beverages took forever. Beer, ordered 10 min later, arrived. Had to ask for bread. Waited 10-15 min to give dinner order. Had to ask for beverage refills. Gave the order, he wrote it down. Salad, added, not written down. Guessed it, salad never came. Thank goodness, meal was comped. Would have been pissed if I had to pay the $100.25 bill with that waiter. In an upscale restaurant, you should never have to ask for anything. Period. No excuses. Good food, bad waiter. Give 2.5 if possible, food only. Take a chance, eat in the bar area. Dinner specials in bar not available in dining room. Family usually eats in the bar, say waitstaff is great there."

"Not the greatest show in Vegas. Jokes were meh, stage was nothing special, and overall felt like something from another era. Got bored halfway through. If you're gonna see one show, this ain't it. But hey, if it's free and you're feeling nostalgic, go for it. Just don't expect too much."

"Hubbard Ave Diner, been there a few times. Pie, good. Service, good too. Food, average. Kitchen, inconsistent. If it's slow, order's right and hot. If it's busy, forget it. Need someone to keep things moving in the kitchen."

"Food's the focus, service is usually satisfactory. Let's get on with it. Bread's decent, but that's the highlight. Pasta's a letdown, especially the creamy garlic chicken - needed lots of salt. Fresh tomato mozzarella's no better. Gorganzola salad's the only saving grace. Local's great, but this place doesn't cut it. Olive Garden's better."

"First-time customer, last weekend. Not the best start. Ordered, waited, wrong order. Took too long, everyone else finished. Had to take mine to go. Waitress cleared the check, no discount, no apology. Food was good, but not worth it. Won't be back. Screw up, miss the meal, offer something."

"Wet burritos? No thanks. Ruins the whole damn thing. They tried to cook my half-eaten burrito in the oven and told me they couldn't add anything else unless it was on top. What a joke. I should've walked out right then and there. But no, I didn't. And you know what? I ended up paying twelve bucks for a crappy burrito with chicken, rice, and cheese. What a waste."

"Went for brekkie here while on holiday. Not my choice, but heard good things. Place was decent, nothing special. Had eggs benedict with avocado. Okay, not as good as the menu made it sound. Rest of the group enjoyed their grub, no complaints. Wait wasn't terrible, but kids running wild and service could've been better. Coffee took forever, not a good start to the day. Wouldn't go back."

"High hopes, but underwhelmed. Arrived post-rush, staff friendly yet lackluster. Indoor/outdoor seats, a plus. Ordered two veggie sandos, dressed with a hair in my salad. Soggy, but passable. Might return, if nearby."

The Shoppes at Wynn Las Vegas are no joke, kid. They got high-end stores like Barney's, Coach, and Burberry. They're caterin' to the rich folks who can afford that kinda luxury. My buddies and I checked out Michael Kors and my girl found a purse she liked. The associate said it was $1400 and she quickly put it back and walked away. We ain't got that kinda money, so we were just lookin'. The place itself ain't too special, but there's a two-story waterfall in the middle that's pretty cool. Lots of tourists takin' pictures, so you might wanna join in on the fun. If you're a regular Joe like me, you might wanna check out Miracle Mile or Fashion Show instead. When the summer heat hits, this place'll be a nice spot to chill and escape the strip.

"Went on a weekend mornin' more than a year back. Still remember the details, though. Place was a mess, disorganized. Lady who seemed to be in charge was barkin' orders left and right. Maybe we shoulda waited for a table outside, but I reckon we woulda had a more peaceful meal."

"Went to The Parlor with my boyfriend and brother. Second time for me, first time for them. Liked it before, but not this visit. Service was poor, food just okay. Employees were cool, but the vibe stank. Maybe it was the pizza, maybe the 'tude. Either way, won't be back. Overhyped pizza with a side of sass. NYPD or Pizzano's are better options."
"Rude guy did my nails. Gel manicure, cuticles, skin, messy. Staff same. Won't return."
"If your address is wrong and you don't answer the phone, you can't expect a good reaction from customers. I was excited to eat here, but now I'm not so sure."
"Hype train derailed. Bread's good, meat's lackin'. Paid for bread, got a snack. Waited 25 minutes, left hangry. Two stars for bread, but it's oily. Better sammies elsewhere in Vegas. Overhyped."

"Petal's been hit or miss for me lately. Mostly misses. Can't seem to find anything that fits right. Feels like I'm trying on a dozen things and they all fall short. And that damn dressing room, always feeling rushed. Like they're trying to hustle me outta there. Don't like it one bit."
"Taste in my mouth, strange. Maybe from roach in my burger. Free wings on Monday night football, not bad. Cheap beer too. Raised over a grand for local teens, good work. In Wickenburg now."

"Don't care much for this joint. Been a Chase customer for a bit, got two accounts with 'em. Went in to cash a check, and this new accounts guy started hounding me to open another one. Gave him my number quick, hoping he wouldn't hear it, but he kept calling me for two weeks straight, leaving voicemails and everything. Teller didn't know her stuff either. Asked her about that check-scanning feature on the window, and she had to search for the answer. Trash can under the ATM was overflowing too. Not exactly the best first impression."
"Scouted joint before bailing. Went there with a buddy. Grub was meh, service meh, ambiance sketch. Not worth another visit."

"Don't like this place. Bartender tries to help, but no greeter. Cashier too busy talking about tips to serve us. Finally, she asks what we want. No receipt, told to go to table. Don't talk to me, I'll forget the number. Chairs too tall, have to jump to sit. Burger undercooked, but better than overcooked. Whole thing too expensive if I gotta wait in line."
"Pizza's fine, I reckon. Not too fussed about it, though. Maybe 'cause it took 'em an hour to bring it over when we're just five minutes away."

"Frustration's been building with Danny's Family for years. Upselling's off the charts. Brought in a new ride, barely broken in, and some salesman's still pushing a buff and wax. Tiny crack in the glass, and the windshield guy's telling me it's gonna shatter any second now. Come on, man. Good job on the detail, but enough with the hard sell already. Wish there was a better way, but looks like this is how it goes down at car washes."
"Tacos, dry meat. Wife's salad, bad. Chicken, sauce like Italian."

"St Rose Pediactrics is grinding me down. Eleven am appointment, forty-five minutes in the waiting room. Still no doc. Time to cut back on clients or appointments. Enough time to write this and read all the other reviews."

"Food was top-notch. Galbi burger with house kimchi on the side, can't go wrong. But what's with the bad review? Big group, 12+, they accommodated us, warm welcome. Why the delay? Two parties' grub took 30 minutes longer than everyone else's. Appetizers came quick, sweet potato fries, great. Huge gap till the entree. Waitress said kitchen was backed up, burger was being made. 10 minutes later, forgotten order. Finally, burger arrives, 30 minutes late. Don't care how busy they are, should've been our turn. Watched other tables get their food faster. Disappointing, not because of the food, but still."

"Had a good time with the fam, but the service was crap. Place was cool, lots of TVs, not many people. Server was terrible, forgot stuff, didn't bring things. Not just picking on her, she even said she was ignoring us. Game area was meh, machines took my money, had to keep getting them fixed. Food was okay, house salad was good, pizza was thin, had to ask three times for more dressing. Mom ordered a wheat beer, got something else, then had to wait ten minutes for the real deal. Had fun, but won't be back."

"Sushi joint was mediocre at best. Been to better places in Charlotte, Davidson, and Asheville. This one was a snooze. Not terrible, just uninspired. Got another coupon for Ayrsley's place. Maybe that'll be an improvement."
"Waiter brings me cheese enchilada, chicken taco. I order beef, chicken. He looks me dead in the eye, asks if I want beef on the side. Not going back."

"Chips and salsa, good. Margarita, decent. Spinach dip, passable. Cheese enchilada and chile relleno, average. Husband's chicken chimichanga, subpar. Beans and rice, a highlight. Friend from Canada, beef enchilada and hard shredded beef taco, enjoyable. Flan, tough."
"Food was lousy. Ravioli like rubber, chicken burnt to hell. Waiter didn't give a damn. Never going back. Plenty other joints around, try one of them instead."

"I give 'em two stars, 'cause the customer service was top-notch. Jay, the owner, got back to me quick as lightning, and his crew was friendly as can be. My cupcakes weren't ready when I went to pick 'em up, but they were real sorry 'bout it, and I couldn't fault 'em for that. The cupcakes themselves, though? Awful. I've had better from Walmart, and that's sayin' somethin'. I ordered a dozen, half with pink bows, half with blue ties. Decoration was alright, but the cupcakes were near frozen in the middle, stale, and the icing was rock hard. Maybe it was 'cause I didn't pick 'em up till Monday, but I let Jay know Thursday evenin' I wouldn't make it Friday. Tasted like they'd been sittin' in the fridge for days. Three of 'em were practically frozen solid. Real disappointed, since I'd heard good things 'bout KAK. Won't be usin' 'em again."
"Tired of these internet outages. Three times this week. Maintenance, they say. But I didn't have a problem till they took it down. Worse than Comcast. Almost."

"Wanted to like this joint, but it didn't sit well. Got the combo with BBQ pork and teriyaki chicken, chicken fried rice. Pork was tough, chewy. Teryiyaki chicken, worse. Sauce, a clumpy mess. Fried rice, soggy. Beans, didn't match. Staff friendly, but herded customers like cattle."

"Dinner at this joint was a slow affair. Waiters took their time takin' our order, and the place wasn't exactly bustlin' with activity. We went for "The Theresa" and some corn on the cob with chili, cheese, and lime. The grub was decent, but I reckon it was a mite pricey. Six bucks for a single ear of corn with chili and cheese? That's a mighty steep tariff, pardner."

"Food? Adequate at best. Service? Subpar. Waiter didn't speak English, order got botched. One-hour limit. Ginger overload. Atmosphere? Meh. Lighting sucked. Not going back, even though it's close to home."

"Been to this joint dozens of times. Steak's always good, but seafood's a crapshoot. Had a lobster yesterday, total rubber. Barely edible. Shoulda known better, but I'm a sucker for surf 'n' turf. Disappointing, that's for sure."

"I went to this joint in Pittsburgh 'cause folks said I had to. Place was packed, real chaos. Told to find a seat, then told to sit down. Waited a bit before some dude came by. Then, two more showed up right after. Food was alright, fries were cool, stuffed in the sandwich like that. But overall, nothing special. Don't get why it's so popular. Worth it? Nah."

"Terrible service at Caesar's. Found previous guest's skivvies in our room. Took six hours for extra blanket, 24 for pillows. No wake-up call. Supposed to be world-class? Don't think so. Told staff, they didn't care. Manager said it's a holiday weekend, they're short-staffed. Solution? Hire more people. Hello."

"Food's alright, not mind-blowing. Typical Greek fare, you know, gyro sandwiches and the like. Service? Forget about it. You'll be lucky to get a smile out of 'em, let alone attentive service. Prices are meh, but hey, it's an option if you can't get a table at that joint around the corner and you're hankerin' for some Greek grub."

"Came here with colleagues, hoping for fun lunch. Decor was unique, but too much black. Uncomfortable chairs, like sitting on a triangle. Service was prompt and friendly, but empty restaurant. Ordered various dishes, edamame was great, garlicky and tasty. Ramen disappointed, broth too thick, not hot. Couldn't finish it. Waffles were okay, sliders just alright. Not a place I'd return to."

"Place ain't what it used to be. Corners being cut left and right. Queso fundido, gone. Service, slow. Not 24/7 no more. Drinks, scarce. Hassle every time I order one. Better options in town. No point in wasting time or cash here."

"Terrible meal. Guacamole was off, tasteless and gritty. Tacos, a disappointment. No cabbage, cilantro, or lime. Fish tacos, a joke. Black beans and rice, flavorless. Table next to us, sent food back. Uncooked. Wouldn't come back for this meal."

"My buddy and I decided to grab some grub at this joint while the others slept off their hangovers. I was starving, so I didn't care what they served. Luckily, the buffet started at 11 am for 11 bucks a pop. It was an Italian spread - spaghetti, lasagna, meatballs, and Parmesan chicken. They also had soup and salad. 

The food was pretty rough, though. My clam chowder was nasty, and the only thing I really enjoyed was the fettuccine. I stuffed myself with bread because I didn't want to feel like I hadn't gotten my money's worth. 

I was surprised how cold some of the dishes were, considering they had just opened the buffet when we arrived. We were even the first ones there."
"Panda Express and Taco Bell, mixed together like a drunk's munchies. Fried rice, terrible."

"This joint? Meh. Lunch, yeah? Chicken salad, fruit. Scoop of mediocrity on greens, grapes, strawberries. Asked for dressing, they said it's on the table. Oil-covered squeeze bottle, tasteless vinegar. Unimpressed."

"Took the folks here for the view, but the grub wasn't half bad either. Ordered the peppercorn strip, filet, and salmon. The steak was a bit chewy, but the fish was just alright. Beet appetizer was too acidic, didn't sit well. Shame, really. Pricey too, near 200 bucks for three of us. Can't say I'd recommend it, despite the great view."

"This joint was just okay. Did the all-you-can-drink champagne brunch, which was top-notch. But the grub? Not so much. Salad was mushy, eggs were bland, everything swimming in grease. Breakfast burrito? Forget about it. Normally, when I'm hungover in Vegas, anything breakfast sounds good. But not here. Left feeling peckish. With all the great buffets in Vegas, give this one a pass."

"Samurai Sam's. Three of us. Different orders. My tacos, good but sparse on meat. Veggie-heavy. Friends' teriyaki bowls, rice-loaded but lacking substance. Panda Express serves more food, better value. Bill tallied $24.70. Two stars. Sorry."
"Thanksgiving dinner at this joint? Meh. Limited menu, uninspired grub. Service? Forget about it. Clueless runners, oblivious waiters. Cheesy decor. Pass."

"Skip this joint if you're lookin' for grub that'll knock your socks off. Decor's neat, but the chow? Not so much. You get a sweet take-home glass with your brew, but the nosh? Bland, baby. Service was A-okay, but can't save the day. Forgettable eats. Go for the trinkets, not the food."

"Claim Jumper in Cali's been good to me. Avondale joint's alright, but not great. Been back a few times, still not impressed. Service is meh. Once got undercooked chicken. Not sure if I'll be back. Still love the one in Deer Valley, though."
"JJs twice failed us. Subs lacked requested toppings. Called, they blamed us. Offered replacement, we declined. Won't return."
"Subpar experience. No welcome or direction upon entry. Burgers, rare. Food, average. Lacking flavor. Smash Burger, superior. Don't see this joint lasting. Operations, disorganized."

"Overpriced and overhyped. Ordered the wrong steak, but at $60 a pop, I expected better. Bone-in, sure, but chewy? No thanks. Had better steaks in Texas, and for less money too. Sides were meh, except for the mac and cheese and spinach. Drinks? One iPad for seven people? Come on. Cheesy bread was good, but not worth the two-star rating. Service was fine, but nothing special. Two hundred bucks for a bad steak and some mediocre sides? No way. Won't be back."

"Tuna, cold as ice. Veggies, frozen stiff. Service, unremarkable. Travel nonstop, see the little things too. Second time at Phillips, hoped for better. Next, saving dough, hitting CPK quick in terminal B."

"Buses full of rowdy kids, barely any adults to keep 'em in line. Chaos, pure chaos. Kids runnin' wild, throwin' balls, no one to rein 'em in. Tough to enjoy the exhibits with all the commotion. They gotta get their act together, or it's gonna be a long day."

"Food was decent, but could've been hotter. Place was clean, though upholstery was dated. Service? Slow. Like, painfully slow. One waitress for a near-empty joint, and our 30-minute meal dragged on for an hour. Might return if they step up the service game and get the rice and soup piping hot."

"The cookies and muffin, delicious. Service, patient and kind, despite rude women with kids who sent their food back. Ordered the chopped salad, mixed greens were old and decomposing, smelled terrible. Disappointed the chef didn't care enough to check the quality of the food. Not picky, but a lazy chef who doesn't care about food quality is a bad sign."

"Drove out to Camelback from Gilbert for a burger joint rated top-notch by Phoenix Magazine. Delux, the name of the place. Two burgers, mixed fries, lemonade, Diet Coke, and a tip came to $39. Fries were decent, but the service was lacking. Our waiter disappeared, and we had to ask another server about our order. Everyone around us was getting served, and they ordered after us. Not worth the risk for a $40 burger. We'll stick to Burger King or McDonald's, where we know what to expect."
"Sunday dinner at this joint. Me, the missus, and our eight-year-old picky eater. Service was snappy, atmosphere loud, grub decent. Basic burger, cheese, bacon, fourteen bucks. Fries extra. Ripoff."

"Pearl was a letdown. Sushi top-notch, but everything else subpar. Large selection, happy hour all day, food excellent. But damn, it was hot. Almost made us sick. Plates chipped, waiter too touchy. Soup came after entrees, weird. Won't be back."

"Placed my order at 8:10. Forty minutes later, still no word from the restaurant. They claim to update the status, but all I see is "pending." If all they do is delivery, they'd better do it damn well. Delays happen, but they should've placed the order promptly. Not impressed, Foodie Call. Won't be using them again unless I have to. Selection's limited too. Spoiled by Chicago's options? Maybe. But here in Charlotte, it's slim pickings. Called 'em up, they said they're swamped and short on drivers. Solution's simple: hire more, pal."
"Food's good, but I won't be back due to poor management. It's one of the worst according to government inspectors."

"Saturday night, we made it before eight. Packed house, couldn't see the band for all the bodies. Deafening noise, couldn't hear a thing. Fire Marshall Bill would've shut it down. It was all about greed, selling tickets till there was no room to breathe. Had to stop, before it got out of hand."

"Food, four stars. Service, one. Maybe it was an off day, but the experience was lacking. Our waiter, Rodrigo, tried his best, but the service was subpar. Had to wait 15 minutes for a refill, while the table next to us got theirs twice. Odd, for a nice, moderately priced spot. Personally, I go out for the whole experience. Good food isn't enough; dining out should be more than just a pricey meal and pretty decor. Doubt I'd go back."
"Food was fair, wings and fries. Service slow, had to hunt down the waitress. Drinks and bottled beer decent, but only Miller and Coors on tap. Sports on TVs, two stars."

"Terrible staff. Like I was bothering 'em just askin' for directions. Rude, miserable bunch. Spa? Don't waste your time. Dirty, smelly. Couldn't last 20 minutes. Front desk? Forget about it. Waited 10-20 minutes every time. Better hotels on the strip for the same price. Not comin' back."

"We tied the knot at The Venetian, a swell joint. We return annually. Night before, me and the missus, plus four pals, hit a quaint Italian eatery. Atmosphere was top-notch, and we're suckers for pasta. Ordered a chicken pasta dish, but it arrived sans poultry. Waiter was regretful, scurried to the kitchen, then returned with a bowl of microwaved, cream-drenched frozen chicken. Absurd. Friends' pizzas were lackluster too. A funny letdown."
"Food court review. Bad. Price no good. Better burgers at McD's. Cheaper too."

"Space was off the lobby, views of the pool and Strip. Great atmosphere, sports-oriented vibe with flat screens broadcasting the Wisconsin v Arizona game. Burger was good, but service (Erin from South Dakota) was slow. Took 40 minutes for our burgers, rings arrived cold and inedible. They comp'd our coconut shrimp app and rings, appreciated, but would've preferred timely and hot food. Not particularly busy, so hard to imagine what the problem was...judging from other Yelp reviews, service issues persist."

"Brat Haus, a joint with promise, failed to deliver. A birthday celebration for my son, 26, turned sour. High hopes, based on Yelp's praise and the spot's hip vibe, were quickly dashed. Service was lacking, grub subpar. My boy's chorizo dog, flavorless. My wife and I shared a burger, cooked well past prime. Pepper, the dominant taste, overpowered the already questionable beef. No booze for me, but thirsty pals struggled to snag a server's attention. Pretzel fundido, the lone bright spot. Doubtful about a return visit."
"Wonton soup, good. Orange chicken, average. Fried rice, bland. Panda Express quality. Dining area, cluttered."

"Sushi? Yeah, tried it a few times. When I'm out running errands, you know, Home Depot, Target, Pet Smart, I get a hankering for some raw fish and cold Japanese brew. And lucky me, there's a sushi joint conveniently tucked away in the same parking lot as Home Depot. But let me tell you, it's been a disappointment every damn time."

"Wasn't impressed. Got up, sold for the hand wax, and tipped well in advance. But when it was ready, they didn't do a good job cleaning the inside. Still had trash on the floor and door panels. Outside and tires were wet, though. Just use them for the cheap exterior wash next time."

"Yoga in Phoenix? More like Yoga in Purgatory. Worst experience in 10+ years. Dropped into a Candlelight Yoga class, expecting relaxation. Got blasted with pop music instead. Annoying and distracting. Instructor seemed bored, pacing back and forth like a caged animal. No connection with students. Good workout, though. Studio's nice - urban, artsy, hipster vibes. But, competitive yoga? Everyone decked out in Lululemon, trying to outpose each other? Not my scene. Seeking depth, presence, and actual flow? Try elsewhere."

"I returned for round two, hoping for another knockout. Last time, the service was top-notch, and the sandwich was a real contender. But this visit, the cheese-stuffed tenderloin with signature white sauce was a letdown. The sauce was more like cheese whiz, and the pork was tough. I left most of it on the plate, but no one offered a discount. Maybe they should stick to sandwiches, something they do well. A restaurant needs both great food and smart business sense to succeed. That's the way it goes."

"Stopped in at this joint on my way to Cali, hopin' for somethin' gluten-free before my flight. Place was packed, couple of stressed-out servers. Long bar, like you'd expect in Vegas, and a bunch of cramped tables and booths. Server was nice enough, pointed out a few options she thought I'd be able to have. Didn't seem too sure about the gluten-free stuff, though. Asked the kitchen if I could have the nachos, they said yeah, but I prob'ly shoulda been more careful 'cause of the language barrier. Heard the kitchen staff talkin' and it sounded like they weren't too sure either.

Went with the nachos anyway, they were pretty good. Chicken, cilantro sauce, nacho cheese, and jalapeÃ±os. Good-sized portion, took some leftovers with me for later. Didn't get sick, so I guess the nachos are okay here. Other notes, heard another customer complain about dirty silverware, mine was alright. Food came out pretty quick, but not a lot of attention from the servers. Prices were average for airport grub.

Overall, it's alright. Might try somethin' different next time I'm in the airport."

"Bought two drinks, overpriced, from a grouchy bartender. Skipped others who'd been waiting longer. Loud drunk girls got his attention. All I wanted was my drinks and to leave. Seven people at the bar, max. Took 15 minutes for weak drinks. Should've saved my cash."

"Fuddruckers, once a proud burger joint, now reduced to a shadow of its former self. Quality's taken a nosedive since opening. Can't blame a great burger for poor service and quality. Had three combos, one with half and half, but only got three onion rings and 14 fries. That's not what I expected from Fuddruckers. Used to get five to seven onion rings, 20 to 25 fries. None of the combos my family had today met my expectations. Place was dirty too. Tables, restrooms, floors. They nickel and dimed us to death."

"Terrible grub and drinks, but digs were tight. Staff and managers were on it. Packed on First Friday, bad call. Manager said he hadn't tried the food yet. Sign number two of a poorly executed joint. Beer selection was weak, mixed drinks were watered down and sucked. Apps were a bust, chips were chewy, dips were flavorless. Tacos were dry, temp was off, calamari was too breaded and fried, chicken was bland. Service was good though, they comped our meal and asked us to return. I'll give 'em another shot if the grub improves."

"Amore, once great, now blows. When it opened, management was friendly, prices were cheap, and pizza and wings were excellent. I recall Amore making a deal with my cousin's middle school for pizza Fridays, and the kids loved it. But things took a turn for the worse after the original owner sold the place. New employees were just looking for extra cash, not putting their heart and soul into cooking, delivery, and service. Food quality suffered, and prices kept rising. Now it's just another greedy joint."

"Panda Express? No thanks. Had their veggies before, they were mushy and made me sick. But with the kitchen under construction, it was one of the few healthier options. First time at the Buckeye location. 

The good: Veggies were fresh and crisp. Pleasantly surprised. Didn't feel sick afterward either. 

The meh: Had chicken, mushrooms, and the Shanghai Angus steak. They were alright. Strong flavors made everything taste the same. Edible, but I can do better at home for less money. 

Desperate times call for desperate measures. It was tolerable, but I've had worse."

"Four of us rolled in without a reservation. No biggie, we plopped down at the bar. I ordered a killer mojito, shoutout to the bartender. 

Sat outside, live music jammin' below us. That's where the good times ended. Service was meh, drinks took their sweet time arrivin' at the table. Food? Nothin' special. Appetizers were decent, entrees? Three small tacos for $30? No thanks. Banana cream pie? Basic. 

Might give 'em another shot, though. Other menu options looked alright."

"Place was a real disappointment. Tables weren't cleaned, staff was uninspired. Ordered fish, asked for tartar sauce, didn't get it. Another guy had to ask for bread, which was also missing from my order. Chicken was crispy but flavorless. Catfish had no taste either, just some Old Bay seasoning. Cole slaw was stale. Not worth the time or money. Skip it."

"Panchero's looked promising, the tortillas were a highlight, fresh off the press. Friendly staff, attentive service. Basic burrito, underwhelming rice, steak lacked zest. Medium salsa needed more heat, but the Tapat\u00edo saved the day. Quesadillas were decent, Monterey Jack the sole cheese option. Prices were fair, worth another visit."

"Rositas, been goin' there 'bout 10-15 years now, mostly for lunch during the week. Their tacos, real good. Enchiladas, cheesy, taste nice, but also a gut bomb, makes ya wanna take a nap. Always been one of my spots, 'd give it four stars, but last Sunday, food was just okay, service was crap. Waitress seemed pissed to be servin' us, got an order wrong, we didn't even see her for 20 more min, tortillas for fajitas came 20 min after the fajitas, check took another 20 min. Typically go there every month, but haven't been in 3-4 months, hopin' this was a one-off, next visit'll be better, place ain't gone downhill."

"Bakery Square, once home to Nabisco, has undergone urban renewal. A few years back, no one would've given a damn about this forgotten community. Now, it's a prime example of revitalization. Google, Urban Active Fitness, and a quaint coffee shop (can't recall the name) have set up shop here. Parking's a breeze, with ample garage space and street-level spots available off-peak. Weekends bring a different crowd - horn-honking Mercs, brake-slamming Beemers, and VW GTI-driving, skinny jean-wearing yuppies fighting for street parking. Good luck with that."

"Overpriced for what you get. Three pieces of equipment, tops. My five-year-old was bored after an hour, but my twenty-month-old enjoyed the Toddler Zone for a bit. Don't forget to bring socks, they cost three bucks a pop. Place was clean, staff was friendly. Not worth the twenty-two bucks we spent for 1.5 hours. Would rather take the kids to Bounce Jungle or Bounce U for half the price."

"Indian Land Red Bowl. Second time's no charm. Service, fine. Food? Blah. Won Ton, decent broth. Beef a la Szechuan, flavorless. Sea of Love, unimpressive. Lacking zest, their dishes. Shame, nice spot and d\u00e9cor. Doubtful return."
"Indian food? Been better. Price? Not worth it. Service? Shit. Waiter? Jackass. No tip. Followed us out. Saag paneer? Small portion. Naan? Expensive. Closed between meals. Not going back."

"Place looked good, renovation-wise. But food and service? Not so much. Sat at the bar, hoping for a quick bite. Messy. Barstools everywhere. Unprepared. Staff, a bunch of kids running wild. Dropping silverware, laughing too loud. Pollo fundido? Awful. Floury taste, mushroom soup sans mushrooms. More like a fried fajita wrap. Disappointing. Wanted it to be good. Hope they shape up."

"Thought I'd play it safe, order in person. But no, they still screwed it up. Three extra things I didn't ask for, and they weren't cheap. Didn't think much of the total, but what do I know? Not till I got home did I realize how bad it was."

"Came here when Market Street had a line, like it usually does. But it's getting tougher to find something good. The hamburger steak used to be solid, but this time it was off. Maybe it was the grill. The philly steak sandwich wasn't great either. Not enough cheese and the meat was flavorless. Needed salt. We were so disappointed we skipped the friend wonton and teri beef, our usual go-tos."

"Today at lunch, I told her to bring me the General Tao chicken. Spicy, I said. But what did I get? A damn packet of hot sauce dumped on top. That ain't spicy. It's just an insult. They got real chicken, I'll give 'em that. Big chunks, not like some joints that serve up a quarter chicken and three-quarters batter. But their sauce, that's where they lost me. Can't even get that right."
"Patio's nice, but service stinks when it's busy. Made us feel like we didn't belong, and that's no way to treat paying customers. Won't be back."
"Not goin' back. Place smells like smoke, service is crud. Food's meh, IHOP's better. Wouldn't recommend to a buddy."

"Two cleaners for two hours to scrub an empty condo. Showed up three days later, place looked the same, minus a few things. Heard it's standard to clear out the cabinets for new tenants. How about we adopt a 'don't take what's not yours' policy? Not like it was trash. They did clean the oven and fridge, couple drawers too, but that's about it. Two stars for that. Feet turned black after thirty minutes of walkin' around barefoot. Offered to come back and clean again, but figured it wasn't worth my time. Never again."

"Buffet's a bust. Thirty bucks for pasta, pizza, and Chinese food? No thanks. Seafood section's a joke. Fried this and that, unpeeled shrimp. Pulled pork and chicken, soggy and drenched in BBQ sauce. Canned beans. Salad bar's a disappointment. Service? Forget about it. Manager had to step in. Desserts save the day. Mini donuts, ice cream, cookies. That's something."

"Paid for service, but the house remained unclean. Surfaces were wiped down, dirt pushed around. Sent pics of filthy tiles after their so-called cleaning. No attention to detail or care from this outfit."

"Went to 1902 tavern for lunch. Waiter was on something, man. Ordered a steak, but it was overcooked and cold. Salads took forever to arrive, and they were full of iceberg lettuce and tasted like shit. Place was a dump, and the area's filled with vagrants. Don't know where they come from, but they need to get a job, like their fathers did."

"Hometown Buffet, a joint that'll set you back $25.99 a pop. And let me tell you, it ain't worth it. The dining area's like a high school cafeteria - loud, drafty, and plain uncomfortable. They got a bunch of food varieties, but they're all cooked to mediocrity. Props for having beer, though - served in a solo cup, just like at the carnival. But, they only got Miller Light. Don't bother askin' for anything else. And here's some advice: don't drop your fork, 'cause you only get one."

"Chicken tenders at Popeye's Louisiana? Forget about 'em. They're drier than the Sahara desert. Stick with Canes, my friend. Their chicken is cooked to perfection, not left to wither away under a heat lamp."

"Late night, I was jonesing for dim sum. This joint was the only spot still serving. Been craving it for months, so I devoured everything. Bad move. Got food poisoning. The pork shumai smelled off, but I was too hungry to care. Should've known better. Limited dim sum menu at night. Sweet custard buns and shrimp balls were decent. Banana leaf sticky rice, shrimp potstickers, and pork buns were kinda like dim sum. Pork shumai and shark fin potstickers were either bland or bad. Heard there's better dim sum in Vegas. Avoid this place unless you're desperate."

"I phoned at six to ask about the kids' section. Guy said they had one, I said great, we're on our way. Got there at six-thirty, paid, and he tells us the kids' area closes at seven. What the hell? Someone should've mentioned that when I called. Kids' section closed, my nine-year-old hit the jumpers with the teenage riffraff, my two-year-old did squat. Asked for a refund, left, and went to Jumpstreet. Recommend it, they don't shut the kids' section at weird times, it's open during business hours, and it's cleaner."
"Place didn't cut it. Service slow and snotty. Hummus? Tahini overload. No lemon, no flavor. Lentil soup? Chef Boyardee crap. Don't waste your time. Plenty other options around."

"Place always out of items. Twice ordered chicken fried steak, no fresh bread. Waitress slow, takes long cigarette breaks. Team leader no better, never smiles. Food good when hungry. Love unlimited hot cocoa. Avoid water, tastes like algae."
"Pricey for small portions. Hard to taste the guacamole. Cold food, too. Had a cold carne asada burrito halfway through. They replaced it, but the taste is good."

"Place was nada special. Started with spring rolls, they were meh. Had the Pacific Cove salad, fishy and segregated on the plate, not my jam. Crab and shrimp tasted frozen, everything was just ok. Not worth the dough. Atmosphere was basic, like any other chain joint."

"Liked this joint for a bit. Didn't mind it being closed on Sundays, since I worked weekends. Thing was, checkout took forever - 20 minutes, easy. And they had a ton of stations, but only two were ever open. Had 30 people in line at one in the afternoon, and the manager never said a word. Just stood there, watching us waste our time. Didn't bug me too much, though, 'cept for the fact that I saw 20 employees just walkin' around. 

Only reason I kept comin' back was 'cause they had Dill buttons. Good quality, metal and plastic. Not like that Hobby Lobby crap. They stopped sellin' Dill, now they just got their own brand. Two for one, y'know? 

Anyway, don't gotta deal with those lines no more. Order online now."

"Shopping on Black Friday? No thanks. Had a cert to use, but no way was I going through that hell again. Planned ahead this time. Went last weekend, 10:40 am. Place was empty. Organized merchandise, not a single shopping bag. Scored four items, one a gift. No receipt since it was a gift cert. People bringing alcohol in? Bad idea. Girl went up the escalator the wrong way. WTF?! Not a stressful morning at the Forum Shops. Forever 21 wouldn't allow that."

"We showed up late and they had sold our room. We had to shack up elsewhere for the night. Not cool. But we got free brekkie for two days and the spread on the exec floor was better than expected. Gym and net cost extra and have limited hours. Disappointing."

"Plenty restaurants serve great grub for a fraction of the cost. This place? Just okay. Shrimp on my salad, over-salted to hell. Cut my tongue like a knife. Scallops, good. Steak, good too. But not worth the outrageous prices."

"Been here thrice. Twice for brekkie buffet, once for lunch. Grub's like Denny's. Nothin' special. Dingy, dirty joint. Hair in one dish. Service is meh. Employees look as grimy as the place. Won't be back."

"Perplexed by all the five-star reviews, we walked in, out-of-towners looking for a quick bite near our workplace. Packed house, thirty-minute wait, no big deal. But the humorless greeter, sourpuss all night, set a bad tone. Tofu appetizer, ikkura and condiments, delicious. Hand scallop soy roll, small, not spicy as requested. Edamame overcooked, various rolls lackluster, ingredients not fresh. Twice sent back the tuna sashimi. No alteration to the bill. Green tea creme brÃ»lÃ©e, tasty but tiny portion. Sake, good, but for twelve bucks a bottle, it should be."

"Subpar service. Got a pedi, polish looks decent, but the rest? Meh. Kid doing it went at me like a bird of prey with those damn cuticle nippers. Still feeling the burn four hours later. Massage? Forget about it. Then they had the nerve to leave me and my buddy hanging from the pedi chairs like a couple of slabs of meat. Not going back."

"Dark, classic vibes, like the good ol' days. Service? Sub-par. Maybe 'cause I looked like a comfy tourist, but hey, we spend money too. Hate how high-end steakhouses ignore health-conscious folks. Hubby likes steak, but I wanna eat right. How 'bout some healthy options, Capital? Had to modify my salad, took off all the extra stuff. Entree-sized, but still left me hungry. Special order messed up too. Watched my husband eat while I counted carbs in the napkin. Won't be back. Too many better places to spend my hard-earned cash."

"Cold beer, good eats, decent TVs. But the service? Awful. Every damn time, it's like they're trying to set a new low. New servers every visit, and I heard it's because the management's crap. Treat their people like dirt, they do. Time to cut our losses and find a better joint. Plenty of other great sports bars out there with decent staff."

"This joint's too damn hyped. Ordered a burger medium well, came out oozing red like a sonofabitch. Can't even fit my mouth around it. Burgers are all about the proportions, ya know? Quality ingredients, perfectly balanced. If you wanna make a bigger burger, do it in a way that makes sense. Not impressed by this place. Stack'd in Shadyside, now that's a good burger joint. Four times the size, quarter the price. And let's not forget the atmosphere. Freezing cold in there, sat at some rinky-dink high table with plates that couldn't even fit. And the way they served the burgers? Crammed in some tiny basket, like they were tryin' to make it hard to eat. Not sayin' this place is complete trash, but there's better options 'round here for sure."

"Hamburger steak's alright, but too pricey. Starts at 4.50 bucks, but can easily add up to a ten-spot with extras. Takeout's quick, about a quarter hour for a burger. But the joint gets loud when it's hopping."

"First time having pho, can't say it's great. Second time, tried the cheesesteak at Asian Invasion, $9 for a sandwich on a crappy roll. Not impressed. Sister offers me her banh mi, too salty and same bad roll. Sriracha helps, but not worth the price."
"Sunday brunch. Bacon, funnel cakes. Frozen stuff from Sam's."

"Went to this joint twice. First time, no reservation. Bellied up to the bar, waited, and waited. Eventually snagged a table. No complaints. Food was good, atmosphere too. Fast forward to tonight. Had a 5:30 reservation for a birthday. At 7:09, told to leave. Table was spoken for - by us! They knew it was a birthday celebration and brought out a nice surprise. But for 60 bucks a plate, don't expect to be rushed out. Service aside, let's talk grub. Tenderloin tips were salty, but decent. Key lime pie was good. Prime rib/shrimp combo was okay, shrimp scampi was good, but prime rib was subpar. Flummoxed why Beef and Bottle would risk pissing off customers. Won't be back. Got sick from the meal too - not sure if it was me or them, but after being rushed out, I'm saying it was them. Won't be back."

"At Chez ma grosse truie cherie, I didn't have high hopes. We ended up there due to a lack of reservations on a busy Saturday night. It seemed like the place catered to big groups, with long tables and family-style menus. Service was top-notch, though. 

We shared some oysters, which were decent but not the best I've had. The chef's seared foie gras was the highlight of the meal - I'd go back just for that. The fresh grapes complemented the fattiness perfectly. No sharing! 

The whole hog platter was a letdown. The baby back ribs, smoked grilled pork chop, and braised shanks were all pretty bland and dry. The shank was tender, at least. And I liked the roasted veggies. 

Local beers made the experience a bit better. But I won't be back anytime soon... unless I can have that foie gras all to myself."
"Food, good. Maggie, waitress, no sense. Owner, spoke with. Cleared up, things. Back, won't go."

People packed the place on a Thursday night. We snagged a spot at the bar to avoid the wait. Menu prices? Outrageous. A $50 gift card saved the day.

We wanted to share something with our drinks. Gluten-free options? The waitress couldn't guarantee anything. I mowed down the free bread and butter. Then, we went for dessert. Ice cream sundae for him; lemoncello raspberry cheesecake for me. The waitress recommended it. Not impressed. I ate a few bites, not wanting to waste the calories.

Three cocktails and two slices of dessert set us back $45. The free bread? Best part of the meal. Service? Subpar.

"This joint's got that franchise vibe, ya know? Staff's tryin' too hard to be cheerful, feels like they're puttin' on a show. But hey, the burgers ain't bad. Got a couple options, big one with two patties or the smaller single patty. Fresh-cut fries, now those are top-notch, best in Tempe for sure. Might come back, but wouldn't go outta our way."

"Rooms were pleasant, clean, and comfy. Family above us made a ruckus, stompin' and slidin' chairs around. Damn annoying. We were in the Lily buildin', parkin' was a bitch. Never any spots near the buildin', had to drop off the in-laws on the curb 'cause they ain't exactly spry. Then I'd circle around, hopin' some fool would leave. Casino next door was closer than the parkin' garage. WiFi was a problem, cost forty bucks a week for one device. Ridiculous, every other hotel we stayed at had free WiFi. Lady at check-in tried to rope one of my guests into a timeshare presentation. He said maybe, she got all huffy and tore up the form. Real friendly, that one."

"Wife goes there often, but I never join her. Place gets five stars for coffee, but the hipster chick at the counter's got an attitude problem. I ain't spending my cash where they treat folks like me disrespectfully."
"Been here thrice. Service been poor all three times. View's amazin', but won't be back due to shoddy servin'."

We dined at Rao's last week, anticipating a legendary experience. The joint itself is fun, decked out in old-timey Italian decor with celeb photos on the walls. Service was top-notch, attentive and professional. Food was good, but not great. Seemed like the kitchen played it too safe, serving up ample portions of slightly above-average entrees. My veal dish was solid, but didn't live up to the hype. Rao's has potential, with a fun setting, great servers, and decent grub. They just need to step up their game in the kitchen. A little tweak in prep would go a long way. Hope they take note, 'cause it's a fun spot with good people.
"Hot dogs, good. Toppings, plenty. Pricey? Yeah. Poutine, heard great things from my Canuck buddies. Disappointed? A bit. Quebec, next time."

"Airports, man. They gotta be the worst. This one, especially. You gotta board a damn tram every time. Like, what's the point? SFO's bigger, but no tram. Don't get it. 

And the PA system? Forget about it. It's like they're tryin' to drill a hole through your eardrums. Distorted, loud as hell. Three loud ass toots, like they're tryin' to make sure you're really uncomfortable. Everyone's coverin' their ears, but they don't seem to care. 

And the taxi prices? Ridiculous. Twenty-five bucks to the hotel, but only fifteen to the airport? Same distance, man. What's the deal?"

Yesterday, I visited this establishment and was disappointed. Our server was friendly, but the food was subpar. I ordered the lunch special with pizza and tomato basil soup, while my cousin got a beer. However, the beer took an eternity to arrive, and when it did, it was lackluster. The pizza was also unimpressive, with old and dry cheese. The saving grace was the delicious tomato basil soup, which my 3-year-old and I mostly devoured. Unfortunately, the rest of the meal was forgettable, and I wouldn't recommend this Yard House Restaurant.

"This joint still open? No kiddin'? I'm lost. I mean, like, in business? Makin' dough? Hours of ops? Manager? Employees? Nah, can't be. Not with all this fancy shit. Air's a smoker's paradise, Earth's got some weird alien vibes, Fire's burnin' my eardrums, and Water's where you go to spend big bucks on drinks that'll leave you dry. Don't get it. How can these rich folk afford this place? Must be nice. Two stars for the cash they sunk into this dump. And that VIP elevator? Real classy. Retarded classy, that is."

"Waited 45 minutes for a table on the terrace, despite the 20-minute estimate. Place was too loud, started off poorly... "The best pizzas in Montreal," yeah, that was worth the wait. And nope... Chef's pizza had zero flavor, just like my friend's pasta drowned in a bland, greasy sauce... an overpriced menu convinced me to give it two stars, with the only plus being the terrace. In short, a place to avoid if you even slightly care about Italian cuisine."

"Two stars, that's all I can give 'em. Overpriced and unimpressive. I know my Korean BBQ, and this place don't cut it. Thirty bucks for a small serving? No way, Jose. I went for the dolsot bimbimbap instead. Most expensive I've ever had. Nothing special here. Two stars, that's being generous. The grub was decent, I'll give 'em that. But the service? Friendly enough, I guess. Won't be going back."

"Two types of folks come here: old timers and freebie seekers. We had passes, so we checked it out. My fiancÃ©'s work scored us Regal tickets, but they're only good at two theaters in this dump. This place was dead, even with the geezers. One dude ran the snack bar, another chick sold tickets. That's it. The theater? Tiny screen, crappy sound, and not even stadium seating. We stuck it out since we didn't pay, but otherwise, we'd have bailed. Might hit up the other Regal joint on Northsight. Thought Scottsdale was ritzy, but this place? Deserted and full of oldies. No wonder nobody's reviewed it â€“ it's time to put it out of its misery."

"This ain't no three-star joint. Two stars at best. Rooms reek of mildew, sheets are stained, and the whole place looks like it's seen better days. Maybe it was somethin' back in the day, but not now. Beds are lumpy, linens are sketchy, and I swear I saw a critter in the tub. But hey, the Speakman shower heads are top-notch, and the water pressure is solid. Still, not worth comin' back to."

"We returned to this side of town, eager for an excuse to come back. But, damn it, we were let down. Zucchini fingers were limp, bending in half when picked up. And they don't even serve 'em with tatziki sauce no more, charging extra for a tiny container. Like getting charged for ketchup at a diner. Zucchini needed salt, bad. My beef and lamb gyro was just okay, a bit dry. Hubby's Oscar burger, with pastrami, was also dry. The salad that came with it was drenched in dressing. Too much. Won't be coming back. Better Greek food at Stephanos, closer to home anyways."

"Speak up if you want a drink, kid. It ain't easy getting served here, especially after 10pm. And when you do, make sure to order a double 'cause the pours are weak. But hey, they got a damn good "Rooster" salad. Shame the regulars don't seem like the type who eat much. They look more like they took a break from scrubbing their grout and decided to bring their teeth-grinding habits out in public. Real intense, kid. Lol."
"Flies on the menu? Hell, they should give 'em away free! Ruined our lunch, those damn pests did. Prepare thyself."

"Disappointment stung like a slap in the face. Thought it was a sure thing, but nope. Waited long time for grub, then it was just meh. Rather shell out more clams for something truly delicious and don't make me wait an eternity."

"Skeptical of this joint, I was. And rightly so. Great for a night out with the lads, watching the game. Not much else to say, as it's not a place for chatting. Ordered a beer and some fried fish and chips. Soggy, but that's how it comes. Greasy fries, fish on top, a hot mess. Tasteless, too. Pub atmosphere, live music, rowdy fans, loud music. Good service, but splitting checks, a challenge. Enjoy."
"Went for lunch, expecting a spread. Got a few dishes, honey chicken stuck like glue. Haven't been back."

"Sunday night, packed house. Twenty-minute wait. Spicy mudbugs, just like Houston. Crawfish, good, not soggy. Hot and juicy, just right. Snow crab, tiny. Shrimp platter, mostly fries. This place wouldn't last in Texas or the bayou."

Pros: Fast service, cold Miller Lite. Cons: Limited menu, no wine by the glass. Cramped, chaotic atmosphere. Frazzled waitress. Had to ask for lemons.

"Food's a joke here. Pasta's mushy, noodles are drowning in sauce. Fried stuff's decent till you hit a greasy, breaded mess. Mac and cheese? Forget about it. Desserts? Bitter or straight-up gross. Soft serve's icy and cheap. Cookies look good, but don't fool yourself. Two stars for dinner rolls and mushrooms though. They're alright."

"Booked two rooms in Vegas for me and the boys. First room was ready at 1:30, second room wasn't ready till 6:15 and wasn't even the connecting room. No shampoo or conditioner in the second room, took them an hour to bring it up. Concierge messed up our plans to hit Marque, said it was closed when it wasn't. Staff was lacking, not up to par for a luxury hotel. Would stay somewhere else next time."
"Arizona's got better joints, but this'll do. Pricey, though. Grub's just okay."

"Gym's got a good class selection, but that's where the positives end. Parking's a pain, and you gotta pay for it. Staff's not exactly friendly either. Equipment's pricey for what you get. And don't even get me started on the desk situation. Guy's always upstairs, never downstairs where he should be. \n\nI'm counting down the days till my contract's up. Big mistake signing that thing. Gotta be better gyms around here."

"Sunday afternoon, busy as hell. Don't know why OG's always jammed on family days, but this time it was packed. People everywhere, inside, outside, bar area. Managed to grab a to-go order from the overwhelmed takeout guy - he deserved a raise. Rest of the joint, not so much. Sat at the bar for 30 minutes, no one bothered to offer a drink or even water. Food was standard OG fare, nicely packed with a smart container for the salad. Two stars for the messy atmosphere and disinterested bartenders. Otherwise, not bad."

"New Mexican food? Serve it right. Don't dilute it. I spent a month in the real deal, and no one uses a full green chile for Chile Relleno. Use Poblano or Anaheim, then douse it in green chile sauce. Guy next to me complained about the sauce not being hot. Free chips and salsa at the bar, decent with two salsas. Food comes out two minutes after ordering, meaning it's not made to order. Fake Chile Relleno was enough to make me run."

"Pizza's been a bust here three times now. Latest one, Hawaiian, showed up soggy as hell. Couldn't even eat it straight outta the box. Called 'em up, owner picked up. First, he says their Hawiian's always like that. Bullshit. Then he tells me the ingredients are fresh. No shit. Finally, he offers me a credit. Like that's gonna make it right. Told him I'd think about it. But honestly, I was feelin' like crap that night, or I woulda put up more of a fight. Maybe even made the driver turn around and give me my money back. Avoid this joint. Bad pizza, worse customer service."

"Beer and grub were passable, but don't expect a genuine craft brewing experience. Service was subpar and the joint was dead. I dig Sleepy Dog in Tempe, but this spot's a dud. It's like they're trying too hard to please everyone, but end up pleasing no one."

"Excited to dine here, I was. Until I did. Disappointment followed. Food, mediocre. Same as Chinese for $40, not $240. Dim sum, decent. Snapper, dry. Prawns and curry, no good. Nightclub, a cave. Left shortly after entering. Service, excellent, though."
"Overpriced, that's what it is. Burger, fries, soda, all for over ten bucks. Fries were two forty, not even worth it. Slow service, empty joint. Won't last long, like Johnnie Brusco's."

"Place was packed, staff was friendly, but the grub? Nasty. Queso and chorizo were decent, but the rest? No bueno. Chilaquiles were a no-go, green sauce was weird, steak was flavorless. My dog got a nice meal out of it, though. Friend's torta was a bust too - we both agreed it was gross. Sticking to Gallo Blanco's torta from now on. Some of the worst food I've had."

"I switched to Dr. Barrettoko after my regular doc left Nevada Family Care. Big mistake. She's not even close to the same league. Last time I saw her, she was texting on her phone while I was telling her my symptoms. Had the nerve to try and hide it behind her tablet too. Unbelievable. Don't waste your time with her. Rest of the staff is okay, but avoid her like the plague."

"Happy hour prices, but the grub ain't worth it. Had a better-tasting roll at AJ's grocery store. Colleagues and I went for an early dinner, and they agreed - not as good as before. Tuna for the hot & spicy tuna roll and the lollipop was over-diced, like mush. Server scowled, said sorry, and took the still-full plate. No discount, no apology from the manager, just the bill dropped off and the server dashing off."

"Parking's free out back. That's a plus. And with your receipt, you get 10% off souvenirs upstairs. Food's alright, but one of our group of five tried to swap mac and cheese for fries. Waitress didn't know what hit her. No fries, no mac and cheese. She was dumbstruck."

"Ambiance cool, drinks good. Service? Awful. Unorg'd, hectic. Food took over an hour, cold. Loud, like a club. Can't chat while eatin'. Group needs separate checks? Good luck with that. Worked in restaurants 10+ yrs, know how it goes on busy nights. But this place? Needs to step up or it'll fail fast."

"Wynn's Pizza Place. Cheap, but not the best. Mr. Wynn says it's like NY-style pizza, but I disagree. Had a cheese pizza with pepperoni, onions, and peppers. Expected green peppers, got red. Ingredients weren't chopped fine enough. Pizza was good, but too greasy. Slices are big, though. Also had a basic vinaigrette salad. Just okay. Dressing wasn't mixed well. Best part was the iced tea, passion tea but not sweet. Sat inside due to wind, missed the waterfalls outside."
"Domino's, near my place. Craving their new thin crust, easy to swing by, order fresh. Waiting room? Drab. Avoid after dark, safety concerns, shootings."

"Decor top-notch, service subpar. Waiter clueless, didn't bother with wine list, zipped by with perfunctory check-ins. Corked wine, no resolution. Soup and apps arrived simultaneously, requested slower pace, no dice. Food unremarkable, except for octopus and onion soup. No point in dessert. Service and food didn't live up to Hubert Keller's reputation. Overextension of a renowned chef's name, or a misuse of his brand?"
"Up and down, this trip. Service lacking: no bellhop, hair in the shower, stain on the sofa. But, rooms have balconies and great views. Nice casino, good location. Cost too high, better options."

"Mexican grub's a rare find, friend. Lindo's got plenty on the plate, prices ain't too steep neither. But it don't make ya wanna come back for more. Not like Mundo's, up in World Market Center. Now that's some creative eatin', worth the trek from Henderson. Shame they didn't pick this town instead of Ft Apache."

"First time at 4ur Nails, not the best. Guy doing the job, no technique. Nails looked better before, cuticles a mess, skin scraped from buffer. Cold water, painful. Sloppy, dull finish. Not worth it. Sticking with my regular spot."

"BLT Burger, huh? Thought it'd be a good spot for some diner grub. Prices ain't too bad, but watch out - fries cost extra. Had their Tex-Mex burger, decent but not the best. Bun was soggy, fell apart quick. But their spiked milkshakes, now those are worth it. Grandma's Treat, that's the ticket - Makers, vanilla, caramel, nuts. Would go back for those, but that's about it."

"Close to the strip, this joint's got some perks. Access to the city center, crystal shops, Aria, and Bellagio via tram. Lobby's nice too. But, there's some downsides. Walls are paper-thin, you can hear everything - conversations, toilets flushing, showers, doors opening and closing. You can even hear your neighbors getting it on. Not exactly ideal. Housekeeping's subpar too. Five pillows, four of 'em stained. Comforter's got a stain too. Bathroom, furniture, bed, TV - all outdated or just plain old. No coffee maker. They'll charge you $3.75 for a Starbucks coffee downstairs instead. No mini bar either. And that "rose petal" scent? It's overpowering and gives you a headache after a while. If you're looking for a cheap Vegas stay, this might be your spot. But if you want a little more comfort, look elsewhere."

"Been here before. Good grub. But this trip, they couldn't accommodate my allergies like they used to. Called in my order, but they said they changed the menu. Online menu wasn't updated, but they still refused to give me what I wanted. False advertising, poor service. Food was good, but won't be back due to this."

"Went to Tryst on a Sunday, family birthday celebration. Menu looked good. Ordered seared ahi tuna salad, spring rolls to share. Didn't think to ask if it'd be hot. Figured spring rolls would be, never had raw ones before. Fish in a salad is always hot. Not this time. Not great, but not a big deal either. Spring rolls were good, just unexpectedly raw. FiancÃ© found a hair in his salad, lost my appetite."

"Wings, heard great things. Chicken Parmesan, half off happy hour. Ten whole wings, five bucks. Exciting, right? 

Nah, tasteless and greasy. Kept biting, didn't improve. Three wings, that's it. Like eating grease-flavored chicken. 

Tomato salad, big Mozzarella chunks. Not bad. Place has potential. Beer's still flowing. I'll be back. Hoping for change."

"Cupcakery's red velvet cupcakes? Phenomenal. Moist, flavorful. Frosted perfectly. Friend gave me one, had to share with the boyfriend. Other cupcakes? Meh. Overpriced. Dry, flavorless. Grocery store quality. Coconut cupcake with cream cheese frosting? No bueno. Shop looked decent. Decorations? Meh. Could've done better myself. Sugar fix? Sure. Worth it? Nah."

"Ice cream's good, but the joint's a dump. Sinks and counters are grimy, and there's dust all over the glasses. Only got it 'cause the ice cream was hidden. Back room's just as dirty, and there ain't no health rating in sight. Shame, 'cause the ice cream's tasty. Clean this mess up!"

"Three years since my last visit to Sam Boyd Stadium. Not much changed. Rebels still terrible, stadium subpar. Won against Western Illinois that night, a plus. Outdated stadium, terrible concessions. Original review still applies. Hoping for a new stadium someday. Return factor, 50%."

"My hair's a simple cut, always has been. But the girl who trimmed it here, she must've slipped up behind my ear. Tried to cover it up, made the other side match. Didn't notice till I was washing my hands in a restaurant bathroom. Gonna speak with the manager on Monday. Lady was nice, till she didn't say 'oops, messed up your hair.' Not too broken up about it, but it's noticeable. Would've been nice if she'd mentioned it. Think I deserve a refund. Keep you posted if I get my money back."
"Place was decent. Curry too runny. Service good though. Waitress nice. Not worth return trip."

"Meat Shop's let me down twice now. Staff's still top-notch, but the product's fallen short. Pork belly was fatty, not like my usual Asian market find. Figured homemade bacon's a tough call, being smoked and cured. Spare ribs didn't fare much better. Meat Shop's were thin, tough. Smart & Final's were meaty, juicy. Maybe I need to be clearer on what I want. But at triple or quadruple the price, I expect better than crap."
The salsa bar's good. Free chips and salsa. People working the counter? Rude. Had the California tacos. Plain, no flavor. Won't be back.

"Chow mein to-go for 8.10. Not bad, but not quite Panda Express quality either. Small portion for the price, and not much meat in the combo. 8.10 for chow mein versus 10.50 for all-you-can-eat dinner? Bad pricing. I'll be back to try the AYCE, but individual platters aren't worth it."

"Burrito drive, huh? Don't get your hopes up. It's got one thing goin' for it - delivery. That's it. If you're lookin' for some real Mexican grub, keep lookin'. This joint ain't gonna cut it. I tried it a couple times, but nothing's changed. Chipotle and Qdoba? They're comparable, but Chipotle's got my vote. Just don't expect too much from this place, and you might not be let down. But hey, it'll make you appreciate places like El Pastor and Taqueria Guadalajara even more."

"We stopped at Phillip's for a quick bite during a layover in Charlotte. It's a simple joint - sit down, order from a waiter, and get your food quick. The grub's a bit pricey, like all airport food, and they were out of BBQ sauce when I asked for it. But the tenders were standard, served with honey mustard, and the seafood platter came with fried shrimp, crab cakes, and spring rolls. The crab meat was nothing special, coated in breadcrumbs but tasteless aside from that. The spring rolls were meh, and the shrimp was decent. Don't expect great service - our waiter had to be flagged down for the check - but it's an airport spot, so keep your expectations low. Worth it if you want something other than fast food, but not much else."

"Food was decent, guacamole was great. But service? Shitty. Waitress gave us the cold shoulder. Like, what's the point? We're paying customers too. Don't know what their problem is in Scottsdale. Place needs a new staff, or maybe just a little common courtesy."

"Been here a few times. GF loves the fresh salads and veggies, but damn, they're pricey. Service is good, though. They offer cookies, which the kids love. But the drinks? Ridiculously overpriced. Smells like feet in the back, too. Pasta's just okay, soups are sometimes good. Friend told me you can't eat as much as you pay for. Always packed, despite mediocrity. Sunset Station's better and cheaper, drinks included. Just saying."

"Tao's a tight spot, packed in like sardines. Nice eatery, good vibe, but they let too many in, too quick. We were done in 30. And the folk? Questionable. A sloppy Mexican dude fell on my girl. She smacked her ass, playful-like. He didn't take it well, charged at her, and tried to swing. His friends held him back, and he eventually calmed down. Same girl, later, dancing on stage, got booted by the bouncer for getting too wild. Maybe Thursday's better, but I won't be back. Marquee and XS, supposedly, better clubs."

"Hated that feelin' when you tell the server you got a travel zoo and wait to see if they're cool or treat you like a leper. Guess where we fell? Couple behind my husband got amazin' service, prix fix meal with wine pairin', good for 'em! Our cocktails were short, drinks with the voucher tasted like sea water. Bar bill was $100, way over the coupon. Husband liked the seafood pot and salmon, I got the beef carpaccio and chicken, but it was dry. Also got a squash soup palate cleanser and fishy paste, bleh! Expected the same service as their sister restaurant, Andres, but no comparison. Views were pretty, crime brÃ»lÃ©e was good stuff, but not enough to bring us back. Thank God we didn't tell the host about the TZ, would've been pissed if we faced a wall. If you don't like coupon vouchers, just stop listin' 'em, simple as that."

"Went here a few times. It's decent. Service is usually good too. But, I gave 'em two stars 'cause they gotta step up their worker training game. I usually get good workers, but today? Guy brings me guac and no chips. Another guy gets me a barbacoa bowl, but forgets the carnitas quesadilla. New, untrained, or just plain deaf, idk. Line ain't movin' neither, couple girls workin', slackin' off. Time for 'em to find a new gig."

"I hit up this Ulta joint regular, 'cause it's just down the street from my crib. They usually got what I need in stock, but the service is pretty weak. I ain't one for chit-chat, but a simple "howdy" or "thanks" wouldn't hurt. Instead, it's like they're too busy gossipin' with their coworkers to give a damn about the customers. I'll still come back though, 'cause it's convenient as hell. But if things don't change, I might just have to have a word with the boss man."

"Rice, three bucks a bowl. Ridiculous. Wynn's late-night options were slim, so we settled for this joint. BBQ pork, duck, and two bowls of rice set us back forty-five bucks. Outrageous. Sam Woo's BBQ, now that's a place that serves a mean meal for a fair price. This place, though? Overpriced and underwhelming. The server, a robot. No smile, no enthusiasm, no personality. A shame, Wynn. A real shame. All I wanted was a satisfying late-night meal, but no such luck at Red 8."

"Lost baggage and child wrangling, all about empowering employees. I'm patient, like the Madonna, or maybe more like the Material Girl. Laid back after my wine industry humbling, I appreciate service industry jobs. But when employees can't answer simple questions and we're left to fend for ourselves with machines, it's a disaster. US AIRWAYS flights have consistent problems. Throw in JFK airport and we end up in Orlando, waiting for our luggage. Our toddler was entertained by the luggage roundabout, thankfully. We waited through two flight arrivals for one bag. Family told us US AIRWAYS uses an efficient delivery service, but lost luggage is common. Good thing our baby is a travel trooper, on-board staff not always thrilled with even the well-behaved kids."

"Saturday night, six forty-five, we walk in. No wait, no crowd. Hostess MIA. Lots of empty seats, NCAAF on TV. Waiter shows up, takes our order. Bruschetta, not bad, but overpriced. Mac and cheese, microwaved crap. Lasagna, decent, but twelve bucks? No way. Tuscan Panini, tasty. Won't be back. Place is dead."

"Tried the carwash again, hoping for better results. But too many cars, not enough employees. Ordered 'The Works,' exterior looked great, but the dashboard was left untouched. Guy was too rushed, missed it completely. Won't be back for a third time."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

I walked into the place with an open mind, but the food didn't live up to the hype. Great location and decor, but that's where it ended. Their beer selection was impressive, but not enough to bring me back.

I tried the squid salad, sake nigiri, and spicy tuna roll. The squid salad was mediocre, the sake nigiri had too much rice and the salmon wasn't fresh, and the spicy tuna roll lacked flavor.

To top it off, I asked for nigori sake, but the server didn't know what it was. They only had warm sake. Not exactly what I'd call a Japanese restaurant.

"Treasure Island hooked us up with some freebies. Place was still dead when we arrived. Trance music, though. Had us both napping like kittens. They were offering Lemon Drops, more like piss-water, but hey, free's free. Didn't know if the joint would pick up, so we bounced. View from the patio was nice, though. Strip and the lake, real purty."

"Flight from Denver ran late, so we ended up at this joint. Only place open at the hotel, didn't wanna settle for snacks. Food? Lacking, to say the least. Burger? More like a charred hockey puck. Asked for medium, got medium-well instead. Service? Meh, it was alright. Not exactly the best, but not the worst either. Wouldn't recommend it, but if someone else is footing the bill, why not?"

"SMG? Meh. Went there the other night. Groupon deal, $5 movie, $3 surcharge for 3D glasses. Not many showtimes, but we took what we could get. Screen was small, lighting from the stairs sucked. Reserved seating, but hard to find four seats together without splitting rows. Ended up in the back. Service was slow, waitress blocked the screen, got annoying. Ticket counter's on the second floor, don't forget your parking ticket, they validate. Not my first choice, but I'd go back if I had to."
"Cheesecake, good. Waitstaff, friendly. Food? Not so much. Had a few dishes, all disappointing. Nachos? Don't bother. But hey, it's alright for a late-night sweet treat."
"Place wasn't much. Went in too early, maybe. Didn't seem like a spot for a wild night or long hangout. Had a nice Irish vibe, but that's about it. Won't be going back."

"New York New York Casino's big eatery. Fake street seats outside. We picked 'em for the people-watchin'. Margaritas? Sweet and watery. Plastic cups? Hell no. Chips and salsa? Generous. Table-side guac? Good stuff. Beef burrito? Underwhelmin'."

"Scottsdale's got a real stinker of a restaurant. Prob, they call it. Dive bar, dirty as hell. You'll be eatin' with strangers, real close, like one big happy fam. Bartender's a character, loud as hell, like he's on somethin'. Server girls are sweet, but they gotta deal with this dude. Food's decent, hot and plenty of it. That's the only good thing goin' for this place. But hey, if you're feelin' adventurous, give it a shot."

"Lousy service at this joint. Went for a late lunch, and we were the only ones there. Waitstaff ignored us for 20 minutes. Food took 30 minutes to arrive, and it was terrible. Pasta was dried out, like it had been sitting forever. Skip this place if you're in Lake Las Vegas."
"Chili's, three stars, small, slow service. Wait at Burgatory instead."

"Nah, not for me. Last year's crowd wasn't worth my time. I'd rather shell out more cash and hit up a bigger event like Devoured or Feast on the Streets. My buddies dig it 'cause it's family-friendly, and I get that. It's a nice way to start the summer, but not my scene."

"I read the raves, so I gave it a shot. Pat's Pounder Platter, pulled pork, beef brisket, added ribs for 3.99, collard greens, hush puppies, $23. My take? Pulled pork, dry and crunchy, pass. Brisket, salty but good. Ribs, all bone, dry, avoid. Hush puppies, meh. Greens, bland, a shame. Could've used a pound of salt."

"Went with a group, ten of us, two kids, early dinner, Thursday, five thirty. Packed. Friendly service, but waited twenty-five minutes for all-you-can-eat. Food, just okay. Prices, average. Layout, crowded, had to walk through wait station in front of kitchen, loud music, like a nightclub. Group consensus, won't go back, not worth it for sushi."

"Bacchanal buffet at Caesars Palace? Overpriced. Quality's good, but selection's lacking. Not worth the cash. There's better options in Vegas. Spend the extra dough at the bigger resorts for a real feast."

"I had given 'em five stars, but now I take it back. Went to The Brake Shop for a brake check, asked 'em to change the oil and rotate the tires too. They drained the oil, but then they couldn't find the right filter. So they put some oil back in my 2012 Audi and put on a new filter. Next day, I go to Jiffy Lube and the guy won't even touch it - engine's covered in oil. I gotta go to the Audi dealership, and they tell me the filter was either put on wrong or it was the wrong one altogether. If I'd driven much longer, it coulda caused some real damage to my one-year-old ride. Two stars 'cause the manager was friendly, didn't try to sell me nothing extra. Minus three stars for them mechanics, though."

"Went here twice. Once out of curiosity, the other because I got dragged along. Fat burger? Mediocre at best. Overpriced and takes an eternity to get your grub. In-N-Out slaughters this joint, and it's almost half the price. I'd rather hit up Burger King or Carl's Jr., and those places ain't exactly great."

"Ambiance good, music not too loud. Five of us girls for Monday night comped dinner plus one drink, $15-20 tip per person, great deal. But food? Half-cooked sliders, rushed salmon. Wouldn't come back at full price."

"Food was decent, portions fine. Service? Shit show. Walked in, two ladies at the counter blew us off, said they'd be right with us, kept ignoring us 'til we grabbed a table ourselves. Sat down, waited 15 minutes for someone to ask if we were eatin' there. Rest of the service was slow, waitress didn't give a damn. Won't be goin' back."
"Two days in, two to go. Tiny room, tiny shower, tiny bed. Shower head busted, ice machine don't work, breakfast's crap. Wi-fi's weak. Location's good though, staff's friendly. Two stars."
"Place a mess, chaos everywhere. Look hard for a good deal, but not worth the time. Big Lots, more orderly."

"Love Costco, member for 15+ years. Word of caution: count your pills before leaving the pharmacy. Three prescriptions shorted by several pills since May 2014. Latest prescription, picked up less than an hour ago, came home, short again. Dang, heading back now to fix the quantity."

"I went to a birthday dinner at this joint on a Thursday night. Big fan of Asian grub, heard good things 'bout the new spots in town. But man, was I let down. Food and service, both subpar. Skate cheeks, bland as hell. Fried Brussels sprouts, not bad. Desserts? Forget it. Vanilla custard, Fruity Pebbles, what a joke. Server, green as grass. Didn't even introduce herself. Had to ask to place our order, and for recs. Hope they step up their game next season. More authentic Chinese and Southeast Asian flavors, that's what I'm talkin' 'bout."
"Luxor. Two stars. Good memories. Pyramid Cafe. Soup. Rest. Bellagio. Ruined. Egyptian motif. Gone. New look. Awful. Really bad. Won't spend time or money. Vegas."

"Vietnam Grille? More like Vietnam Fail. Overpriced, undersized spring rolls with too much repetition in the filling. Peanut sauce? Try syrup. Pho? A star anise bomb. Flank steak? Thick as a brick. Tendon? Chewy as hell. Avocado smoothie? Nowhere to be found. Service? Meh. Parking? Plenty, but who cares? Keep searching for my Charlotte Vietnamese spot."

"Eliseevsky's under new management, and it shows. Gone are the horseradish vodka shots, and they lost their liquor license too. Menu's been trimmed down, no more caviar or veal. Had the chicken Kiev, decent but not impressive. Borscht and pork soup were alright too. Atmosphere's still intact, modern Russian tunes playing, server did some lip-syncing. Service was slow, but that's on me, rusty at dining. Might go back, try something else, but prices remain steep, around 12-16 a plate."

"Punked! Horrible value for money. Thought we'd get a nice meal and service, but boy were we wrong. Told the waiter we had a show to catch and he said we'd have plenty of time. An hour and 10 minutes later, our steaks finally arrive. Meanwhile, the other tables around us got their food way before us. Don't know what's up with that. Had to wolf down our meals and rush outta there. Oh, and the waiter forgot my mushrooms. Nice guy, huh? Food was just okay, not worth the cash. Skip Delmonico's if you're lookin' for a fancy meal."

"Nice spot, but too rich for my blood. Manager Nancy's got some serious issues with kids. Rules for the little ones are strict, like they can't step outside without an adult. No bikes in the courtyard either, which was a big selling point for me. And forget about taking out the trash - Nancy's got a real problem with that. She's got a tight grip on the place, even locking up the pool at night. Feels like a senior community, not kid-friendly like it's supposed to be. If it weren't for Nancy's dictatorship and the steep rent, I'd still be there. It's a good option for apartment living, but not worth the cost."

"Been searchin' for a decent nail joint for a spell now. This ain't the place. Get gel manis every two weeks, like clockwork. Don't dig when they use Acetone to soak off the old polish. It's rough on the nails, ya hear? And what's with the half-cut lime on my nails? No idea. Asked her to trim 'em a bit, she cut 'em damn near to the quick. No thanks. Movin' on. The search continues."

"Lunch at Cartel, noise level drove me nuts. Ordered green curry with chicken, veggie soup with tofu. Soup was lightly salted, fresh tasting. Curry sauce was good but watery, not silky. Egg roll had *, first time I've seen it in a Thai restaurant. Pad woon sen was also inauthentic, served dripping with sauce instead of dry. Noise and soggy pad woon sen will keep me away."

"Firehouse Hero? More like flavorless disappointment. Turkey, ham, and roast beef, all piled high in the center. Bread was mostly empty. Not worth the cash. Asked for white bread, got wheat instead. No apology, no concern. Waited while others got their sandwiches. Won't be back."
"It's alright, good for a fast bite. Don't get the fuss about it though. Had a shake instead of pop once and paid for it dearly. Staff's friendly, but they need someone to keep the joint tidy."

"Nick's Fat City, re-skinned to look swanky. Not a bad joint for a show, unless it's packed. Then, you'll taste human sweat and forget what beer tastes like, 'cause you won't make it back to the bar.
