"Waitin' at the drive-thru, ain't no picnic. Today, it was a real bust. Two cars ahead, and I'm sittin' there for damn near 15 minutes. Just for a sandwich and a smoothie, nothin' fancy. Service is gettin' slower each time I go. Makes me think twice 'bout comin' back."

"Kahunaville surprised me. Sandwiches, big and cheap, around eleven bucks. Drinks, pricey like Vegas, but strong. Get a Bombay and tonic, yards. Our server, friendly and professional, did great despite one of my crew pulling a dick move with an empty ketchup bottle."

"Panda Express with a twist - a drive-thru for convenience. Service is meh, but let's be real, it's not like we're there for the small talk. Food's solid, portions are decent, and it's close to some shopping spots. That's all that matters."

"Date and I hit The Lodge for Happy Hour. Prices were right, service was good. Deep fried cheese curds? Hell yeah. But the bar stools? Brutal. Didn't stick around long, but might give it another shot at a table. P.S. Saw a server working hard for tips, but damn, she was almost too scantily clad. Made us check out the rest of the joint."

"Edinburgh's oldest Chinese restaurant, or so they claim. Fifty years young, and still going strong. Locals have been coming here for decades. Name's a bit sketchy, but the grub's top-notch. Cantonese and Peking cuisine, plenty to choose from. Dessert menu's limited, but hey, bananas are always a good idea. Real Chinese folks eat here too, that's a good sign. Tough to please the locals, but they seem to be doing alright."

"Hotel wasn't our scene, but the crap game? Top-notch. Double payout on 12, 100X odds. Cheap thrill on the Strip. Place could use a spruce, low ceilings, smoke-filled air. Locals, friendly. Drinks, meh."

"I felt a certain impatience as I gazed upon this restaurant... a bit too much perhaps. We shared some 'croquettes' with foie gras: nothing extraordinary. Next, I was tempted by the happy pig's ribeye: tender meat, but the sauce wasn't quite to my taste. My friend had the duck breast, clearly disappointing. Excellent pecan tart, but is it worth coming here for? Really content to have eaten here, but several other restaurants in the same price range make me happier."

"These digs, like the Teepee, take us back to a time when our Mexican grub was straightforward, our expectations low. But hey, it's still good eats. This joint's got some stories to tell, just ask Marty Robbins."

"You get what you pay for, but I wished they offered basics like a mini fridge, tea kettle, or coffee maker. No microwave either. We had to spend our last pennies on street food. The carpets were old and smelled bad. Our faucet broke, but they fixed it the next day. Pros: silence after midnight and close proximity to everything. Would consider returning, but only after exploring other options."
"Sushi joint's mediocre, at best. Rice overpowers the fish. Pay extra for more substance? Hell yeah. No seating? Lame. Go there for quick work lunches. On par with grocery store sushi."
"Place was decent, had some good deals on beer. But the grub? Meh. Overpriced and underwhelming. Had the oyster po boy, wasn't impressed. If you're lookin' for seafood, best to head west."

"I went there after Fry's gave me the runaround. Nice to see the minis, e-readers, and Kindle up front. Glad I didn't have to trek to the back, heels killing my feet. Just wanted the Kindle and outta there. Couldn't resist a snazzy blue case, though. Employees actually helpful, unlike Fry's where it was like pulling teeth. Cashier asked about their rewards card, but I wasn't feeling it after a bad experience with gift rewards going to some random Illinois address. Three stars, tops. Can't fully trust 'em."

"The club was nothing special, but the view from the 53rd floor was something else. The city stretched out below us, a sprawling mess of lights and noise. But the distance from the Strip was a bitch, and the weather had to be just right or else going outside was a nightmare. Otherwise, the club was decent, but not much to write home about. A solid effort, but nothing to get too excited about."
"Ate here a week back. Food was good, not great. Gnocchi and ravioli, both decent. Marinara sauce, top-notch. Caprese, just okay. Service, good. Prices, steep."

"Gordon Ramsay fan here. Love the guy's shows, his passion for excellence. Reminds me of my college days, grilling up a storm at Buffalo Wild Wings. Had to try this place, what with being a fan and all. Ordering was tough, like solving the ACT. Wanted a burger, but thought I'd branch out, try something British. Went with the pie sampler. Good idea, I thought. Sample all of Gordon's flavors. But it backfired. Still hungry after. Meat pies were decent, but that's not saying much. Should've gotten a whole pie or a burger. Maybe both. My friend had a burger, looked great. Swiped some fries when he wasn't looking. Very good. Be back to try the burger."

"Not the greatest comp sci program, but it's a big school with that Arizona vibe. Heat can be brutal, but I'm used to it living in Vegas now. Classmates were cool, but some teachers were a bit too uptight. Funniest thing was how people would steal bikes and Frankenstein together new ones. Crazy combinations, man. Lots of religious folk around, too. All sorts of people, which is dope, but my teachers didn't blow me away."

"Hotel had its ups and downs. Checked in late Fri night, non-smoking room we requested was gone. Settled for smoking room. Told to come to front desk Sat between 12-3 pm to switch rooms. Next day rolled around, great time at pool and gym, called front desk, they pushed back time for room availability. Wasted 5 hours waiting, finally got non-smoking room after complaining and sounding upset. Big disappointment. Giving three stars due to awful experience, but hotel itself wasn't too bad. Room we got upgraded, really nice. Positive note, hotel's in middle of strip, across from Cosmo and Bellagio. Fun shopping and eating at Gordon Ramsey's Burgr place."

"This joint's no good. Shoulda left it in my college days. Not exactly cheap either. Place is clean, sushi guy's friendly, but that's where the positives end. Don't eat the raw stuff here. Cooked dishes are meh. Tonkatsu's dry, batter's lacking. $14.50 instead of $10 at King Muramoto? Nope. Hot miso soup's the only saving grace. Not worth the price. Low traffic on a Friday night raises questions about freshness."

"Big eatery inside crummy Imperial Palace hotel on the strip. Two separate rooms. Had simple breakfast: eggs, hash browns, biscuit, and coffee. Biscuit was fluffy, warm, and buttery. Couldn't finish it or the rest of the meal. Prices matched the large portions. Entree was $9, others were more. Bad experience: guy threw up, splashing a woman. Maybe he had a wild night in Vegas. Still, nasty to see. Good spot to pig out, maybe wear a poncho..."

"Hotel's not bad. Staff's friendly. Fitness room's decent. Breakfast is top-notch. Room's a bit of a letdown though. No microwave, just a fridge. Hate wasting grub, ya know? Shower's like a dorm room affair. Tile job with a single shelf. No full door, so there's always a breeze. Getting a bit fed up with these 'nice' joints that look good but don't deliver."

"Sunday mornings, I hit up this joint for their killer double stamp days. 

The wait can be a drag, especially on weekends, but that's par for the course. 

Their Chandler location off Ray Rd has a friendly atmosphere, clean digs, and a sweet little breakfast bar. 

The grub's top-notch, with just the right portion size for me. My husband, though, sometimes gripes about skimpy servings. That's where their rad $1 menu comes in - loads of options to add to your meal. I'm a fan of the fruit cup or mini-pancakes. Their menu's extensive, and I've yet to try everything. The 7 Veggie Omelette's a winner - tasty and healthy, too. Some of their offerings are loaded with ingredients, or all meat, if that's your jam. But steer clear of the biscuits and gravy - underwhelming, with bland gravy and chewy biscuits. 

Service can be spotty, but I appreciate the big beverage cups to go. 

Solid spot overall."

"Been here a few times, thinking I'd follow their advice and feel like a superhero. Still haven't. It's a health food store, kinda. Sells cod liver oil and garlic pills, etc. Staff is great, can't fault 'em. Heard Manuka Honey helps with skin and weight loss, so I tried it. Worked, too. Glowed a bit, lost a bit of weight. Cost me over \u00a340 though. If you're into this health stuff, it's a good spot. If not, stick with Boots."
K Mart, nothing special. Just another corporate chain. But hey, they got some exclusive deals for us Mavericks. So I'll swing by, flash my patch, and show some pride.
"Waiter was attentive. Omelet, good. Grape leaves? No way. Reddish goo on one piece. Sent it back. Decor? Yellow mausoleum with cubbies. Food, hit or miss. Good thing omelet was decent."
"Pizza's decent, similar quality to Setabello. Menu's shrunk, prices are steep for pizza. Service is good, atmosphere's cozy."

"I drove out to the sticks for some proper Southern grub. Got to the joint at 11:30, before the lunch rush. Had the smothered chicken with mac and cheese, and some green beans. It was worth the trip, but I reckon it was a mite too pricey for the portion size. Shoulda been a seven-dollar plate, tops. Paid ten and didn't even get a drink. Won't be goin' back anytime soon."

"We hit up Braddah's for lunch again on our latest trip, sharing a Kalua pig burrito with all the fixin's. Good stuff, even without the cilantro. But the service wasn't quite up to par. No samples, dirty tables, and a wait for the sauce. Three and a half stars, tops."

"Decent joint. Egg rolls and grilled pork, that's what we ordered. But Jesus, the wait was long, too long for how busy the place was. Clean, though, can't deny that. Tidy, too. But smoke from the kitchen, yeah, that was a problem. Ventilation, you know?\n\nEgg rolls, small, real small. Sweet and sour sauce, not the usual fish sauce. Pork, tasty, but small for the price. Not worth another visit, that's for sure."

"Sunday morning in Vegas, hungover and hungry. Decided to check out this breakfast spot, heard it was good. Place was packed, 30-minute wait. Thought it'd be worth it for some decent grub. Finally sat down, menu looked promising. Ordered the Benedict, portion was huge. Presentation was on point, but the food was just alright. Coulda been better if it was hot, not cold. Guess you can't win 'em all."

Le Marly's alright. Didn't eat, just drank. Their raspberry martini's good, vodka, puree, basil. Most drinks under ten bucks, like eight-fifty for liquor, seven-fifty for beer. Appetizers looked decent, but didn't try 'em. Place is downtown, Beaver Hall, but not many people come. Modern decor, purple theme. Staff's friendly, takes coats, attentive. Not my first choice for a night out, but I'd join a group.
"We chow down on breakfast at this joint often. It's your standard IHOP fare, but the grub's decent and the service is top-notch."

"Hotel's got a young vibe, twenty-seven and under, I'd say. Not my style, though. Thirty, and I'm feeling a bit old for this joint. Rooms are decent, but some things could use a fix. Loose wall plugs, rattling around. And watch out for the minibar, it's stocked with vibrators and lube. Not the best place for kids, that's for sure. Pool's where all the young ones hang out, loud and drunk. Good Mexican grub at the Pink Taco, though. Recommend it. Hotel's great for the young crowd, but not for us old folks. And it's not actually on the strip, so keep that in mind."

"L'Avenue was the plan for getaway day lunch, but the line was out the door. We didn't have time to wait, so we went across the street to a friendly-looking bistro with a nice patio. The food, portions, and service were great. The portions were huge, making the prices reasonable. They had Boreale draft pints for $5, which is a steal. Everyone in Montreal seems to enjoy a beer or wine with lunch, like in Europe. It's a safe bet place."
"Sunday arvo, my bloke and I popped in for the first time. Atmosphere, nice. Restaurant, spotless. Server Dan, knew his stuff and friendly. Grub, average but decent for the price. We'll be back."

I went to this joint for the first time yesterday, waited for some cat to show up. When I got there, nobody paid me any mind for a good five minutes, even though the place was pretty dead. Finally, some dude comes over and seats me at a big ol' table with five chairs instead of a booth. 

My buddy shows up, we order, and the waitress is real nice. Food's not bad, but it ain't hot and could use some more flavor. Meat's cooked good, but there's a ton of onions compared to the meat. Rice is just plain boring. 

Decor's real purty, staff's friendly too. Price is alright for the amount of grub you get. Might come back, but I hope they step up their game on the food and greet me at the door next time.

"Bison Witches, a sandwich joint with a decent beer selection and fair prices. Their chili cheese nachos are pretty damn good, Kristen enjoys the miss pris. Nothing out of the ordinary, but solid nonetheless. Good grub, good brews, good service, good prices. That's it."
"This mom and pop joint serves up some damn good grub. Had the lobster roll with clams, not the biggest but it'll do till we hit the coast again."

"We drove past this joint four, five times a week, thinking it was just another coffee shop. But one day, we decided to stop in, and boy, were we surprised. It was a bar, not a coffee house. Nice atmosphere, good lighting, friendly staff. Their cocktails were top-notch, even when they spilled one on us, they replaced it free of charge. Food? Not so much. Tamale burger was dry, off-tasting. Fries were great though, had a nice kick from some kind of spice, maybe nutmeg or cinnamon. We'll be back for drinks, might give the sweet and spicy burger a shot. Waitress said it's good. We'll see."

"Lunch at Thai place two days pre-NYE. Papaya salad and panang curry, both top-notch. Good service, cold beer. Some litter on floor, but not a big deal. Would go back, explore menu further, adjust review accordingly. Recommend to Thai food fans. Their 'hottest' setting? Not too spicy."

"Entrance looked like a hotel lobby. Security team was chill, nice change of pace from the usual power-tripping bouncers. Went on a weekday, place wasn't packed. Lil Jon spinning, he's alright. Local prices for drinks would be nice, though. Fifty-two bucks for a beer, wine, and a shot? Ridiculous. That's why I avoid the Strip. Clubs gotta pay the rent, I get it. But come on, we're locals. We can stash booze in our cars and run in and out. Just a thought. Overall, not bad. Moon's still my go-to, but XS wasn't terrible."

"This joint gets 3.5 stars from me. I was expecting a skimpy portion after reading the other reviews, but it was adequate. And let me tell you, I was starving when I arrived. 

We started with the olives (all green, served warm) and got some bread to soak up the reserve oil. Our server gave us the lowdown on the menu items, like the ricotta gnocchi and the puntanesca sauce (my recipe only has 7 ingredients). We both went for the orecchiette with sausage and greens. It was a bit oily, but the pasta was cooked just right. 

The desserts were described perfectly, and that chocolate bark with almonds was a great finish. Oh, and the wine prices? Very reasonable. 

We spent around $36 a person, had two glasses of wine, and left feeling satisfied."

"Bars like this one, they're impacted big time by their clientele. This All Bar One, smack in the middle of Edinburgh's financial district, attracts mostly desk jockeys. Students and office workers don't mix, so it's best to avoid the place. Drinks and grub, nothing special, similar to Wetherspoons."

"Fry's Signature in Scottsdale, saw it, high hopes for the joint. Not as swanky, still a nice spot. Bathrooms by the pharmacy, air fresheners give it a little somethin'. Starbucks, sushi, all that jazz. No price scanners, though. Good amount of folks for bein' in the middle of nowhere."

"Decent joint. Friendly service. Food's alright, fresh though. Had the angry whopper. Fries were a bit thick for my liking, but still decent. Their soda selection was the real highlight - tried the orange coke, never had it before, and damn it was good. Shame about the dirty floors, both in the dining area and the bathroom. Not exactly appetizing, but hey, it's a small gripe."

"Mandalay Convention. Two meals here. First night, Angus steak burger. Bleu cheese, mushrooms. Twenty bucks, not cheap. Best value in this joint though, 9:47 p.m. Checked in.\n\nNext morning, back for brekkie. Pricey menu. Two sides instead: two eggs any style, eight bucks. Home fries, three. Oversized tea, three-fifty. Ridiculous, but worth it. Fancy English Breakfast tea bag, honey, soy milk too. Service top-notch. Friendly, efficient. Not special, but decent grub at a bearable price in this overpriced casino."

"Average. That's what it was. The burgers, the service, the prices. All average. I had the Kiki burger. Sweet, but the mushrooms saved it. Garlic fries? Average. Handful, not a ton. Hostesses sat folks next to us, twice. Empty place, yet they crammed us in. Not worth going back."

You wanna know what the fuss is about? Come check out this joint. Get yerself a frozen hot chocolate, it's like the real deal in NY, but maybe a bit sweeter. Share it with a friend, but don't expect to finish it all, it's a lotta whipped cream. Food's alright, nothing special, just your usual bar grub. Skip the loaded potato skins, they're overpriced. Chicken dijon pizza? Forget about it, it's dry as hell. But hey, the vibe's cool, it's worth three stars easy. Makes us ladies feel pretty damn special.

"Went to the Bank twice. First time was a wild scene. Music was bumpin', people were dancin', and the energy was electric. Felt like a house party, everyone was havin' a blast. Met some cool folks and hung out at their table most of the night. Didn't wanna leave, but had an early flight. Second time, six months later, wasn't as hot. Place was dead when we got there, and it only got worse as the night went on. Crowd looked rough, and we ended up bailin' and headin' to XS instead. Maybe the first time was a fluke, or maybe Christmas night just wasn't the right time. Third time's the charm, they say."
"Pretty good, consistent. Chain food, but that's not always a bad thing. Big corporate restaurants can be vanilla, but their chambord margarita is something else. Not your average drink."

"First timer at Tandoori Times. Atmosphere was alright, thought it'd be busier. Good: food. Goat curry, their Friday special, was great. Hubby, not a curry fan, loved the tandoori chicken. Pesto naan, solid choice. No gripes with the grub. Bad: service. Polite waiter, few sightings. Waited 15 min for order, disappeared during meal. Had to grab another server's attention for the bill. Drinks went unrefilled. Ugly: belly dancing. Music and finger cymbals got annoying. Fun at first, but became too much. Couldn't chat with hubby without yelling. Decent spot. Reasonable prices, good food. Service needs a boost."

"Snooty hosts and hostesses bug me at some high-end joints. Like this one place, the hostess gave us the stink eye and made us pay seven bucks for a surprise birthday cake. We felt unwelcome, like we couldn't afford the fancy grub. But once we got past her, I ordered a tasty Lycheetini at the bar. Loved it, but wanted to save room for the food. They had a sweet elevator that took us up to the restaurant, and the modern Asian decor was impressive. Our waiter and bussers were top-notch, always filling our sake glasses. I went for their special California roll, freshwater eel roll, and adobo chicken roll. The grub was good, but the atmosphere and vibe were worth the price. I figure the chef must be Filipino, since they had lumpia, pancit, and adobo on the menu. One of the staff even asked if I was related to the chef. Didn't know all Filipinos were family. The Social House is a great spot to hang with pals, grab some real deal sushi, and get a little tipsy on good sake. If only they'd ditch the snooty hostesses."

"Pizza's too pricey for how thin it is. Extra cheese was a joke, barely any on there. Not like the pies I'm used to. Menu's limited, just salads and pizzas. If it gets cold, it's trash. Can't even heat it up, it'll be rock solid. Good thing they use a coal oven though. Makes the pizza better. Decent pie, just not my style."

"I hit up this Dunkin' Donuts joint pretty regular, 'cause the one near me closes early. Now, I gotta say, their iced coffee's not too shabby. But, let me tell you, this place is just mediocre. Consistency's not their strong suit. Every time I order, it's like I'm playing roulette. Sometimes it's good, sometimes it's not. My fiancÃ©e and I, we've learned to order a certain way, depending on who's makin' the drinks. Even then, it's a crap shoot. And don't even get me started on this one chick who works here late at night. She's got some serious 'tude. Makes orderin' real uncomfortable."

"Someone brought me a sandwich from City Market Deli today. Santa Fe Club. Oven Gold Turkey, Bacon, Avocado, Lettuce, Tomato, Alfalfa Sprouts, Chipotle Mayo on toasted multi-grain bread. Good bread, flavorful turkey, just the right amount of heat from the chipotle mayo. A tasty sandwich."

"Food was a solid five. Split yakitori and onigiri with the missus, and I had a pork rice bowl - fatty, but damn good. Boyfriend got a tuna and salmon salad special. Grabbed some wine specials for four bucks a pop - not bad. Ate till we were full. Now, the not-so-great parts:\n\nSat at the bar, and it was sweltering hot. Lost our appetites. Service was good, but it was a group effort. Food came out whenever, not really organized. Some folks might not dig that. Place was tiny, too. Had to wait a couple minutes to sit down, and the line was long when we left."

"Swung by on our way back from Vegas. Food was solid, sauce better than Boiling Crab's. Waitress couldn't explain spice levels, said Cajun fries were too hot, and medium sauce was too hot for her. I like spicy food, would've gone for medium. Probably would've tried Cajun fries too, but she discouraged me. Service was off, friend got chicken wings instead of fried shrimp, took forever to correct, and they still gave us a bill with chicken wings. Would return, but they need to tighten up their game."

"Flat, odd-coloured mess. Can't wait to leave. Had the Dic Ann cheeseburger and sauce - flat cheeseburger, meat sauce, and a popsicle stick to lift it out of the cardboard basket. Flattest hot dog, all the fixins, squashed and tasty. Like White Castle, but with Wolverine-like origins from the wilds of Canada."
"Goodwill's not in its usual spot. It's bigger now, sharing space with Food Lion. Easy drop-off in the back, but you gotta turn around in the loading dock."

"Craving Banh Mi, I hit up Mr. Sandwich. Read decent reviews, thought I'd give it a shot. Sandwiches were better than Lee's, but not the best I've had. That was in Cali, still searching. Intrigued by their other options, I'll be back. Until I find a better spot, Mr. Sandwich it is."

"Staff's top-notch. Restaurant's spotless, but grub's lackin' somethin' compared to Chipotle. Location's prime (right across from Wells Fargo)! 

My guy's a big fan of this joint (it's the only one with buffalo chicken), but even after a few tries, I can't seem to finish it. 

I usually love the bowl, but I've also tried the burrito. Want to give this place a shot. 

Chips and cheese dip are my go-to. Never been disappointed with 'em."

"Saw my first spring training game on St. Patty's Day. A's vs. Giants. Family split down the middle, half for each team. Good first. Ballpark felt just right, no bad seats. Parking easy, plenty of it. Concessions solid, extra staff with beer and water. Bad next. Outfield seats, bleachers built for kids, not six-footers. No grass areas either. Despite that, loved the game. Giants won, everyone had fun. Look forward to Scottsdale."

"A race to cram the most grub down your gullet in record time. Food's alright, but they take their sweet time bringing out the next course. If you find something you like, you might get a small taste before waiting another half hour. Tiny, packed joint for a casino eatery. Side dishes are lackluster, and drinks cost an arm and a leg. Maybe I was let down by the long wait, even with a reservation. Wouldn't exactly be eager to return."
"Went to this joint, real hot outside. Wings, man, they were top-notch. Maui wowi and hot ranch, you know? Not sure 'bout eatin' in, but hey, they got a sweet setup for parties n' all."

"Tucked away on Wynn Road, this joint's got a cozy vibe. They're going up against some stiff competition from Dai Jung Gum and Pho, but they're holding their own. Their dishes are like mom used to make - the Panang and Veggie green curries taste like they came straight out of a can. But their soup, man, it's something else. No MSG, just pure, unadulterated flavor from chicken and veggies. \n\nI went for the Sliced beef noodle soup, Thai style. I was expecting a spicy, sour, and sweet mix, but what I got was a beefy broth and thin noodles, more like pho than anything you'd find in Texas."
"Slow service. Beers out of stock. Sunday evening dragging on like a dying horse. Food taking its sweet time. Cancelled my entrÃ©e and bounced."

"Doc and Eddy's is adequate. Not remarkable, but not terrible either. Might be a good spot for a group gathering, as the place is quite spacious. They have plenty of pool tables and games towards the back, and tables up front for eating. You won't find a lack of TVs, that's for sure. 

I tried the SoCal Chicken Sandwich on my last visit. It was alright, a tad dry, but the fries were well-seasoned. The food is passable for a bar, and I was surprisingly full when I left. Service was meh, not impressive, but not horrible either. My previous encounter with their service was subpar, unfortunately. 

The draft beer was disappointingly flat, with barely any foam. I appreciate that it wasn't half foam, but a bit of head would've been nice. For a place that serves draft beer, this is suboptimal. 

I might return, but only because it's a short walk away."

We'd had a hell of a day, so we decided to treat ourselves to a nice meal. This place looked decent, so we gave it a shot. It was clean, not too crowded. I ordered the fagioli soup, it was good. The veal piccata was alright, but the veggies were a bit bland. My husband got the lasagna, but he wasn't impressed. The bread was great though, and the vinaigrette was top-notch. All in all, it was worth the price we paid.

"This joint's got some great acts, but the fees are whack. Online purchase fees and parking costs add up quick. It's like they're trying to gouge us for every penny. I mean, I've seen some top-notch bands here - BRMC, The Black Keys, Guster - but the venue itself ain't worth the extra dough. It's just a big concrete box with speakers and a sloping floor. My back's been killing me after standing there for hours. \n\nNow, they do have a decent drink selection and good security. And the stage is pretty rad too. But overall, it's not worth the cash. I mean, Phoenix may not be the biggest music hub, but we still gotta support our local scene. So, I reckon it's worth a visit, but don't say I didn't warn ya."

"Jollibee's been my go-to fast food joint since I was a kid. My mom took me there for my birthday, so it's got sentimental value. The one in Vegas was the first I visited stateside, maybe five years back. I hit it up at least twice a year. Their Chicken Joy with spaghetti and Peach Mango Pie are my top picks. The rest of the menu's alright too."

"Parents like this joint, so I join 'em for lunch. Free grub, ain't bad. Service is friendly, food's not half bad neither. Love me a cold one and some fried zucchini, they got it. Beer selection could use some work, but I ain't complainin'. Convenient spot, cold brew, tasty BBQ. Even if I had to pay, I'd still come."

"Pumpkin pretzel, that's what I went for. Place was empty, needed some work on the decor. Service? Just okay, not exactly warm. Five flavors, plus the daily special - pumpkin, of course. Could've used more pumpkin taste. Felt like a cinnamon sugar pretzel. Still, wasn't bad. Might go back, if they mix it up a bit."

"I've stayed at the Palazzo more times than I can count, but I've never written a review. Maybe it's because what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas. But let me tell you, this place is top-notch. Great location, spacious rooms with separate living and sleeping areas. The only thing that's a bummer is the bathroom lighting. It's so dim, you can't even do your makeup properly. It's a real disappointment."

"Local's been my haunt a few times on fuzzy nights in the Southside. It gets wild, more so than other joints down here, probably 'cause it's still new. 

If you're lucky, you might catch it on a night when it's poppin' but not too crowded. That's when it's a good spot to chill, especially outside in the summer. 

You'll find the usual Southside bar crawl crew here, but if you're lookin' for fancy vibes, why bother with the Southside? People are friendly, service is quick if you can grab the bartender's attention, but drinks can be pricey, especially shots. 

All the same, I reckon Local's alright for a night of drinkin' and cussin', provided the weather's nice and it ain't too packed."

"Standard visit. Checked out a PS3 and some games, but Black Fri's deals won out. Browsed the CDs and DVDs instead. Selection's meh, what with streaming and all. \n\nBest Buy's still around, mostly for the nostalgia. Friendly staff, though. They're good for finding stuff."

"Cotton candy sorbet on vanilla custard, not too sweet. Custard's good, thick like it should be. Plastic spoon's gonna snap. Servers? Not exactly friendly. Don't seem to care. Dark Baskin Robbins vibe. Take it to go, eat at the park instead."

"The store wasn't half bad, decent size, buncha cheap stuff that's almost stylish. People everywhere, buyin' up a storm. Don't know what got into me, but I felt like I needed somethin' fresh, somethin' to carry around and bring back home, ya know?"

"Mu shu's got its fans, we ain't one of 'em. It's alright, but not worth the trip. Price ain't great either, considering it's just a couple blocks away. Service is friendly, but it's still cafeteria food."

"Driving through Arizona, we passed Nielsen's Frozen Custard every time. Closed, it teased us. This trip, we finally made it inside. Surprise, they served food too. Not why we came. Friendly girl behind the counter, patient with our toppings deliberation. Small vanilla with sprinkles for me, plain chocolate for him. Quick delivery, but underwhelming taste. Consistency, yes. Flavor, no. Disappointment, but no regrets. Trying it was the only way to know."

"Clean hotel, not too pricey. Stayed four nights during CES, paid around $160 per night. Got a smoking room, heard plumbing next door, stains in the bathroom from cigarette burns, and a chair with white stains. They charged $5 for hot water! It's always the expensive hotels that nickel and dime you for things like hot water, WiFi, and a microwave. But I outsmarted them by heating water with a glass cup and the iron. You think you can work me, PH? Think again, LOL."

"Beehive Pub, Grassmarket. Reasonable size, selection, and decor. Hidden treats: back garden on summer eves, upstairs dining area. Festival vibes: tiny room turned cozy performance space for surreal comedy acts. Well done, Beehive."

"We hit up this joint when we ain't feelin' like drivin' too far or we're already in the plaza and need some crickets for our lizards. It's a pain in the ass to find someone to help us out, even after askin' a few folks. The cashiers are pretty friendly, though. They've given us discounts for waitin' in line more than a couple minutes while they're dealin' with technical difficulties. We'll keep goin' back for the same reasons we started goin' there in the first place, but it ain't our top pick for pet stores."
"Fry's has come a ways. Decent selection of meat, bread, and produce - organic and non. But the service at the deli? Slow and incompetent. I've waited too long, walked away too many times."
"Barcelona? Questionable name, but decent tapas. Service, top-notch. Half-price night, give 'em a shot. Sangrias, worth a taste."

"Hostess acts high and mighty. Two run-ins, both times she played nose-in-the-air. Food's just alright. Pork belly tacos, bone marrow, tzatziki dip, skewers with chimichurri, sushi roll - all mediocre. Skewers lack flavor. Pistachio ice cream, decent but melts fast. Don't see the appeal. Won't be back."

"Sushi stop. Trendy joint. Loud music, classic Bruce Lee flick on the wall. Sushi's fresh, but stuck with basics - Spicy Tuna, Cali rolls. Nothing special, but decent. Sapporo Beer, 22oz can, unique steel design."

"Tucked away, this joint's hard to find.  Menu's decent, had the fried beef flat noodle to go.  Just alright.  Owner's Cantonese, chatted with 'em a bit.  Need to try somethin' else next time, give a better review.  First dish didn't cut it."

"Rito's is a rip-off. Their burritos may look big, but it's just a ploy to hide the skimpy meat. I ordered the green chile burrito, and it was a disappointment. Sure, the beans were good, but the salsa? Forget about it. They charge 25 cents for a measly two tablespoons. I was expecting something special, but it tasted like my mom's cooking. And that's not a compliment."

"Richardson's again? Sure, why not? Date and I, we're game. Manager says, "Let me take care of you." We're like, "Okay, sure."

Garlic plate comes out. Not bad, but not our thing. Too heavy, too cheesy. We couldn't finish it. No room for entrees. 

Next time, I'll stick to my guns. My own palate, that is. Beautiful spot, great date spot. Just call ahead, yeah?"

"Five stars for Giligin's, a dive bar manned by little people. But that's not all, folks. This place oozes Klassy, from the sticky floors to the tacky wheel of misfortune. And don't forget the swing hangin' random in the bar. It's like a trashy, fun cousin, but with a menu I'm too scared to try. \n\nI visited during FBR Super Bowl weekend, and let me tell you, it was a wild time. $1 jello shots, rad photos with the Captain Morgan's guy, and a game of beanbag toss that left me defeated by a Wisconsonite girl. Midwestern bar games never were my thing."
"Pepper jack mac and cheese, that's my jam. Get it every time, can't get enough. Sandwiches ain't bad either. Chill vibes, decent grub, cold beer. That's my kind of place."

"CVS, a top-notch pharmacy chain, also peddles daily essentials. This spot, off the 215 and Valley Verede, bolsters their already sterling reputation. Savings and weekly deals? Tough to trump. Service and 24/7 drive-thru pharmacy? Top-shelf. A damn fine store."
"Chicken parm, average. Field greens salad, great. Wait staff, top-notch. Seating, beneath the blue sky and before a grand fountain in the Forum Shops."
"This joint looks swell, but I ain't seen no golfin' going on. Maybe they're just trying to keep it classy, like me."

"Sidebar's alright, I guess. Drinks are good, but that's about it. Been there a few times, once with a great bartender from Frisco, nice guy, enjoyed myself. Next time, not so much. Dude was uptight, acted like he was above it all. Turned me off, haven't been back since."

"New joint, real cozy.  Clean as a whistle, too.  Sat at the bar, drinks were solid.  No tap beer or craft selection, but they're workin' on it.  Nice bar, but a bit cramped.  Game room's got pool, foosball, darts.  Back patio's got cornhole, horseshoes.  Service is a tad slow, staff's a bit thin.  But we'll be back for the 'cue."

"Vegas, nice restaurants, that's my jam. This place, solid choice. Bone marrow, pork belly, appetizers on point. Filet mignon, American Wagyu, med-rare, that's my steak game. Wild mushrooms, creamed spinach, broccoli-rapini, solid sides. Red wine, don't remember, didn't matter. Steak arrives, crusted, burnt, disappointment. Didn't touch it, enjoyed the wine, sides though. Service, top-notch. Won't be back, steak letdown."

"Parking's a pain. Overpriced, too. Took me 25 minutes for a cup of joe. No one bothered to say they'd be right with me. Guess that was too much to ask. Place has potential when it's dead, though. Interesting setup. But those spaces? Way too small for the crowd. Gelato's a snooze. Store brand's better. Pizza's decent, at least."

"Saturday night, ladies. Be careful. I was out with some friends, enjoying drinks on the patio. We ordered from the server, couldn't see the bar. One Cosmo and I was done. Sick as a dog later that night. Never happened before. Maybe something in my drink? Don't know, but glad my girls were there to get me home safe. Lesson learned: keep an eye on your drinks, always."

"Apathy's a disease, kid. Infects the soul, eats away at the heart. Guy behind the counter, he's got it bad. Don't give a damn 'bout his job, just stands there, staring into space. Don't even look at the books I brought in, just shakes his head, tells me no way. First time that's happened at this place, usually they're good. Maybe it's 'cause he's old, maybe just had a bad day. Either way, don't matter. Gotta keep moving, find what I need elsewhere. Shame though, 'cause I found two things I wanted. But, you know, can't let one guy ruin the whole experience. Keep on truckin', kid."

"Nook, a new joint in town. Went there for lunch, liked the vibe and the people. Shared a pizza and a salad with my buddy. Crust was good, mushrooms too. Sausage, spot on. Red sauce, not so much. Needed more oomph. Tasted like straight tomato paste. 

Chicken in the salad, grilled nice. Pieces easy to eat. Dressing, watery and bland. 

Overall, Nook's got potential. Just needs a bit of tweaking. Service, top-notch. Would go back, for sure."

"Average joint. Nice view 'til you get close to the wall and all you see is abandoned buildings till you hit South Mountain. Cool bein' next to US Airways Arena and Chase Field. Thought the bar was on the top of the hotel, but it's only on three. Decent spot, drinks were alright. Might come back if there's out-of-towners around."

"We came for the grub, drawn in by DDD's Guy Fieri. The joint lived up to its dive status, sticky bar and all. The bartender was solid, despite the mess. We ordered wings and pizza, both hits. But damn, it took 'em forever to cook it up. They gotta step up their game, can't handle the crowds. Tiny kitchen, one cook, you do the math."

"Herb 'n Flavors, always a gamble. Sometimes great, sometimes not. First visit, Spinach 4-Cheese Quesadilla, too oily and cheesy. Second time, Veggie Rice Bowl, overcooked tofu. Vegan Spinach & Artichoke Dip, nope. Friend's salmon, good. Pollo Fresca and Chicken Shawarma Wrap, both decent. Third visit, Veggie Bowl sans tofu, much better. Falafel fries, tasty. Tiramisu, incredible. Owner, friendly and accommodating. Despite inconsistencies, I'll return for the good stuff."

"Place is decent, but gets loud when packed. Laptops and chatty couples everywhere. Coffee's alright, but too sweet for my taste. Two things stood out: cramped layout, even when it's not busy, and the bathroom could use some scrubbing. Not my go-to spot, but it'll do. Might come back sometime."

"Came here with Ma. She likes the joint. Place was clean, but pics of grub didn't help me much. Service was decent though. Had a Sprite, or so I thought. Turned out it wasn't. Guy at counter didn't give a damn. Tried lemonade next. Tasted like water. Floating crap in my cup too. Lunch specials till 4pm, but we missed it. Prices were fair, but I couldn't shake off the fountain machine vibe. Had Udon soup. Good, but unappetizing due to my thoughts on the machine. Want to support small places, but first impressions matter."

"Bowling alley wasn't half bad. Went on a Friday night, around five. Wait was an hour, though. That was a bummer. Decided to stick it out, played some games in the arcade. Nice stuff, but damn expensive. If you're willing to shell out a few bucks, it ain't a bad spot. Might try going at a less busy time next visit."

"Lunch at one-thirty, not too busy. Had a hankerin' for pasta, plus a rewards card coupon. Sat in the bar area, stroller and all. Took a while for someone to come 'round and take my drink order. Ordered quick, food came out fast, tasted good. Just had water, though. Got a refill when they brought the check. Thought the bartender/waitress was just for the bar, but nope. Happy hour's a good reason to come back, that's for sure."

"Quirky joint. LA vibes. Good service. Menu had variety. Raw, vegan, but cooked grub and meat too. Salt overload, like they needed to make up for no cooking. Desserts? Delish. Pies? Crusts too salty. Water? I guzzled six glasses. Way too much."

"Came here with the boyfriend couple months back. Place was decent, food solid. But they mixed up our order with some other poor bastards. Can't blame 'em, it happens. Worth another shot, maybe try something different next time. Bird cages out front were pretty neat, though."

"Disappointment hit hard at this joint. Heard good things, but the pizza fell flat. Bland crust, too dense, chewy. Expected light, airy crust, but didn't get it. Fig appetizer, delish. But not worth the cash."

"Johnny Rockets, a joint that brings back memories of high school hijinks with pals. This spot, though, didn't quite live up to the nostalgia. Limited seating, rushed vibes, and a lack of cozy booths to sink into. Missing the old days, when we could sip on a perfectly poured milkshake and let the jukebox serenade us. \n\nOrdered a Big Apple and Dark Chocolate shake, but only got one. Had to wrestle for the server's attention to get the second shake, which seemed like an afterthought. When it finally arrived, the flavors were on point, but the experience fell short."

"Met some pals at this joint for lunch today. Good grub, but some issues with the service. First time I came, it was colder than a witch's you-know-what in here. Second time, it was hotter than a jungle in July. Today, it was cold again. And don't even get me started on the lackluster service. They brought our food out on one tray and left us to figure out what was what. Usually, they give each person a little tray of veggies and citrus, but we only got two for the three of us. Not cool. My order: carne asada taco, al pastor taco, pescado taco, and a beef tamale. Total: $6.50."

"I'll give this joint another chance. Their sushi was good, real good. Maybe even better if I ate it there instead of taking it to go. They got a happy hour menu that's worth checking out. Music's loud, but that's okay. Prices are fair. I'll be back, and maybe next time I'll give 'em a better review."

"Thirty-five minute wait means this place is serving up something good. Free coffee outside while we wait? Nice touch. Atmosphere's cozy, like a southern cottage. Friendly service, too. None of that assigned-to-a-table nonsense. They all work together, making sure everyone's happy.

Came for breakfast, wanted the stuffed French toast. No peanut butter for me, please. Asked for Nutella and banana instead. No problem. Thought I was getting Nutella, but it wasn't as dark. Tasted more cream cheese than Nutella. Disappointing. Three out of five of us got the corned beef hash. They made the right choice. Way better than my French toast. Oh well."

"Work gets hectic, I shift into old-folk mode - whatever it takes to get the job done. Like the chef at AF, when the joint's packed, he's in survival mode. My herb roasted chicken sandwich, a long-time fave, became my least fave after one visit. Rarely have a bad meal here, but on Saturday, the place was swamped with old ladies' birthdays, baby showers, and other gal events. Kitchen must've freaked, started tossing crap on plates like monkeys running wild. Not good. Come here when it's not busy, avoid listening to the gay couple next to you bragging about their Barbados trip and how they frolicked naked on the beach. Bad sandwich plus mental image of swinging dicks? Too much. Glad I have my Xanax prescription."

"Lolo's got some good things goin' on, but it ain't perfect. Closes too early on Saturdays, for one. Had three pieces of fried chicken, two waffles, cornbread, and mac and cheese. All right, but not great. Chicken was juicy, but needed more meat. Mac and cheese tasted like it came from a can. Stickin' with Honey Bears for my glutenous cravings. Lolo's needs some outside perspective, ya know? Too much competition around here with better grub and service. Four Peaks' fried chicken strips beat 'em. Bring on the hate."

"Starbucks, an institution in the States. I'm a fan of their coffee, usually a Venti Mocha, no whip. But, I'll mix it up with a Columbian Roast or Frappaccino. Breakfast sandwiches are mediocre, but better than McDonald's. Bakery items are decent for prepackaged goods. Don't frequent it due to crowds, long lines, even in the drive-thru, and it's always chilly. Overall, prefer local coffee shops or hole-in-the-wall places. This is a Starbucks, nothing more."

"Craving frozen hot chocolate, I ordered it. Monstrous, it was. Good, but not as remembered from New York. Other dishes too, nachos, burger, hotdog. Good, but pricey for diner food. Service was slow, had to flag down the waiter. Take Harris' comps, a plus."

"Harris Teeter, not the biggest or best in Charlotte, but for Plaza Midwood and NoDa residents, it's the closest. Produce ain't great, and the place is tiny. But hell, it's packed around 6 pm, folks grabbin' groceries after work. Props to the VIC card though, rewards are decent. Got myself some free luggage once."
"This joint's swell. Had some trouble checkin' in, system crashed just as we arrived. But the grub from six to nine made up for it. Gonna scope out other places with free brekkie from now on."
"XS, a club with beauty, but not my scene. Techno beats, not my taste. Stuck-up crowd, not my people. Security, top-notch. Guys, paying $100, then $200? Ridiculous. Not worth the hype."

"Service was top-notch, food was prime. Manager? Not so much. Big party ahead of us, kitchen got jammed up. No explanation, no solution, just a whole lotta waiting. Same story at the end, confusion reigns. Manager? Nowhere to be found."
"Lee's got some damn good sandwiches. Real good. No need to head all the way to Chinatown for a Viet fix. Not anymore, anyway."
"New owners at cafe, real nice folks. Staff too. Ordered burgers, fries, salads, grilled ham and cheese. Food was swell."

"Sprouts, once Sunflower, now bears the stamp of corporate takeover. Changes abound, but are they for the better? Limited Boar's Head options and a scant meat and seafood selection leave me unimpressed. Fresh produce dominates the floor space, but prices, though competitive with Whole Foods, still pinch the pocketbook. Supplements, once a highlight, now disappoint. Kava Kava, once abundant, now dwindled to a paltry two options. Basic supplements for newbies, perhaps, but seasoned veterans will find the selection lacking. Three stars, at best, for this once-promising spot now marred by corporate meddling."

"Meh. Not too memorable. Had a bite here and at the one by ASU. This one's better, but only if I'm starvin'. Cookies are solid, though. Get one with your sammy. They got my fave Jones Soda flavor - sugar-free black cherry, kicks ass. \nWord of caution: Roast beef sandwich (Overture?) comes with horseradish sauce. It's hot as hell. I like the heat, but damn, my nose turned into a snot factory. \nCheck out Opa Grill next door instead."

"Tried out a new restaurant. Menu was limited, but that's how it goes sometimes. Food was alright, cheese plate was decent, beets were good, mussels too. Salad was huge, but nothing special. Beer selection was solid though. Music was a bit off-putting, but I'm sure they'll figure it out. Brunch menu looked promising, so I'll give it another shot sometime."

"Went to this joint for brekkie last Monday, had to wait near on 20 minutes to get a table. Place was hoppin' busy. Food came out quick, but it showed. Pancake combo, turkey bacon too salty, pancakes flat. Rest of the grub wasn't much better. Not exactly the best meal, but not the worst either. Nowhere near the IHOP in Torrance though."
"Cool, laid-back spot. Salon across the way, bench out front. Feels like San Diego, California."

"Food quality disappointing. Not the best steak in Vegas. Three of us enjoyed two ribeyes and one filet. Waiter said their ribeye is the best, but I've had better. Cooked correctly, but rub was bland and filet was overcooked. My ribeye was a 7 out of 10. Sides were disappointing. Creamed spinach was odd and bland, asparagus was the best. Desert was lackluster. Wine list was excellent. With so many great places in Vegas, you can do better than Delmonicos."

"Been eyein' this joint for a bit, checked out their menu online. Pear omelet sounded good, so we swung by after the National Kidney Foundation Walk. Expected a wait, but we got seated right away. Cozy spot, felt like bein' in someone's home. But, gotta say, the thick gray carpetin' was a bit off-puttin'. Looked dirty, didn't feel too clean. \n\nOrdered the pear omelet, it was alright. Coulda used more pears, ya know? Saw some other dishes, the french toast looked damn good. All in all, it was an average spot. Nothin' too impressive, but not too shabby either."
"Buffet with good value. Haven't been in a while, but still worth it for dinner. Hand-scooped ice cream, cheap. Meats are decent, not five-star, but not bad either. Just gotta find what you like."
"Montreal, a city of mediocrity. Galettes, a disappointment. Told you so, my friend. But, their desserts and coffee, fantastic. Chocolate, Juliette et Chocolat, not bad. Dinner, a gamble."
"Pizza joint. Slices or whole pies. Better than Sabarro's, but not worth writing home about. Good for a quick, cheap bite. Near the airport? Stop by if you're waiting for someone."

"Happy hour's a treat here. Tuscan Taster apps never disappoint. Spicy shrimp and eggplant vary, sometimes crispy, sometimes oily. Burger's a safe bet. Could use a healthier option. Stick to happy hour drinks, or your bill'll climb quick. San Tan's blonde bar manager's efficient, but a bit stern. Leave satisfied, not thrilled."
"Damn shame. Place is shut down. Had no idea, just swung by for a bite to eat. Back to the office hungry."

"Prices too steep for my blood. Sure, I'm grateful to eat out these days, but eleven bucks for a tiny sandwich and two small sides? And don't even get me started on the drinks - two bucks apiece?! It's highway robbery, especially if you've got a fam to feed. They should either make it a buffet or give you a bit more bang for your buck. That said, the grub's not bad."

"Food's good, selection's decent. Service is top-notch. But Jesus Christ, it's loud as hell in here. I get it, sports bar vibe and all, but I can barely hear the waitress. We'll be back, no doubt about it."
"Hotel's a looker, innit? Lobby's swell, all dolled up. Location's decent too, smack dab on the Strip. But the casino? Meh. If you're a gamblin' man, best to try your luck elsewhere."

"Good spot, but I was peeved how my buddies got their grub before I did. I ordered right away, famished, and they took their sweet time deciding. Spicy mayo? Just plain mayo and sriracha. Odd. Eel sauce was meh, rainbow roll was tasty, and eel roll too. Friends enjoyed their Arizona, crunch, and California shrimp tempura rolls. Solid overall, but I'm a sauce fiend. They fell short there."

"Sis and I swung by last week. Place was dead when we got there, not a soul in sight. Server finally showed up, looked like they'd been snacking on the goods. Had the Pink Spot sundae, couple big scoops of kona coffee and hot fudge. Ice cream was whatever, but the hot fudge was top-notch, generous pour. Sis had the low-fat coffee, raved about it. Prices weren't bad, considering the size. Had a similar thing at Mary Coyle's for three bucks more. Not blown away by the ice cream, but they do have a low-fat, sugar-free, or sorbet option. Wouldn't be my go-to spot, but convenient."

I gave Diablo's 3 stars after some thought. Good grub and big portions, but man, the service was rough. Our server was rude, like she was tryin' to make us feel small. My buddy asked for fresh cheese on his nachos, not a big deal, right? But this chick got all bent outta shape, sighed loud, and told him it wouldn't taste the same. Like, what's the problem, lady? Just do your job. Took forever to get our orders too, and the check took its sweet time comin'. A real drag, man. Good eatin', bad servicin'. That's Diablo's in a nutshell.

"I've hit up The Joint three times now. Once in the old spot, twice in the new one. The flow of people in and out was smooth, but I wonder why they didn't throw in a reversible escalator. Would've made things interesting. 

Scored balcony seats for the KISS show. Way better than being crammed on the floor. Comfortable theatre-style seats, you know? 

Sound and lighting at The Joint? Top-notch. KISS brought the heat with their pyro effects. Shame about the catwalk, though. Got in the way of the view. 

Not many shows I'd come back for, but if I did, I'd shoot for a table seat on the side balconies. 

Pro tip: Park in the Paradise garage. Easy access to The Joint."

"Your body's taking a beating, not your wallet. You did this to yourself. Leg of lamb, prime rib, wild boar, kalbi ribs, spicy shrimp, mac-n-cheese, gnocchi, cheeses, salads, breads. And don't forget the... other stuff. Too much to mention. You're being watched, so pace yourself."

"Place had its moments, ups and downs. Atmosphere, old-school charm, great for a night out. Food, just okay, pricey, and not worth the cost. Service, slow, inconsistent, and terrible. Formal complaint made. Only worth it on a busy night, maybe. Location and atmosphere make it worth a visit, but not for the food or service."
"Bubble tea joint. Ginger milk tea, lukewarm. Lychee jelly, too sweet. Surly service. Woman at register, annoyed. AC, nonexistent. Grumpy cashier, understandable."

"Bought two chocolate croissants and a mini cake. Not a bad deal, considering the price. But let me tell you, those croissants better be packed with chocolate flavor. I'm not paying 2-3 bucks for something that doesn't deliver."

"Mr. Lucky's ain't much to write home about, 'cept their off-menu $7.77 Special. You get a salad, steak, shrimp, and mashed taters for less than eight bucks. Not bad for a 24/7 joint. If you're hungry and everything else is closed, give it a shot."

"Thai Basil? Alright, not great. I had the Pad-see-ew. Noddles, good. Veggies and chicken, bland. Medium to hot, mild. 

Iced Thai coffee, delicious. Service, friendly. Prices, reasonable. Less than 10 bucks. 

I'll try more dishes. Hopefully, better."
"Walked by the ol' DD just last week. Place was shut down tight. Economy's to blame, they say."

"Waterfall. That's all it took. Amidst the sea of drunks, it stood out. My girls and I scored a table with bottle service, had a few drinks, then bounced. But not before some dude swiped our purses 'cause we didn't wanna stick around. Spent an hour trying to retrieve 'em. Finally got 'em back from a guard. Then, some tool at the table had my friend's camera in his pocket. Real cool, bro. Needless to say, we dipped outta there fast. But hey, we got in free, had a blast on the pole and tables, and that waterfall? Stunning."

"Not the cheapest Chinese buffet, but still a damn sight cheaper than anything in New York. Decent spread, too. Sushi, Korean grub, make-your-own soup station - not bad. Rest is standard Chinese fare. Fish dishes could use a little more TLC, but I ain't complaining. Service was a mite eager to turn the table, but I wasn't in a rush. Plenty of open tables, so I took my time. Worth another visit, sure, but not exactly a destination joint."

"Been here for weekend brunch a few times, and for the price, it's a damn good deal. Locals, take note: Mondays and Wednesdays, breakfast is $3.99, lunch is $4.99, and dinner is $6.99. Just show your Hilton rewards card and local ID. 

Weekend brunch has crab legs, prime rib, and beer or wine, sometimes champagne. Classic breakfast items, made-to-order omelets, grilled meats, and sausages. Solid, traditional buffet food. Nothing fancy, but a hell of a deal. 

$18 gets you prime rib, cocktail shrimp, and crab legs. Can't beat that. Service might not be perfect, but it's a buffet, for crying out loud."
"Family joint, but too damn bright. Food's alright, service is fine. Six outta ten. Not great, not terrible. Cutesy spot with a hint of 'almost.' Check it out, you'll see what I mean."

"Pork, any way you slice it, is my jam. So, when the missus and I had a night out, I picked Salty Sow. Not the best choice. The grub was just alright. Had the candied pork belly, thought it'd be crispy, but it was braised. Not bad, just not worth another visit. Hubby had the lamb burger, decent if you like tapenade. I don't. Service was good till we asked for the check. Then it took forever, and it was wrong. Overall, just an okay time."
"Noodles, overcooked. Vegetables, frozen. Not fresh. Disappointing. Been to better build-your-own wok places. This one, mediocre."

"Shot my share of guns at Bullseye Precision Indoor Shooting Range in San Rafael. Came with a bachelor party, did the $110 package for 12 guys. Guys running the shop argued a lot. Guns looked worn out. Ear protection sucked, my ears hurt. Shot Uzi, Thompson, two other automatics, and a Desert Eagle handgun. Bachelor shot grenade launcher, but it's not a real grenade, just a shotgun shell. Best quote from the store: 'You mean Obama poster?' when we pointed at an Osama Bin Laden poster. Decent place for a group of guys looking for something different from the casinos. Recommend getting a limo for a big group since it's hard to get cabs back."

"Hubbie's sis and her man were in town, wanted to hit up RigaTony's. They'd heard good things from a Snowbird pal. We hadn't been in a bit, been doing Olive Garden instead, cheap gift cards from work, you know? But RigaTony's, damn, it's worth the extra scratch. Chicken with lemon and artichoke, hell yeah. Their house salad, best in town. One of my bunco girls always gets it. Hubbie loved the bread, and the salad too. Lasagna, he said it was good, but later, acid reflux, not so good. Getting old ain't fun. Won't try my ginger remedy, stubborn fool. Haven't needed Tums in ages. Finished the night at Angel Sweet, yum."

"The joint's seen better days. Saw Avatar in their Imax, seats were beat up, movie conked out on us. Took 'em a good quarter hour to fix the mess. Food's not half bad though, gotta give 'em that. Hot dog and nachos, not too shabby."
"Sushi, good. Other grub, meh. Joint's clean, service decent. Not a five-star spread, but better than some say. Good for big crews, plenty of choices, especially for rugrats."
"Spectacle entertaining, girls dance well, but scriptwriters seemed to have smoked something when they came up with the script. Mickey's the most amusing of the actors."

"Mexican grub, so-so. Heard folks ravin' 'bout this joint, don't see it myself. Better than Manuel's or Filiberto's, that's all I'll say. Pollo Fundido's alright, not as good as Ajo Al's though. And them purple and teal accents, straight outta the 80's. Lame. Good chips and salsa, but tiny bowls. Can't park in their lot during dinner rush either. And let's not forget the sketchy neighborhood."

"Went to IHOP with a buddy. They were hankerin' for some grub, didn't matter where, just as long as it was eatin'. Got the balsamic chicken, they got the club sandwich, side salad, and pancakes. Don't ask. Food was damn good, service top-notch."

"Tried Hash House a go go for lunch. Great interior, good service. But the food? Meh. Gave it three stars, but the grub didn't do much for me. Had the mushroom and goat cheese sandwich, which was fine. The potatoes au gratin were decent, but the cheese could've been toned down a bit. My wife had the chicken and waffles, and we both agreed - nothing special. A bit dry and bland, and nowhere near as good as Roscoe's. For the average joe, maybe it's okay. But for those who know their food, there's better stuff out there. And the prices? A bit steep at $38 for two."

"My uncle's got a well-known BBQ joint in Memphis. I'm a skeptic when it comes to BBQ, but I gave it a shot. Had the pulled pork and chicken breast sandwiches. Both were good, right down to the bread. The potato salad was decent, but I could've used some chopped egg. Saw some folks with killer desserts that made my mouth water. The real test is the ribs. I'll be back for those. Y'all come back now, ya hear?"
"Taco Bell, built with speed and quality. Cheap, delicious. Love it."

"Atmosphere, wines - top-notch. Food? Not so much. Three stars, tops. Bread's too thick, uncooked maybe. No oil. Not what I expected. Thought I'd get crunchy bread, creative toppings. Combinations are great, but execution's off. Bruschetta's cold, not warm like I thought. Bread's too big. Great concept, but reviews are a bit much."

"Food's basic, nothing fancy. But it's good. Menu's limited, wine selection's a joke. No Multipuciano or other Italian standards. Just the usual suspects. But hey, it's right next to Goodwill, so don't expect too much."

"Food's great, but this joint's got some issues. Walk in, there's a line, but nobody knows which one they're in. Two lines for tacos, but if you want a burrito or fish tacos, you gotta go to another line. They tell you to go there, but then you're cutting everyone in line. Everyone's just standing around, looking at each other, wondering which line they're supposed to be in. Finally get to the line, and they don't speak English. Ordered a carne asada burrito, and they tried to give it to someone else. Had to tell 'em, "Hey, that's mine." Guy opens it up, looks at me funny, still doesn't speak English. Give 'em a 1-star review, but the food's too good. Prices are decent too. Just a real confusing setup they got going on here."

"Barbecue's our thing, my wife and I. Siblings in Austin, we know the real deal. Dickey's ain't it, but it's close enough. Meats got a good smoke flavor, tender too, even if they're overcooked sometimes. Ribs and brisket, that's what you want. Chicken's just a grilled breast, forget about it. Sauces are hot, thin like Texas, good stuff. Jalapenos and onions, that's the way. Sausage, not so much. Slaw and potato salad, decent. Other sides, meh. Free ice cream, make yourself a root beer float. Kids eat free on Sundays, nice touch. Twenty bucks, that's all you need."

"Dragon Noodle, been going there for years. Food's good, prices a bit steep, service is meh. Like some other Yelpers said, back section's a bit dark. Liked it better before the remodel, had character. Cheesy decor, t-shirts for sale. 

After a long day at a trade show, just wanna chill, don't wanna venture far from the hotel. Dragon Noodle's never busy, can usually get a table no problem. 

Don't really order from the sushi menu, prices seem high, haven't been impressed in the past. Stick to the Chinese menu, always satisfied with the portions and taste. Favorites are Kung Pao Chicken, Mongolian Beef, Wonton Soup. Group of 6 of us ate last week for $140."

"I stopped by this joint on my last trip to Vegas. Had the Kobe beef sliders, they were alright, but not worth the price tag. My buddy almost got sick from 'em, too rich for her blood. Their Shichimi fries were good though, nice kick of heat. Also had some Yukon Gold mashers, solid choice. Decent cocktails too. Might stop by again next time I'm in town, if I'm feeling peckish."

"Came here for a networking gig a couple weeks back. Had some apps, nothing special. Ordered a moscow mule, it was good. Sat outside on the patio, real cute. Great spot for some wine and fresh air. Need to try the main dishes, wasn't impressed with what we had. Had some wings, ahi avocado salad, flatbread and parmesan, and a quesadilla. Not bad, just forgettable. Worth a shot, but nothing special."

"Tourist trap restaurants, overpriced and lacking in service. That's my take. We tried a cheese platter, four local varieties, brie being one of 'em. Goat cheese, a standout. Mains were a mixed bag. Pasta Arrabbiata, unremarkable. Mussels and quarter chicken, decent portions. Food was passable."

"I'm Hertz Gold, so I head straight to the gold check-in. It's a crap shoot - sometimes they're great, car's ready, easy peasy. Other times, they give me a clunker - high mileage, beat-up, sticker-covered. They're also anal about the gas tank being full, so I fill up near the airport now. Always inspect the car before taking it, and don't be afraid to request a different one if there's an issue. Check the tire tread, too. Otherwise, the gold service is handy when the regular line is long."

"I was in a hurry, needed something quick. Panda Express sounded good. It wasn't fancy, but it hit the spot. One guy was handling everything, looked a bit overwhelmed. Place was clean, just needed some more utensils and napkins. Food was fresh, tasted great. Got a combo with fried rice, beef and broccoli, and string bean chicken. Added a chicken egg roll too. Other folks there seemed happy with their meals."
Lunch combo, $5.50. Soup, entree, appetizer. Red curry, 3/5. Oily. Garlic and pepper stir fry, 3.5/5. Two Thai iced teas, 4.5/5. Customer service, 4.5/5.

"Scott's didn't impress me much today. Joined by Arlin, Robyn, and Mike, I had a pricey bowl of Kreplach Soup that was barely warm and only had one small dumpling the size of a Ping Pong ball. Even the smaller cup of soup should have had more. My corned beef sandwich was decent, but the service was lacking. With the high prices, I give Scott's three stars at best."
Drove past it this weekend, read yesterday they'd shut down. Never been, but the joint looked sharp - big outdoor patio, glass fireplace. Just another casualty of the economy, I reckon.
"Airport was a blur after long travel day. Got turned around, couldn't find exit. Tram confused me. Staff was friendly, facility was clean. It's an OK airport. You fly in, fly out. PDX still tops."

"Coworker said this place was solid, so I gave it a shot. Had the Gyro lunch with fries. It was alright, nothing special, but decent for the area. Small spot, friendly service, and an awkward bar. Good for a quick bite, but that's about it."

"I'm reassessing my rating. Mor told me to wait for inspection, but I'm moving and don't have time for that. So, I left my review. Next thing I know, a manager calls me and delivers a brand new table. Turns out the old one was from a bad batch. Now, I'm satisfied with the customer service. I'll give 'em the benefit of the doubt and trust it was a bad batch, not overall poor quality."
"Spider roll, lobster roll, Uni. Spider roll, delicious. Soft crab, fresh, crispy. Uni, fishy, not fresh. Ask waiter."

"The girl didn't seem too thrilled. Guy was trying too hard, babbling on about this and that. He was annoying, to say the least. His conversations were nothing special. The job they did was average, at best."

"Classic Car Spa did a damn good job. No smudges on the glass, no water spots. You gotta give a BMW the works, especially the rims. They shined 'em up like new. Attention to detail, top-notch. My Z4 was the cheapest ride there, surrounded by fancy SUVs, a Panamera, and a Maserati. If I could afford one of those, I'd spring for a home wash service too."

"NYC born, I craved the real deal Chinese grub. Moved out west, searched far and wide, but nothing quite hit the spot. China Red, a pleasant surprise, came close. Generous portions, bold flavors, killer egg drop soup. Lunch specials, a steal at six bucks for two meals' worth. Delivery? Rare gem in AZ."

"Went to the park last Sunday, had a good time overall. But the grub? Terrible. Way overpriced too. Skip the food, bring a cooler instead. Preferred parking is worth the extra ten bucks. Don't say I didn't warn you."

"Hey, keep this under wraps, alright? I ain't no high roller, but I do enjoy a good time at Hooters. Got a sweet deal at the Hilton for a couple nights, but we needed a spot for our last night in Vegas. Hooters fit the bill, cheap and close to the airport. Guy at the desk was real friendly, got us a nice room with a view. Basic, but it worked. Spent the day across the street at the MGM, then came back to Hooters for some fun. Minimum bets were low, so we could play without feeling like big shots. Crowd was young, atmosphere was relaxed. Just my style."

"Bacchanal's alright. Lots of stations, but nothing too memorable. 'Cept maybe the desserts - orange beer sorbet, mango habanero gelato. Spicy, for sure. Crab legs, hot or cold, were decent. Plate 'em for ya, so that's nice. No dungeness crab, though. Prime rib and lamb chops were good, but nothing special. Chinese chicken wings had lots of flavor, but a bit salty. Oysters? Not fresh. Obvious, if you know what I mean."

"Go on an off-hour, and you'll be seated in 30-45 minutes. Otherwise, plan on waitin' forever."

"Tiffany Showroom, nice joint. Three levels, top's got chairs and small tables, middle's got banquettes and chairs, bottom's got more banquettes and some tables. Stage is decent, sound and lights were top-notch. Beatles tribute show, those boys can sing, play instruments well too. Harmonies were great, solo parts weren't always Beatles-like. Show was an hour long, wish I could give 3.5 stars but that's not an option."

Indulge Burger, a joint worth stoppin' by. Dog-friendly, too. Water bowls outside, patio area. First found 'em through a coupon in the mail. Been back every few months since.

Food's good, lots of options. Sweet potato fries, onion strings, garlic chips - all great. Burgers run $10 to $14, but they're big, half-pounders. Keep an eye out for coupons, that's the trick. Just saw they got a Yelp deal goin' on - $15 for $30 at Indulge Burgers & More.

"Cajun Queen, good eatery. Service, top-notch. Atmosphere, swell. Jazz, live and sweet. Kitchen's got a thing for heat, though. Crawfish scampi, tonight's order. Garlic, herbs, a bit of red pepper flake, that's it. They drowned it in chili. Not much diff 'tween scampi and etouffee, which is meant to be hot. Lighten up on the Cajun spice, ya hear?"

"Food's decent for a chain joint. Prices are fair, portions are big. Had the Chicken Katsu with gravy fries. Hit the spot. Katsu curry had corn, that's Hawaiian style, I guess. Fries were alright, but the gravy could've been richer. Not the best, but far from the worst. \n\nPlace could use a makeover, though. Haven't changed a thing since they opened. Looks like a 50's diner, inside and out. Right side's been under reno for a bit, looks kinda rough."

"Worth the hike from my buddy's place on the West Side. Clean joint, quick service even with the lunch rush. Sat outside under the misters, but the AZ heat's not for me, even with the mist. Food's fresh - Fontina burger with blue cheese, juicy and full of flavor. Like the side options, but the garlic fries were too greasy. Beet salad's a nice touch. Strawberry cheesecake from scratch was just okay. Fried okra was overcooked. BBQ pork sandwich looked good, my friend enjoyed it. Worth trying."

"Meh. That's what I got from the upstairs joint. Sure, some dishes were decent - pork belly, salmon, beef tartare. But most? Forgettable. And don't even get me started on our server. Dude was pushy as hell, trying to upsell us like crazy. 'Jumping off point,' he called the five-course menu. Yeah, right. Like we needed 24 oysters and extra wagyu beef. Annoying, man. There are better spots to drop your cash in Vegas."

"Steak and eggs, a classic Vegas dish. I came here often, back in the day. Charged it to the room, didn't break the bank. Recently had breakfast, a solid take on the standard. Minus a star for the price, twenty bucks? In Vegas? Should be ten. But, the waitress brought Heinz 57, a nice touch."
"Yard House, been there a few times. Good beer, great food. Pricey, but worth it. Only gripe is the cost, but I'll still go back. Love the tunes they play."

I lunched with a customer at this joint today. The yellow curry was good, not too spicy, and the pre-meal soup was tasty. But the service was slow, took forever for my food to arrive. Sixteen minutes, to be exact. Though after it came, the staff were attentive, asking if I wanted a refill on my drink. Nice atmosphere, reasonable prices.

"3 1/2 STARS

Marriott's TIME-SHARE complex, opposite their luxury hotel. Traded a time-share for a week in May. Place was packed, fully booked.

Our room, small but sufficient. Friendly staff, well-maintained grounds.

Good base for day-trips to Grand Canyon, Sedona, Prescott, Scottsdale, Phoenix Botanical Garden, etc."
"Nail salon in Charlotte. Fumes hit you at the door. Pick your color, sit down, stare and smile. Decent job, familiar. Nice color selection, friendly, same price. Good cuticle work. Come back."

Spearmint Rhino and Treasures, siblings they may be, but like night and day, they differ. Rhino, wild and lively, a place of endless fun, while Treasures, dull and lackluster, leaves much to be desired. Bottle service, a bargain, but not worth the savings.

"We found this joint while shopping in Townsquare. Nice atmosphere, but the happy hour was about to end. The waitress said we could still get the discounted drinks, but the bar manager, Jessica, said no. We ordered a bunch of food, it was great, but the service was even better. Too bad, 'cause we won't be back. I'm a loyal customer, but Jessica ruined it for us."

"Dog park's small, one area for all dogs, backed up against a ballfield. Went there lots when hubby lived nearby, but now it's just an occasional visit when I bring my pup to work and we need a lunch break. Folks are friendly, but the place could use some upkeep. They did some renovations, but it still looks rough. They even took out half the grass, now it's just dirt and mud. Pup's gonna need a bath after this place. Still, it's close to work, so we'll keep coming back."

"Walked past this joint dozens of times, never knew what lay inside. Finally stepped in one Friday night, around 9pm. Ducks and turtles swimmin' around, tables full of lovin' couples. Old gent playin' Spanish love songs on his guitar, added to the romance. Felt like a secret club, like we stumbled onto somethin' special. Food was good, not great. Shared pollo fundido, rice was top-notch though. Margaritas a bit too sweet. Great spot for a date night, all in all. Worth another visit, maybe try somethin' else next time."

"Good grub, wine, and vibes. But, slow service and they ran outta food. Felt like the server was the angel of death, ready to snuff out my order. Wanted to give 'em four stars, but that one time ruined it. Maybe I'll give 'em another shot."

"Saw part of the infomercial, decided to give it a shot. Club card benefits are meh, but they got better once we signed up. Like the mix of new and old machines here. Didn't win big myself, but the missus hit the jackpot. Used coupons for the deli, food was solid. Had the breakfast special, spouse had a burger. Burger was juicy, fresh veggies, and the fries were crispy. Can't mess up eggs, toast, and sausage, so that was good too. We'll be back, see if it's consistent."

Tuesday, December 18th, 2012. Not the best Italian in Edinburgh. Maybe not even the best in the immediate area. Antipasti was decent, but the crostini was a bit stale. Pork belly was nice. Roast potatoes were top-notch. Chocolate tart was too rich. The atmosphere was enjoyable, but the food was just average. Lacked that extra something special to make me want to come back. Staff was friendly and capable, but couldn't compete with family-run spots like Nonna's in Morningside.

"Facility's decent size, variety of units. Clean, too. I rent a small one for my files. Friendly staff. Dust's a problem though, gets everywhere. Location's a bit of a hike from my place. Doors could be better, keep the dust out."

"Driving through Chandler, I saw a standalone Jimmy John's, a rare sight. The menu was the usual, but prices were lower by about 50 cents compared to the Chandler Fashion location. I'm a fan of JJ's, but I gotta knock 'em down a half star for the chaos inside. It's like a high school cafeteria - employees yellin', jokin' around, and blastin' music that'll blow your eardrums. Hard to enjoy a meal with all that racket."
"Pei Wei, good eatery. Kids' meal, no problem. Portion control, that's the ticket. Rice, sauces, all good. Parking lot? Stinks. One more star, maybe."

"Toby Keith's, been there a few times. First visit, couple years back, local concert, too damn crowded. Forget that. Today's visit, met my mom for lunch. Nice waitress, attentive, didn't rush us. Ordered green chili chicken sandwich, no bun, side of slaw. Mom had turkey club. Chicken was alright, bit overcooked. Mom's turkey club, huge serving, just okay. Overall, midday dining, decent experience. Food, meh. Service, good. Be back? Maybe."

"The show wasn't much to write home about. Started late, as these things often do. But the comedian, she was something else. Had me in stitches, she did. Still can't find her videos online, though. Pity, that. Some of the girls were lookers, but they didn't seem to know their steps. Out of sync, they were."

"Came for the Restaurant.com cert. Not bad, but not much to write home about either. Fresh taco shells, good chicken. Mushy rice though. Preshredded cheese? Please. Not exactly legit, but a decent cheap eat."

"This joint's in a dive casino, but don't let that turn you off. It's a swell spot for a fast, filling breakfast. And hell, it's cheap too! They got a bar, so why not grab a drink with your grub? Menu's got a bit of everything, but the breakfast dishes are where it's at. Service is top-notch."

"Vegas restaurants overwhelm. Mon Ami, packed. Sign, good. Bread, great. French, no paper bags. Beef bourguignon, Julia Child-approved. Noodles, too soft. Cocktail, messed up French 75. Ambiance, nice. Heaters, music, Bellagio fountain. Patio, crowded. Expensive, subpar. Try again. Let me know."

"Espee's gotten too rich for my blood. Three items, sixteen bucks?! Hell, I can get a better meal at Agave for that price. And don't even get me started on the tamales. They've shrunk, man. And the salsa bar? Pure garbage. Where's the pico de gallo? Happy hour's still decent, two-for-one margaritas and half-price nachos, but that's not enough to justify the prices and tiny portions. Used to be a four-star spot, now it's a three. What's the deal, order-at-the-counter places trying to charge like sit-down joints?"

"MTO Cafe, solid spot. Been there a few times, always try somethin' new. Food's good, no doubt. But here's the thing, they got a delivery service, right? And let me tell you, they always forget somethin'. Green drink, salad, chicken and waffles, mashbrowns, you name it. Still, it's a tasty way to cure a hangover or just chill at home on the weekends. They got a new spot at the Summerlin mall, might check it out."

"Sushi joints, I've seen my share. From cheap to high-end. But Yokoso? Sushi ain't their game. Rice dominated the pieces, a tad too dry. Ordered a Rainbow and The Pitt. Underwhelming experience. Prices, reasonable but not worth it for the sushi. Haven't tried the rest of the menu, but sushi? Meh! Go only if you're desperate for a roll."
