"Prices are steep, food's alright. Had better pizza. Wings were decent. People were friendly both times."

"Came here with pals, not too long ago. Grub was solid, tea was fine, ambiance alright. Didn't knock my socks off, but didn't let me down neither. Dig the spot, inside's got character, old-school vibes. Outside's decent for brekkie, fresh air's a plus. Prices are fair."

"Wings? Not so good. Shared 20 with a friend, couldn't finish 'em. Grilled wings drenched in spicy Cajun sauce. Shoulda had it on the side. Other 10, chalky batter. Shrimp and spinach salad, good. But damn, I wanted good wings."

Rio,

Tighten up, will ya?

* Looser slots,
* Friendlier security,
* Cuter shops, under-21 entertainment,
* Glitz and glamour upgrades all around.

You already got:

* Delicious seafood buffet,
* Spacious rooms,
* Fun vibe.

I'll still come back, though. (YAY for rewards points.)

"Food's solid, but unremarkable. No distinct theme, so the joint lacks character. 

Pros: attentive servers, decent beer selection. 

Cons: prices don't justify the experience, nothing out of the ordinary."

"Went out tonight for a girlfriend's birthday. Food was top-notch. Server was attentive, but it took a while to get our grub and drinks. Soft pretzels with fondue, damn good. Everyone dug their entrees. Had the Sweet Corn Cannelloni, rich flavors. Glad to see veggie options. Got a free dessert, Monkey Bread. Sounded meh, but it was tasty. Decor was swanky. Comfy chairs, unique at each table, and them chandeliers made it feel ritzy. Gripes? Wait time, loud, a bit dim, and portions were smallish for the price."

"First review's old news, but I'll share it anyways. Two stars for poor service. Waited six minutes for someone to take our order, and the girl at the front had a sassy attitude. Asked for mayo and ketchup on the burger, and she said if we'd been there before, we'd know they were on the table. Whole burger came out wrong 'cause she cut us off with her smart-alecky vibe. Second girl fixed it, though. She was real nice. \nSecond review's a different story. Got some grub while bowling for my little sis's birthday. Service was good, food was decent. All in all, a pleasant time."

"This joint ain't cheap, but if you know how to get your money's worth, you'll be alright. My buddy and I got the veggie sandwich with extra roast beef. For 15 bucks, it was a damn good deal. We added coffee and cake, and still spent under 30 bucks total. The sandwich was plenty, no need to eat more than what they give you. Share your grub, 'cause there's no way one person can finish it all. Good stuff, especially the chocolate cake. Fries? Meh."

"Place is cute, outdoor area's nice. Sat outside, had a garden salad. Food was decent, but nothing special. Service was slow, though. Took forever for our food to come out. Hope they step it up, 'cause this place has potential."

"Tacos, real deal. Service, friendly. Barbacoa, tried it, good. Flavors pop. Chicken tacos, spicy. Guac, simple, avocado, lime. \n\nSeating, rough. Metal chairs, ripped booths, rusty nails. Booths, still best. Meat, could be better. Not regular spot. Interesting experience. Recommend it, but not for me...\"

"Fleur de Lys, a nice spot, but not quite wow. Prix fixe menu, good value. Onion soup, rich, earthy, truffles, duck. Salmon, perfectly cooked, pretty, but horseradish sauce, bitter, like grass clippings. Short ribs, my friend liked 'em. Chocolate trio, disappointing. Dry soufflÃ©, salty peanut butter shake, Baileys ice cream. Maybe I expected too much. Hubert Keller's joint, though. Service, wine, reasonable price. Some misses, but still a good spot."
"Subpar grub. Pancakes, eggs, sausage - all undercooked. Buttermilk or potato, didn't matter. Shoulda waited. Mom's recipe, now that's a real breakfast."

"This joint's alright. Never blew my mind, but never gave me reason to quit either. Close to home and my nephew loves their pies, so I end up here a fair bit. Consistent, friendly, and they always deliver on time. One time they screwed up my order, but they fixed it pronto. Can't say a bad word about 'em."

"Thursday night, we ate at Steelz. Our kid's 14 months old, but this place ain't for kids. Not recommended. But for adults, it's a go. Crabcakes were decent, but needed more crunch. Spicy aioli was top-notch. I had the brie and bacon burger - damn good. Juicy, cooked right, and the bacon was on point. No fries though, that was a bummer. My wife had the lobster bisque, good flavor but too much sherry. She also had the beef and blue salad, that was the highlight. Great quality blue cheese, we loved it. We'll be back."

"Breakfast here was bad last time, but dinner was a surprise. Twenty-four-hour buffet pass for forty bucks, how can you go wrong? Two buffets in twenty-four hours is too much, though. This is Vegas, where you lose money and eat too much. \n\nOur third buffet, a dinner stop. Highlights: crepes, yummy and delicious; seafood, not great but good enough; dessert, plenty to choose from but nothing special. Duck was good, made with orange sauce and rice pilaf. #3 on our buffet list."
"Las Vegas. Strip. Surcharge. No thanks. Found a place just off the strip. Pool, wifi, food nearby. Parking included. Simple."
"Hofbrau Haus, Munich. Band, German. Service, good. Music, good. Beer, good. Food, not so much. Wife's Jager Schnitzel, tough. Sauerkraut, bland. Mashed potatoes, mix. Better German food elsewhere."

"Mandalay Bay's suite, 750 square feet of luxury. Friendly front desk staff, always. But, comped rooms? They still charged me. Didn't notice till weeks later. Two free nights, but they billed me double. Not cool."

"Tuesday night, great bar. Get there after nine, score the three-buck burger deal. Place fills up quick, so grab a seat early. I sat upstairs, nice and quiet. They got a good selection of drafts, but ten bucks for a small glass of Pumking? No thanks. Went with a bottle of Purple Haze instead. Computer glitch gave me a nice surprise - three bucks for my first drink. Second round, no such luck, but the bartender gave me a heads up. Stayed for the nine o'clock burger special. Damn good. Double burger, Stack'd special sauce - highly recommend."

"Gave it 3.75. Tucked away under shady apartments on 7th, it's a cool little breakfast joint. Sat at the bar, ate. Kitchen's tiny, but cookin's decent. Had eggs and bacon, can't go wrong. Other dishes looked great. Pancakes next time? Definitely coming back."

"Hype? Don't see it. Came in expecting big things, left feeling let down. Ordered the original, thought it was a safe bet. Tiny sandwich, flavor was off, too much horseradish. Disappointment city. Also got the chicken noodle soup, it was alright. Glad I did, otherwise I'd still be hungry. Buffets earlier in the trip were better. All these rave reviews, sandwich should've been better."

"Heard good things 'bout Noca, so I was pumped to give it a shot. But, man, I gotta say, I was pretty let down. Me and three others went for the tasting menu. Two of us got the wine pairings too. Presentation was solid. Started off with some sorta palate cleanser. First course was either mushroom soup or a salad. Had the soup myself, hubby had the salad. It was good, not great. Second course was pasta with a meat sauce. That was the best dish, no question. Entree was a flat iron steak. Good, not amazing. Dessert was blue cotton candy and chocolate cake w banana gelato. Cotton candy was a nice touch. 

But, man, the wine pairings were a real bummer. Waiter didn't know much about 'em and gave us the same pairings no matter what we ordered. Soup or salad and fish or steak. All reds, too. 

Overall, presentation was good, portions were good, service was alright, food was alright. But nothin' special. If you're lookin' for a real stand-out joint, I'd suggest Alto at the Hyatt Gainey Ranch instead."

"Decor's on point - industrial chic. Food's solid, but not worth the hype. Salad and soup, unlimited refills, no big deal. Steak's the star, various cuts, cooked right. Ribs, lamb, chicken, all decent. Sides? Meh. Pao de Queijo, fried bananas, garlic mash. Overpriced desserts. Service was A+, food? Underwhelming. Bacon-wrapped steak, good but not great. Other meats, lacking flavor. Lobster bisque, just okay. Some folks loved it, but I wasn't impressed."
"McDonald's, near Pepsi Center. Open late, good for post-clubbing crew. Friend got me McChicken, not sure why, but appreciated it. Normal taste, expected."
"Food and service, top-notch as always. But the floor, worn and faded, it's a distraction. Ottomans in the lounge, stained and tired. A shame for a joint like this, high-end and all."

"Pumpkin patch fun for the kids, but I wasn't feelin' it. Not after I saw they had stuck a store-bought pumpkin in with the local ones. $12 for somethin' they got for $4 at Walmart? No way, pal. Put our pumpkins right back where we found 'em. If you're gonna grow 'em, grow 'em yourself. Don't fake it with store-bought crap."

"Oliveo's serves up good grub, day or night. Pricey, sure, but it's Greek food, and worth it. Never had a bad dish, personally. Their chicken souvlaki, gyros, and chicken breast plates are all solid choices. Cooked to perfection, full of flavor. And hey, they're open late, so it's a great option when you're craving something better than fast food. Give it a shot, especially if you're looking for a healthier college town eatery."

"Place wasn't half bad. Upscale, you know? Menu was decent too. Had some chicken tacos, new addition to the menu. Big ass chicken fingers, crispy and all that. Spicy, but not too bad. Table was a bit worn out, sticky even. Could use a good scrubbin', ya know?"

"Forgot about the hair in the grub? Unacceptable. Can't let that slide, not when you're running a joint. Food might taste great, but that don't mean squat if it's got a furry surprise. Gotta keep it clean, no excuses."

"Underwhelming experience with too much grease."

I went there a couple of times, and it wasn't impressive. Decent prices, but the chicken was too oily, and the burgers were a mess. I'd go here before other fast-food joints, but I've had better burgers. The fries and flash-fried veggies were good, but too salty. Not something I'd order often.

"Mac and cheese, their best dish.  Pair it with bologna.  Comfort food at its finest.  Cheese plate looks decent, onion rings piled high with the thin cut variety.  Perch, my top pick of the fish options.  Had it tonight, paired with a bowl of beer cheese soup.  Flavorless, topped with popcorn.  Meh.  Rest of the menu's alright, but they try too hard to be Wisconsin-style.  Whatever that means."

I stepped into the thrift store, curious about the place. Busy, but not packed. Mostly women, a few men. Didn't notice any aggression, but the women looked focused on their finds. Found some great deals on men's shoes - wingtip heaven! Scored a pair of Maison Forte boots for $30, originally $215.00. Not big on brands, but they looked sharp. Will be back for more.
"Food was good, but the joint could've used some sprucin' up. Clean, though. Service was alright. I'd order takeout again."

"Went to Tofu Hut for dinner. Not bad, but not great either. They were short-staffed when we arrived. Took 'em five minutes to notice us, and no welcome or hello. We skipped the all-you-can-eat and ordered Ã  la carte. Short ribs and spicy chicken were good, but forgettable. Loved the banchan, though - fish cake, japchae, spicy cucumber. Would go back, but won't be a regular."

"Love this joint, but Bellagio's still tops in my book. Got upgraded to the 60th floor - sweet view. Rooms are tidy, clean, and dig the TV in the bathroom. But the one in the room? Dead as a doornail, despite the instructions on the remote. Thin walls too. Could hear the hallway chatter all night, and the neighbors having a screaming match in the wee hours. Still, a fan of the hotel, La Rev, the buffet, and the shops."
"Sushi was good. Service, just okay. Too many servers, hard to keep track. Didn't like how rolls came at different times. Stayed at Wynn, gave it a shot."

"Movie joint's got its pros and cons. Small theater, so only a handful of flicks at a time. But hey, comfy seats with plenty of legroom for you tall folk. Too bad about those damn bright pathway lights though. Felt like someone was shining a flashlight in my eyes the whole time. Not cool.

Prices are meh, but students get a decent deal for $5.50. Just don't forget your old student ID and maybe wear that retainer again. You know, for the nostalgia.

Park in the garage and stroll through the food court to get there."

Zumanity's no Absinthe, but it's not bad either. It's got some raunchy jokes and topless acts, but it's mostly tame and a bit campy. I took the boyfriend and he enjoyed it, but he didn't see what the big deal was about Cirque du Soleil. Maybe I was expecting something more extreme, like O. The comedy's mostly heckling the crowd and some of the acts weren't even there. No midgets or fat twins. Maybe that would've spiced things up. It's a typical Cirque show with some dirty jokes and sexier outfits. Not bad for 50% off tickets for military though.

"Tried this joint due to the rave reviews. Had high hopes, but the grub was just alright. Fish taco was dry, flavorless. Guacamole on the rolled tacos? Tasteless. Had the carne asada too, but it wasn't much better. Hubby had the steak and eggs, looked like machaca. Dining room was tidy, but the can was a mess. Wouldn't come back unless I was dying of hunger."
"Smoke hung heavy in the air like a fog. Dining suffered. We ordered the famed Steak Special. Damn fine, it was. Green beans and mashed spuds, a pleasant side."

"Public House, a gastropub, had the usual dark wood decor and rich dishes like poutine and foie gras. Being in Vegas, they had a hook - an extensive wine list on a fancy iPad for guests to play with. Half the fun was picking the wine. They also did well with lighter fare. I went with a group of girls and half of us got the scallops. They were sweet and fresh. The salads were good too, with a nice burst of acidity from the pomegranate seeds."

"North Arcadia, never been. Fan of North Kierland, though. Decor, nice. Lunch, mediocre. Service, slow. Attitude, present. Zucchini chips, overcooked. Bucatini, small. Price, steep. Total, $59. Nearby, better options. T. Cook's, Coup des Tartes. Just saying."

"City Cafe's got some good things going for it - their breakfasts, pool table, and beer pitchers are solid. Atmosphere's decent too, feels like an American diner. But their cocktail pitchers? Weak. Don't expect to get more than a slight buzz from 'em. Food's hit or miss. Nachos are alright, but the guac tastes like mayo. Had a veggie burger once, and the cheese made the bun all soggy and gross. Still, I end up back at City Cafe pretty often. Sticking to pints and chips, though."

"Tivoli Village's Cantina Loredo boasts a prime location and a solid indoor-outdoor bar. Happy hour offers are a bonus. The real draw? You can bring your pup along for a patio dining experience. 

Now, the grub ain't your typical Mexican fare, but that's not a deal-breaker. What's disappointing is the subpar execution. Been there a few times, hoping to find something I truly enjoy. Not yet. Guac and chips, made fresh at the table, are the highlight. Complimentary salsas are a nice touch too. 

Would I give Cantina Loredo another shot? Sure thing. My husband's a fan of the fajitas, so that's a plus. Three stars, averaging our two opinions."
"Food and service were good, not great. Noise level was horrendous, waitress had to yell. Tables were too close together. Better places nearby."

"Red Robin's consistent, that's for sure. Been to a few in the Bay Area, and they all taste the same. Not bad, but not great either. Had an onion ring tower, huge and mediocre. Shared a chicken pasta, not impressed. But their fish, fries, and shrimp sampler? That's worth trying. Three stars, tops."

"Ate here twice. First time, dead atmosphere, family group, server prioritized them over me, paying customer. Ordered General Tso's Chicken, crunchy fried white meat, scallions, spicy sauce. Good meal, nothing special. Second trip, lunch, Mongolian beef, spicy marinated beef, sautÃ©ed scallions, sweet yellow onions, crispy rice noodles, sesame seeds. Great meal, excellent service. Hope third visit as good."

"BBQ joint stands out. Tasty, doesn't upset my gut. But service? Forget about it. Ordered online, showed up on time, still waited 15-20 mins. Take-out counter's your best bet. Just as slow, but at least you'll save some time."

"Dinner with the fam at Pointe Hilton Squaw Peak. Nice spot, casual grub. Menu had some good options. Service was alright, food was decent but the lamb was a bit overdone for one of us. All in all, an OK time."

"The joint was jumpin', me and the gals having a blast. Free drinks flowed like water. Service was top-notch, staff friendly as can be. Food? Meh, not the reason I was there. But hey, it wasn't half bad. Just stuck to apps, didn't want to fill up. Place gets packed, so plan ahead, kid."

"Grimaldi's Pizzeria has the right stuff - solid tools, proper technique. Their coal-fired oven cranks out a damn fine crust. But let's be real, the toppings are nothing special. Just your run-of-the-mill national chain fare. And don't even get me started on the sauce. Raw and lightly drizzled? No thanks. I like mine long-simmered, full of depth. Guess the search for the perfect slice continues."

"Flamingo. First time, '87. Buddy's parents hit Vegas, I tagged along. Arcade, Ms. Pacman, strip stroll. Haven't been back, till last week. Nicer then, dingy now. Smoky air, like Super 8. Layout's confusing, but enjoyed Sam Adams at the bar with my company's owner, fresh from Germany. No gambling, though. Harrah's properties? No thanks, after Rincon San Diego fiasco."

"I came here often when I lived nearby. Good food, decent portions. But lately, quality's slipped. Service is meh, portions shrinking, too much repetition of veggies, not enough meat. Still, their Pad Thai's top-notch."

"New joint, clean. Order at the counter, fresh fish fry. Good selection of dips, fries decent. No beer, damn shame. Generous portions, didn't need more. Hubby wanted crisper, preferred Texas toast. Fish, white and delish. Coleslaw, meh. Hope they stick around, we'll be back."

My first time at the gun range. Fun, sure. But let's get down to business. Pros and Cons, that's what I'm looking at.

Pros:

* Knowledgeable staff. They knew their stuff, no question.
* Plenty of firepower. You want to shoot something? They got it.

Cons:

* Busy. That's a good thing for them, but you'll wait. Weekends, especially.
* Small. People sitting on the floor, standing in corners. Shoulder to shoulder.
* Flustered range officers. Overwhelmed, trying to keep up. Can't blame 'em. Thirty people with rifles and pistols walking in all at once? No thanks.
* Price. Expensive. Shared a lane and gun with my sisters for 30 minutes. $88. Heard it was $15 per gun. Not worth it.

Not a bad place to visit if you're curious about ranges. Just remember: small size, long lines. That's the truth.

"Shrimp Pad Thai, that's what I was after. Google led me to this place. Ordered for pick-up, ready in 15 minutes. Parking? Down a dark alleyway. Guy smoking in the corner gave me a start. Maybe park on Spring and walk around to Valley instead. Inside, friendly staff, inviting atmosphere. Dish was damn good, spicy level 4. Noodles were thin, like angel hair, shrimp small. A bit disappointed, but still tasty. Next time, I'll order larger shrimp. That's how it goes."

"Cozy joint, dig the various rooms and seating areas. Patio's gotta be sweet in the warm months. Lost a star for a couple things though. First, they poured the cream for me without asking. Would've preferred skim milk, but oh well. Second, the music's a radio station with obnoxious ads. Just play some tunes, ya know? Don't need to hear about $7.99 haircuts while sippin' joe. Coffee was solid, food looked good, but prices were a bit steep. Beer's cool, but the pizza banner's a little confusing. Pick a lane, ya feel me? All in all, not bad."

"Cheddatruck didn't quite hit the mark for me. I'm a sucker for a solid burger, but this place fell short. My boyfriend was looking forward to the mac n cheese burger, but they were out, so he settled for an egg instead. I went plain cheese. We added tots to our order too. Let's just say the burgers were nothing special. Mine was overcooked and lacked flavor, my boyfriend thought his was forgettable. The tots? Handmade, sure, but they missed the mark too. They had potential with the cheese and herb cream cheese, but they were dull and overpriced at three bucks for seven bits. There are better burger joints around. Sorry, Cheddatruck, but you ain't it."

"Phoenix, on vacation from Chicago. Ate here on a friend's rec. Long wait, three hours, but killed time at the bar next door. Pizza good, wine fine. Not as great as Chicago-style, but still solid. Fresh ingredients, enjoyable evening once seated."
"Never gambled or dined here. Just caught a flick at the cinema. Easy parking, friendly staff, clear signs. No gripes, no expectations. Will update if things change."
"Second Cup, big one. Fresh goods galore. Busy on Sundays, students flockin'."

"Came here for lunch a couple weeks back. Place was alright, nothing special. Been on a pizza kick lately, trying out different mom and pop shops. This one was decent, staff was friendly. Not too busy, but that's okay. Pizza took 20 minutes, pretty standard. Looked a bit sloppy, but didn't affect the taste much. Pizza was alright, nothing great. Will give it another shot."

"Late night hunger pangs led us to this joint. Bread pudding and french toast, that's what we ordered. Food was alright, but the service? Forget about it. Bartender was too busy yapping on her phone to give a damn about us."

"Brambles CafÃ©, a new joint in town, ain't your typical greasy spoon. Sure, they got the usual suspects â€“ baked potatoes, paninis â€“ but where they shine is in the fried department. Chicken nuggets, chips, beans, haggis, mushy peas â€“ you name it, they'll deep-fry it. And don't even get me started on the lasagne. It's like they're trying to kill your arteries. But hey, that's why we go to Brambles, right? For the unhealthy stuff we can't get enough of. The dÃ©cor? A little tacky, a little dated. But it works. It's like they're trying to make you feel like you're in a 70s time warp. And the prices? Reasonable as hell. So, if you're in the mood for some good ol' fashioned junk food, Brambles is your spot."

"Mystere ain't half bad for a Cirque du Soleil show. Acrobatics were top-notch, no question. But the pace dragged on, and my old lady caught some Zs a few times. Those filler acts between sets? Yeah, they could've been skipped. Not the best way to spend an evening in Vegas, but not a total waste either. If it's your first Cirque show, you might enjoy it. Otherwise, there's better options."

"Went to a soft opening dinner with the missus. Place had a man cave vibe, which was alright by me. Good spot for a burger and a drink on a Saturday, or a date night during the week. The Grind's a solid addition to the Arcadia neighborhood. 

Waitstaff was friendly and on the ball. Props to 'em for gettin' their act together for the opening. 

Shared the melted rosemary brie with strawberry relish. Brie was cheesy goodness, picked up some rosemary flavor. Strawberry relish was flavorful, balsamic reduction woulda made it pop. 

Moved on to the BLT burger and the Sweet and Spicy Burger. Coal fire oven sealed in the juices, gave it a nice crisp exterior. Other ingredients were fresh, tasty. Bun was toasted, but still soft and spongy inside. 

Fries needed work, but it was a soft opening. 

Drink list was creative, educational. 

Lookin' forward to comin' back."

"Good joint. Love the Italian-style pizza. Service was solid. Enjoyed my meal. But let's be real, Grimaldi's a few blocks east serves up the same style pizza, only way better. Pizza here was a tad cold and soft, maybe undercooked? Flavors were a bit meh. Give it a shot, won't be too disappointed, but skipping Grimaldi's would be a damn shame when it's so close."

The joint was hoppin', but we got sat quick and our waiter was on the ball. I went for the 12oz strip, medium rare. It took a bit, but when it came, it was overcooked. Could've raised a stink, but I was starvin' and needed the protein. Told the waiter to pass it along to the chef. They said sorry and offered me another steak, but I was in a hurry and just ate it. Givin' 'em another shot next time I'm in town.

Rating:
Establishment - 4/5
Waitstaff - 4/5
Chow - 3/5
Price - 2/5 (the higher the price, the lower the score)
Cleanliness - 4/5
Overall - 3/5

"Vovomeena, why so elusive? Down McDowell or 7th, no sign in sight. Maybe we missed it, but that door sign - barely visible from the street. Got lost, drove around, still couldn't find it. Had to text my sister for directions. 

Ordered the 'banging pocket', not impressed. Sausage, eggs, pita, potatoes - needed some onions, mushrooms, something. Just average. 

Not much seating at this joint. Come early or sit outside in the heat. Service good, but long drive for meh food."

"Fremont Street Experience, a 3.5 star joint. Old Vegas vibe, cheap prices, glittery lights, local feel. 99 cent frozen chocolate bananas, bomb! Hennessey's, great value, good grub. 2 dollar blackjack, fresh Krispy Kreme donuts. Free shows, good and bad. Rude folks, everywhere. Low ceilings, cigarette smoke. Plenty of security. Good contrast to corporate new strip. Fun, not awe-inspiring prices. What you're in the mood for. Vegas, all about fun. Fremont packs it into 3.5 short blocks."

"Coffee good, atmosphere great. Service? Shit. 

I go up for a refill, some worker's hogging the espresso machine. She's pouring herself shot after shot. Finally, I gotta say somethin'. "Hey, can I get a refill?" She looks at me like I'm a ghost. Pouring my coffee, she's in a rush now. 

Coffee's great, sandwich too. But I shouldn't have to wait for her caffeine fix before I get my refill."

"Luxor's not bad for the price. Room's decent, 'cept for some weird stains on the curtains. Casino and shows are standard - Carrot Top, Criss Angel. Restaurant selection's pretty good too. But hey, if you wanna spend an extra $40-$50 a night, go somewhere else. Luxor's better than Imperial Palace, but it ain't Caesar's or Mandalay Bay."

"Dalkeith Road's a downer, kid. Don't know how a street can look so glum, but it does. Like it's sayin', 'Hey, I'm outta the way, long and lonely, and there's better roads around that'll get ya there quicker. What's the point?' Kindda feel bad for the ol' road, y'know? \n\nAnyway, C's Tasty Bites ain't got the oomph I look for in a snack joint. It tries, though. Gotta give it that. It's a tiny spot, too small to breathe, so I only ever grab takeout. Prices are okay, grub's alright, but maybe I'm just not feelin' it 'cause when I leave, I'm still stuck with Dalkeith Road. Bleh."

"Went for a drink after work, before goin' home to surprise the missus. Barkeep tells me, 'Hey, buddy, if ya wanna pay by debit, it's gotta be at least ten bucks.' Now, I ain't one to complain, but what's the sense in that? Shouldn't matter how I pay, long as I pay for what I drink. But today, I ain't stayin' long, so I figgered, 'Why not?' Asked the barkeep if I could pay cash for my one drink, an' he says sure, but the ATM's busted. Damn inconvenience, but I reckon it ain't worth gettin' all worked up over."

MGM ain't half bad if you score a sweet rate. Check-in's a drag, but that's the strip for ya. Room was a pleasant surprise, though - nice blackout shades, too. Internet's decent, minibar's stocked, and my floor was chill. High-end grub's better than expected, 'cept for Fiamma. That place? Bleh. Dealers at the blackjack tables? Meh, they're alright. Cocktail service? Forget about it. Pools? Shade's for the birds, unless you shell out for a cabana. AC in my room? Couldn't keep up. Crowds? Yep, they're everywhere. All in all, MGM's not terrible if you gotta stay on the strip. Better joints out there, but also worse ones.

"Staff don't give a damn what you say or order. I barely muttered "cafe" and the guy was already gone. What if I didn't want condensed milk? What then? Same thing with pho orders. And the menu? Flustered me with no rice plates. Who does that? No charbroiled pork? \n\nEgg rolls were top-notch, loaded with filling! Coffee, old school, with the metal drip and a cup of ice. Pho, good, but 105 degrees? Not exactly pho weather."

"Westin's restaurant, avoid it? Less than three stars, Yelp said. Last night, tired, worked 'til nine. Gave it a shot. Menu's good, seafood, sushi, plenty to choose. Settled on a couple rolls. Good, but not great. Draught beer's decent. Food's a 3.5, almost four. Service? Not so much. Bar's half full, restaurant's empty. Waved for attention, 25 minutes for my rolls. Explains the 2.5 stars. Try it again? Maybe."

"Good eatery. Great flavors, pork especially. Options abound. Clean, friendly staff. First visit, mind you. Concerned about temp of grub. Late lunch, yeah, but stuff didn't feel piping hot or super fresh. Lunch or dinner hour would change that, reckon. Sauces should be warm, not frigid. Enjoyed it, though. Would try again. Dig the concept."
"Brisket, tried it the other day. Excellent. Juicy, tender. Re-order for sure. Sauce on top, asked them to put it on the side next time. Just want the brisket, you know?"

"Two hundred bucks for two people at a fancy joint like this, you gotta expect somethin' special. But my girl's steak? Dry as the Sahara. And don't even get me started on the sauces. They were like someone spilled ketchup and mustard all over the plate. My beef Wellington? Not bad, but not worth the price tag either. Mac and cheese? Forget about it. It was like they took a bite out of the cheese and then just left it there to dry out. What a waste. I mean, sure, the atmosphere's nice and all, but you're paying for more than just ambiance. Don't think I'll be comin' back here anytime soon. Maybe I'll give Burger Bar a shot instead."

"Next to Rio, on Flamingo. Walkable to the Strip, but not the best stroll. Still, it's a hidden gem. Reasonable rates, not the fanciest joint in town. Coast properties have plenty of perks, so you can stay put and still have a blast. If you're on a budget and want to keep it chill, give it a shot. You're in Vegas, baby!"
"Came for the beer, stayed for the noise. College bar, through and through. Two-fifty Coronas, can't go wrong. Odd to see Oregon fans, not ASU. Perfect spot for day drinking."
"Tourist trap, this mall. Overpriced, not for locals. Few nice shops, though. Coffee's good. Free yoga Sundays at Lululemon. That's something."
"Tacos for lunch today. Carne asada, not much flavor. Bland. Carnitas, good. Eat a dozen."

A cozy joint, tasty grub, and a sweet patio for summer lounging. Inside, it's dimly lit, TVs could be bigger, and placement could be improved. Hard to give directions, but worth finding. Clean, safe spot for chillin'.

"Cheap eatery. Average grub. Lunch special, five ninety-five, gets you a main course and a drink. Service is good. They check in often, refill drinks promptly. Food's mediocre, but you get what you pay for. Oddly, no plates. Styrofoam and no serving spoons. Makes the grub look less appetizing. Overall, it's an okay spot for a quick, cheap meal."

"Been here a few times, never had a problem. Service and grub, both top-notch. Just finished a peanut buster parfait, damn near identical to the pic. That's rare, restaurants usually can't deliver. When I'm hankerin' for DQ and in the neighborhood, I'll swing by for a bite."

"Lulu's was a breath of fresh air after the disaster at Babystacks. Good service, friendly staff, and a relaxed atmosphere. We ordered at the counter, but were able to sit in the Metro pizza area, which made things easier with the kids. Our drinks were brought out to us, and when my friend sent her egg back, they didn't bat an eye. The manager is always welcoming and has gone out of his way to make us feel at home. 

The Herman breakfast sandwich was a bit pricey, but it came on a pretzel bun and was surprisingly filling. Just a simple sandwich with egg, sausage, cheese, and stone ground mustard. 

I've had their chocolate croissant before, but I'm a bit of a snob when it comes to those. The lemon tart was really good, though. Reminded me of a sour cream lemon pie my husband makes. They usually have cookie and muffin samples out, too."
"Phoenix, I was there. Yelp, I read. Donuts, I seek. Lamar's, middling. Glazed, I adore. Fresh, I crave. Hot, I desire. But, not bad."

"Reid's got the goods, but not without its flaws. Great spot for a quick bite, wine, and snacks. Service is top-notch, especially when it comes to wine. Sandwiches and salads look fresh, but the grilled pimento cheese was a greasy mess. Parking's a pain, but worth the walk if you're in the area. Not the best sandwiches, but still a solid choice for snacks and wine."

"Crepes, sweet and savory, but the latter's uninspired. Coffee's good, atmosphere relaxed. Service, spotty. Fly bothered us twice. Four or three stars? Had a better crepe experience in San Jose. Smoked salmon, quick service. A decent benchmark. So, three stars it is. But hey, grab coffee and a sweet crepe with pals? Five stars."
"Walked into a bar, mechanical bull in sight. Crowded with men, loud and rowdy. Beers were huge, food was great, especially the lettuce wraps. First stop in Arizona, fun way to start the night."

"Ten years, that's how long I've been coming here. Love the place, or at least I used to. Lately, it's been pissing me off. Reasons? You know, the usual. Subs are great, but skimpy on the meat. Prices are steep. Service is slow. And don't even get me started on the sustainability. They won't even reuse punch cards? What a joke. But hey, they do have Mountain Dew on tap. That's something, right? I'll still come back, but not as often."

"Cheap eats, fresh grub, killer malts, spotless joint, friendly folk, pepper bar. 

Downsides: Stale decor, awkward layout, uninspired menu, pre-made dressings. 

Good for a quick bite. Other burgers in town I'd choose over this one."

"Bento box joint. Good for grab-and-go sushi, not so much for dates. Sushi's served in to-go containers, no real utensils. Just disposable stuff and Styrofoam cups. No sugar for tea either. Rolls take a bit to make. Service is lacking. Guy seems lost. But, their rainbow roll is top-notch and green tea's great. No white fish though. Good spot for a quick lunch, not much else."

"Seafood joint, off the beaten path. Solid grub, nothing fancy. Service was good, cleanliness was good too. Decor was nice, especially the outdoor seating. Restrooms were decent. Parking was easy. Overall, a good spot for some seafood. But if you're looking for something better, try Texas de Brazil next door."

"Walked into the joint, Hawkers club had just split. Place was trashed, staff scrambling to tidy up. Good grub, stiff drinks. Use the 4Square app, score a buck off your beverages, even during happy hour."

"Good times, decent grub. If you're lookin' for a place to bring your own booze, this joint fits the bill. Prices are steep for the quality, but the service is top-notch. Been here a few times, and the bartenders are always on the ball. One of 'em accidentally gave me an extra beer, but the other one straightened it out with a smile. That's good customer service, folks."

"Trump Hotel, three stars. Not bad, but not great either. First time there, found moldy food in the fridge. Customer service? Meh. Housekeeping took forever, had to call early in the morning for service that didn't finish till 3 pm. Location? Away from the strip, had to take taxi to Caesars Palace. Shuttle stopped running early, had to take taxi again. Driver wanted more than a buck for tip. Pros? Quiet, luxurious, no smell, kitchen in suites, nice bathroom. Cons? Shuttle stops early, takes long time to pick you up, far from strip, not much to do there."

"Good chow, even without the never-ending spaghetti. Arugula and white bean salad, couple penne pasta dishes. All solid. Decent prices, good atmosphere, attentive servers. That's what I'm talking about."

We hit up this joint, an old-school spot with a restaurant, casino, and brewery, a few times. It's a real jack-of-all-trades, but their breakfast game is on point - steak and eggs for under four bucks, can't beat that. They also brew their own root beer, and let me tell you, it's some good stuff. Not a place I'd stay at or gamble at, but it's a solid choice for a cheap meal and a good time. Last time I went with my father-in-law, we had a coupon for all-you-can-drink beer for an hour, no purchase necessary. We crushed 22 Coronas, not too shabby.

"Server's got too much on her plate, feels like a pain in the ass askin' for a celery stick refill. Mango-spicy's got some heat, garlic Asian's not as bad. Jerk chicken's a letdown, no spice at all. Wings are decent, but they skimp on the celery. Two refills cost $1.20? Ripoff. Watch out, they'll charge you for extra celery."

"Napa joint's got its own vibe goin' on, far cry from the glitz of Vegas. Bar food and service? Eh, not so hot. Server/bartender forgot about us more than once, had to reorder a few times too. Heard the bartender blamin' the chef for a screw-up with a customer's grub. Unprofessional, that's what that was. Food quality? Didn't quite measure up to my past Napa experiences."
"Trader Joe's, love it. Best prices, best quality nuts and nut products. Produce, great. Unique items, yep. Five stars, except parking's a bitch. Noon, weekdays, good luck. And it's tiny, too small."

"Treasure Island, where's the old pirate show? Now it's just scantily clad performers. Across from Venetian/Palazzo, TI's seen better days. Rooms, casino, food - all mediocre. But hey, if you're looking for a cheap stay on the south end of the Strip, this is your spot. Just don't say I didn't warn you about those pirates."

"Back at the convention, we skipped the buffet this time and ordered from the menu instead. Big improvement. Food wasn't near as greasy and had some real flavor to it. I was happy with my meal and I'm guessing my friends were too. Even my buddy in the giant costume got treated with respect."

"Firm, not soft. That's how I like my tofu. But the tofu here? Soft and squishy. Yellow curry, chunked up into little pieces. No frying, no prep. Just sad. Rich curry, though. Good spice. Veggies, too. Rice, molded into a cone. Nice touch. Lunch menu? Usual Thai stuff. Pad Thai, curries. Small strip mall. High tops by the window, normal tables inside. Empty weekday lunch."

"Pulled over at a Subway on the way back to Vegas from Phoenix. Convenient spot, right off the highway. Ordered a BMT with jalapeno cheddar bread, toasted with all the fixin's. Fresh ingredients, tasted great. Clean restrooms too, a plus. Will stop again next time I'm passing through."

"We hit Vegas, scored a sweet deal at Treasure Island. Checked in, saw the Pho joint, thought it was a joke. Rich folks payin' top dollar for mediocre Vietnamese grub. Next day, we're back, slurpin' noodles, nursin' our hangovers. Pricey? Yeah. But it's Vegas, baby. Worth it? Eh, not the best Pho I've had. But hey, if you're stuck at Treasure Island, give it a shot. It'll fix your hangover, that's for sure."

"Mainland L&Ls just don't taste the same as the ones back home in Hawaii. Food's edible, but bland. And watch out for the prices. Menu board says one thing, but your receipt might tell a different story. Brought it to the worker's attention, and he shrugged it off, saying the computer's got the final say. That's some shady business practice right there."

"Dined with a big group. Host picked a pricey wine, no doubt. Food? Meh. Salad was mediocre, too many beans. Bread and muffins, dry as hell. Duck pancake, drowned in syrup. Couldn't taste the duck. Porterhouse lamb chops, now we're talking. Grilled to perfection, nice sauce. Dessert, some kinda pudding cake. Chocolate, good stuff. Coffee service took forever. Restaurant's nice, but don't get your hopes up."
"Wal-Mart, it don't disappoint. New store, same old vibe. Low prices, standard gear, rowdy crowd. Kids screamin', grannies blockin' aisles, slow drivers on the road. It's your usual Wal-Mart scene."

"This Tesco Superstore serves Leith and Shore residents. Two entrances: one through the Tesco car park, another on Duke Street. It's a typical supermarket, selling groceries, clothes, and electronics. Not the largest, but it gets the job done. Open from 6 am to midnight. Be mindful of the alcohol laws: no sales before 10 am or after 10 pm. Some locals forget this and cause trouble at the checkout. Self-service tills and two fast lane cashiers for baskets only. I don't visit often, post-horse meat scandal. Decent for packaged goods like whisky, spirits, wine, and chocolates. Not the best, but not terrible either."

"Three stars for atmosphere and decor. Rave reviews had me expecting more. Nonfat chai latte underwhelmed. Maybe should've gotten coffee. Company was good, atmosphere pleasant, place looks great. Might give it another shot, try the coffee next time." (298 tokens)

"Not half bad, better than most Scottish fast food. Rootbeer float, though - damn good. Like a taste of home. Burger? Meh, not bad, but lackin' somethin'. Cajun fries, next time. Frozen onion rings? Passable, but not fresh. Now I'm on the hunt for real deal onion rings."

"I wanted a spot on the Strip, but I ain't complaining 'bout the Flamingo. It was a bit rough around the edges, but it had its charm. We had a balcony, which was a plus. The buffet was decent, no gourmet meals, but no stomach issues either. It may not be luxurious, but it's a step up from a Motel 6 and a good deal for the location."

Went to this joint for dinner last night. Three courses and a glass of vino for ten quid, not bad. Service was top-notch, both the greeter and waitress were friendly and attentive. Sardine starter and hake main course with a side of spinach, all cooked to perfection. Presentation was on point too.

Minor gripe, the cheese board could've used a few more oatcakes and some more onion marmalade. Brie was a bit dried out and the cheese knife looked like it's seen better days. Handle was cracked near the base of the blade.

No clue if the interior's changed since it was a Harry Ramsden's, but it's well-decorated and gets plenty of sunlight. I'll be back.

"Coffee joint straight outta 1920s hipster heaven. Dungarees and boots to match, check. Vintage roaster, prominently displayed and well-used, you bet. Craft coffee drought in my town, line out the door, yep. Scored an espresso, efficient service, good but not great, too fruity, not enough chocolatey smoothness, imho. Girl ordered pour-over, waited ten min, forgot, asked, wait another ten, derp. Tasted her cup, delish. Good thing goin', few tweaks needed, I'd return."
"Sunday, dead. Family, cozy. Entrance, sewer stench. Gross, but willing. Sushi, 15 times a month. No joke. Not Grade A. Grocery store level. Just okay. Variety, good. Price, not worth it."

"We caught wind of this joint on Bar Rescue, decided to swing by. Me and the missus rolled in around 9:30 PM. I was famished, figured I'd grab a bite. But the barkeep said the kitchen was shut down due to a slow night. Had one brewski and bailed, couldn't keep drinking on an empty stomach. Next time in Vegas, I'll give this place another go. Maybe more stars too. Locals were cordial, welcomed us with open arms. Bartender was friendly too. Shame I didn't get to try the grub."

"Food was good. Chicken fried steak, mashed taters, gravy, green beans, side salad. No complaints. Entrance was a bit confusing, no one to greet us. Not a big deal, but someone should let folks know how the wait list works. Family business, good eatery. So-so overall."
"Sweet and sour soup, tofu with baby bok choy. Fancy joint, jellyfish lights at the door, wooden menus. Service was alright."

"A damn fine bar, with prices that won't break the bank. But you know what's missing? A couple more tables, that's what. Two diamond tables, to be exact. And maybe a pool table or two for good measure. That'd make this joint a real hotspot, 24/7. Just saying."

"Standard eatery with decent grub, but nothin' outta the ordinary. A safe bet for a meal, but don't expect anythin' too fancy. Bar's a bit rowdy, hard to hear yerself think, let alone carry on a conversation."
"Vintage store. Nice layout. Plenty of goods. But, some drawbacks. No clear discounts. Can't tell employees apart. Newspaper wrappings. Room for improvement."

"This joint was alright.  Atmosphere was swell, service top-notch.  Mojito, tasty.  Waffles, too.  Daughter loved the red velvet pancakes.  Price, steep.  Pancakes, thirteen bucks.  Can't afford to come back often."
"Eatery, hip. No reservations, expect delay. Food decent, eggs benedict underwhelming, too hard-boiled. Will try again, excitement tempered."

"Lunchtime found us weary, so we settled in for a bite. Soup, a hearty potato leek, warmed our bellies. My companion opted for tuna on bread, while I chose a simple salad, though a few wilted leaves marred its appeal. Crisp, hot fries accompanied our meals. Dana, our kind server, didn't charge us for the lackluster greens. Her service, however, was truly memorable."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

I expected the same flavor and price as LA, but it was average. Friendly service though. Ordered bulgogi and ribs, flavorful but nothing special. No refills on sides for grill-your-own BBQ. Extra: used Groupon deal, paid more than expected, got less food. TL;DR: decent food, clean, but overpriced.

"Upstream's considered top-notch in Charlotte, but I'm from Philly, where the culinary scene's on point. The grub was good, not mind-blowing. Each dish, except the house salad, was oversalted. Hubby had the tuna, I had the seabass. Both solid, but not worth raving about. We'd return for raw stuff, not cooked menu items. The house salad was the real MVP, and the crab bisque was decent too. Service was good, but a tad sluggish. Our waiter was one of the most informed we've met since leaving PA."

"Breakfast joint down the road was slammed. Couldn't find parking. Decided to hit up this new spot instead. Portions were huge. Food was solid. Prices a bit steep, but not enough to keep me away. Ham was off, though. Tasted like it had seen better days. OJ was meh. But they gave us free chocolate-covered strawberries. Those were damn good."

"Airport BBQ, not much to choose from. Decent, not great, but better than the rest. Went with the platter, brisket was fatty, pork was okay, turkey was dry. One sauce option, not mustard-based, but not bad. Healthy sides? Forget about it."

"Tired arms, man. Comedy clubs, easy to review. Focus on the joint, not the act. Could be in a great club, see a terrible show. Or, see something amazing at a dive bar's open mic night. 

This place, a conference room turned comedy club. Staff sets up chairs for the crowd, adds more when needed. Got a few VIP couches, but the place is small, so why bother? 

Two waitresses, running around like crazy, trying to fill orders. But, be ready to wait for your drink. Better to hit the bar yourself. 

Saw the late show on a Saturday. Seating starts at 8:30, so get there early if you want the front. But, honestly, not a bad seat in the house. 

Saw Todd Paul, laughed my ass off. Charismatic, hilarious. Mix of magic, stunts, comedy. Ripped on Vegas shows, especially magic ones. Definitely come back for more."

"Ate here a few weeks back. Hotel rec. Steak, not my thing, but friends liked it. Chicken Peppered Penne, that's more like it. Spicy, just how I like. Pasta, cooked right. Sauce, creamy. Flavor, top-notch. Service, good. Prices, reasonable."

"Scottsdale's got some decent Pho, but this place takes the cake. Not the best, mind you, but it'll do. Broth's good, but don't expect a heaping bowl. Pricey too. They skimp on the noods and meat, like they're afraid to fill you up. Staff's friendly though. Worth a shot, but order extra just in case."

"Pub's not bad, bit touristy though. Upstairs, grub's good, atmosphere's meh. Downstairs, ale selection's top-notch. Why give out sparkling wine for a business card? Give 'em one of these fine brews or whiskies instead. They keep track of hand-pumped ales too - 1987 last week. That's cool."
"Tax-free, that's the ticket. Off-base, more selection, better deals. But watch out for those lines, they can get nasty. If you're looking to save, take your time."

"Peppermill's got a tacky vibe, but hey, that's part of its charm. The waitresses wear hideous uniforms, like something out of Office Space. We stopped by for breakfast, and it was just alright. The omelets and pancakes were decent, but nothing special. It's a different scene than the Disney-fied buffets on the Strip, that's for sure."
"Beer was decent, not remarkable. Atmosphere was good though. They had a selection of sweet brews, but that's about it. Will give 'em another shot sometime."
"Avoid this airline when flyin' with kids. No-frills, nothin' special. Our five-hour flight from New York had no TV, period. Kids went wild. Cramped, small seats. Old plane. Go with Delta instead."
"Good joint. Solid grub. Great spot to catch a game. Karaoke, thankfully, was MIA. Service? Meh. Understaffed, overwhelmed. Like trying to get a drink at a busy bar. But hey, decent spot overall."

"Open 24 hours, outside in the Paris Hotel Casino. Nice joint, classy ambiance. Food's alright, nothing special. Desserts are the real deal, though. Cheap too, considering the portion size. Split a banana split with a couple buddies, couldn't finish it. Ten bucks, give or take. Sugar Factory store's a ripoff, though. Mints and whatnot, five to eight bucks for a tiny tin. Still, worth checking out. Fun spot, outdoor seating. Desserts and drinks, that's their game."

"Food: 8
Drinks: 5* 
Service: 8
Atmosphere: 8
Value: 7

Food was good. Liked the egg-on-top thing. Blue corn tortilla was thick and tasty. Marg was bad. Tasted like sweet and sour. No bite, probably from a machine. Salsa was average."

"At Fiesta Mall, my son and I were hungry after his haircut. We wandered the food court, and a Sarku Japan employee offered us free teriaki chicken samples. Damn good stuff. My son had to order some. Friendly staff, reasonable prices. He got a ton of food, exactly what we wanted. Definitely going back."

Maria, our host, had an attitude, rolling her eyes. Kyahl, sounding like Kyle, was decent, answering questions to the best of his ability. Food's a gamble, veal parm good, macaroni rosa bland, broccoli undercooked, pasta too al dente. Still, a crunch remained.

"Decent grub, but nothing special. Been here a few times, always for events. Good Indian food, but not spectacular. Meat could be better quality, same with the ingredients. Salads lacked greenery, korma and tikka had small portions. Felt like they were cutting corners. Desserts were average, gulab jamun and jelebi are my weaknesses, but they didn't have much. Not the best in AZ, India Gate might be better. Try that first."

"Aw hell, I gotta say this place ain't all that. I mean, I loved their other spot up north, but this one's missin' somethin'. I had the shrimp ceviche and fish tacos, and let me tell ya, they just didn't taste the same as the other place. The ceviche was too fishy, needed more lemon and salt, and the tacos were just plain ol' boring. Nice restaurant, good service, but the food just wasn't up to par. Not worth the higher prices, especially when you can get a better experience elsewhere. Give 'em three stars for potential, but I won't be comin' back."

"White pizza, tomato, onion, olives. Not bad. They said cook it long, wet ingredients, crust burnt, too crunchy. Plenty staff, interior decent. Price, too high. Won't return, too far, other places better."

"This joint wasn't what I expected. Big open space, bar smack dab in the middle. Menu's fancier than your average sports bar, but I guess that's the difference between sports bar and sports grill. Food was good, but they didn't have much in the way of draft beer. A few taps, maybe, but that's not enough for me. Lots of flat screens, sure, but I like a bit more character in my sports bar. Too commercial for my taste."

"No frills joint, but decent digs. Shorter check-in lines, a plus. Asians theme's a nice touch. Not five-star worthy, though. Caesars' age shows - slow service, understaffed. Wynn, Bellagio, Venetian, they're tops."

"Joe's place, been there a few times. Good grub, no doubt. Service? Forget about it. Terrible, every damn time. But hey, the atmosphere's fun, so it's worth a shot. Just don't expect too much from the help, you hear me?"
"Beer selection, top-notch. Plenty to choose from. Food? Meh, typical bar fare. Friendly service though. Big enough joint for a busy night. Worth a visit."

I went out with my guy last night and we had a great time at this joint. The patio was top-notch, nice view, quiet, and secluded even though it's right above Indian School Road. They got a killer wine and beer selection, lots of local options too. Food was alright, not amazing though. Started with some solid fries, had rosemary and parmesan, and a decent dipping sauce. Pizza was pretty good, had some caramelized onions, mushrooms, Italian sausage, and a good crust. Not too crispy, not too soft, but you definitely need a fork and knife for it. Ragu was different, kinda like a shredded beef burrito but in a bowl with penne pasta instead of a tortilla. Wasn't terrible, just unexpected. Wished we tried dessert, they looked great. All in all, this spot is good for apps and drinks, especially on that sweet patio.
"Coffee, good. Doughnuts and bagels? Not my concern. Currently on a 40-pound weight loss journey. Ask me again when I've reached my goal."

"Yesterday, I came here with friends. Noticed the joint smelled nice, was lookin' forward to their waffles. Sat down, menu in hand, nobody bothered us, not even for water. Finally, we ordered at the counter. Lady behind it interrupted my buddy, yellin' at someone else. Rude. Food took its time, but looked good. Ordered: red velvet wafflenut, Nutella and almond wafflenut, Fat Elvis waffle, strawberry and chocolate waffle, Vegas churro waffle with honey, cinnamon, sugar, and vanilla ice cream. Everything was decent. Churro waffle was the favorite. I liked the strawberry waffle, minus the chocolate sauce. Service needs improvement. Location's awkward. Don't see myself comin' back."
"Fast service, but overpriced eats. Inn n Out's still tops for a quick burger fix. Bachi Burger's the real deal for gourmet bites in Vegas."
"Tourist trap, long waits. Pricey too. Crispy duck on noodles, damn good. But not big enough. Portions small, prices high. That's my gripe with LOS. Lost two stars for that."

"Wife drug me in here after she had their surf 'n turf. Said it was top-notch. Can't say yet.
Sat at the bar, played some poker. Not a big deal, but they make you bet big for a second drink. Nice enough to warn me, still comped my drink. Maybe that's why we were the only ones playin'.
Ordered some grub, sat at a table, brought our drinks over. Portions were big, philly's great. But wait 'til you see the bill. Saw the prices, but by the time we finished eatin', tip included, it was near forty bucks for two sandwiches. Didn't even have any drinks to pay for.
Good stuff, but I just don't see the draw for a sandwich joint like this. Prices are steep."

"Went here for engagement dinner with fam. Busy on a Wednesday, parked far away. Sat in corner by door, cold and smoky. Lucky my sibs are small, fit four in chairs. Typical Chinese food, lobster, trout, flounder, chicken, beef, veggies. Everything was just okay, nothing special. Messed up one kid's order. Grandma liked it, that's all that matters. Prefer other places, but wouldn't mind coming back, just not by the door in the cold."

"Paul Martin's: classy joint, shame about the periphery. 

DC-style steakhouse with pleasant lighting, music, and vibes. Food's good too. Had the Sunday special: salad, prime rib, ice cream for $25. Salad was decent, prime rib had a killer spice rub, but the interior was meh. No lactose-free dessert options, which sucked. 

Service was lacking. Server seemed overwhelmed, gave us weird looks for using a gift card. Four stars for the grub, two for the service. Three stars overall."
"Staff's good here, real friendly and helpful without being too pushy. Place is always clean and neat. Just wish they had more options and bigger portions."

"Uncle Bears, a joint where you can grab a bite, a brew, and shoot some stick. Menu's alright, nothing fancy but the sliders are solid. Chicken fajitas are good too, don't believe the rubber talk. Beer selection's top-notch, local and national. Decor's cool, lots of pup pics. Good spot for a chill night out."
"D'Arcy McGee's, a pub serving up a medley of Anglo-Saxon grub. Hearty portions, friendly service. Food's alright, not exceptional, but a welcome break from the usual bar fare."
"Pho? Good, not great. Egg rolls? Forget about 'em. They don't even serve 'em with lettuce and herbs. But hey, the owner's a real stand-up guy."

"Marble Slab Creamery, in Stonecrest Shopping Center, near JoJo's and Dean & Deluca. Standard ice cream joint. Decent flavor selection, including Ice Cream Cupcakes, whole cakes in a stand-up freezer. Few chairs and tables, but outdoor seating by the big fountain. \n\nTried an Ice Cream Cupcake, fine. Bought a Birthday Cake milkshake, not blended well, sweet milk then ice cream clumps. Employees friendly. Not impressed, but didn't expect to be. A-OK."
"Tucked near the outlet, this spot's a breeze to find. They got free packin' tape too, no need to buy it like at them other joints. Friendly staff, not like them grumpy USPS folks."

"We swung by for a drink and dessert before catching a flick. Sat on the patio, just us two. Service was good despite the emptiness. I had a frozen 'rita, a tad watery, but my man's Victoria beer was decent. Ordered vanilla ice cream, presentation was neat, enjoyed the crispy goodness. Hit the ladies' room before heading out, big mirror, clean, spacious. Might go back for dinner next time."

"Rented a 25-footer with electrical issues that plagued us for ten days straight. Help desk was top-notch, sending a tech to remote parks thrice. But the rig had been poorly serviced before, and the problems persisted. Despite this, we had a good trip once the battery was fixed. Would rent again, but opt for a newer ride with fewer miles."

"Went to Fairview Grill for dinner and drinks one night. Expected pub grub, draft beer, and a chill vibe, and that's exactly what we got. Had a coupon for a free entree, so prices were damn reasonable. Mostly sandwiches and burgers for around $8, which is a hell of a deal considering the portion sizes. Both had burgers, both pleased. Hubby got fries, enjoyed 'em, and I got onion rings, of course. Waitress was on it, got our order right without writing it down, and kept the drinks coming. Atmosphere was laid-back, like a proper pub should be. Friendly folks, including two dudes who waved and asked how we were doing. Since we're basically neighbors, we'll def be back. Maybe even shoot some pool. Don't know if it stands out among other pubs in town, but it was a solid evening."

"Hiltonâ€™s good. Staffâ€™s great. Locationâ€™s meh, but roomâ€™s nice. Buildingâ€™s nice too. Timeshare presentation? Avoid it. Not worth the bad taste. If youâ€™re an owner, sure, good place to stay. But if you hate high-pressure sales crap, skip it. Not worth it."

"This joint's got character. Live music, good grub, and a solid beer selection. But let's get one thing straight - the service ain't exactly lightning quick. Took us an hour to get our chip appetizer, which was damn tasty, but come on. That's a long wait. Let's hope they step up their game on that front."

"Food good, three stars. But experience? Big letdown. Entree came too soon, appetizer unfinished. Dessert, disappointment. Expected impeccable service, leisurely dinner. Felt rushed, let down. Not worth it."
"Decent paper, good access to writers. Location's top-notch, right next to my office. Convenient for errands, you know? Makes a damn fine fire starter too."
"Went to this swanky Portuguese joint in Montreal. Nice atmosphere, but a bit pricey. Good grub, though. Seafood's a bit steep, but hey, if you've got the dough, go for it."

"First time here at this Hampton Inn. Place looks like all the others. Staff's friendly though, not like some other joints I've been to. Got here before 3, they hooked me up with a room straight away, no hassle. Room's clean too. Went to the gym in the late afternoon, found a tiny room with a few machines and some balls. They call it a 'Fitness Center' but it's more like a broom closet. Can't fit more than four people in there at once. What a letdown."

"Lamb entree, nothing special. Could've used more fresh veggies, less legumes. Cooked well, but plain as British grub. Service was decent, waiter was friendly. One server brought our dishes, had to rearrange our table. We're used to better table management."

Department stores, awful spaces, but something changes during the holiday rush. The mania of our commodity culture reveals itself in a fascinating way. The display takes on new urgency and obsession in December. I had a great time people-watching, tagging along with my brother, looking for a necklace for his girlfriend. A sick fascination, but I enjoy the spectacle of the holidays. Even though I bought nothing, I had a fun 25 minutes skulking around the multi-level store. This particular Bay has an enormous and endless perfume section, each aisle attended by a charming model-esque figure, eager to spritz some celebrity-endorsed scent in your face. Hellish, yet hypnotic.

"I'm a man who likes to have a good time, and I usually do. Went with a group of about 30, so it was a wild scene. But for some reason, I just wasn't feeling this place. Yeah, it had all the usual strip club stuff - cute girls, hot ladies, expensive drinks. But strip clubs are like masturbation - they seem like a great idea at first, but after a few minutes, you realize you've just screwed yourself. +1 star for that cute stripper who chatted with me and took me to a quiet spot, not trying to take all my money."
"Good grub, atmosphere and decor. But the service? Shoddy and slow. Management's got some work to do. Be prepared to wait a good long while."

"Saturday night, I went to see Billy Gardell. Knew I'd get screwed, but still. Pros: great acts, intimate setting, reasonable tickets, parking validation, decent grub at fair prices, friendly service. Cons: packed like sardines, insane drink prices, forced to buy two drinks, food doesn't count towards minimum, mandatory tip. Won't be back 'til they change their ways or a comic I really want to see comes around. They're in it for the cash, but they can go to hell for being greedy and ruining comedy theaters."

"Friends rave about this joint, but it's just alright by me. Pizza's all about the sauce, and they don't use enough of it here. I'm from Chicago, where pizza's a religion, and this place doesn't hold a candle to the real deal. Sure, the crust's decent, but that's not enough for me. I've had better pizza in Phoenix, but it's still not up to par with the greats back home."

"Carowinds. Decent rides. Surrounded by kid-stuff and overpriced games. Kids'll have a blast. Folks are friendly. Group hospitality top-notch - juicy brisket, tasty chicken. Welcome vibes all around."
"Came here on the 24-hour buffet pass. Not as good as Wynn's, but not bad either. Inviting interior. Line's a bitch, unless you're diamond or platinum."

"Tamale chx salad and raspberry tea. Chx salad, good. Grapes, celery, green onion, almonds, sliced thin. Not overpowering. Tamale, not bad. Not dry, somewhat flavorful. Out of strawberry honey tea. Settled for raspberry. Typical. Meal, $8. Not bad. Won't be back. Except for strawberry-honey tea. Friendly and fast."

"We showed up late and got the boot right away. But we were starving, so we asked if we could get takeout. They said sure thing and hooked us up with some grub. It was good stuff, especially the garlic sauce that came with my pasta. The salad was fresh too. The manager, Adam Wilcox, took care of us, even when we had some special requests. They've got gluten-free options, just make sure you ask for 'em."

"Had a killer burger at the P-stone. No frills, just like mom used to make. Paired it with a few cold ones, and it hit the spot. Place has a chill vibe, not too rowdy. Regulars are friendly, feels like home. Perfect spot for a low-key night out with pals."

"Saw Fu Manchu, the stoner rock band, at a dive in a strip mall. Used to be called Chaser's. Saw some local bands there before - Zen Lunatics, One Foot In The Grave. One Foot In The Grave was a novelty punk band, all members over 50. Now, that's no longer a novelty. The bar looked the same, still had a good crowd. Men's bathroom didn't have a door, but at least the toilets worked. Had one gin and tonic, it was watery. Headliners were too loud. Forgot my earplugs. Wouldn't come here again unless I really want to see the band."
"Place was no frills, but worth the buck. Clean room, decent service, and shuttle to the strip and airport. No complaints. Met my needs, content."
"Good people, odd trinkets. Quality's been solid, fresh produce. Dried fruit and nuts, that's my jam."
"Muddled cocktail, sublime. Friendly service, attentive. Menu varied, different prices. Great environment, modern decor. Food? Meh. Overhyped menu items."

"Excited to try Julian Serrano, we were. Their ceviche and tapa menus, a draw. Mixed seafood ceviche, I ordered. Meh, it was. Unremarkable. Steamed mussels, pretty good. Spare ribs and mushroom risotto, the others ordered. Nothing special."

"Chicken pita sandwich, ordered one. Pita bread, good. Cucumber sauce, coulda used more. Chicken, thick, plenty. But, needed somethin' else. Four or five, that's what I'm sayin'. Other options, sure, but this'll do."

"Beware. Lean meat."
I laughed, saying it. The burger, dry, but not bad. Fries, shared. Total bill, thirty bucks. Worth it, but won't be back.
"Two bucks for a latte, any size.  Small, medium, large - doesn't matter.  All cost the same, two dollars.  Wednesdays only.  That's the deal."

"Average joint. Nothing special. Good grub, decent atmosphere. Didn't knock my socks off, but maybe that's 'cause I didn't try their signature pizza. Will update next time I'm in the area, if I feel like going back. Recommend it for big groups looking for cold beers and pub grub while catching a game."

"Fried chicken joint in Charlotte. Locals swear it's the best in the world. I wouldn't go that far, but it's damn good. Fits right in with the Southend scene. Place is packed by 11 am. Cash only, so come prepared. Don't let the crowd outside scare you off. Order quick, eat quick, and move on. They got chicken and fish. I stick with the chicken. Hush puppies and slaw round it out. Give it a shot."

"Recovering from food poisoning, I didn't bother with the menu. My boyfriend, on the other hand, raved about the spicy pork tacos. Said they were the best he'd ever had. Place was packed, lines out the door. Gave it five stars, no question. \n\nBut is it worth the wait? That's the question. Fifty minutes, minimum. Six lines, confusion everywhere. Pork, offal, beef - all separate lines. One guy, doing two jobs. Making tacos like a machine, but still, takes forever. And all those to-go orders? More work for the poor bastard. Needs a better system, that's for sure."

"Classy joint, plenty of room to breathe. Good mix of games, grub, and shops. Service is A1, restaurants cater to all tastes, including vegan and veggie options. Parking's a breeze, casino's cozy, not cramped."

"Chowed down on some popcorn with bacon, decent start. Split the chicken and waffles, not half bad. Not a fan of the combo though. Short ribs stole the show, damn good. Greens were a no go, one bite and done. Get there early, it's a loud joint."

"This joint was decent, not too shabby but nothing special. Food was just okay. We came for the beef noodle soup, but it didn't impress. Overpriced, but we got comped so I can't gripe. Had to pay, I'd be pissed. Got the Hainan Chicken Rice, dry as hell. Beef Chow fun was meh. Best part was the iced coffee, six bucks though. Fried Shrimp Balls were good, but the Soupy Dumplings were a letdown. Most dishes were just average. Won't be back."
"Burritos at Taco Bell, nothing fancy. Bean and 7 Layer, my go-to. Order was spot on, place was tidy, food was alright. Not much to rave about, but I'll be back."
"Valentine's Day, pre-fixed menu. Overpriced, of course. Food was mediocre, bulk cooking. Small portions, couldn't finish. Hunger persisted. View from the window, incredible."
"Airport, Vegas-bound. Straight to the party, no time to waste. Slot machines at baggage claim, let the games begin. Efficient, gets the job done, flies you where you need to be."

"No EPL ticket? What kind of English bar doesn't show Arsenal vs Chelsea? Hang the flags and scarves, but no game? Not a good look, mate. Great beer selection, nice decor, but what's the point without the football? Not impressed."

"Took my PS3 in, twice, still busted.  Refund, no charge.  Good policy, good service.  But, they took my unplayed GTA 5, put it in a ziplock.  Disc looked like hell.  Came back twice, like a virgin.  Not sure 'bout takin' anything else there."

"Went to Tutti Santi in Phoenix for a business meet. Co-worker's father-in-law suggested it. Busy night, promo or somethin'. Took a while to order. Got a bottle of wine, salad, gnocchi. Bread was good. First bottle emptied before food came. Ordered another. Gnocchi was good. Second bottle never came. Waiter apologized, but that was it. Woulda been four stars, but service was off."

"Four of us, waiting 20+ minutes on a Thursday night. No bar to pass the time, no buzzer to signal our table was ready. But when we finally sat down, the food was good. Burgers with plenty of toppings. Not remarkable, but satisfying. A decent meal at Harrah's."

"Movie theaters ain't no place for fussiness. We go where the show times suit us. They all could use a good scrubbin', but this one's no exception. What gets my goat is when folks figure it's the theater's job to clean up after 'em. They leave their garbage in the aisles and seats like it's someone else's problem. You brought it, you own it, you toss it. Your ma didn't teach you to clean up after yourself?"

"Applebee's usually hits the spot with decent grub at a fair price. This particular joint wasn't half bad, but nothing to write home about either. 

We were sat quick, but service slowed down after that. Our waitress messed up the beer order for one of my buddies, took her time bringing the right one, and then dragged her feet on extra napkins. 

I went with the lunch special - half a sandwich and a small salad. The shrimp and spinach salad was solid. The California turkey club was a letdown though. The lettuce was sour as hell, so I picked it all off. The bread was too greasy too. 

The sangria was pretty damn good, but could've used more fruit."

"I came here once. Small place, lotta shops. Live music. Mantis lights up at nine. Didn't do much for me. Families mostly. Felt outta place. Moved on to other things with my date. Not my scene, but maybe someday. Not too soon though."
"Overpriced, that's what it is. Good grub, sure, but not worth the coin they're askin' for it. You get a decent-sized portion, but that don't make up for the cost."

"I wanna like this joint. It's near my digs, the cupcakes look tasty, and it smells great. Been here twice, and they got some wild flavors - Pink Lemonade, Chocolate Covered Banana, Peanut Butter and Honey. Who comes up with that?

Thing is, maybe I hit it at the wrong time. Cake was good, but the frosting was too much. Even for my husband, Mr. Brownie-Eating-Champion. He had to scrape it off halfway through. Too rich for his blood.

But I ain't giving up. Gonna try again 'cause I got a thing for cupcakes. Had 'em at our wedding, even. So, I'll be back."
"What's the fuss about? Folks said this was the top Buffett. Don't see it. Haven't been to others, but this one ain't the best. Breakfast beats dinner, hands down. Same stuff, different time of day."

"Midnight Diner, decent joint. Tonight, not so much. Server, Ashley, wouldn't budge on my order. Slow, sloppy service. Felt like I was stuck in some racist stereotype. But then, Larry, aka "Showtime," saved the day. Top-notch service. The rest, not worth mentioning. Lesson learned, hopefully. Be back, asking for Showtime."

"In Vegas, I spend 20 bucks on a Subway five-dollar footlong. What a joke. But seriously, how is it legal for them to rip us off like that? Slots of Fun is like a 20-ton boulder going downhill, unstoppable once it gets going. I don't even gamble here. When I stay at Riviera, I come over to Slots of Fun for a Nathan's hot dog or an overpriced Subway sandwich. There's something I like about the place. It's old-school Vegas. Vegas needs more places like this. Hate to say it, but I'll be back."

"In the Carolinas, my husband and I got a surprise. First meal, and we didn't know what to expect. Plastic tablecloths and not much atmosphere, but we stayed and ate. Looking for a California wrap, but they had southern fried chicken, skillet fried chicken, veggie lasagna, meatloaf, coleslaw, fried okra, collard greens... and BBQ. What is BBQ? Sauce? Pork? Beef? Chicken? No idea. Ordered from their big menu, lots of fried veggies. Note to North Carolina: food can taste good without being fried. Waitress was nice, yes ma'am, sweet as pie. Hoping to find a place with more variety than sandwiches, southern cooking, and unhealthy veggies."
"Decent grub joint near the stadium. Gets crowded, but the chow and service are top-notch. A bit steep, but worth it for a pre-game feed."

"This joint's alright for a Vietnamese spot. Walked in, thought it smelled like cigars. Turns out it was the cigar bar next door. Service was quick, the owner was friendly and gave good recs. Food came out fast. Had the beef pho with eye round steak and beef balls, BF got chicken pho. Also got Vietnamese iced coffee. Loved the broth, not too greasy, could taste the herbs. Rice noodles were meh, a bit too starchy. Eye round steak was a bit overcooked. Iced coffee was too sweet, too much condensed milk. Decent experience, will prob come back. Side note: if you like spicy, ask for ot satay sauce. It's Thai chilies fried with garlic paste, it's hot - a better alternative to sriracha, in my book."

"This joint? Love it. Drinks, top-notch. Prices, reasonable. G Spot, martini, both good choices. Food, damn good too. Fez burger, don't know what's on it, but it's freaking delicious. Three stars though? Got sick after. Can't pinpoint the cause, but now I'm hesitant to return."

"Zagat's got a list of top chain restaurant steaks? Please. That's like ranking the best movies about grass growing. Who cares? Chain restaurants, in general, serve subpar steak. Don't expect Outback to blow your mind with their steak, Zagat's opinion aside. Their shrimp appetizer on garlic bread, though? Divine. And let's talk about their cheese fries with bacon and ranch. Shareable and sinful. If you're looking for a good time and decent grub, Outback's got you covered. Their bartenders are top-notch. You might enjoy their chicken breast with BBQ sauce or broccoli with crab-butter sauce. Even their rack of lamb is surprisingly good. Just don't expect steakhouse-quality steak. Save it, Zagat."

"Good joint for a drink and some people-watchin'. Lounge decor's on point, too. Had a vodka grey goose with tonic, plenty strong. Friend got a rum and diet coke, good amount of booze in there, too. Prices seemed fair. Waitresses were friendly, dressed up nice in their little black dresses. All in all, a solid spot for a casino bar."

"Capriotti's. Good sandwiches, but not all connect. Capastrami, greasy pastrami, Swiss, cole slaw, Russian dressing. Reubenesque. Bread holds up. Cheesesteaks, Italian subs, dense bread, no flavor. Meat, grisly, dry, bland. Bobbie, mayo, gross. Turkey, good on cold subs, provolone, hot peppers. Jersey Mike's, better cold subs. Pop's, cheesesteaks, Vegas."

"Went to this joint with a bunch of friends, had to wait a bit. Small place, real trendy, so expect a delay. Red velvet pancakes? Too sweet, overhyped. Love red velvet, but with chocolate chips and icing, it's too much. Buttermilk pancakes, now those are good. Nice and moist, perfect with butter and syrup. Got corned beef hash too, it was solid, but the potatoes were nothing special."

"I checked out the Casino, since I was crashin' at the Palazzo next door. Had high hopes, but it was packed with foreigners takin' pics and movin' slow. Found one slot game I dug, but some dude's fam took up all the other machines and they weren't even playin'. Wanted to hit the tables, but too many folks millin' around. Might stop by again, though. Had a decent vibe."

"Been here thrice. Twice through the drive-thru, once inside. Glad I did. Cook, stawky white guy, no gloves. He hits my chair, elbow on the way to the john, no words. I go, no paper towels. Use the blower, loud as hell. Means he didn't wash his hands. Walk out, he's got a handful of bacon. My friend, bacon burger. Oh, and his crack's showin' when he bends over. Good burgers and fries, but not worth his presence."

"Pink's in So Cal, I'd heard about it. Always wanted to try it. Saw one in Vegas, got excited. Disappointment, at least. Mushroom swiss dog, six-fifty. Rubbery hot dog, not enough cheese. Moments of goodness, but few. Too many mushrooms, not enough cheese. Proportion, that's the key. Maybe next time, try something else. Heard their chili cheese dog's great."

"Rose St's got plenty of waterin' holes, so how's a joint like the Auld Hundred stand out? It don't, really. But that's what the regulars want: a place they can count on for a steady pour and a plate of grub. No frills, just the basics done right. That's what you'll get here: good portions, decent beer selection. A-OK."

"Stayed here for a bachelor party. Great spot, close to hotels I dig. Appreciated the discount, courtesy of my buddies' player points. Rooms were clean, staff was solid. Liked their sportsbook. Too bad I didn't get to try their grub. Would stay again for the price, but there are better joints in Vegas."

"Staff's good, attentive. Brought the kids one night, got dinner. Predictable bar grub, fried and heavy, but not bad. Weeknight visit, musician playing, couldn't hear ourselves think. Loud, man. Giving three stars 'cause of the service. Two stars otherwise, ain't no place for a date or family dinner. Good spot to catch a game or meet someone you don't wanna talk to."

"Food's alright. If you're in the neighborhood, grab a bite. But if you're hankerin' for real Chinese grub, head down to Spring Mountain or California. Had some killer Chinese in LA recently, so this place didn't quite measure up. It's like Panda Express - decent, but not authentic."

"Hadn't had Papa John's in a year. One of the better chains, conveniently on my route home from work. Scored a $10 gift card for $5 on Saveology. Their large specialty pizzas were $11.
