Not huge, but the Spinach Alfredo was decent. Missed the butter sauce and pepperoncini in the box, but understood. Service was slow, two registers but only one person working, lots of folks standing around. Would stop again if the price was right."

"KA. Not your typical Cirque du Soleil. More focused on Asian themes, sword fighting, acrobatics. Storyline, but not my cup of tea. Language and characters, like Tarzan-ish guy, hard to take in. Glad I got cheap tix, but not my fave. Vertical platform, last scene with fighting, favorite part. Other parts, meh."

"Good spot for work and lunch when you forget yours at home. Went at lunchtime, not too busy, so the combo of free Wi-Fi and big tables was perfect. They got a good variety of dishes and the service is solid. Had two salads: veggie and mustard, then veggie and oriental noodles, or just plain soy sauce. Both were great and I liked having a non-bread option. They also got hot dishes and daily specials that change regularly. All in all, it's a place that mixes cafe vibes with a no-frills atmosphere. Cash only, but there's an ATM on site."

We hit this joint for grub on a Friday night, me and seven other cats. We had a reservation, but it was late, 9:45, and they sat us outside. No biggie, but we missed out on the inside vibe. Kobe meatballs were solid, man. I went for an eight-ounce filet. Good stuff, but it didn't come with much else. Asparagus was heaped and tasty, though. Filets were cooked right and seasoned nice. Most others got pasta, looked decent. Service was on point. Not cheap, but not too pricey either. Just felt a little underwhelmed, you know? Like, pay more for better grub or less for something junky. No major gripes, but nothing blew my mind either.

"Hit up this joint for their 2-for-$5 fish sandwich deal. Not bad, but the bread overpowered the fish. Side salad? Forget about it - just iceberg lettuce. Service was top-notch, though. Lady manager's doin' a swell job. Place looks nice, but the grub ain't worth another visit."

"Good eatin' and good drinkin'. Pasta on point, just like they said. Asked the waiter about the wine, he knew his stuff. Ended up with more than just a snack. Classy joint, nice people, damn good food."
I ordered a venti green tea lemonade, but they gave me a tall instead. I was in a hurry to get to school, so I didn't bother correcting them. I wished the usual girls who took my order were there.
"South Phoenix got the best damn donuts. Makes workin' there worth it. Maple bar, fantastic."

"This joint's got one thing goin' for it - their bread. It's got character, ya know? Unique look, texture, and taste. Rest of the menu's pretty meh, overpriced too. Small sandwiches costin' five, six bucks? Nuh-uh. Service ain't great either, few people workin', cashier gets antsy when you're takin' your time. Drive-thru's my go-to now. Building's old, parkin's a pain, but I still come back for that bread. Get the small original, it's decent. But honestly, if they switched to regular bread, I wouldn't bother."

"Front cafe's got fresh-baked white cookies for five bucks. Damn good deal. Inside, the restaurant's got long waits and water refills that'll drive you mad. Skip the Sunday pasta, it'll ruin your gut. Stick to the cookies, they're worth every penny."

"Food was good, but something was off. Maybe the noise from the casino or the slow service. We sat down quick, no reservation needed. Menu was short but had some variety. I went with the prime steak panini and potato salad. Flavors were on point, especially with the BBQ sauce and a touch of horseradish. Potato salad was top-notch, not too sour and just the right amount of mayo. Service, though, was slow. Took forever to get the check and my card back. Only saw the server once after the food arrived."
"Beet salad, fantastic. Service, new but clumsy. Spilled water on my table mid-meal. Short rib loco moco, too salty."

"3.5 stars. Went with friends for the open bar. Cover was steep, bouncers were rude. TAO looks sharp. Made me hungry walking through the restaurant. Got there early, no issues with space. Main goal was drinks, didn't explore other dance floors. Basic well drinks were off, waited too long for drinks. Felt good leaving, music was alright. Didn't know Dash Berlin was playing, good thing we left before it got packed. Danced with plenty of space. Not a bad time at TAO, but need another visit to explore."

"High hopes brought me here, but what I found was a local joint that didn't quite live up to the hype. My burger? Dry as the Sahara. Fries? Meh. Crunchy, sure, but lacking any real flavor. But hey, at least the ingredients were fresh. Not frozen, mind you. Bacon in every bite, that's for sure. Lettuce was crisp, too. Decent lunch, I guess. Overpriced, though. Won't be making a return trip anytime soon, but if I lived nearby, I might give it another shot instead of hitting up a fast food joint."
"North Scottsdale, good spot for a gyro. Friendly staff, quick service, and a fair price - 7-10 bucks a pop. That's how it goes in these parts."

"Chinese food here ain't half bad. Had some decent grub in the past, maybe that's why this place didn't impress me much. Egg rolls too salty, hot and sour soup not sour enough, veggie pork bland. Not a fan of over-seasoning. Place is quick and affordable though, might give it another shot."

"Grampa's Pizzeria - a name that fits like a glove.

No one makes pizza like Gramps. It's delicious, through and through. Quality ingredients, flavors that pop. I love Gramps and his pizza, simple as that.

But my last visit had me wondering if the old man's losing his touch. The host gave us a funny look, like we were strangers in his house. Should've known something was up. Appetizer comes out, it's cold as ice. I ask, "You forget to cook this?" They poke it, shrug, and toss it back in the oven.

Then, the pizza. Don't know what happened, but our server says it'll be a while. Free beer for the wait, courtesy of Gramps. Generous to a fault, that one.

Place was dead, three couples tops. Good thing, too. Busy Monday would've sent Gramps into a tizzy."

"Haven't had my eyes checked in a while. Probably just for my driver's license or some other thing. Never had a real exam. Until now. Denise got hers done, so I figured I should too. Signed up and went to the Christenbury Eye Center. They're pros. Check in, shuffle from room to room. Don't know what they're doing, but they seem to know their stuff. Famous people on the walls say they're good. You can get laser eye surgery there too. Gave me drops to dilate my eyes. Screwed up my vision for the day. But, my eyes are fine. Hope I don't have to go back soon."

Last night, went there for the first time. Took ages to get in. Some joker started a scrap with us 'cause they didn't like us parked next to 'em. Couldn't hear parts of the flick 'cause of the racket from the neighborin' movie. Helicopters flyin' around, real distractin'. But hey, prices were decent for tickets, plus we had coupons. Not bad.

"Airports ain't for the faint of heart. Morning and afternoon flights, especially. Folks getting on those planes, they're usually feeling pretty rough. Hungover, you know? Like they've been put through a wringer. And the airport itself, it don't help none. It's loud, it's bright, it's a real sensory assault. Makes you wonder who thought this was a good idea."
"Good eatery. Menu, top-notch. Service, spotty. Atmosphere, lackin' juice. Grub, decent. Grits and pork belly, my jam. Quality, high. Pricey, yeah."

"Pizza joint with the kid. Large slice, plenty of toppings, bit oily, but that's the pepperoni's fault. Not bad, though. Fast service, too. Will try something else next time. No fountain drinks, but that's a minor gripe."
"Meatballs, man. They make up for the crap service. Terrace, Strip view, perfect weather. Fun."

"Thursday night, June 28th, I stopped by for a bite and a drink. Place was jumpin', packed tight, elbows bumpin' into each other. Service was top-notch, but the grub was pricey, thin-crust pizza cooked to a crisp. Bathrooms? Tiny, single-person jobs. Don't blink or you'll miss 'em. Might be worth another visit, might not."

"Good Asian grub, that's what I'm a fan of. Don't know much about Korean food, but I know what I like. Went to this place in downtown Chandler, simple decor, not too fancy. Service was quick, we were the second table. Ordered the Korean BBQ ribs, and I got the dolsot. Meat was greasy, fatty, light sweet sauce, just how it should be. Dolsot came in a hot stone bowl, had to stir it up with my spoon, mix it all together, get it nice and crispy. Not a lot of flavor, but different, you know? Sides were alright, a bit plain, but good with the spicy kim-chee. Apples and mayonnaise, who knew Koreans ate that too? A good option when you want something different in downtown Chandler."
"Good grub, but the fuku burger fell short. Overpriced for what you get. Not impressed with the patty or the fixin's. Togarashi fries? Meh. It's in a neat food court though."

"Five-star service, bread with olive paste, not bad. Calamari? Bland, too salty. Pesto gnocchi? Mediocre, like Chef Boyardee with green sauce. Steak? Way too much pepper, Alfredo sauce for pasta? Olive Garden looks like Ruth's Chris. Dessert? Good. Bread and dessert, yes. Food? Heck no."

Yesterday, I visited this place to catch a postseason game with some fellow Yelpers. The joint was decent, with plenty of TVs and a non-smoking entrance for those who prefer fresh air. But, if you wanna shoot some stick or use the men's room, you gotta brave the smoky patio. Speaking of which, the men's room could use a good scrubbin'. My feet stuck to the floor like glue.

They had a nice selection of beers on tap, but I was hankerin' for a burger. Turns out, the table orders were plentiful, so I settled for some nachos, hot wings, an onion ring, a potato skin, and a cheese stick. Solid bar grub, but nothing too impressive. Service was hit or miss - sometimes attentive, other times MIA. They were out of a few things, like iced tea and some beers, but hey, at least they didn't give us a hard time about mixin' in some H2O.

Overall, it's a good neighborhood spot, but don't expect anything fancy.

"Pizza delivered to hotel. Box opened, pie looked good. Ingredients as requested. Cut in squares, like a true Chicago pie. Epic fail, though. Can't pick up a slice with all ingredients on top. Three of us, two never had Chicago style thin crust. No cutlery, mess ensued. Hand-pulled empty slices, tried putting ingredients on each slice. Gave up. If can't cut pie, create crappy experience. 3 stars for fresh ingredients, great sauce, owner added Giardiniera. Minus 2 stars for mess. Had higher hopes."

"Went here years back, thought it was swell. Latest trip, not so much. Five-star review, now three. Nothin' special 'bout this buffet, 'cept it's in the Paris hotel. Not even that big a spread. Lotsa fish dishes, don't care for 'em. Sunday evening wait, an hour! Not worth it."

"Lemongrass, a joint that typifies the grub game my missus and I often face on holiday. Thai chow, mediocre at best. Spring rolls, frozen and flavorless, veggies mushy. Pho, cinnamon-heavy. Singapore Noodles, spicy and decent, but not worth the wait. Service? Forget about it. Don't bother booking a table; try somewhere else."

"Betty Lou's brunch cruise, a sweet gig, but room for improvement. Pros: taste and amount of food, quality of atmosphere/boat. Cons: value for price, selection of seats, availability of crew/service. Disappointing start, shoved aside by rowdy kids. Get there early, line up in front of the wooden dock. Food, amazing! Mimosas, tasty but weak. Difficult to get the crew's attention. Scenic views, captain spins the boat for photo ops."

"Love this joint, but feel outta place. Twenty years too young, maybe? Dig the tunes, though - real music. Can't tell if I'm young with good taste or if everyone else here's older. Showed up on a Friday, Baddness played. Funky vibes, no blues. Seemed like something straight outta Mystery Train. Red suits, sequined coat - badass. A+ for music and style. Not sure 'bout this place being a blues house, though. Rhythm Room's more my speed. Feel like I shoulda been born twenty years earlier."

"My visit was just alright. Me and my bro ordered but didn't finish our meals. Maybe we just weren't hungry. Or maybe we don't know good Asian food. Who knows? The owner was super nice though. Like, too nice. He showed us a picture book of their menu. It was cool, I guess. Would I go back? Nah, not unless I'm already there and someone else wants to go."

"I'd passed by that restaurant plenty of times before, and it always gave me a warm, welcoming feel. I told myself I'd stop in one day, and I finally did. The service was good, but the grub wasn't worth the scratch. It was overpriced, like something off the tourist menu. Tofu Hut has better options for less dough. If the food was as good as the joint looked, I'd have given 'em another star. But it was just alright."
"Food's good, but Jesus, the MSG'll get ya. Not usually a problem for me, but this place'll put some hair on your chest."

"Stuffed animals? Who needs 'em? Not me. I passed on the dirty thing. Just wanted my grub. But no food came. Huh? Maybe it was the stuffed animal. So I got one. And waited. Still nothing. What gives?

Chuy's, huh? Like those surf n' turf taco joints by the beach. Meat, seafood, smells good, but needs more spice. Big menu, lots of options. Fried chicken? Yeah, weird. 

I went for the Broiled Whitefish Taco Platter ($6) and a side of Shrimp Skewers ($4). That shrimp skewer, man, add some lemon juice, hot sauce, and that's a meal. Fish didn't taste fresh, don't know what whitefish is. Rice, beans, standard. Cabbage salad, needs work. 

Not impressed, but I'd go back. Try their $2 margaritas. All day, every day. Now we're talking."

"Hot as hell outside, we waited 20 minutes to be seated at Serendipity. Food was good, huge portions, but overpriced. Couldn't handle dessert, too full and hot. Came back next day, tried frozen hot chocolate and oreo version at walk-up window. Oreo one was better, richer taste. Posted pics. Will try NY location next."
"Dollar underwear. Ten-dollar bras. Hell yeah, I'm in. *Only in sale section, and good luck finding your size."

"Tacos, simple street style, like 'em. Al pastor, asada, both tasty. Al pastor, nice spice. Green tamale, gross. Masa, barely any cheese or green chile. Can't find good tamales around here. Jamaica to drink, wished I got horchata instead. Watered down, sour. Come for tacos, skip rest."
"Vegas, twice a year. Different casinos, but Excalibur's my favorite. Clean, comfy, and affordable. Leave a tip for the maid, Clementine. She leaves a thank you note. First time that's happened."

"Costco ain't all it's cracked up to be. Parking's a bitch, but that's standard. Samples are the real draw for me, but this joint's got subpar offerings. Slow service, constant shortages, and inefficient replenishment. Other Costcos do it better. \n\nBut hey, I still dig the beer and wine selection. And those discount restaurant cards are clutch. Just don't expect me to be all smiles when the sample situation's lacking."

"Tasty pizza, unique style, three stars. But slow service, no slices, no lunch special. Industrial area customers need quick turnaround, 20 minutes max. Get it together, guys. Add slices, a slice and a drink deal. Basic stuff, common at other pizza joints. Would appreciate the opportunity to enjoy your pizza more often, with reasonable time and price." (298 tokens)

"We found this joint and decided to grab some grub. Had the hummus and chips, onion rings, fries. It was all good. Service was decent until it got slow, then it was like they forgot about us. I tried to flag someone down, but they just ignored me."

"Dropped in for dinner with friends. Hadn't tried the BBQ yet, so I split the big boy plate with my girl. All the BBQ was good, but the chicken was a bit dry. Pullled pork was decent, though. Place has a dated vibe, but who cares? Feels like a neighborhood joint. Service was top-notch. Problem is, there's better BBQ in Charlotte. This spot's easy to miss."

"I met the inventor of the soft serve ice-cream machine and asked him how he came up with the idea. He told me he was walking his dog, Toots, when it suddenly took a dump on a neighbor's lawn. The neighbor, an attorney, threatened to take action if it happened again. The next time Toots did its business, the inventor was inspired by the way it pinched off a creamy brown dump. He wanted his ice-cream machine to do the same, so he created a machine that cleanly pinches off the ice cream, just like Toots. I used to love frozen yogurt, but now that I have to serve it up, all I can think about is the strange inspiration behind the machine's design."

"Galaxy? Nah, not worth it. People who work there? Weirdos. Twice in one week, twice disappointed. Breakfast sandwiches? Alright, but overpriced. Coffee? Nothing special. Almond syrup, though. That's a plus. Star Wars decor? Cool, but not enough. Poor customer service ruins it."

"Lunch stop. Nice specials, miso soup, salad, sashimi, rice. Friendly staff. Miso, great. Salad, wilted, bell peppers, no good. Rice, didn't come out. Confused service, disorganized, friendly. Commented on salad, no replacement. Rice, huge, dry, nasty, didn't eat. Tuna sashimi, excellent. Wasabi, powerful. White ginger, dry. Needs improvement. $12 lunch, plus tip."
"Food's good, but getting it's a bitch. They promise, but don't deliver. Manager finally brings it out, 15 minutes late."
"Las Americas, Colombian grub. Genuine stuff, friendly folk, but nothing that'll knock your socks off."

"What I like 'bout this joint? I'm the youngest customer by a mile. Been around long enough to remember when phones were stuck to walls, y'know? Nowadays, it's all about the deals on veggies and such. Old folks love 'em. Sometimes, I can slip in and out without feelin' like I'm in a zombie flick. Prices can be steep, but stick to the good stuff and you'll do alright. Oh, and the parkin' spots? Plenty big for my Buick."

"Place was decent. Hubby and I grabbed takeout, enjoyed it. Chili rellenos, top-notch. Veggie salad, meh. Mostly lettuce. Black beans, spicy and salty. Bring rice or tortilla. Won't dine in, not comfy. But, good takeout. Snickerdoodle, nice touch."
"Place was bigger than I thought. Great spot for games. Didn't have a drink, but the deals looked solid. Dead as a doornail that night, but I wanna give it another shot when it's hoppin'."

"Town search for Jin's chicken and fish led us astray. Not at Francis spot. Found this joint instead. Satisfying after bar snack. Never for a meal, but good enough after drinks. Chicken sandwich: two fingers drenched in hot sauce, mayo, small lettuce piece on a thin bun. Did the trick."

"Healthy-ish options on the menu. Breakfast till 10:30 am would be better if it was all-day. I got the chicken beer bread, grilled chicken in a wrap with fries or salad. I got the fries, trying to be good, but it was a mistake. Processed chicken, covered in melted cheese. I picked out the good stuff, but the wrap was cut up and too wet to cut. Odd combo of dance music soundtrack. Not quite right here. If I had to come again, I'd go with fish and chips or a burger."

"Chicken soltani, $17.99. Not bad, but the boneless chunks of chicken? Forget it. Beef kabob, $16.99. Looked better than it tasted. Needed more seasoning, texture was off. 

But, Basmati rice? Fluffy, delicious. Big portions, too. Enough for two. Should've split one. 

Hummus? Decent. Yogurt and cucumber dip? Too much dill. 

Sit-down joint. Open interior, two lit-up trees in the middle. Casual spot? Keep lookin'."

"Ceres, a joint inside JW Marriott, was a spot I won't forget. Brunch with a bunch of Yelpers, and I paid for two. Life-changing, you know? Food, music, the works. Only downside was the parking lot, some jerk almost ran me over. Buffet-style brunch, decent spread. Waffle and omelet stations, but they gave mine to some grumpy old broad. Eggs, hashbrowns, sausage, bacon, Danishes, bread, potatoes, the usual. For $20+ per head, it was just alright."

"This joint's always dead, but it stays open late. That's two thumbs up from me. The grub's not half bad either, but they skimp on the quality of their meat. Fatty slices of beef, that's what they serve. Still, it's a decent deal for the price. Service is good, attentive even. It's never busy when I go, which is usually late at night. So, if you're out and about past midnight, this could be your Plan B. Not a bad backup plan, if I do say so myself."

"Breezed in and out. Rarely hit up Chipotle, but when I did, it was right down the street. Not busy inside, plenty of other eateries around. Depends on what you're in the mood for. \n\nStaff was friendly, had to ask them to repeat themselves a couple times, though. Still young, dammit! Food was solid, nice warm burrito on a chilly day. Will stop back, ask for less red salsa next time."

"Been here a spell. Great times, till last couple visits. Always came during the day, staff on top of things, food, drinks, refills, checkin' in. Hit the bar after. Evening visit, place packed, group of nine. Server didn't show much. Ordered food all at once, avoid confusion. He smiled, but knew somethin' was off. Three plates arrived, rest forgotten. Drinks took fifteen minutes. Had to track down server for the tab. Still a great spot, but nighttime's a bust."

"Food was good. Had a burger, tots, and some mac and cheese. Boyfriend's catfish Po'boy was top-notch. Onion rings were meh. Went to catch the Panthers game, sound was on, and service was decent. Beer selection? Meh. Few taps and where's the local brew? Oh, and a palmeto bug joined us for dinner. Not ideal, but what can you do?"

"Rooms small, bathrooms dingy. Clean though. Vintage feel. Shower, freezing or scalding. Old building. Not wild about $20 resort fee for spotty WiFi. No pool either. Price is decent though. Fremont Street Experience outside our window. Dumpsters too. Partygoers might not mind."

"Good grub, chill vibes, decent beer selection... solid spot to kick it with fam or pals, no need for fancy-schmancy food. Mix-and-match six-pack is a sweet deal if you're grabbing a drink to go, saves you a trip to the bottle shop. Only downside, service can drag ass, like they're juggling tables instead of keeping it real zen."

"Food was good, but the bill caused a stir. Luke, the server, did his job well, making sure everything was A-okay, especially on a busy Saturday. Food came out quick, fries a bit undercooked, but the sandwiches made up for it. The real issue was the price of the bloody mary's. The menu outside said $6, but we got charged $8. When we brought it up, the waiter seemed confused. We were in a rush, so we paid the bill. But we won't forget the $12 extra we paid for the bloody mary's. If we go back, we'll make sure to bring it up again."

"I didn't dig this joint back in the day, but word is they've revamped the menu. Now they're rockin' organic ciabatta rolls and ditched that high fructose corn syrup. They're even the first restaurant to cut out trans fat completely. Their Royal with light mustard is top-notch, and I usually swap out the meat for turkey or ham if I'm feelin' fancy. It's a solid spot now, and I frequent it often. Heard they throw in some soft serve with every meal too. Not sure why I didn't know that. Maybe it's 'cause they got a lesbian workin' there who's skinnier than me. Just kiddin', sorta."

"Had the ice cream cookie sandwich from next door. Needed a bit more. So, tried their version of fro yo. Sweet and tart, but not bad. Customer service though? Top-notch. Friendly, eager dudes. A breath of fresh air compared to the usual sourpusses."

"Went there once, had good wings and fries. They got subs, wraps, burgers, fish, chicken, all that. Reminds me of back home. Been here seven years, first time I found a place like this. Small corner, keep your eyes peeled."
"Smog check, that's what I needed. Price was nineteen ninety-five, but with the coupon, fourteen ninety-five. Not bad, in and out quick, cheaper than Jiffy Smog."
"Packed joint. Dance floor? Tiny. Bottle service? Everywhere. Reserved? You bet. Flirted my way in. Sorry, fellas."

"Fast Chinese food, like a strip mall. Exactly what you'd expect. Good for a quick family meal, but don't expect high cuisine. Had beef and broccoli, kung pao chicken, and sweet and sour chicken. All good for picky eaters. Staff is Chinese, and a few words in Mandarin go a long way. Nothing special, but a decent value for a mid-week meal."
"Grillin' up some steaks, just like you wanted. Good ol' ham and roast beef, too. Price was right, and the kids couldn't get enough."

"Didn't come back 'cause last time was a bust. Honey toast, twelve bucks ninety-nine cents, and it wasn't worth it. But we couldn't find any other joint to play cards, so here we are again. Service is better than that tea place, but still too rich for my blood."
Food was fresh, authentic, but overpriced. Owner and girl behind counter were nice. Will I return? Maybe, but only for a light meal. The bill adds up quick with $2 drinks and $3 desserts.

"The West Room's got style, no doubt. Cocktails, top-notch. But the grub? Meh. Not worth another trip, in my book. They call themselves the west end's hidden gem. Maybe, but not quite hidden enough, if you know what I mean. Worth a look, sure, but not worth making a habit of it."

"Family from Korea visits, craves familiarity in Vegas. Plan: Grand Lux. Detour: Imperial Palace. Elevator to 5th floor dining plaza. Familiar Korean greeting. Grandma smiles, feels better. Menu: Korean, Japanese, Chinese. Opt for Korean. Duk mandoo gook, dolsot bibimbap, soft tofu soup, bulgogi. Meh. Grandma eats with gusto. Expensive mediocrity ($90+tax&tip for lunch!). Friendly staff. Won't return, but appreciate service and convenience."

"Plane ride over, we stepped into a joint and had us a nice lunch. Calamari, salad, scallops, ceviche, tuna skewers - all good stuff. Presentation was top-notch too. But for two people, $80 felt like a lot for just a light meal. No drinks either."

"Went to CUT with friends. Portion's good, bread sticks are great. Steak's a bit burnt, taste's alright. Price is fair, lots of staff for few guests. Service feels forced, not too friendly. Lighting's too dark, can't see the grub. Might give it another shot."
"Menu's too big. They can't seem to nail anything but cheesecake and chicken pasta. Had five dishes, all mediocre. One was so bad, I sent it back. Never do that."

"I had dinner with my boy at Cafe Zupas. Underwhelmed, that's how I felt. I was looking forward to a solid sandwich and some good soup. The grilled cheese was a letdown, not much flavor. The red pepper lobster bisque was alright, a bit thick though. I'll give Zupas another chance, hoping my next sandwich choice will be better."
"Blue Man Group. Not bad. Some good bits. Some slow spots. Hubby? More critical. Thought it was mostly dull. Pricey tix. Not worth it. Maybe cheaper. Funny parts. Neat parts. Meh parts. Three stars."

"This joint's got it all. Good grub, stiff drinks, and a killer wine list. Service is top-notch too. But let's talk about the music. They crank it up loud on Fridays and Saturdays, so forget about chatting if you're in the main room. It's a foot-stompin' good time, but you won't be able to hear yourself think."

"In-laws in town? Needed something to do with 'em. This place fit the bill. Tourist trap, through and through. Lots of knick-knacks for sale, all costing extra. Snapped some great photos, though. Learned a bit of history too. Won't be back, but glad I went. Once was enough."

"Vegas has more to offer than just this mall. Only come here if it's unbearably hot or cold outside and you need a place to chill indoors. It's a nice mall, sure, but there are better deals at the outlet malls nearby if you're looking to save some cash."

"Went to this joint with some pals. Menu looked like Greek to me. Counter was a mess too. Ended up with a turkey sandwich, but they must've used that damn Miracle Whip instead of Mayo. Not my cup of tea."

"Went to this joint after readin' some decent reviews. Pellini's an Italian burrito, ya gotta choose your meat - chicken, steak, sausage, or shrimp. Then there's the sauces - tomato or white - and toppings - cheese or veggies. Lotsa options, so you can mix it up and make it your own. 
Had the chicken and sausage myself, wasn't too impressed. Maybe I just put it together wrong. My wife got the chicken and shrimp, and she said it was pretty damn good. Shrimp made all the difference. 
Decor was modern, clean. Service was solid too - friendly, helpful folks. 
Not sure if I'll be back, but my wife liked it, so we'll see."

Napoleon's Dueling Piano Bar. Gold Medal - Extraordinary Pianist. Silver Medal - Peppy Fun Environment. Bronze Medal - Free Entrance. These pianists know every song. Journey to Metallica. Amazing. People sang, danced, and drank. No admission fee or drink minimum. You pay for what you want. Request a song, pay a tip with the song's name. Crowd mainly 40 years old+. Younger hipsters hit dance clubs. HAPPY DUELING!!!

"Came here for lunch a few days back. Place had a nice feel to it, warm and cozy inside while the storm raged on outside. Service was good, not too pushy. Had the halloumi sandwich with ciabatta and salad. Salad was fresh, halloumi was good, but the ciabatta didn't do much for me. Didn't think it brought out the best in the halloumi either, even with the chilli jelly. Carrot cake for dessert was a bit dry. Better carrot cake in town. But I'll be back, heard their eggs benedict is solid."
"This joint's alright. Cheap, too. Food's not bad, but nothing special. We go there often 'cause it's convenient. Worth a visit."

"Spinato's, three times. Takeout, twice. Dining room, once. Thoughts? Pizza, good. Overpriced, yes. Service? Craptastic. First time, wrong pizza. Waited ten minutes. No discount. Third time, called order. Told me 30-35 minutes. Actual wait, 57 minutes. Complained, takeout person blank stared. No apology, no discount. Bad service sends me elsewhere. Grimaldi's, worth the money?"

"Caramel, a joint for a quick drink before the night gets wild. Nothing special, but it'll do. We walked in, met up with some friends, and grabbed a reserved table. Small place, random crowd, but the music was alright and the infused vodka was decent. Not worth staying long, but a good spot to start the night."
"Tuna entree, $35. Not my thing. But their cocktails, now that's a different story. Happy hour, that's when you'll find me at the bar."

"Cirque shows, I love 'em. Seen Ovo and Zumanity before, so I was pumped when my boyfriend scored comp tix for his birthday in Vegas. Our seats were sweet, middle row, six up from the stage. Set was gorgeous, water acts, beautiful. But, I gotta say, I was a little let down. Comedy, not so funny. Clown humor, meh. Boring, you know? Expected more acrobatics, but aside from some diving and fire dancers, it was eh. Story, didn't get it. Some scenes, confusing. Guy with the 1-800 sign, no idea. Red coat dudes, nightmare fuel. Still love Cirque, but "O" was just alright. Glad we didn't pay and we were yawning at the end. Next time, gonna check out Ka or Mystere."

"Pub's alright, but it's a Vegas thing, ya know? Pricey pints, too. Food's good, though. Had some pork belly, eggs, and maple glaze. Real tasty. Service at the table, though? Passive aggressive. Fish and chips were meh. For the cost, I'd want better grub and service. Still, if you're on the Strip and need a cold one, it's an option."

"Famous Dave's got some good eatin', especially the catfish. But the service? Forget about it. Our server jabbered on for ten minutes about his name, then had the balls to ask for donations for his charity. And the manager? Nowhere to be found. We got screwed on our order, big time. But hey, that's what you get when you mix poor service with a side of selfishness."

Nobody likes the DMV. That's a fact. But I gave it three stars for the self-service kiosks. In and out in under ten minutes. Best thing they ever did. Now, I only dread it when I gotta see a human. Check the website for what you can do at the kiosk. They got 'em in other places too, like AAA and grocery stores.
"Food was decent. Done better tapas, but this was still good. Crowd was young and packed tight. Weekends too busy, but worth another visit. Plenty other options though."

"Good service, cozy joint. Heater blew hot air beneath our feet, tables cramped in our section. Living Social deal made dinner affordable. Escargot and French onion soup, both tasty. Frog legs, unavailable. Ribeye steak, disappointing. Meat lacked flavor, some parts tough and rubbery. Enjoyed the soup and appetizer, but left feeling unsatisfied due to subpar steak. Will return, eager to sample other menu items."
"Skip the bananas, kid. They're refrigerated and turn brown by day's end. Dole's the worst."
"Prices good, selection great. Staff? Not so much. Bad day, maybe. Need chairs for reading."

"Fillet mignon, mediocre. Bring your own wine, overrated. Better steakhouses in the Old Port, many. Meat lover, I am. Better steak at home, I can make. Less money, same effort. Corporate dinner, weeknight, not too busy, not too pricey, not too despicable. Recommend, I would."
"Fries, good. Burgers, bad. Eat here more, improve burgers."

"Place was just okay. Old timey vibe, old timey crowd. Went for business lunch, lots of older dudes from Phoenix. Zero ambiance, looked like a Best Western dining hall. Ordered prime rib, was a bit disappointed. Not very tender, flavor was meh. Au jus was lackluster too. Potatoes weren't great either. Companion's filet was decent though. Can't give it a bad review, but not gonna rave about it either. Prices are a bit steep for unimpressive grub. Meh on Stockyards...life's too short for mediocre chow."

"Love-hate thing with this joint. Used to come here for all my nail needs, but last few times, they started doing gel mani/pedi at the same time. Too much, you know? Like they're trying to take the relaxation out of it. But, they do have one of the better pedicures in Vegas. The hot stone one, it's awesome."

I wanted coffee, bad. It was 10:45 on a Saturday and I knew a place close by. But, damn it, it was closed. I searched for another joint, wanting to sit and read the Times with a hot cup. I thought I'd stop at the Drip, but it looked too modern for my mood. I wanted something simple, nothing fancy. Then, I saw this old dude waving a sign that read "Best lunch in town!" and dancing. I thought, "Hell yeah, that's where I'm going." It was MacAlpines, just opening up. I sat at the counter, had two cups of good diner coffee, and realized I was hungry. So, I ordered a stuffed tomato, which was delicious, with fresh veggies. The place had a great vibe, cozy and inviting, and the jukebox was cool. I'll give it three stars, though, 'cause the staff took a bit to warm up. Maybe it was 'cause they'd just opened or maybe it was 'cause I was still half-asleep and needed caffeine bad. Either way, I wanna go back, with friends next time, and see how it goes.

"Not their best, but still on the strip. Renovations made it a bit rough, but portions were huge. Split two dishes among three of us and left full. Would've chosen chicken and waffles, but democracy won. Tried chorizo skillet and Tractor Driver Combo. Skillet was good, but one tortilla wasn't enough. Upgraded to a banana pancake, worth the extra buck. Service was top-notch. Experience at their other spot on Sahara was better, but this was still solid."
"Twenty-first birthday, here I was. Fun, yes, but small, too small. Double capacity, felt like. DJ, awesome, dance floor, too small, crowded."
"Food was good, plenty of it too. Menu had a nice variety. But damn, it took us over an hour to get our grub, even though the joint wasn't packed. Worth it for the eats, but plan on waiting a spell."

"Island Flavor, a spot in Vegas that claims to serve authentic Hawaiian grindz. I was skeptical, but the portions were huge. Kahlua pork was tender, but needed more salt. Sweet and sour pork ribs were tasty, but too salty. Furikake chicken was bomb, especially with Sriracha. Rice was a letdown, though. Brown rice was mushy, and fried rice was just white rice with lapcherng and veggies drenched in soy sauce. Not impressed. COCO PUFFS were yum, though. Mud pie was good, especially the chocolate cacao or coffee nibs in the kona coffee ice cream. Staff was friendly, despite being busy. Spam musubi was on point, reminding me of all the musubis we've had in Hawaii."

"Massages, I love 'em. Hubby got me a couples massage gift card for Christmas. Easy peasy to schedule. Clean joint, therapeutic waitin' room. Massage room? Meh. Barely decorated, weird layout. Therapists? Friendly, pro. But, meh, massage was just okay. Had better. They push membership hard when you check out. Don't like that."

"Jerk fried rice wasn't as spicy as I remembered. Portions were smaller, too. But still tasty. Black beans trump refried. Service was good. Staff was friendly and helpful. Order paper's confusing, but they'll guide you through it."

"Sipping coffee at Starbucks, I noticed the Wells Fargo ATM. Not a soul in sight, all three lanes empty. Almost like a four-star review, I thought. 

It's an alright spot, but not in my neck of the woods. Traffic's a bitch, too. In and out of the Trails Center, it's a hassle. 

Lived here over ten years, this is my first check-in. Says a lot."

"Fin's prices are steep for Chinese grub, but the staff's attention is over the top. They'll refill your water before you can even take a sip. The food's good, though. I had the stir-fry chicken and it hit the spot. They finish off the meal with a tasty homemade fortune cookie and a shot of Baileys. The ambiance is great if you sit near the back and can tune out the slot machines. It's a solid choice for a nice dinner, just be prepared for the prices and excessive service."

"It's well-stocked, but lacks that neighborhood feel. Twice now, I've been short-changed. Not a friendly query, just a suspicious glare. A pound or so, not pennies. They're onto me, too. Overcharged for a Coke, I pointed out the mistake. 'Oh, we undercharged you by accident,' he said. Nice try. And don't bother haggling. I tried for 20p off Snapple, but only the Old Man can sanction such deals. The others looked startled, even scared."

"DAILY LUNCH BUFFET! Monica O. led the charge at a UYE today, 15 of us devouring tasty Thai grub and solid Yelpie camaraderie. Thanks, Monica! The spread featured 15 items: two soups, veggie and tofu, coconut and chicken. Plain and fancy rice, plenty of hot dishes - chicken, beef, fish - and veggie combos galore. Good eats all around. Three Thai buffets in the Valley, this one's a gem. Comfy digs, decent service, but a few gripes: too much repetition on the meat front, no sweets, and a silly single-card policy. Cash-strapped Yelpers, beware! Lunch Buffet: Tue-Fri, $9.99, 11:30 AM. Sun, $10.99, 12 PM."
"Tacos for lunch. Corn tortillas, respect. Fish good, tofu mix interesting, but tacos not great. Location nice though. Bar spacious, patio likely pleasant."
"Interior's got character, popular spot, and tea's a steal. Wish they'd stay open later."
"Price was fair. Concept was neat, but I prefer 5 Guys. What A Burger, that's my jam. Classic, through and through. In-N-Out was bumpin', good grub, but the burgers? Meh, too much fuss."

"Most of these new reviews are probably from employees and their kin. 

Wouldn't honor my Groupon, prepaid no less. Same joint, same owners, same sign - Greek Grill & Fry Co. Server was polite, made good recs, but didn't say they wouldn't honor the 50% off Groupon till after we ate. Always bring up deals on the way in for this reason. 

Food was good, not a big selection, but hot and made to order. Seemed like we were the only customers that day. Uncle/Grandpa was in the dining area, watching TV, yapping on his phone. Real casual spot."
"Slot machines and tables abound. A fine spot for locals to kill time. Don't bother driving from the Strip, but worth a visit if you're nearby. Dollar beers and hot dogs? You can't lose."

"Tasty, but Americanized. Love the fried rice. Bartender gave us free lychee cocktail samples while we waited for takeout. Not crowded, quiet, and decent service. Nothing special, just solid takeout."

"Dinner at this joint was a letdown. Portions were tiny, prices were steep. Sake, too. Service was pushy, like they wanted us gone. Plates cleared before we finished eating. Told 'em to back off. Ambiance was nice, but not worth the bill. Won't be going back."

"Golden Steer ain't what it used to be. Been goin' there since the '70s, and the grub and service were top-notch. But it's been downhill since the 2000s. Won't be eatin' there no more. Ain't worth it. Friendly staff, but the decor's the same. Ordered a NY strip, and they butterflied it, takin' all the flavor outta it. Used to tell all our friends comin' to Vegas about this joint, but no more."
"Food's not my cup of tea, but they got a damn fine patio. Great spot for a drink, any time of day."

"Not a hike, folks. More like a leisurely stroll with too much repetition."

"Steps, not trails. A short jaunt from the zoo. Bring your beau, but don't call it a hike."

"Dressy boots? Check. Cute outfit? You bet. But let's not get carried away here."

"Came in before doomsday, place was jumpin'. GF scored us free entry, courtesy of her promoter friend. Drinks flowed like water, pre-midnight. Blush ain't big, not like XS or Surrender. No dance floor, just tables and walkways. People tried to bust a move, looked kinda silly. Music was mainstream, not much hip hop. Stayed 30, met up with the rest outside."
"A chef, cooking in the open. Noodles, mostly. Beef and Pad Thai, a feast for a hungry man. But, couldn't take it to heart."

"Went for lunch with pals after a hike. Hungry. 

Had a sandwich, fresh and hot. Side salad, wilted. Would've tossed it at home. 

Friend had a breakfast, eggs cooked right, generous portions. 

Another friend, breakfast burrito, said it was good. Salad, weakest link. 

Service good, friendly folks. Seated quick, warned of wait. Left drinks for self-serve. 

Prices okay. Go back, skip salad..."

"We devoured our meals here on our final day in Vegas. Everyone's head throbbed from last night's bender, and we required some hearty broth to revive us. I requested the fiery chicken wings, which sadly lacked any real kick. However, they were still enjoyable. The dim sum delighted due to its generous shrimp content. The duck noodle soup was acceptable; the duck itself was flavorful. The hot and sour soup had a bit too much pepper and a hint of spice. Lastly, the chrysanthemum iced tea quenched our thirst admirably."

"ASU's neighbor. Holiday emptiness. Great service. Perfectly cooked grub. 'Study hall' for students - smart. Only gripe? Waitress should mention upcharge before slapping surprise on bill. Menu mentions it, but not clear on cheese slice cost."

Prices were good, but no stout. Place was packed, staff stretched thin. Table faced kitchen, two cooks working hard. Waited for grub, water, and check. People watching made up for it. Looked like a convention of middle-aged salesmen took over. Funny as hell.
"Room cost thirty-five bucks a night. Not bad for a place that's nicer than a Motel-6. Pools are great. You get a free drink pass. Gym's decent too. I give it a thumbs up."

"Metro Pizza finally opened in Henderson. No more fighting UNLV students for a table. New spot's better than the original. Full bar, party room, and regular dining room. Separate wing for pick-up orders, so you can avoid the crowd. Nuclear fries are a must-try. Spiced and kicky, they pair perfectly with a pie. Beer selection's solid too. Avoid weekends, it's packed. Lunch is the best time, it's quiet. 

Try the margherita pizza. 

Pair it with a Hefeweizen and some lemons."
"Paris, cheap eats. Two doors down, display case, extra buck or two, better sandwich. Not worth going out of your way, but if you're hungry and fresh off a flight, it'll do."

"Coffee worth spendinâ€™ dough on, no question. But things ainâ€™t like they used to be â€˜round here. Used to be my favorite spot, catchinâ€™ up with the baristas, shootinâ€™ the breeze. Nowadays, theyâ€™re all gone, probâ€™ly due to the new digs. Shame, too. Coffee just ainâ€™t the same no more. Losinâ€™ its magic, like the people who made it special. Guess weâ€™ll be sippinâ€™ elsewhere from now on."

"Flaverz Buffet, Harrah's. Not cheap, but worth it. Great selection: Mexican, Italian, seafood, fresh fare, Chinese, desserts. Always something new. Twenty bucks a head. Timeshare deal, two-for-one. But, 28+ only. Bummer, I'm 24. Couples, take note."

"Wife and I grabbed lunch last week. Food was mediocre, service slow. Got lunch specials with soup, spring roll, fried wontons. Soup wasn't traditional Thai, spring roll too greasy, wontons bland. Wife got yellow curry, I got Panang. Ordered mine Thai spicy, but it was more like medium. Next time, we'll hit up Thai Cafe, just a mile or so away."

"Fruit and veg ain't always top-notch here. Bought a bag of plums once, real cheap, but they were rotten. Lucky for me, I knew how to slow cook 'em and they turned out great. There's a risk with cheap or out-of-season stuff, but otherwise, you should be good."

"Food was good. Steak, halibut, baked potato, all tasty. Wine of the month, $20 or free with coupon. Service was hit or miss. Attentive at times, nonexistent at others. No bread, had to ask for entree after 75 minutes. Server defensive, made excuses. Pricey for South Point, but worth it for a special occasion or if you're staying there."

"Reservations recommended, especially during Christmas lunch rush. Place was empty when we arrived, but filled up fast. Sat at the bar. Expensive menu: $10 soup, $19 soup and pasta combo. Food was mediocre, one colleague had to send lunch special back due to raw meat. Staff recognized issue quickly and replaced dish promptly. Showed appreciation with generous tip."

"Lavo, a swell joint. Haven't had a meal here yet, but the nightclub's a real treat. It's a bit cozy, but not too packed like Tao. Dance floor's small, but it's alright. They play some hip-hop and old tunes, a nice change from the usual house music. Had a good time with the crew, thanks to our friendly promoter who hooked us up with open bar and free entry for the guys. The main bar's decent, but the side bar's where it's at, even though it's a bit cramped. The bartender's a peach, too. All in all, a solid 3.5. Would definitely come back, especially if we're staying at the Venetian/Palazzo."

"Town & Country. Not bad. Good spot. Parking, A-okay. Service, top-notch. Prices, reasonable. Chocolate milkshake, tasty. But, The Wreck? Meh. Sandwiches, lacking. Bread, too much. Subway, better. More bang for your buck."

"Pizza was decent, not bad. Good atmosphere though, real cozy. Fireplace, dim lights, comfy tables. Solid wine selection too. Cheese board was alright, nothing special. Pizza was just okay, not as good as I expected from a pie joint. 3.5 outta 5, that's my rating."

"Don't frequent Fresh and Easy much. Stores don't appeal, 'cept for a few snacks. Peanut butter pretzels, salted kettle chips, decent trail mix. That's it for me. Stopped by yesterday, thought it'd be a quick, easy trip. Walked around like a zombie, found what I needed. Checkout was fast, only had two items. Crossed the street to Albertsons, did some real shopping."
"Tiny, authentic Mexican joint. Great salsa, tacos, quesadillas, and burritos. Not for families or large groups, though. Parking's a bitch too. Someone even threatened to tow my car."
"Burgers here, real good for the price. Joint's got character, too. Not some chain shithole. But they gotta step up their beer game. More options, ya know? Fries could use some work, too."
"Food's good, but service is crap. One of my fave joints, but this spot don't cut it. Sat for 15 min in an empty place at 1:30 for a bean burrito to go. What a joke."
"Flavor good, service good. Wait long, pepperonis underdone. Compare Grimaldis Brooklyn."

"Sunday night concert series, families, dogs, strollers, blankets, trains, horns, crappy sound systems, and hellish parking. If that's your scene, you'll love it. My date and I found a good spot away from the stage, but still got an earful of noise. Didn't bug us none, though. If you can handle the chaos or you're some kinda superhuman with multiple dogs and kids, this is your jam. Scottsdale douchebags were MIA, but get there early to snag a spot across the street. Maybe it was busier than usual due to the holiday weekend, but who knows? Not me, that's for sure."
"Night, live band on the patio. Nice atmosphere, good drinks, just-okay food. Might return if other joints are packed."

TI, nice joint. Stayed three nights. Early check-in cost fifty bucks extra. Better than sleeping in the parking lot with the fam. Not many places to plug in our cell chargers, so we took turns using the restroom plugs. Check-in line was long, not enough staff. Check-out was a mad rush too. Vegas was slow that time of year. Parking was free. iPod dock didn't charge, wrong time. Had a fridge and safe in the room. No coffee pot. Check-out was weird. Suggest an easy checkout. Get the folio under the door and just walk out if there ain't no problems with the bill. Ended up standing in a thirty-minute line just to check out. Good job TI, but for the price, might stay somewhere else.

"Went to Mert's for dinner last night. Fried catfish and beef rib combo, that's what I had. Whole fried catfish, a bit of a challenge with all them bones, didn't yield much meat either. Beef rib, chopped up and a small pile of bones, that's what they gave me. Sides were the real deal though, mac and cheese had a nice crust on top, corn bread was good too, although my wife's piece looked a bit overcooked and dry. Decent stop overall."

"Breakfast Club didn't live up to its name. Eggs were alright, potatoes O'Brian were meh - soft, oily, and too much pepper. Jalepeno biscuits were a letdown, more like tough, flavorless disks with jalepenos baked in. Heuvos rancheros looked like my cat's vomit, but tasted okay, according to my friend. Overall, it was greasier than expected. Outdoor seating is nice, but the busy road nearby makes it a mixed bag. Service was good, but the waitresses seemed like Stepford Wives."

It's a decent joint, but they got some issues. Five bucks to park, thirty-five ninety-nine to get in, eight clams for a tiny locker, and three bucks for water. And all you get for that is five working slides, a wave pool, and a lazy river. You do the math.

"Decent Chinese grub, not bad. Had the egg drop soup, pork dumplings, kung pao chicken, and chicken lo mein noodles. The soup and chicken were good, the dumplings were meh, and the noodles were nothing special. Not the best value, but it's a solid spot for takeout. Prices are a bit steep for cheap Chinese, but the quality's a notch above."

"Cute joint. Made me wanna stick around. Had my first macarons - two of 'em, mixed berry and raspberry. People rave about 'em, so I gave 'em a shot. Didn't love 'em, didn't hate 'em. I'll be back for more."

"Footlocker's got your standard fare: Reebok, Nike, Adidas, and some overpriced basketball kicks. Prices are steep, but they have sales sometimes. Only catch is, you'll be stuck with some ugly-ass shoes nobody else wants. Not exactly a lady's paradise, either. Guy's shop, through and through. I swing by every now and then, but usually end up looking elsewhere."

"My fiance told me to write a review. I shrugged, saying the restaurant was mediocre. Two and a half stars, tops. Service was forgettable, neither great nor terrible. Food-wise, the salmon taco during happy hour was a pleasant surprise. The guacamole, though, fell short of my expectations. Too bad, since I love a good guac. The dried cranberries added an interesting twist, but Trader Joe's still takes the cake. The food was rich, in a caloric sense. Not eager to go back, but not avoiding it either."

"Renovations" at this joint since Rave took over seem decent. Added some heavy-duty cup holders with extended armrests between seats. Pros and cons, though. Share drinks and snacks easy, but armrests don't move no more.

Pros:

* Bigger armrests
* Larger snack bar than usual

Cons:

* Movie started 20 min late
* Only 30 M&Ms in the package I bought

"Ja, gut. Fehlt noch 'ne Location mit Burger & Bratwurst-Vibes, aber nicht wie 'ne Fast-Food Kette. Eher Restaurant als Bar. Keine fertigen Gerichte, sondern einen Baukasten, um sein eigenes zu bauen. Freundlicher Service, aber das Konzept ist noch nicht quite right. Eine Kreuzung zwischen Szeneladen Berlin-Mitte und den trendigen Currywurst-Bars in MÃ¼nchen. Hohe Frauenquote."

"Buncha us went to this joint for some burgers. Heard they were good. Food was solid, bit greasy and dry though. Woulda given 'em four stars easy, but the service? Horrible. This chick Olivia, bad attitude the whole time. Threw the To Go box on the table like it was a problem. Took forever to fill our waters too. Three times we asked! Place is pricey, so I expected better. Still, worth it if you're a burger fan. Just hope you get a decent server."

"Afternoon delight, that's what I was after. Yummy Flavors, plenty to choose from. Irish creme, that's what I picked, with almond roca on top. Enjoyed it for a few bites, then my mind started wandering. 'Twangy Tart,' that's all I could think about. Golden Spoon, who needs it? Once you try the Twang, nothing else compares. Damn you, Ice Tango!"
"Food's good, not the best for the price though. Had a spicy chicken, they ain't kiddin' about the heat. Enjoyed it, but $11 for lunch? No way. Four stars for the grub."
"Pho, underwhelming. Other dishes, promising. Americanized. Worth another shot."

"Fiesta Mall used to be the go-to spot around here. Then, Arizona Mills, Chandler Fashion Center, and Tempe Marketplace popped up and snatched up all the locals from Chandler, Tempe, and Gilbert. Don't get me wrong, there's still some great shops left, just like the ones you'd find at the other malls. But these days, Fiesta's a ghost town compared to how packed it used to be, especially during Christmas and sales. And let me tell you, that covered parking is a godsend come summer."

"Bill came in plain envelope. Inside, cheap print job on flimsy paper. No return envelope or postage. Folded like crap too. Guess professionalism ends at exams and procedures. Medical bills piling up since we got our own insurance. This one takes the cake for cheapness. A few cents for a decent envelope and form wouldn't hurt. Makes for a better experience, ya know?"

"Chopped Salad, best I've had. Small, too small. Double the size, I'd visit more. Flight took forever, like a stray dog on my lawn. BBQ sauce, good. Staff, just okay. Give away free dessert, redeem yourself. Cool place, fits downtown Scottsdale. Stay away from buffalo, doggy bag takes on new meaning."

"Tasty grub, but not worth the pesos. Filling, sure, but lacking that authentic Mexican flavor. Pricey too, fifty bucks for two people? No way, amigo. If you're looking for real Mexican food, keep searching. This place is average at best, even with the discount for gamblers. Don't waste your cash."

"Food's decent for the price, but I've had better sushi for the same coin. Their makis are a bit of a mess, and some fish ain't exactly fresh. Good for a quick bite, but not the place for a fancy meal."

"Tennis courts in decent shape, nets sans straps. Played on regardless. Nice complex, save for the parking lot's labyrinthine design. Many a blind spot when backing out. Aesthetically pleasing, but a groundskeeper's nightmare. Solid apartments, all brick. Highway noise from 485, loud from the courts."

"Applebee's, just another chain joint. Not my cup of tea, but I've been known to indulge. Food's alright, nothing special. Had the Bourbon Black and Bleu Burger, though. That was a nice surprise. Kickin' flavor, party in my mouth. The others had the 3 cheese penne and chicken. Didn't try it, but they seemed to enjoy it. My picky eater even ate half her grilled cheese. Sweet bread, like brioche. Service was top-notch too. Never had to ask for anything. Overall, good eatery, but still not my style. Give me Chili's any day."
"Second time here, salad bar ain't what it used to be. Fewer items now, still good, but not like before. Don't eat much meat, so I notice these things. Still, it's real good."

"Spago served up a solid meal, but didn't quite knock my socks off. Wedge salad was good, nothing special. Heirloom tomato and burrata salad, though - that was the real deal. Best dish of the night, easy. 

We split three pizzas. Crust was a letdown, no getting around it. Just a platform for the toppings, you know? 
-Margherita was average, crust a bit undercooked. 
-Proscuitto was the best of the bunch - prosciutto and fromage blanc, perfect combo. Great crust would've made it mind-blowing. 
-Lamb Chorizo was a nice pie, chorizo worked well with the other toppings. 

Service was top-notch."

"Good joint for the buck. Not the fanciest spot on the strip, but it's got its perks. Decent grub, friendly service, and a killer location. Solid value all around. 

We've stayed here a few times before. Rooms are tidy, beds are comfy, and there's plenty of eatery options downstairs. Casino's a bit small, but it's a great low-key spot. Spa's modest, but it's affordable. And it's just a quick stroll to other casinos, eateries, and shops. 

Only gripes were the high-pressure showers (not our cup of tea) and a busted TV on our last visit (but we didn't bother getting it fixed since it wasn't a big deal). 

Sure, you could splurge on a ritzy, trendy joint on the strip, but you'll be shelling out double the dough. We'd rather stick with what works for us, save our cash, and use it to live it up while we're in town."

"Tucked away, easy to miss. But worth the trip for a solid gyro or kebab. Donuts are decent too, lots of variety. Personal favorite's their cookies. Homemade baklava's a plus. Sandwiches with seasoned fries, highly recommend. Veggie options available, potato kahbi or falafel. Drinks galore. Not the best location, but worth a visit."

"This joint used to be top-notch, five stars easy. Now? Just okay. My old man's still a fan, that's why we ended up there. Started with the grilled artichoke, usually a solid choice. Not this time. Maybe they're out of season? It was tough and lacking flavor. The aioli was decent, though. Prime rib was alright, but the portions keep shrinking. Still, it was tender, good taste. Nothing special. We all got the same cut, same baked potato on the side. No dessert. I'll probably end up back here, since my dad's still into it."

Barneys is a chill spot, not too flashy. Good place to have a few drinks, no fuss. Second floor's my jam, bartender's on point. Roof's nice too, but smokers ruin it for me. Beer's poured bottom up, funky fresh. Lobster game's a blast when you're feeling frisky. Solid 3.5 stars.

"Wife went there on a Monday afternoon, with some friends. Said it wasn't what she expected. Neat experience, but not many animals. 10 bucks to get in, steep price for locals. And hot, real hot. Over 100 degrees. No water, not a drop. Fountains were bone dry. Dangerous for visitors."

"UNLV student? This joint's got the best deal in town. Five tacos, two sides, drink for five bucks. Traditional street tacos, not huge, but they don't skimp on the meat. Fun spot for friends, grab a bucket of brews, shoot the shit. Order at the counter, they'll call your number when it's ready. Sometimes they got live music or a DJ, Latin vibes, no surprise."

"First Friday's got me feelin' torn. Love community events, especially art walks. But this one's missin' somethin'. Should be great, it's in my backyard, but it don't deliver. 

Galleries are lackin', vendors just tryna make a buck. Kids everywhere, grungy ones causin' trouble. Food stalls are decent in summer, but winter's a bust. 

Prob'ly still go back, but early, before it gets wild."
"Environment was top-notch, staff was exceptional. Food? Not bad, not great either. Price didn't match the plate."

"Went to TMI for grub the other night. Toast was the highlight, good bread, even if it was a bit crusty. Mac and cheese was a letdown, oily and flavorless. Other folks liked their sammies and salads, though. Nice joint, but too hot, loud, and the food was just alright. Won't be back soon."

"I found a shitload of new irrigation gear at this place. As a gardener, I'm always futzing with the waterworks, and I need a steady supply of emitters, hose, and connectors to feed my dirty habit. This joint had it all, and for way less than the hardware store's prices."

"Good spot. Family-style grub, just how I like it. Some dishes worked, others didn't. Eggplant and goat cheese, too much cheese, not enough eggplant. Egg and potato, heavy on the spuds. Filet mignon and Thai beef salad, solid choices. Worth a shot, but unlikely to return."

We hadn't been to this joint since it was still Cafe Del Sol. We had a Groupon we bought a month ago, so we figured, why not? It was a little weird since there's a main dining room and a separate room for the red-headed stepchild, but whatever. We got there right at happy hour and my wife ordered Sangria, while I had Tempranillo. Let me tell you, it was a total letdown. I ended up getting another glass of wine, don't remember the name, but it was alright. I got the short ribs with cola and pineapple, jalapeno cream corn, and chile corn casserole. The sides were decent, but the corn casserole was a bit dry. The short ribs were great though, didn't have that cheap pot roast taste. The sauce was a bit too thick for my liking, but not a big deal. My wife had the grilled shrimp appetizer with avocado and mango sauce, and the empanadas. She loved her food, but I wasn't a fan of the empanadas. The shrimp were pretty good though. Overall, it's not a bad spot, but I wouldn't choose to go back. My wife will probably make me go again sometime.
"Dive bar, off the strip. Friday night, empty. Free beers, courtesy of Fremont Street. Loud, obnoxious bartenders, but fun. Watch out for the shot scams. Your bill's gonna skyrocket."

"Stayed at Hotel Monte Carlo Las Vegas a few times, but it's time to move on. Place is showing its age, especially compared to newer hotels. Food at the main cafe and buffet is just okay. But, gotta give 'em credit, they've got a good deal going on - concierge puts guests on the VIP list for free entry into Haze and other nearby clubs. That's a nice touch. If you're looking for deals and decent rooms, it's worth checking out."

"Hit up the ones in Henderson on Sunset and South Rainbow. Both solid for breakfast, especially the steak and eggs. Happy hour at South Rainbow, $2 drafts and half-price apps? Hell yeah. That's an A. But their rewards card? Joke's on us. New earning levels mean it'll take years to snag a tenner. F 'em for that, and for not giving a heads up. Three stars, smack dab in the middle of A and F."
"Ordering system, confusing. But I'm smart, figured it out. Wanted a good burger, found one. Onion rings, good too. Missing some personality though."

"Resort restaurant. Food ambitious, prices steep. Chicken, solid choice. Service top-notch. Table beside us, smoke fest. Already done, sat outside. Pricey for what you get. Good grub, resort pricing. Won't return. Server, pleasant. 3 stars, fair."

"Few blocks make much difference going east. Love me some Lao Laan, never had it before Madison. Service and menu recs ain't the same, authenticity lacking. Menu's smaller, dining room bigger, good for grooving, but Willy's still the best bet for curry east of the capitol."
"Burger, good. Pricey, though. Work nearby, wanted lunch deal. Not open for lunch. Staff pleasant. Service good. No lunch, no return."

"Menu's still the same as it has been for six years now. In Montreal, you know. But that radish oyster dish, damn good. Can't get enough of it. Worth every penny of those twelve bucks for four oysters. Rest of the menu? Ordinary, overpriced."

"Picked up a new laptop charger, needed the Lion OSX upgrade too. Easy peasy, right? Wrong. On Leopard, gotta buy two upgrades to get to Lion. What the hell, Apple? Can't even find the Leopard to Snow Leopard upgrade at the damn store. Ended up ordering it online, waiting like a fool. Stupidity aside, the place was clean, employee was decent. That's something, I guess."

"Good grub at a fair price. That's what you'll get here. No frills, just solid eats. Service is friendly, food's decent, and the cost won't break the bank. Don't let the three stars throw you off. It's a damn good spot for a satisfying meal."

"Decent grub, I had the 'Sin City' burger. Liked it plenty. Wife had a classic, don't know what was on it, but she enjoyed it. Sweet potato fries, not too keen on 'em. Seasoning wasn't my cup of tea. Regular fries, just alright. All in all, not bad. Better than most fast food joints."
"Kid-friendly, decent price. Staff's friendly too. Slices are edible, not the best taste though. Limited sweets and greens."

"Sweet tooth? Look no further. Old-fashioned ice cream joint in old town, pink decor and all. Friend and I stopped by for the buster brownie sundae - sweet, but worth it. They serve food too, but stick to the sweets."
"Wings good. Sauces good. Service hit or miss. Waffle fries overcooked. Don't believe the hype."

"Plate of food in front of me, huge, makes me squirm. Wanted chile rellenos, not the super-sized plate. Restaurants nowadays, portion control nonexistent. Friend could've shared, didn't know, no regrets. Vegas, table on Friday night, no wait, no reservation. Service attentive, bill reasonable. Mojito, tasty."

"PC, a Charlotte classic due for a refresh. Good grub, but consistency's a concern. Atmosphere's stale, stuck in the past. Still, worth a trip - especially when the weather's fine and you can snag a spot on the sweet patio. Salads are top-notch."

"Slipped in for a drink before dinner. Place was rowdy, real rowdy. People hollerin' at the TVs, birthday crews ragin', music blastin'. Gin joint, mostly. Beer menu's lackin', but their gin game's strong. Tried the Ungava with maple syrup, and damn, it was good. Not usually a gin guy, but that maple syrup's magic. Pricey, though. Twenty bucks for a beer and cocktail? No way, JosÃ©. Service was top-notch, though. Waitress hustlin' between them big ol' parties, still took care of us quick as can be."

"Central Library's got nothing on this place. This is where they keep the good stuff - all the rare books. You'll need to get a pass from the registration desk, but it's worth it if you're looking for something specific. If not, then it's a bit of a hassle just to read a book. But hey, your call."

"Sports bar/restaurant. Good, if that's your thing. Went with my dad, he said it was one of those new fun places. Stuffed portabella mushroom appetizer, delicious but decadent. Carnitas libre pizza, rich, artery-clogging. Pollotate pizza, bland and dry. Forgot the onions, actually might've made a difference. Service was great. Loads of TVs, well-stocked bar. If that's your thing, one of the better ones out there. For me, gotta be something special, this place ain't it."

"Hit up TDP for lunch after some morning yoga. Place was closed when I first tried to check it out, but it was worth the wait. Cute joint, dig the outdoor seating and small bar. Staff was friendly, too. Sandwiches were solid, but overpriced. Caprese was $9 and the tomato was unripe. Meatball sandwich needed more sauce. Chicken salad looked good, but tiny for the price. Next time, I'll stick to the free smells and grab some olive oil from their store instead."

Jersey Mike's didn't knock me off my feet, but it's a tight ship. Efficient, friendly, and clean. Menu's a bit tricky for a newbie, but I managed. Place was hopping at lunchtime. Mini sub's a decent size, regular's a behemoth. Club had plenty of meat. Sub rolls were alright, hard to tell apart. Cups are cool, each one's got a story. Fundraising for good causes? Hope so. Might just be branding. I'll be back, craving something spicy next time.

"Seven combo platters, seven bucks. My wife and I shared, seven items between us. Rice, beans, sour cream, guacamole - endless combos. Chicken enchilada, plain or with fixings. Burrito, cheese enchilada, tamale, beef enchilada, bean enchilada, all good. Tamales, a bit dry, jalapeno-spicy. Mild here packs a punch. Three and a half stars, worth another visit."

"This joint's got me stumped. They reckon they're proud of their smokin' ways, but it don't make sense when they got such a fine selection of brews. Menu's not half bad either, lotta good eatin' to be had. But then there's the smoke, stickin' to your clothes like a bad habit. Don't know why they can't join the modern world, it'd be a real improvement."

"V-food in downtown Phoenix, finally. Ethnic cuisine, the more the merrier. Convenient spot on 1st and Adams. Open kitchen, a first. Takeout, no problem. Fast service, plus. Taste, not quite up to par. Prices, a bit steep. Still, support 'em for convenience. Craving authentic Vietnamese? Head to the avenue's dives. Didn't have bahn mi, out of stock. Standard buhn dice, decent. Nom plah, could use more sweetness, garlic. Egg rolls, good. Spring rolls, missing shrimp. Omellette, acquired taste."

"Chinatown in Montreal's small, but reliable for good, cheap eats. Rice is a must for my mom, always. Their roast pork/duck over rice is solid. Beef pan fried noodles? Not so much. Wonton noodle soup's decent, though. General Tso's chicken? Pretty good. Service is hit or miss, depending on the waiter. If they speak English well, it's good. Otherwise, frustrating. Food comes out quick, so if you're starving, it's a good spot. Bubble tea's alright, but not great. They get props for the baby bok choy and huge portions."

"Roaches on the floor, two of 'em. One got squashed, the other got smacked. Staff didn't flinch. Chatty waiter, too much yappin'. Owner's always hammered, patio hangout. Food's still good, but I'm lookin' elsewhere."

"Twenty-nine ninety-nine, thirty-two forty-two with tax, too rich for my blood. Lot of grub, sure, but not worth the scratch compared to some swanky joints.

Saturday morning, ten fifteen, mimosas flowed like water. Had me two, they hit the spot. Breakfast and lunch, they got 'em both, had a bit of each. Yeah, brunch, you know.

Nothin' blew my skirt up, but it was all good eats. Not some massive spread, but enough to fill you up.

Might go back, you know, if I'm 1) hammered, 2) jonesin' for AYCE, 3) stranded, 4) held hostage, or 5) drunk again. That's about it."

"Mexican and Chinese, why not? Interesting menu. Jade Red Chicken, just as good as Orange or General Tso's. Wide variety, good food, especially if you like spicy. 

One issue, cleanliness. Low budget decor, uncomfortable seating, weathered ceilings, messy. Not a big deal. But restrooms were disgusting, eating area dirty, trash overflowing. Busy, but no excuse for men's restroom. Looked like a truck stop after a long weekend. Doors and walls filthy, handprints everywhere. Most tables dirty, only one trash bin not full. Glad I didn't use the restroom until after I ate. 

If it were mine, I'd invest in some maintenance. Better tables and chairs wouldn't hurt either. Close to clean, four stars easy."

"Ran in, grabbed what I needed for dinner. First time in this place. It's alright, I guess. Fruits and veggies ain't the best, but they'll do in a pinch. Safeway's better for that stuff, though. Prices are meh, nothing special."

"First visit was a bust. Food didn't live up to the hype. Artichoke appetizer was a disappointment, and my burger was bland. Wife's steak was mediocre, and she got sick afterwards. Server, Cassie, was top-notch though. Friendly and attentive. Manager reached out, offering a coupon. Gave the place a second chance, but food needs to step up its game."

"Sunday arvo, empty joint. Friend raved about it, but service was too quick - must've been pre-cooked. Chicken full of bones, pork like rock. Cubans like it rough? 

Parking's round back. Lock up tight, don't walk alone. 

Might go back, try somethin' else. Gave 'em three stars for friendly service, bilingualism, no food poisoning."

"This joint closed? Or just getting a facelift?\n\nBeen here a few times for lunch, and gotta say, the barbacoa torta's my jam. Nothing else on the menu's all that special. Had the breakfast burrito once...potatoes overpowered the chorizo. Pricey too."

"Food's creative, flavors are good. Appetizers, reasonable price and quality. Main courses, though - too small for the price. Bread's a bit dry, but a nice light bread. Wine selection's great. Not bad for Chandler, but not worth dinner. Maybe for apps and a glass of wine. Not busy on a Friday night, so maybe others think it's too pricey. Might reconsider for longevity. Nice atmosphere, despite the weird strip mall spot."

"Best cocktails in town. Bartenders can be hit or miss. Mojitos are top-notch. Prices are fair. Decor is swell. Crowd is lively. Music is nice. Brunch is a mixed bag. Lobster omelette has too much going on. Guava mimosa is a miss."

"Upgrading to three stars due to top-notch service. Server-to-guest ratio was near one-to-one, can't complain about that. Place isn't doing too well, though. Prices are steep and portions are small. You get what you pay for, but it's still a bit much. Burgers, skewers, sandwiches, and salads run around ten bucks each. Pizzas cost between ten and fifteen. A la carte menu, and you only get a few skewers for your entree. Appetizers are ten dollars too. Desserts are seven, plus an extra dollar for ice cream. Not bad, but not worth it either. Their burgers are better than The Grind's, at least they don't fall apart. Fries were decent, five bucks. Pork skewers were meh. Dorito potato skins? Meh. Cupcake was alright, but the chocolate was a tad grainy. Small portion too. Won't be back for anything but happy hour, and that's just for the burgers."

"Verdun's got a secret. A real gem. Heard about it from a mate, didn't believe it at first. But Parisa, she delivered. Big time. Their house soup? Damn near perfect. Minus the noodles, they were a bit off. But the mushrooms? Nice surprise. Sauteed to perfection. And the lamb? Oh boy. Melt-in-your-mouth good. Drumsticks? Not bad either. Service? Top-notch. Friendly host, cozy atmosphere. For a BYOW spot, it's a must-try. Don't skip the soup. It's a game-changer."

"I hit up this joint after catchin' it on the Loafer radar a buncha times, hearin' good things. I dug my burger 'n' fries, but my buddy wasn't too into 'em. They don't got no AC, so I was sweatin' like a pig."

"Place was decent, not too shabby. Family of 12, reserved an hour ahead on a Thursday, got good seats no wait. Waitress was top-notch, didn't flinch when we sent her back and forth across the table. Food was just okay though. Overcooked potatoes, funny-tasting sausage, rubbery omelette. Service was great, food was meh."

"A good spot for a cold one, outdoor seating's nice too. But, man, it can get loud on E-Wash. Nice place to chill, but I was let down by the lack of Belgian brews. Would've fit right in on Willy street, and hey, it's got a porn shop next door. That's somethin'."

"This joint's got a swell atmosphere. Dim, cozy, and the chairs are real comfortable. DJ spinning tunes on Saturday night, but the volume's a mite too high for a lounge. Can only chat with the folks next to me, and even then, gotta holler a bit. Patio's a peaceful spot, plenty of seats, and a nice view of the courtyard for people-watching."
"I hit this joint when Im at Tempe Marketplace. Decent drink deals, nice big bar. Bartenders take their time, no idea why. Maybe its just me."

I'm an American from the NYC area, so I know good Italian grub. This place didn't blow me away, despite what The Guardian said. Service was top-notch, though. Friendly and attentive servers. Portions? Enormous. They convinced us to order more than we needed, but we could've shared a starter easily. Entrees were enough for 2-3 people. Come hungry! Ambiance felt corny, like an Italian joint in suburban New York/New Jersey. Frank Sinatra played in the background, and the servers tried too hard to be Italian.

"Went to the clinic twice in two weeks. First time, fractured my tail bone. Doc fixed me up good as new. Second time, had a gut full of pain. They turned me away, said they were full. Didn't matter how bad I was hurting, they wouldn't budge. Not exactly what you call great service. But hey, life goes on. I'll still come back, but won't forget how they didn't help me when I needed it most."

"Don't love it, don't hate it. Just blah. 
Wanted to try it after seeing pics on Instagram. Excited for snow like Hawaii's Snow Factory or Frost City. 
Had #3, #4, #5. Didn't like the popping pearls in #5, so replaced it with butterfinger. Texture was similar, but flavors need work. 
Tried taro, green tea, and kuma snow. Whatever...just quenched my thirst. Want more variety, like Snow Ono food truck. Miss horchata flavor. 
Love the bright, cute decor. Going for the Asian-kawaii market. Instagram-worthy pics. 
Will be back. Businesses improve over time. Want to bring more people to try more flavors."

"I'd heard of this joint but never made it 'til now. Supportin' a fundraiser for an elementary school, I was expectin' somethin' like the skatin' rinks I knew back in the day. And that's exactly what I got - hot as hell, smellin' like a gym locker room, but the concession stand prices were right and the tunes were current and fun. All the skaters, young and old, looked like they were havin' a blast. You can even bring your own roller blades if you want, save a buck or two. It's an old-school spot, not some fancy updated place. Check it out if that's what you're lookin' for."

"Clean joint. Good grub. Had the egg rolls, peanut sauce. Standard fare for us when it comes to 'Nam food. Solid. Not much to say. 
Combo pho soup, big portions. Tastes like fish sauce, mint, and a little kick. Made for American tongues, not too spicy. Can add heat yourself, but starts with a weak base. Authenticity lacking. 
Small menu, not a bad thing. Less is more sometimes. Still, wanted more Viet options. 
Friendly service, prompt. Did well. Might be back."

"Went to a colleague's farewell shindig at this joint. For a group of 16 and a rugrat, they did alright. Guac was decent, but the spicy salsa, you gotta ask for it, was the real deal. Sangria was too sweet, but the house margarita on the rocks wasn't half bad. Food was meh. Had some lackluster chicken enchiladas, not terrible, just uninspired. Best part of the night was hitting up Trader Joe's next door after dinner."

"View's damn near perfect, 360 degrees of it. Chill vibes too, 'cept for the DJ on Fridays - top 40 and EDM, not my scene. Happy hour's got some issues though - food's subpar and service is slow. Sliders' buns are rock hard, calamari's like rubber. Waitress takes her sweet time comin' round too. Coulda walked down to the liquor store and back up before she brought our order. Place has potential, but needs some work."
"Friendly folks here. But, their brews lacked something. Overpriced too. Three stars from me."
