"Heard good things, but underwhelmed. High expectations, let down. Brunch time, mostly breakfast food, some salads and lunch options. Chicken wings, saian chow mein, fried rice, alfredo pasta, calamari skewer, good. Rest, plain Jane. Big on desserts, but only a few stood out. Chocolate dipped strawberries, cheesecake, Thai ice cream, favorites. Thai tea ice cream, a must try. Average buffet, $30 a person, decent food, exceptional dessert, Thai tea ice cream."
"Sorry to see Him's JL close. Liked the place."
"Clean buffet, ample seating. $13 per head, not bad. But then, too much pork. Not a fan. Better options at Buffet@asia - more variety, seafood, Mongolian BBQ. Take my $13 there next time."

"Wife and I searched for a decent meal in Phoenix's industrial area. Found a cluster of Mexican joints. Chose Salsitas, a local chain. Food was good, plenty, and cheap. But the service was poor. Asked for forks, got none. Had to beg the hotel clerk for plastic ones. Burritos were huge, tasty. Wife couldn't finish hers. Gave us spicy carrots, too. Scored points with her. All for ten bucks, including salsas and sour cream. Not bad, but worth another visit."

"It's a tight spot, but we had a table, so why not? Place is tiny, packed like a sardine can. Felt like I was in China or the NYC subway. People smelled decent, though, unlike the subway. Lot of fake plastic chickadees flitting about. Hard to gauge their age, so I felt comfortable, being only 27 myself. \nDrinks were pricey, so I sprang for three shots. Didn't want to be some metrosexual spiked-hair guy buying drinks, and I can afford my own. Asked where the diamonds were, 'cause I couldn't find 'em. Wrote on the slip, "I ain't no rich bitch." Sorry, bartender dude. With these prices, you should get the novel price. \nStill, it was fun. Pre-booze heavy or bring a platinum credit card-carrying dude along."

"Bring 'em here after a night out. Better than MacDonald's, healthier, quicker. Grab breakfast next day too. Always see 'em bakin' fresh bagels, no matter the time. I'm a traditionalist, so I stick with sesame or butter. Hope that helps. Cheers."

This joint's a mixed bag, kid. Get here early for the good stuff. They run out fast. Fried chicken's a home run, but they can't seem to nail the cooking. One day it's perfect, next day it's burnt to a crisp. Spaghetti's decent, but same story. Mac and cheese? Forget about it. Burnt on top, every time. Blackeyed peas and cornbread are solid, though. And don't even get me started on the lemonade. Best in Charlotte, easy. Don't ask what brand, just enjoy it. Volunteers are friendly as hell, too. Charm 'em right and they'll hook you up with some extra mac. Tip at the register, kid. Your buddy, Walter.

"Hemingwayâ€™s Review: Service Stinks, Foodâ€™s Alright

Went to this joint for happy hour, expecting a swell time. But no, they gotta go and mess it up with some lousy service. First off, they didnâ€™t tell us where to sit for the happy hour prices. I mean, come on, who thinks to ask that? So we sat wherever we wanted, and turns out it was the wrong spot. Only the bar and bench are for happy hour, but they didnâ€™t bother telling us that either. Nice job, fellas. You lost a star just like that.

Now, the grub. It was alright, I guess. Had some good stuff, like the Patatas Bravas. Just some roasted taters covered in tomato sauce, but it hit the spot. The lamb was decent too, but small for the price. Croquettes were a bit meh. And donâ€™t even get me started on the red sangria. It was like they just poured some wine and fruit juice into a glass and called it a day. Not impressed. 

So, the bill comes and itâ€™s about $60 sans tip. Turns out we paid extra for sitting at a table instead of the bar. Like, what even is that? Happy hour prices should be the same everywhere, you feel me? So yeah, thatâ€™s my two cents on this place. Service stinks, foodâ€™s alright. Maybe try it out for yourself, but donâ€™t say I didnâ€™t warn you."

"This joint's got real character. Owners did a swell job fixin' it up. Had a blast watchin' 'em turn it into somethin' special. 

Other spot's cool too, minus the DBs. Parkin's a bit hairy, but the valet's top-notch. 

Service was A-okay on my Friday afternoon visit. Celebratin' a buddy's birthday. Had some killer apps - Trifecta, Double Down, Crabmeat and Artichoke Dip. Waitress was attentive, kept us posted on Happy Hour start time. 

Place started fillin' up around five o'clock. Golf crew rolled in, sweaty and lookin' for a spot to park their behinds. Atmosphere's still chill, though. Good mix of ages, young and old. 

Plenty of TVs to catch a game or two. Got a bit loud by the patio, but we were havin' a ball anyways. Lot of room to breathe, plenty of elbow room. Lookin' forward to a dinner visit, stay tuned!"

"The Green Owl gets 4-5 stars for grub, but service drags 'em down. Went there with the boyf last week. Took a bit to snag our waitress' attention, but we split an order of crabby cakes and each got our own meals. Crabby cakes were tasty, sauce was top-notch. Boyf's chili and cornbread were solid, and my "meatball" sub with kale chips was a hit. But damn, it took 40 minutes for our food to arrive. Waitress didn't give us an update, either. Food was great when it finally came, tho. Sandwich was hot, bread was crispy, and eggplant meatballs were flavorful. Woulda liked to try dessert, but $6 was too rich for my blood. Might go back to Green Owl, tho. Lotta other menu items I wanna try."
"Food was decent, pricey though. Went for a fast lunch, service was fine. Skip the kimchi, not worth it."

Saturday night, Oregano's was slammed. I figured others might be in the same boat. Didn't matter to me, I was hankering for Mexican grub anyways. Service was top-notch, beer was ice-cold, salsa was delish. Ordered the signature chimichanga, mom went for rolled tacos. Plates were ginormous. Cream cheese made everything better, especially those chimis. Yum. Not the best Mexican spot I've been to, but worth another visit for sure.
"Went to a hip-hop night, but they didn't play much hip-hop. Didn't matter though, still had a good time."

"Fresh fish, reasonable price. Best sushi in the valley, but service is slow. Bad service, often rude. Don't go in a hurry. Once, it took 25 minutes for an itemized check. Still don't know what it was. Love their sushi, but time to find a new spot. Happy hour prices are a plus, Sunday through Thursday."

"Solid store with knowledgable staff, but prices are a tad steep. One employee suggested a collar that worked wonders for our pullin' pup. Friendly folks all around, plenty of pet supplies to choose from, but prices are a hair high. Avoid Banfield, though. Had a bad experience with their "plan" for our old dog. Felt pressured into pricey treatments, couldn't always get what we wanted, and it ain't cheap. Better off gettin' exercise for your pet in the summer, grabbin' food, litter, and checkin' sale prices. Maybe snag a treat or toy, too. But steer clear of Banfield, feels like buyin' a car all over again."

"Review's for casino, shops, pool. No strong feelings either way. Shops look good, new reno. Only go to Urban Outfitters. Pool's great, beachy vibes, not too crowded. Casino's standard Vegas fare. Chandeliers are a nice touch. Overall, clean, okay casino. Don't mind coming here, lots of good restaurants, House of Blues, families welcome, Shark Reef's a bonus."

"Good eatery for the folks in Vegas. A tad steep, but that's Sin City for you. Menu offered some unique options, yet the grub wasn't exactly mind-blowing. Standard American breakfast fare with a few twists. Service was decent, seated promptly without much wait. Peak brunch hour saw a small queue."

"US Egg's interior could use some updating, but the grub's still good. Not a fan of shelling out extra for sub-par hash browns and a soggy English muffin instead of fruit. Feels like I'm paying more for less these days. Still, US Egg's a reliable spot for a hearty meal. Just don't expect to impress anyone with a visit there."

"Chilenita's got the best empanadas in town. Great spot for lunch, whether you're takin' it to go or sittin' down. Friendly staff, killer grub. Prices are right, too. They got 13 different empanadas to choose from. No other joint's got that kind of variety. I'm a big fan of Chilenita."

"Food's decent, not too pricey. Sandwiches go for eight to ten bucks. Had a burger with pork barbecue and onion straws, iced tea, cost me fourteen. A bit steep for lunch, but not bad. Place was packed, twenty or so at the bar. Only one bartender, but she handled it well. TVs all over, sports and trivia. Good spot in the USX building, that's why it's busy."

"Went to Red Lobster for lunch. Place was hoppin', but we got sat quick. Had the Endless Shrimp, all three of us. Varieties were decent, nothing too exciting. Service was good, not too slow or fast. Everyone was friendly. Price was steep for this town, but not shocking. All-in-all, A-OK."
"Food's good here. Mostly. Pork kebab's got too many bones though. Service? Forget about it. Made me wait for my drink, then my sauce. If you don't mind going without, give it a shot."
"Phoenix spots got bird, we add to grub. Not this joint. Drove 10 extra, found out no fowl, not a good time."

"Food's good, service is poor. Been here twice, both times they messed up our order. Second time, no apology. Waitstaff's reactive, not proactive. Decent grub, but pricey. Wanted to like it, but too many reasons to skip it."

"Grilled cheese, ultimate. Service? Poor. Staff chat, cook works. Lunch, wonderful. Front of house, slacking. Hours changed, closed till three. Place gonna shut down. Pool prices, great during promo."

"My pal's girl came to town from Austin, studying architecture and all that jazz. We had to hit up the Frank Lloyd Wright joint, no question. Place was straight fire, I gotta say. But listen, they wanted us to shell out thirty to eighty bucks for a damn tour? No way, Jose. We took a stroll around the house and checked out the gift shop instead. It was cool, but we were bummed about skipping the tour."

"Aria cafe, a quick bite joint, good for spendin' them resort credits. Used to just grab some pastries and chocolates for the fam back home, but recently tried their crepes. Had a savory one with ham, cheese, and mushrooms, real good. Came with some greens and tomatoes too. Their dessert crepe, vanilla custard cream inside, mixed berry sauce on top, real tasty. Lines are long, but they move 'em through quick. Pricey, but worth it."

"This joint's always slammed. Don't know why. Maybe it's the sound system, which is top-notch, best in town. That's something, at least. But getting to the pool tables is a war. It's tight, man. Once you're there, though, it's not bad. Decent number of tables too. Not bad overall, but I'll be back for more recon."
"Colorful joint, especially if you're lookin' for a place to smoke some weed with a bunch of strange cats playin' drums. Other than that, it's a snooze."

"Wife wanted Indian grub, so we checked out this joint. Not big, but decent buffet. Mother's Day special included mango lassi - damn good - and a rolled-up pancake thingy with lentils. Cold bar had chutneys, salad, fruit, and soups - tomato, lentil, and spicy. Standard Indian fare, but goat curry stood out - tender, flavorful. Tandoori chicken, too - juicy, not dry. Paneer sagg was alright. Some veggie options, but I stuck to the good stuff. Not bad, but could use some more heat."

"Folks, let's keep it real. It's fast food, no matter how you slice it. Pricy, maybe, but still fast food. My buddies and I had a Groupon, so we went all out, trying a bit of everything. Staff was friendly, attentive too, bringing our grub to the table. Shakes? Top-notch. All the toppings you could want. Veggie burger? Not bad. Beef burgers? Gone in sixty seconds. Curly fries? Popular, sure, but give me the skinny fries any day. Two thumbs up."

UltraStar's new in town. Lobby's like an airplane hangar, all cold and corporate. You can feel the committee's touch everywhere. Concession stand and coffee bar? Yeah, real funny to the Europeans. Seating area's got no charm. Not a place to linger. Theatre's alright, but nothing special. Film started on time, at least. UltraStar could learn a thing or two from Harkins.

"Food's decent, service is good. Salads take their time, same with chicken strips. Wraps are a safe bet. Soup's good, but don't get too comfortable with it. It's the daily special most days. A solid choice when you're sick of takeout or need a break from sandwiches."

"The restaurant was pleasant, the staff friendly. But the grub? Nothing special. We expected a five-star feast, but what arrived was mediocre, at best. Frida's in Glendale serves better Mexican fare. My nachos, however, were a hit. Everyone devoured them. For me, it's all about finding exceptional Mexican cuisine. Diego didn't deliver. Nice atmosphere, friendly service, unremarkable food."

"Layers, love the grub and combos. Organic, too. Been a fan since they opened. But, rating's dropped 'cause recent visits haven't been as great. Baked goods still rock, but kitchen food's slipped. Pasta was swimming in oil, ruining the dish. Meatloaf sandwich was a mess, bread was soggy and broken. Had to eat it with a fork and knife. Used to be better. Maybe different bread or chef? Something's changed. Not gonna discourage anyone, still a fan, but Layers can do better."

"Tell 'em if you're in a rush. I called ahead, gave clear instructions - plastic bags for the bialys, had to pack 'em in my suitcase. But no, they weren't ready. Had to wait, cost me more. Damn it. Seventy-two bucks for thirty-nine bialys, including the taxi fare. What a waste."

"Been here twice. Same selection, but not sure. Like walkin' into an aunt's house. Friendly workers, speak Tagalog, good or bad. Pork gisantes, tasty pancit. $7.99, not much to complain about. Other goodies at register. Be back with fam soon. Honorable mentions: Pusit, Diniguan (dinardaraan). Parking's odd, one way only, correct entrance. Small lot, usually find parking quick."

"Poked around on Yelp for something new. Found this joint with a wide selection of fresh, authentic Poke. Nice surprise. Sampled before buying, liked the spicy avocado ahi. Not too spicy, just right. Enjoyed it, only had it for lunch that day. Place doesn't look like much, but worth stopping in."

I walked into Thai Taste, feeling peckish after a day at the park. The place was small, but cozy, with traditional Thai decor. I ordered the green curry with chicken, expecting a decent kick from the green chilies. But, it was surprisingly mild. Maybe I'll ask for it extra hot next time. The prices were reasonable, and the service was good. My meal came quickly, and I left feeling full and content. Not bad for a Thai place in Charlotte. I'll be back to try the Pad Thai and, hopefully, a spicier green curry.
"House of Blues. You know the drill. Standing room, unless you shell out for bottle service or the balcony's open. Sound's good, no complaints."

"Pizza Hut. No need to say more. You know what you're getting. But I gotta give props to the crew at the carry-out joint I hit up sometimes. They're always friendly, trying their best with what they got. Gotta give 'em a thumbs up. Three stars, that's the law."

"Large dinner parties, A+ experiences. This time, reservation for two in the dining room, happy birthday dinner. Restaurant full and busy, seated upon arrival. Drink orders taken promptly, then waited...

Salad and entree orders taken, salad arrived quick. Waitress assigned to 10-top table, chef/owner hosting, ignored us rest of dinner. Flagged down bus person for water refills, asked for additional bread, waited for entrees, requested water refills, final request for check. 

Food was okay, angel hair with tomato sauce, gnocchi, good portions, served steaming hot."

"First off, the spice bouquet makes its presence known. Memories of its broth, cleverly seasoned with cloves, bay leaves, coriander seeds, and cardamom. Variations on the same theme. The Classics are more polished, with cleaner cuts of meat. The Adventurers, on the other hand, have a less refined beef anatomy, with juicy flanks and crunchy tripe. If the lack of asepsis bothers you, best to avoid the bathroom. I deduct a star for this reason."
"Pasta, good. Wine, good. But can's trust Italian restaurant with Hershey's syrup on tiramisu. Sorry."

"Came here on a freebie from a radio contest. Not sure I'd have paid for it otherwise. Steak was decent, but overpriced. They do have a sample platter, though - filet, Kobe, and New York strip for around 70 bucks. Kobe was solid, but it's hard to mess up a good cut of meat. Mashed potatoes were alright, tried the trio and the truffle and lobster version was the best. Wouldn't come back, too many better options around."

"Capriotti's makes a damn fine sandwich, but they're overpriced and stuck in the past. No whole wheat bread? Get with the times, boys. Every other joint's got it. Fire House, Subway, Port of Subs, Quiznos - they all offer a healthier option. Come on, Capriotti's, step up your game."
"Buses run late. Students ride free. Nasty weather? MTD's the way."

"Not too shabby! Been here a few times, still haven't fallen head over heels. 

Antipasta platter was alright. Mozzarella was good, bruschetta had too much pesto, and calamari wasn't crispy enough. Chicken marsala was meh. Tasted more grill than sauce. Mashed potatoes were decent. Should've stuck with my usual pasta carrabba. 

Service is always top-notch!"
"Nations don't need no stinkin' English, we can look after ourselves just fine. Freedom!"

"Went to Einstein's for breakfast, Sunday mornin', just before nine. Line was out the door, but we decided to wait. Moved pretty quick, only took thirteen minutes to order and pay. Dining area's decent, so we found a table easy. Food came four minutes later. Had the applewood bacon and cheddar egg sandwich on a plain bagel. Hot and good, but a bit pricey."

"Met up with a buncha folks at this joint. Twenty or so. Got to try a few dishes. Some were good, some weren't. They got European beers, that's a plus. Took 'em a while to bring out the grub, even though we booked ahead. Family-run spot, mom, dad, and the kid were all workin'. Good to support the locals, I reckon."

"Came here for the first time today. Place is decent if you're hankerin' for some boba without the hassle of goin' to Chinatown. Got the boba milk tea with jelly - tasted like volcano tea, so I was pleased. My boyfriend got the taro smoothie, said it was subpar. Guess it's hit or miss. Docked off points for lackluster selection and uninspired atmosphere. Inside's cramped, plain, and dull. Feels like a grab-and-go joint, not a spot to linger. Would be nice if they sold snacks too."

"Golfing in The Ridges, a swanky Summerlin neighborhood, had me stoked. Shotgun start, fundraiser gig. Nicklaus-designed course, touted as his best. Potential? Sure. Actualized? Not quite. Dry conditions, patchy greens. Recent punching, poor healing. Clubhouse visit? Chilly reception. No purchases. Hole layouts? Phenomenal views. Homes, Strip. Bad stretch? Maybe. Give it another go?"
"Salads, good. Jumbo shrimp, nice. Dressings, unique. Lime ranch, great. Customer service, poor. Unhelpful, yeah."
"Went to NY, had pizza. Nowhere near the real deal. Ordered the NY style, disappointing. Nice spot, good service, won't be back."

"I wouldn't have bothered with oil changes for a while if it wasn't for this joint. One-stop shop for oil changes and car washes, plus a Wendy's next door for a bite to eat. They've expanded their services, doing headlight replacements and belt changes now. Last time I went, I got an oil change, new air filter, and car wash for $47 after tax. They also do basic car washes for $3.99 and super washes for $7.99. I've only ever gotten the basic wash, and I've always found things they missed, so their quality isn't impressive. But it's convenient to have everything done in one spot. They have a 48-hour guarantee on their washes, and when you get work done, they give you a 'limited time' coupon for additional work. Not a bad deal."

"John's joint's alright. Decor's tidy, food's decent. You can get pizza from Mario's or a limited bar menu. Their sliders are pretty damn good, though. Nice and juicy. They got some kinda drink special most days, and enough TVs to catch the game. Service is good, but it can be hit or miss. It's a regular spot for the locals, but I wouldn't go outta my way for it. It's a solid, no-frills bar."

"Breakfast at Gertrude's was solid. Had the sammies with my travel companion. Coffee was strong, but not refilled enough. Ate on the patio, nice way to start the day. Weather was good, a welcome change from the cold."

We stepped into this joint for lunch last week, and it was bustling. A long line snaked out the door, but they coaxed us back with a steaming platter of lechon kawali. I went for the Filipino-style corned beef and spuds, and my companion opted for the oxtail stew. Damn fine grub. It's a humble abode, nestled in a busy strip mall amidst a Chinese plaza. They got all sorts of other edibles for sale too. Name of the place translates to "neighbor," but it's more like "house-connected." Shows how tight Filipinos are with their neighbors, culturally speaking. Price ain't bad either - six bucks fifty for two dishes and rice.

"The store's got some nice stuff, but the staff could use a crash course in manners. The young ones especially, they're rude and act like they don't give a damn. Talking loud, rolling their eyes, ignoring customers. You wouldn't expect that from a high-end place like this. The older staff, though, they're a different story. Polite, friendly, and helpful. Shame the young ones can't take a cue from them."

Sitting here, son playing. Music blasts, gotta holler to talk. Asked 'em to turn it down, they did, then cranked it back up. Inappropriate jams come on, gotta tell staff to switch it off. Don't want my kid hearing about a$$ and twerking, know what I mean? Besides that, not bad.

"The Boozery's got nothin' special goin' on, despite its spot. Small bar, but they squeeze in some outdoor seats. Inside's cozy, but the size's a bit cramped. Limited drink menu, prices like any other joint on Fremont Street. Just your run-of-the-mill downtown bar, nothin' to rave about."

"Met some gals here for early dinner. Place is easy to miss, small building, blink and you'll pass it. Parking's a pain too, few spots out front, couple more in back if you're lucky. Menu's simple, classic dishes, meatloaf, burgers, fish, salads, but underwhelming. Went with veggie burger, fries, nothing special. Service was good though. Might give brunch a shot based on reviews."

"Loud joint. Great for beer, grub, and games. Not the best for chatty nights out. 

Beer selection? Top-notch. Food? Tasty and well-cooked. Service? Slow, and the grub was getting cold by the time it hit the table. 

Server and owner? Friendly folks. Gravy fries and mac & cheese? Flavorful as hell. 

I'm in Glendale, so won't be making the trek across the Valley again. But hey, if you're in the area and want a fun spot for a game and a cold one, give it a shot."

"Location? Prime. Walk to Notre Dame, Old Montreal, Chinatown, Latin Quarters, St. Catherine's, art museums, metro, shopping, restaurants. Room? Big. High ceiling, king bed, small kitchen. Staff? Friendly. Provided free cot. Internet? Free. Breakfast? Continental. Toast, croissants, cereals, fruits, coffee. Cons? Only one bed, smelly towels, valet parking ($22/day)."

"Las Vegas buffet, first time for me. Wide variety, not gourmet but good. Crab legs, awesome. Prime rib, mashed potatoes, spicy tuna rolls, solid. Salad bar, just okay. Desserts, meh. Good deal if you're hungry. Tacky atmosphere, Imperial Palace, no surprise."

"Stayed here twice. Renovations made a big difference. Nice king-size bed, updated bathroom. Booked again with friends, got dated rooms. Two doubles, worn furniture, old carpet. Good spot, decent price. Gym costs extra, pool's packed. Slow drink service."
"Food didn't live up to my hopes, plain and simple. Overpriced for what you get, but the wait staff were top-notch."
"Pizza and wings, delivered. Vibes from the staff, weird. Unpleasant. Called in, expecting cheer. Not happening. Last time, till the free coupon. Not bad, better than Hut."

"Hakkasan's inside the MGM. We hit the GL line, free before 1 am, so we hustled our way in. Bouncers were cool, made our entry smooth. Inside, the dance floor was tiny, packed tight. Couldn't even move, let alone dance. Body to body, no breathing room. No big DJ, just a regular night. Can't imagine how wild it gets when the big names spin. Got pretty hammered, memory's fuzzy. That's all I got."

"Been here twice for eyebrow threading. No appointments, just walked in. Desk attendant, professional. Brow threader, excellent job. But could work on customer service. Didn't ask how I wanted my brows or say a word. Still, good enough to come back."

"Place wasn't bad for a buffet. Food was legit, spices on point. Variety was solid, but I didn't know what the hell half of it was. Might hit up an actual Indian joint next time, get just one dish, like chicken marsala or curry. That way, I can really taste the flavors."
"Pricey, but Gandhi's down the street is cheaper.  Food was good, not great.  Better atmosphere than most Indian joints."

"Had a swell time at dinner. Space was a real looker, felt like I was in a swanky joint. Dancers strutting their stuff on the catwalks, added a bit of spice to the evening. But, gotta say, the hostesses were a bit too much for me. Shoulda had a reservation, but they claimed they never got the call. Had to wait an hour, and they acted like they were doin' me a favor. Server, on the other hand, was top-notch. Food was good, not great. Black Cod app was tasty, crab cake was meh. Fried shrimp was good, steaks were solid Morton's fare. Overall, fun night, but with all the great joints in Vegas, doubt I'd be back."

"This joint's got good grub, but it ain't my cup of tea. Service was top-notch, that's for sure. Food? Eh, it was alright. Hash and taters were too salty, couldn't finish 'em. Stick with the waffles and pancakes, they looked decent. Can't say I'd recommend it, unless you like your food drowning in seasoning. It's a fun spot, though."

Atlanta Bread, once a Panera copycat, now boasts its own creations. I sampled the Italian veggie panini recently - flavorful, but pricey for the portion. The complimentary pickle and kettle chips didn't quite fill me up. \n\nThe atmosphere is pleasant, and the free Wi-Fi is a plus. However, the service is lacking. Still, it's a decent choice for a sandwich craving. Just avoid the uninspired pasta dishes.

"Sometimes, amidst the fancy eats, ya crave somethin' plain. This joint fit the bill. Not bad for a cafe, especially considerin' the limited lunch options on a lazy Sunday. Reminded me of Cheesecake Factory, what with the extensive menu and friendly staff. I went for the Fried Chicken and Mashed Potatoes. The chicken was a tad salty, but the potatoes were decent. Had a Strawberry Martini since they were out of Pear. Hubby's cheeseburger and fries were satisfactory. I'd return if I had to, but there's better grub nearby."

"Decent buffet for locals, I reckon. Didn't have to pay myself, thanks to my partner's comp. But if I had shell out over $50 for two people, I'd be a mite more critical. It's just a mid-level spread, after all. 

Went on seafood Friday. Nothing too impressive - same old fare you find at most Vegas buffets. Average, at best. Our server was friendly, though. Hot crab legs were pretty good. 

But the sushi was cold and lackluster, and the cold shrimp was soft and floppy. Salmon looked moist, but it wasn't. 

Hush puppies were just fried salt balls. Fried catfish tasted like "chicken fried" but the batter was soft from sitting too long. Carrot cake was dry as dust, and the chocolate fudge was no better. 

Crab was good, at least. Presentation of the shelled seafood dishes was nice, and they were flavorful. Rest was just "meh." Kids would enjoy it, sure. And folks with a bit of extra cash looking for a relaxing meal."

"Pasta portion? Huge. Didn't need apps, but got 'em anyway. Spaghetti with meatballs, classic. If they can't nail it, bad sign. Noodles, al dente. Meatballs, juicy. Stuffed from cured meats and flatbread pizza. Came back later, drunk, for more pizza. Everyone else did too."
"Ate here twice. First time, food poisoning. Second time, sticking to veggies and rice. Rice, top-notch. Generous portions too. Working-class Asians like me, we love our rice. This place delivers."
"Vegetarian fajitas, ten bucks. Not a bad deal, but you don't get much tofu. Jack Astor's got better fajitas in every way. Overall, not bad, but I wouldn't order 'em again."

"Burgers, I'm a sucker for 'em. But it takes a damn good one to impress me. Indulge, they think they can, but they always screw up the temp. Hate that. Outback's got the right idea - undercook 'em all, I don't give a damn. And for Christ's sake, add some salt to the beef. Happy hour deals, now we're talkin'."

"Food was top-notch. Service, too. Get the sides - lentils and hummus, both excellent. Ran outta pita bread, but they hooked me up with more. Dessert? Strawberry bar, can't remember the name, but it was damn good. Ordered the Good Earth sandwich, fresh ingredients, but the sauce was off. Guacamole sandwich, better, but red sauce too sweet. Split 'em with a buddy, both agreed. Tree of Life, the other vegan option, went well with the boys."

"Lifetime's got top-notch facilities, no question. But let's talk about what really goes down in the men's locker room. I'm not kidding, this place gets wild after hours. I've seen a 55-year-old dude blow-drying his junk not once, but twice, while I was at the sink next to him. My friend was on his left, and this guy was straight up sandwiched between us, buck naked, stretching and blow-drying like it was nobody's business. I bailed on the gym, scared shitless. And it gets better. Another time, two dudes in their 30s were slapping each other's asses with towels, buck naked, chasing each other around the gym. They damn near knocked me over. Now, I ain't homophobic, but come on, there's a time and a place. And apparantly, Lifetime's the spot. Proceed with caution."

"High hopes, but let's start with the good stuff. Big parking lot, modern joint, plenty of space. One person running the show up front, doing a damn fine job. Ordered chicken red curry, papaya salad, BBQ chicken, pad thai, and an extra side of sweet rice. Sweet rice, soggy and overcooked, served in a plastic bag. BBQ chicken, not BBQ at all, just a piece of chicken breast marinated in dried curry rub, pan-fried. Didn't like it. Papaya salad, too salty, missing that lime kick. Chicken red curry, loved the bamboo shoots and veggies, but the curry sauce was bland, needed some fish sauce. Pad thai, the kids loved it, but I was done with it before I even tried it. Not returning, still searching for real Thai food in AZ."

"Manager took care of our bill, no fuss. Second time issues with service. First time, no water, no bill. Tonight, food to wrong people, cold. Told 'em we didn't want it, no attitude. Great customer service, but two strikes in a row. Comfortable seats, nice tables, screen, atmosphere, bar - good. Dining experience - bad. Rather focus on movie than what's wrong. Bottom line: Snacks and drinks in big purse, enjoy the show."

"This joint's got some charm, ain't it? Big ol' dance floor, plenty of space to move around. Decor's not half bad either, bartenders are friendly. Shame about the clientele, though. Guys here ain't exactly the sharpest tools in the shed. Still, not a bad spot to dolly up and cut a rug."
"Cool joint. Volcano show, good grub. Better than The Burger Joint, same spot. Pricey, but worth it."
"Roberto's, it's a joint I used to love. Good food, but not great anymore. Been to Mexico, had some real good street tacos. Now, it's just average. Still good, but not what it used to be."
"Been here twice. Service good, atmosphere relaxed. Pizza meh, tried a few. Sauce and crust not my thing. But, liked the other stuff - sides, salads, soups. Would come back, but not for the pizza."

"Good joint, good vibes, and solid service. But the bread? Meh. They're going for that heavy, wet stuff, which ain't my cup of tea. Just found Wildflower Bread Co., though. Their bread's got the right stuff - light, dry, but still juicy and snappy."

"We found this joint's lunch buffet by chance on our last day in Vegas.  It followed some rough times at Studio Cafe.  For a set price, it's not a bad deal considering how much grub costs in this town.  The dining room was colder than a witch's heart, but our server was top-notch.  She saw us shaking like leaves and offered us coffee and tea.  Kept 'em filled too."

"Tucked away in the Palazzo shops, this humble wine bar pours decent drinks and boasts a solid selection in its adjacent store. Prices are steep, but that's Sin City for you. Glassware leaves much to be desired - think cheap hotel banquet styles. Service, however, is top-notch. They keep your glass full."
"Playground's decent, but needs work. Speedball's closed, refs are slackin'. They fixed the gun, though. Cleaned it good. If they stepped up their field game, this place'd be five stars easy."

"Went to the Block & Grinder, heard good things. Food, 4-5 stars. Atmosphere and service, 2 stars. Cramped space, no waiter assigned. Waited 12 minutes, finally got a waiter. Slow service, but friendly. Pimento cheese appetizer, delicious. Ribs, lean and tender, top-notch. Would return, try a weeknight, hoping for better service. Want to try cocktails too."

"Papago's where I hike most days. It's close to home and the trails are easy. Can't say I love it, but it's convenient and safe. Don't worry 'bout getting hurt 'less you slip climbing a butte. Park's clean, views are decent, and I've seen some birds. Good spot for beginners, kids, and dogs. Worth a visit if you're lookin' for some fresh air."

"Locals raved about this joint's burgers. I gave 'em two shots, thinking the first visit was a fluke. But damn, the grub was dull both times. A big hunk of meat don't cut it. I had a burger and steak, and they were both flavorless. Major letdown."

"Bed Bath & Beyond, overpriced and with poor parking to boot. Not my cup of tea, unless I've got one of those sweet 20% off coupons. Last time I was there, I was on the hunt for some Egyptian Cotton linen spray. No luck. They didn't have it. Needed a new everyday pot too, but they wanted too much for it. Passed on that. Grabbed a shower curtain liner and a couple candles, but had to find the pot elsewhere."

"Excited to eat here, but ultimately let down. Had frisee salad and lobster bisque for apps - delicious. Big chunks of bacon, broken yolk made it better. Half bottle of red wine, worth it. Steak was meh, had better in Texas. Surf and turf, nothing special. Rolls were good, but not worth the hype. Hartz Chicken has better yeast rolls. Wish I could say more."

"Downtown hotel. Not the Cal. Can't stand that joint. Makes me itch, like a bad case of crabs. Happy Faye, happy stay, I say. Standard rooms, nothing special. But the staff, they're good eggs. Always helpful, always friendly. And the 24-hour coffee shop? Decent grub, reasonable prices. Even got some Hawaii-friendly options. Not too shabby."

"Three and a half stars, that's my take on this joint. Nice decor, menu's got some appeal. But, it's a bit too flashy for my taste. Maybe that's the Vegas vibe. Oxtail chili fries, though - damn good. Loaded with meat, flavorful as hell. Must-try if you're new here. Manga burger? Eh, it was alright. Too much sauce, couldn't taste the burger. Matcha green tea milkshake? Now that's a winner. LA's got some great burgers, but Bachi Burger's opening up shop on Sawtelle soon. Let's see how they stack up against the competition."
"Sahara, old and falling apart. Terrible shows, but great character. Too far from the strip's heart, though."

"Renaissance Tower, that's where I worked. Lazy days, I'd come here for a slice. Pizza? Not great, not really. But the breakfast muffin, twice I had it, and damn, it was good. Just the right amount of grease, you know it's real. Cheap too."

"Indian grub ain't my cup of tea, but if I gotta eat it, this joint's the place. They got some non-Indian dishes too, which is nice. Food's got some kick, real authentic stuff. Vegetarians'll find plenty to like here."
"Got a haircut. Liked it. Salon? Not my cup of tea. Too flashy for an old boy like me."
"Decent spot for Indian grub. Haven't tried the buffet, but what I have had is good. Nice to know they keep the meat outta my veggie dishes."
"Sushi's decent here, service too. But can't compete with other spots nearby. Better quality, same price. Maybe back for Korean grub, but not sushi."

"Shoppin's a breeze at this joint. Good deals abound. Luggage game's on point too. Carry-ons, check 'em out. Weekends get wild, so hit it up mid-week, midday. Friendly staff, tidy digs. Return policy? Sixty percent, not bad."

"State employees, doing their job, helped me out. New to the state, needed a change of residency. No car, no driver's license, but a state ID would do. Lady at the front, kind and helpful. Line moved quick, faster than Chicago's DMV. With all the right papers, it's a fair experience."

"We spent four days here last August. It was an alright stay, but I doubt I'll be back unless they have a killer sale. The hotel's a bit worn down, but we had friends getting hitched at Mandalay Bay and we couldn't afford to stay there. So, we settled for this place since it was close by. Construction was a real pain in the ass though. They were banging away all weekend long. The pool area was tiny and nothing special. But hey, Club LAX was a plus. We got in for free since we were guests and it was a blast. No line, no fuss. We also appreciated the tram ride to Excalibur and Mandalay Bay. It beat walking in the scorching heat. Our room was cozy for two people, but any more and it would've been a squeeze. The food court could use some more options. All in all, you don't get much, but you don't pay much either."
"We tried three tables before settling at the bar.  No luck with the lager.  What kind of brewery runs dry?  Decent grub, subpar service, and the usual Glendale crew: aging whites."
"Modern hotel. Nice vibe. West side for 3G/4G. Pool's closed most of the day. WiFi'll cost ya. Drinks at poolside? Ridiculous."
"Food's good, but service? Forget about it. You'll be waiting forever. Make sure you've got nothing else planned for the night, 'cause you'll be stuck here, waiting for your drinks and grub."

"Went to my first Panthers' game. Packed house, even though I don't give a damn about the Panthers. Fans everywhere, tailgating, having a blast. Stadium's surroundings are dead otherwise, but on game day, it's alive. Good facilities, decent grub, not too pricey. Family-friendly vibe, plenty of tix available. Check it out."

"Food's been average, twice I've had it. Prices, though? Outta this world. Happy hour's decent, atmosphere's great, but that's about it. Unless you wanna impress someone with your bank account, no point in comin' here. Ocean Club's got better grub, that's for sure. Won't be back 'less someone gives me a gift cert. Too rich for my blood, even with a drink it's over 60 bucks, splurgin' territory. Not worth it."

"Don't like the joint's vibe or the noise. Music's too damn loud and crappy. Take-out's the way to go. Food's alright, but takes its sweet time getting to you. Had to wait over 25 minutes once, and that was during lunch rush. It's more like a grilled wrap than a burrito, but it's tasty. No debit, though. Come on, it's 2011. Get with the program, boys. Parking's a pain too. Angled spots that make you drive over the sidewalk. Pro tip: don't mow down any pedestrians when backing out."

"Murphy's got a sweet spot in downtown Chandler. Place has potential, this is a good start. Irish pub, we don't have enough of 'em in the Valley, right? 

It's a narrow joint, but the bar's long. Gets crowded quick, though. People vanish after 11pm. Don't know why, they just leave. Maybe they know somethin' I don't. But when it's poppin', it's a mix of young bloods and old heads. 

Tons of beers on tap, find your poison. Staff's friendly, they hustle to get to everyone. Live music some nights, just a dude or two jammin' in the corner. Not a lot of space, but it works. 

I'm optimistic, hope this place sticks around. Area needs it."

"Drinks good, bartender rude. Party and I hit VBGBs first, then Willies. Ordered drinks at counter. Friend asked what tasted like chocolate, bartender sassed back, 'Chocolate tastes like chocolate.' We tried Call-a-Cab, he asked if we liked Robitussin. Attitude annoying. Been to Myrtle Beach location, bartender nice, offered samples, checked on us at bar. Don't order Call-a-Cab alone, it's rough. But Shock Treatment, Chocolate Thunder, Sour Apple all tasted great."

"Saturday night's buffet costs 26.95 a head, and I reckon it's a fair deal at 20 bucks. But 27's a mite steep. Now, some grub was top-notch. Steak and salmon, mighty fine. Peanut butter chocolate cream pie, pure delight. But the so-called French onion soup? Pure garbage. Reconstituted onions, same crap McDonald's uses. A Lipton instant soup would've been better. Unacceptable at 30 bucks, let alone 7. Fresh onions ain't that pricey, and a decent French Onion soup ain't rocket science. Shame on 'em."

"Pros: Good tunes on the radio, they played Todd Rundgren during dinner. Lots of server attention, decent selection of draft beer. Pulled pork was good, corn side was good, portions were large. Cons: Hush puppies were unbeatable, awful. Beef brisket was way too salty, mac and cheese was a fried puck with cheese sauce, tiny serving of vinegar sauce. Expensive, $24 for two meat platter with one beer, NYC prices."

"You come here for Berthillon, you'll be let down. Fine American-style gelato, you'll be damn pleased. I fell in betweenâ€”knew I couldn't get the real deal, but thought it'd be better. Choc was milk choc, shoulda been dark. Fruity gelato? No thanks, not compared to France or Italy. But hey, Nutella's good stuff. Try it next time."
"Dim sum at 10 am, only place open this early in Vegas. Quality was fair, har gow small, flavors decent. Prices reasonable for a dive like Rio Casino. Next time, waiting till 11 am."

"Catered an event with 'em. Food was top-notch, two kinds of quiche, rave reviews from the bunch. Forgot the fruit platter, but I had extra grub on hand, so no biggie. Delivery was early, 15-20 min before schedule, hot food's a bitch. Still, good job overall. I'd use 'em again, but double-check the order and stress the delivery time."

"Good: plaintain-black bean mash, lump crab nachos, skinny margarita, chipotle ribs. Bad: service hit-or-miss, enchiladas meh, greens plain. Note: grilled corn used to be fabulous on the cob. People complained it was messy, so they stripped it. Lost something. Worry less about cleanliness, more about good food."

Last night was a bust. Been here a few times before, but last night was subpar. Patio's still great - heaters, live DJ, good tunes. Food and service, though... Food was meh. Going with the meat and cheese platter next time, maybe that'll be better than the bland mozzarella and tomato panini I had. Service was rough. Waitress was strange, sarcastic, made underhanded comments, spilled water on the table every time she refilled a glass, and splashed it on me. Took forever to get our bill, and even longer for her to come back and run the card. She seemed put off whenever we asked for anything. Weird vibes. Bomberos is still solid, but avoid the panini and steer clear of the waitress - she'll get ya. Haha.

"I dig this joint for the al fresco seats in the cooler months. The Bellini, ravioli, and rosemary chicken pizza? Top-notch. But let's talk turkey. Their takeout game needs work. I ain't got time for no "pickup windows" nonsense, especially when I'm shelling out top dollar. Oregano's, you gotta step up your customer service game, ya hear me? You got too much competition in this town. I'll give 'em another shot soon, we'll see how it goes."

"Seafood trio over risotto, I ordered. Small, it was, compared to others', but pricey. Salmon, shrimp, good. Rest, meh. Calamari, spinach artichoke dip, good too. Peanut butter mousse, awesome. Experience, just ok. Not lovin' it, not hatin' it. Wouldn't go out of my way, but wouldn't object either."

"Pizza's like sex. Good or bad, it's still satisfying. This joint? Meh. Pizza was decent. Liked the garlic crust. Screwed up my order though. Pepperoni and olives instead of garlic. No apology, no discount. Chicken fingers? Meh. Cheap. Price was right, but wouldn't go back."

"This joint's a dive, but that's what you pay for. Location's the selling point, smack in the middle of the strip. Penthouse? Seen better. Dealer impersonators were a kick, till I realized they cycled through the same acts twice a night. Still, not bad."

"First timer here. Ordered online, quick 'n' easy. Food was ready when I got there, fresh 'n' hot. No sit-around-gettin'-cold-'n'-soggy business. Got the Brisket burger. Cheese, BBQ sauce, brisket, 'n' bacon. Sauce wasn't overpowerin', good thing since I don't like things drowned in sauce. Brisket was alright, flavorful but coulda been more tender. Burger was cooked well done, prefer some pink in mine. Maybe shoulda mentioned that in the comments. Soup, chicken tortilla, was real good. Packed with flavor, had a bit of a kick. Shredded chicken 'n' corn, real tasty. Liked it better than the burger. Meal was good, I'd come back 'n' try other stuff."

"I'm a fussy movie-goer, thanks to my stint as a college projectionist. I've got high standards for film viewing, and I'm picky about the theater itself. This place felt worn down, like it had been smoking too many cigarettes. The bathrooms were decent but not spotless. The seats were stadium style, but the rows were too close together, so my neighbors' restless feet kept stepping on mine. The movie was just okay. Would I go out of my way to watch a movie here? Doubtful."

"Burgers, big and juicy, but pricey. Onion rings, crispy and plentiful. Black Milk Tea, delicious. Kimchi burger, the bomb. Staff, friendly. But, my Kiki burger too sweet, like the Ronin. Oxtail Chili fries, forgettable. Bar, mildewy. Bathrooms, limited. Beer, overpriced. I'll return for another burger, or just stick with the kimchi."

"Mimis, been there a few times. Inconsistent, that's the word. Breakfast, usually good. Dinner, not so much. Went last weekend, three-course steak deal for ten bucks. Shoulda known better. Salad, okay. Steak, mashed potatoes, fake grill marks. Sundae, vanilla ice cream, chocolate syrup. You get what you pay for."

"Lunched here. Biggest buffet in Vegas, no doubt. Impressive spread, too. But quality dips with each return trip. Not four-star fare, more like a cheap eatery. Price tag matches the mediocrity, but hey, if you're looking for a cheaper option with plenty of variety, this'll do."

"Grabbed some croissants for the boys and me this mornin'. A bit overcooked, but still good. Miss the old place down the strip mall. New ownership, prices doubled, quality gone down. Fillings lackin', size shrinkin'. Rather they ditch the new flavors and stick with what worked. Prices up again, so I'm takin' my business elsewhere. Better bang for my buck across town."

"Rented a car, hit Vegas at 80 mph. Met up with two other couples at Caesars Palace, dragged 'em away from the Baccarat tables to grab a drink at OG. Best way's to call ahead, they'll send a limo and you skip the cover charge. Buy a bottle, get free drinks. Bill came out to 415 bucks, including tax and tips. Had a sweet booth with curtains. Girls went upstairs to check out the guys, but it was dead. Few girls, hot dudes, tight bodies, abs, guns flexin'. Intimidating. We dipped. Husband asked why we were back so soon. Lap dances were meh. Some good, some bad, some real, some fake. Go with couples, it's more fun that way."
"Slices big, but not the best joint for pizza. Worth a shot, but won't be our go-to spot. Price don't match quality."

"In Vegas, I found myself at Red Robin in the Galleria mall, seeking refuge from the crowds and heat. The familiar atmosphere and menu were comforting, and I ordered a simple burger. The server apologized for the delay, but I was in no rush. When my meal arrived, I was pleased with its quality and size. If you're craving a satisfying burger, give Red Robin a try. I'd like to explore their menu further next time I'm in the area. 3 out of 5 stars from me."
"Crepes station, top-notch. Seafood, just okay. Place could use a good scrubbin', front and back."

"Parking's a bitch. One star for that. Getting in and out's a pain too. Whoever designed this place was an idiot. Five stars for convenience though. Close to work and home. Service is decent, three and a half stars. Employees are helpful, but there's always a line. Plan accordingly."

"Sushi Creek, that's where we'd usually head. But today, we took a detour, stopped by a place we'd passed a million times. Clean joint, that's what we thought. Sat down, ordered the Denver omelet, some breakfast bowl. Good grub, good service. Waiter kept our drinks full, made sure we were pleased with the food."

"Haven't been to Old Navy in a bit, so I was alright with the joint. First time, it was a bit of a mess, what with all the Christmas shoppers and all. But the second time, it was a bit tidier. They had some decent sales, too. For all ages, mind you."

"This place would normally get five stars from me. Everything's usually top-notch. But today, with my mom, it was a bust. Fried chicken and a basic burger, that's what we got. Chicken was a letdown, real fatty. Cornbread muffin started out warm, then turned into a rock. Veggies were a mess too. For fourteen bucks, not worth it. If you're at BBD, go for the Cali Benedict or the sweet cream waffle. And don't forget to finish with a personal pie or their specialty, a big bear bear claw. That's the way to do it."

"We picked this hotel based on Yelp reviews. Clean room, comfy beds, and a sweet little balcony. But the free Wi-Fi never worked. Didn't bother with the free snacks, too much hassle going down to the lobby all the time. Place got loud at night, thin walls, but there was a wedding going on. Breakfast was nice, quaint, and busy. Didn't see much of the staff, can't comment. Not sure if I'd stay again, but it was a good little getaway."

"Looks ain't bad, gym's a bit cramped though. Cardio's decent, treadmills and Xfit, you know. Pool's still closed, man. Like, a month left. Sunbathers at Bellagio, they're living it up. Vdara, she's a harsh mistress. Service is friendly, but slow. Bulb in the bathroom, still busted. Coffee's Kcup, two free, rest in the minibar. Bring your own milk, just saying. Silk Road, on-site grub, not open for dinner no more. Give 'em a ring before booking, they got some stuff going on."

"We arrived, bloated with liquids. We revived ourselves with soda and water, necessary for survival in the scorching heat. I yearned to sample three float flavors, but the mob of people was too chaotic, darting about like maniacs. No way, kiddos. Let's keep moving...to the M & M World."
"Came here with a crew, pre-dinner drinks. Didn't dig the hostess thing at the bar. Had some drinks, fries, all good, but overpriced. Not worth the hurry."
"Market's alright. Needs more fresh produce, though. Good vendors, but not enough variety."
"BK, no frills, just good grub. Clean joint, friendly servers, and VAULT soda on tap. That's my jam."

"The joint's name is like callin' a place The Pizza or The Burger. Simple, direct. But, The Sushi? That's like sayin' The Taco. Don't make much sense. 

Now, the grub? Top-notch. Fresh, flavorful. You get the idea. But, the portions? Small. Like, real small. And the prices? Higher than most other sushi spots 'round here. 

Inside's cozy, though. Nice atmosphere. Big screens, too. Four of 'em. Like bein' in a basketball arena, almost. 

Staff's friendly, too. Offered me hot tea or water while I waited for my to-go order. Polite, you know? 

Overall, it's a maybe. If you got money to burn and ain't that hungry, give it a shot. But, if you're lookin' for somethin' heartier, keep lookin'."

"Edinburgh's preserved old school pubs, like the Rose St Brewery, are a treat. Quaint, with carpeted floors and vintage city pics on the walls. Upstairs lounge, my favorite spot. Plaque proudly claims Pub of the Year '85. Had a goat cheese salad, not my usual meat-loving fare, but sounded fresh. Two big hunks of cheese, mixed greens, seasonal veg, light dressing. Pair it with a Guinness, perfect. Staff could be more attentive, but it's a pub, so no frills. Kudos, Rose St Brewery. Keep it real."
"Good music, talented artists, but the story's a mess. Not as smooth as a Cirque show."

"Coffee shop's hard to judge by a single french soda, but this joint's not bad. Three bucks for a drink's a bit steep, but it tastes good and they use top-notch syrup. I'll have to come back for a coffee to give it a proper assessment."
"Casino's small, quiet. Machines clean, spaced out. Drinks then food. Low traffic means less smoke."
"Bagels, a couple dozen. Work, took 'em to. Don't last long, they don't. Good, the bagels are. Friendly, the service is. Busy, they were. Chat, made time to."

"Cozy joint. Good atmosphere, decent grub. Had birthday dinner here with the missus. Main draw was the Matilda Wong - didn't disappoint. Get it now, you won't regret it. Started with sweet potato ravioli, Gorgonzola cream sauce. Ravioli was great, sauce was too rich and salty. Loved the walnuts though. For mains, steak was solid, pizza was too salty. Forgot the dessert, not that it mattered. Prices were fair, will return to try Farro Saute."

"Sports bar open round the clock. Got all I need. Cheap breakfast, Pt's Platter, better than Ihop or Denny's. Friendly service too. But those video poker machines, they got me. Leave with a full belly and light pockets."

"Went to celebrate the missus's dental school finish. Fancy joint, nice decor. Hostess, friendly. Ordered the steak special, waited 20 minutes. Just okay. Waiter, too busy, didn't take care of us. Didn't even refill my water. Had to drink from the missus's glass."

"Back from my first business trip in 8 months. Security worries as a nursing mom. TSA agent explained the process, courteously. Scanned 12 bags, done in 5 minutes. Delta Terminal 3 has Starbucks and Wendy's for breakfast, but long lines. Construction finished, rental car shuttle easy to find. Short wait at 12:30 am. Shuttle smells of strong air freshener, almost sickening. #Yelp365 - 169/365"

"Drunk? Hungry? This is your spot. Pizza that'll hit the spot, and memories that'll last a lifetime. Don't worry 'bout bein' sober, just follow the scent of cheese and sauce. Tastes like a heart attack in the daylight, but at 1:45 am, it's pure bliss."

"Pros: Fun, laid-back vibe. Great spot at Cosmopolitan. Sick decor--lucha libre meets Vegas--red lamps, video screens with Frida Kahlo and Mao pics. \n\nCons: Menu was lackin'. Pricey for a casual spot servin' fried rice and tacos. Tapas style, so order a few dishes to share. Not really a fusion, just average Chinese and Mexican grub."

"Christmas Eve eve, Carolina Place Mall open late. Let's wander, watch the crowds scramble for gifts. Not my first choice, but H&M nearby makes it worth it. Typical anchors, old school vibe. If I'm in the area, I'll stop by. But with better options in Charlotte, it's not a must-visit."
"Brunched here pre-Cardinals game. Grub, good. Drinks, generous. Bus to game, nice touch. Everyone enjoyed, no worries 'bout drivin'."
"Food, delicious. Pricey, yes. Dressed down, we stuck out like sore thumbs. Youngest ones there, by far. Older crowd, sixty-five plus. Views, great. Service, good."

"The club's all rage in Vegas, but I ain't impressed. Too many stairs, especially for a lady in heels. Main room's at the top, where they got their big shows and DJs. But the setup's crap, tables blocking the view. You paid good money to stare at some stranger's back while the DJ spins. Same with the balcony, more tables in the way. Feels like they're trying to strong-arm you into buying a table. Now, Lights, that's a damn good club. Worth checking out for shows."

"Family's had some good meals here, burgers especially. But it's not consistent. Orders are often messed up, food's cold, or burgers are overcooked. For the prices they charge, I expect better. It's hit or miss."

"This joint's got a real small-town vibe goin' on. Food's decent, prices ain't bad either. But let me tell ya, the service is slower than a snail on a hot summer day. So if you're in a hurry, best to steer clear."

"Good service, got the right bike after a mix-up from another store. Spent time with me on shoe choice, answered my questions, but some techniques raised an eyebrow. Haven't needed repairs yet, but I'll be bringing in my beat-up mountain bike soon. Will review then."

"The show was good, the comedian was funny. He only did a few stunts, but they were impressive. Made me wonder how he knew that stuff. At the end, he gave out some lottery numbers. Doubt anyone will actually win with them, but it was a nice touch. Not sure if I'd go back, but that's just how I am. Once it's done, I move on."

"Breakfast here? Top-notch. Endless options. I'll be back. \n\nDinner? Overpriced. Crab and seafood, sure, but not worth the cost. Mesa Grill at Caesar Palace serves a better meal for the same price."
"Average, that's all. Been to better, seen worse. Not my cup of tea, but not bad either."

"Breakfast joint opened up in my 'hood, had me feeling pretty damn good. Been there three times now, always get the same thing 'cause the rest of the menu's a little too out there for me. Went in yesterday, and they've taken all the sides off the menu. Can't get an omelette or two scrambled eggs with bacon, or even a piece of toast. It's one of the nine items or nothing. Don't work for me, that's why I gave 'em three stars. Hope they bring back the basics, or I won't be back."

"Tapas place number two in Vegas. Food was alright, paella being the standout. Wait was long, but worth it. Service was top-notch, welcoming from start to finish. Price, too damn high. Overpriced, even for the Strip. Won't be back. Better options around. Atmosphere was good, plenty of space, decent noise level, clean. All in all, just okay."
"Hit or miss joint. Service, subpar most times. Chicken fried rice, oil slick or dry as bone. Orange chicken, chewy as hell. Prices, average. Not the best Chinese grub in North Phoenix."

"Lunch with a departing colleague brought me here. Unimpressed by the eggy popover bread, I was glad my panini arrived, stuffed with mushrooms and gruyere. Fries abounded. Bank employee discount, a welcome perk."

I found solace in this hotel restaurant, late one Monday eve. The bar brimmed with folk, but I didn't mind. Gnocchi, misspelled on the menu, arrived, and I pondered correcting the waitress's pronunciation ("knock-y"). Her Bigelow Grill-e tale made me smile, and I let it slide. Despite the cigarette haze, the ambiance pleased me. Bigelow's phrase, "innovative and imaginative interpretations of ethnic Pittsburgh classics," left me perplexed. Perhaps a local can enlighten me.

"At Marche Atwater, the early bird don't catch no worm. Especially on a cold winter Sunday mornin'. Only a few stores were open, but we managed to snag some pastry at Boulangerie Premi\u00e8re Moisson for breakfas'. A good start to the day. By 8:30, some of the fresh produce stands and stores started openin' up. Marche Atwater's a lot smaller than I expected, prob'ly 'cause it's winter and the outdoor vendors weren't open. Next time, I'll skip Atwater and head straight to Jean-Talon."

"Lobster rolls, my weakness. Came here for lunch, splitting a combo with the missus. Lobster roll was alright, but the meat was chopped up too fine, like canned tuna. Didn't like that. Bun was cut halfway through, like they were scrimping on the lobster. Meat kept falling out with each bite. Chowder fries were nothing special. Over $20 for a mediocre meal? Not impressed."

"White Castle, my go-to spot. Best in town, no question. But out west, Fat Burger's where it's at. Now, about this place... Lyrics brought me here, but it didn't quite live up. Burger was decent, not bad, but not top-notch either. WHAT-A-BURGER kicks its ass. Reminds me of Freddy's, Culver's, Steak and Shake. Had it built with the usual stuff, including sweet relish. Thought I'd give it a shot. Big mistake. Weird, just weird. Hold the relish next time."
"Decent grub, but service was lackin'. Waitress came by a few times, didn't fill our water glasses, and forgot our rolls. Fish was just okay, not exactly fresh."

"Gin Mill. Dive-y. Chrome, scarred wood, bathroom needed a flamethrower. Loud music. Sat at bar, beer in hand, watched young-uns dance. Bartenders moved fast, efficient, friendly. Bouncer checked ID's at door. Taxi stand outside for wobbly folks. Short walk to Light Rail station. Sobered up on ride back to car."

"Dos Chandler's been my jam for a hot minute now. Started with Negra Modelo and Dos X, but now I'm all about that chimi life. Their quesadillas? Top-notch. Work in a New Mexican kitchen, so I know what's up. They should offer more Mexican brews on tap, though. Tequila selection's lackin', too. Frozen margs? Nah. Sticky tables, new servers every time - they need some backup on the floor. Three stars for the dirt, limited beer options, and basic tequila. Come on, Dos, step it up."

"I went to the diner at 8:45 that mornin'. Sat down, got a nod from the waitress. Ordered the handful - two eggs, two pancakes, potatoes, and two slices of bacon. Asked if I could swap the bacon for some veggies, but they wanted another buck. Don't make sense, since the bacon costs more than the veggies on the side menu. But whatever. It was alright, can't say it was great, but not terrible neither."

"Taxi from the airport, cheaper than a shuttle. Bell-Man grabbed our bags, no waiting in line. Check-in, 30-45 minutes on a Sunday. Stayed in the Grand Tower, freshly renovated. King bed, pricey mini fridge, killer view for our anniversary. Spa was great, except for the naked lady in the women's hot tub. Germs, ew! Pool, beware. Came back with a bacterial infection on my legs, four weeks to clear up with antibiotics."

"Grand Lux Cafe, inside the Venetian. Another one in Palazzo, but this one's better. Been to the one in Beverly Hills, similar vibe and grub, but this joint's open 24/7. Fifteen of us, no reservations, still got sat quick. Shared a sausage, pepperoni, and mushroom pizza. Doughy, but the crust was great. Ate just the crust towards the end. They got all sorts of food, like Cheesecake Factory, but steer clear of the 'asian' stuff if you're lookin' for somethin' real."
"Coffee joint claimed their brew didn't taste like coffee, had my doubts. But the espresso wasn't half bad. Not great, but better than that Starbucks swill."
"Good grub. Slow service, like molasses. Manager's on it, but servers? Meh. Took forever to get our sushi, and I had to flag down the manager twice. But hey, the food was worth it."

"Flew into Phoenix last week with my partner for the holidays. Stopped by this joint for lunch before heading out to see the family. Not bad, not bad at all. Had a solid burger, cooked just right. Could've used a few more fries, but didn't really need 'em. Weird thing was the 80's hair band music vids playin'. If I'm ever back in Phoenix, I'd eat here again."

"I found what I needed in a Pitt hotel. Close to the city, but not too close. Free park and a good rate, under a hundred bucks. Room was small, but clean. Front desk folks, friendly. If I'm back in town, I'll stay here again."

"Went to Rigatonys with sis and niece. Shared manicotti, decent. Sis had Mahi special, loved it. Creamy dill sauce, nice. Salad, good portion. Spumoni, legit. Server, Bryce, nice, knew his stuff. Will be back."

"Saturday, I came for lunch. Place was mobbed. Took our grub to go. By the time I dug into my torta ahogada, it was a mess. Soggy, falling apart. Spicy sauce had taken over. Usually, I can handle the heat. Not this time. All I could taste was fire. My buddy got three fish tacos. Tiny. He was still famished. Ordered another full meal. Verdict? Didn't live up to the hype."

"Food's decent, remodel's a nice touch. Been there twice. First time, waitress had an attitude about over-easy eggs, wouldn't eat 'em. Second time, another waitress gave us grief for being a rowdy group after bowling. Told us to keep it down, it's a restaurant, not a playground. Maybe we should start a poker game there, see if they take us seriously then."

"Plenty of poor choices made here. \n\nMeaningless place, yet means everything. Like coming to Maz. Beer selection? Shit. Drinks? Piss. Pool tables? Forget it. Sketchy stuff happens. Still end up here, sometimes. Crappy mood or too lit to go home, too wrecked for elsewhere."
"Service was slow, but grub made up for it. Sushi, delish. Burger, unique and flavorful. Mixed delux fries basket, phenom. Definitely coming back."

"Clean joint, good location. Close to the action, but not too loud. Got a nice lounge with a fireplace, good for a drink or three. Room's alright, but the wifi's slow as molasses. Not a bad spot to crash after a long day."
"Waiter wasn't half bad. Gave me a look like I was lost. Service was just okay. I'm stuffed."

"Qdoba's alright. Similar concept as Chipotle, but the grub just doesn't quite measure up. Their burritos lack that certain je ne sais quoi that makes me wanna come back for more. And let's be real, the decor's a bit of a turn-off. Concrete floors and metal tables? It's like they're trying to make the place feel like a dingy basement. Not exactly the vibe I'm lookin' for, ya know?"

"Went to Applebee's for a coworker's birthday. Never had issues before, but this time, found plastic in my shrimp and spinach salad. Manager and waitress apologized, offered a new salad, and comped my meal. Gave 'em a 3 'cause they fixed the problem quick, but cooks are the ones at fault. Salad was still good, though."

"Sundays, I come here for football. Today, impulse brought me through the door. Sat at the bar, Asian bartender pours drinks like silk. Wings, she says. Phenomenal. Kobe burger too. Home, box open, rot on sight. Two tomatoes, rotten as compost. Smell worse. Back to the joint, assistant tells me that's how they come. Manager steps in, saves face. Bartender, my savior. Otherwise, never again."
"Horchata, a tasty brew. Faces, familiar and friendly. Veggie burrito, a satisfying meal. Breakfast burrito, a morning delight. Prices, fair. Guacamole, needs improvement."
"I hit up this joint three nights a week, around two am. It's never packed, just a handful of folks. I get my own hoop court, do my thing. No crowd, no hassle."

"Tourist trap, maybe. Prices weren't bad, though. Bought a sweet sombrero for five bucks. Other stuff looked decently priced too. Place had all sorts of Mexican goodies for a fiesta or to decorate your joint - masks, plates, cups, garden stuff. Women working there weren't exactly friendly, but the store was tidy and I'm sure you'll find something you like. Lot of trinkets to choose from."

"Been going to PP for damn near two decades. Chiles and Salek, they've been my kids' doctors since day one. Seen a lot of new faces come and go. But now that PP's merged with some other big group, it ain't the same no more. Still love our doctors though, that's why we stick around. My kids are getting older, don't need to visit as often no more. This place just don't got the same warm and fuzzy feeling like it used to."
"Thirty minutes in, still waiting. Not busy, just slow. Patience wears thin. Cheap, yes, but not worth the wait during 'rush' hour."

"This joint's a real monster, pal. It's freakin' huge! Try walkin' through the casino from the strip and you'll get lost for sure. Signs point every which way, but they don't make no sense. You'll end up back where you started, clueless. It's a nice hotel, well-kept, but showin' its age. Had a Wizard of Oz thing goin' on, now it's just gone. No theme, just a buncha green...very, very green."
Manager reached out, offered full refund or free install. Communication mix-up, that's all. Problem solved, kept the truck box cover too.

"Dolce, three-and-a-half stars, maybe four after I try the grub. Good spot, cozy joint. Had the hummus and pita chips, solid snack. Wine bar, always a fan. Servers, not always warm, but no issues. Wish they'd expand the wine list, more options would be nice. Worth a visit, especially if you're already in NoDa."

"Happy hour at this joint, close to work and all that. Decent deals on drinks and grub too. Had the tortilla soup, not bad. Enchiladas were alright, came with rice and beans. Server was swell, shame I can't recall her name. Couple margaritas later, names slip away like sand between your fingers."

"Pizza in Vegas? My buddy said this place had the best. I was skeptical - Vegas isn't exactly known for its pizza. But hey, I'm always down to try something new. So, we went for a large pie with pepperoni, sausage, and black olives. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. The crust wasn't crispy enough and the sausage made the whole thing feel soggy. Not a fan of that. But hey, the crust was decent. Can't say it was the best pizza I've ever had, but it did the job. Is this the best Vegas has to offer? Meh, I'll stick to my NYC pizza."

"Sat in the dining room and at the hibachi grill a few times at this joint. Never had a bad meal at the grill. Food's always been top-notch and the chefs put on a hell of a show. Dining room's a different story though. Waited 30+ minutes for my sushi every time (staff's always apologized...once they even gave us free edamame). Not enough sushi chefs or waiters. Would give this place a higher rating if they stepped up their game. As it stands, it's a solid ***."

"Commuter needed oil change, so I took her in. Price was right, service was quick. Location's convenient too - just a stroll to Costco for some shopping or snacks while you wait. Pro tip: check their Yelp page for coupons before you go. Saved me a few bucks, might do the same for you."

"Las Vegas' newest hotspot, packed like a can of sardines. House floor, vibrant sound, but no room to move. Shoulder-to-shoulder, couldn't dance, couldn't breathe. Moved to the Hip Hop area, equally cramped, but found a tiny corner to squeeze in. Got lucky, a girl invited us to dance in her reserved table area. Warren G performed, West Coast girls, knew every song, great time. Left right after, too crowded, not worth it. Don't buy bottled water, small bottle costs $9, total ripoff."

"Liked it first time 'round, gave it five stars. Good grub, ate it two days straight. This time? Quality lackin'. Ordered four Earl's clubs, no lettuce - zip, zero, zilch. Too much bacon, sandwiches way too salty. Officially sick of this joint. Won't be cravin' it next time."

"Decent spot, but prices are steep for what you get. Only had their Togo grub, which is solid. Can't say much for the ambiance, though. They let folks smoke hookah outside, and even picking up my order, I gotta endure the stench. Not bad, but could use some fine-tuning."
"Tacos, greasy and flavorless. Disappointment, my order. Dirt floors, English lacking."

"Kitty's Cafe, tucked away in the El Cortez Hotel and Casino, serves up classic Vegas fare with a side of friendly service. The old-style diner, complete with booths and a traditional counter, is a place where the staff knows their regulars by name and calls everyone "honey." The menu offers nothing too fancy, but the portions are generous. I opted for the grilled sourdough melt, loaded with turkey and ham. It was a satisfying meal, but not exceptional. On this particular visit, the kitchen was running a bit behind schedule, which made for a slower-than-usual dining experience. Late at night, Kitty's might be your best bet for a quick bite, but for the same price, you can likely find better options elsewhere. The days of those "$1.99 deals" are long gone, unfortunately."

"Busy joint, this Starbucks. Owned by the NY NY hotel, so no app for us. Sucks, but I had cash this time. Didn't lose to the slots either. Place is always hopping, but moves quick. Decent grub too. Open 24/7, that's good. Coffee's solid. Be back, since it's in our hotel. But hey, get with the program, Starbucks. Use the app, earn those points."

"At another DDD joint, Melissa, our server, greeted us with a cheerful good morning. We waited the usual 10 minutes - a sign of a good spot. Coffee, rich and full-bodied. Diet Coke, perfectly carbonated. Eggs arrived swiftly, leaving me just enough time to jot down a few lines. Glasses remained full. A decent breakfast spot."

"Walked over from FireSky, easy peasy. Started with green pork chili, not too shabby. Lamb fondue, nice. Squash sauce, tasty. Short ribs, big. Needed more flavor, though. Could've used some salt and pepper, maybe a bit more oomph in the seasoning department. Not bad, but not amazing either. Three stars, I reckon."

Tapas, great. Paella, too salty. First time trying it, thought it'd be good. Tapas, tasty, especially mushroom risotto. Oxtail, tender. Potatoes, yummy. Garlic chicken, good, but accidentally ate a clove of garlic. Vampires, beware. Paella, too salty. Service, meh. Cafe, better.

"Limited grub options before the Luxor show. Ticket agent, 20, suggested T&T. Said it was great. Should've known better. Mojitos to start. Waiter said they were good. I've had my share, but these were too sweet. Club soda couldn't save 'em. Chips and salsa subpar. Easy to do well. Had tacos and shrimp. Average. Server was friendly, offered free show tix. Already had 'em, but kind gesture. Won't be back. Asian joint had better menu."

"Best meal I had in Vegas. On vacation with my sisters, we wanted to keep costs down. Friend recommended this place, hidden in the food court. Not the greatest location, but prices are decent. Inside seating, bright lights, not the best ambiance. Service was meh, our waiter was a chatty Italian guy, more interested in the young ladies nearby than us. Forgot about us at the end, had to be reminded by a busboy. Food was great though, Caeser salad, filet mignon meatballs, and Quatro Stagioni pizza, all delicious. Recommend the grub, not the service."

"Enjoyed checking out The Dog empire during my extended weekend in Edinburgh.  Great concept, cool vibes, and solid grub.  Wished I had more time to sample everything!  \n\nHad a decent flank steak salad (2.5 stars), a bit chewy but the sweet balsamic reduction balanced the bitter arugula.  My man's mushroom risotto (4.0 stars) was rich and cooked to perfection.  Finished with tiramisu (3 stars), but it lacked the kick of espresso and the dark chocolate overpowered the light dessert.  Ended up scraping off the top."
"Food was good, prices were fair. Waiter could've been more polite, but still a solid spot."

"Beer selection top-notch. Rotating taps, so consistency lacking. Food surprisingly good, exceeded expectations. Large group, great time, drinks and trivia. Atmosphere and service subpar. Overcrowded, understaffed. Long waits for help. Server friendly, but overwhelmed. Returning, but not when hungry. Dive bar vibe, not impressive. Good beer and food, but that's it."

"I've been coming here for years. Dr. Finch has done a minor procedure on my dog Dozer, and I was pleased with his work. He's got a good bedside manner, and he's informative. Now, he's gonna do a bigger surgery on her, and I'm confident in his abilities. I've tried shopping around, but I keep ending up back here. Dozer's got a history with them, and I trust 'em."

"I've only had the breakfast here, specifically the corned beef and farmer's omelets. The grub's decent, nothing special. I appreciate the blueberry muffin option instead of toast. The server was friendly, no issues with bringing ranch dressing for my hash browns (a strange but tasty combo). It's also the only joint open past 10 pm that's not in a casino and won't break the bank. A good spot for a low-key meal with a friend. My only gripe is they don't serve dark chicken meat (white's too dry for my taste)."

"Food was good, service top-notch. But jeez, $18 for enchiladas? That's rich. Roach coach enchiladas, five bucks a pop, could give 'em a run for their money. Chips and guac, nine bucks? Good stuff, but not worth the coin. This joint's got some kinda complex, tryin' to be fancy with cloth napkins and menus on paper. But at the end of the day, they're just another mainstream Mexican spot, loads of cheaper options around. Won't be back, prices are too steep."

"Mert's, a place that'd fit right in on Triple D. Decor's got that down-home Southern vibe, makes you feel like you're in the right place. But don't come here for lunch, unless you're lookin' to get knocked out like a newborn after a feedin'. Service is good, food's alright, but overall, it's just an okay spot for a meal."

"Harrah's got a sweet setup goin' on at Carnaval Court. It's like they knew what they were doin' when they put it smack dab in the middle of a tourist trap. Kiosks everywhere, sellin' junk nobody needs. But hey, we weren't drunk or nothin', just a buncha buddies lookin' for some laughs. So we figured, why not? Bought ourselves some of them fancy light-up shirts, just for the hell of it. And man, did we stand out. People were givein' us props left and right. \n\nWe hit the dance floor, shirts blazin', and let me tell ya, it was a real good time. Plenty of space to bust a move, and bein' outside kept things from gettin' too hot. Plus, them flare bartenders put on a show, makin' drinks like they was performin' magic tricks. And hey, if you wanna switch it up between dancin' and gamblin', this is the place to do it. They got tables set aside for that very thing. It's like they knew exactly what people come to Vegas for."

"Relaxed over dinner this week, nice spot. Amazing view, friendly staff. Had the rib eye, cooked just right. Blue cheese potatoes, good but blue cheese overpowered 'em. Cake for dessert, ice cream melted, cake dry. Pricey, expected better details. Worth it for the view."

"A friend recommended it. Sounded exclusive, only open twice a year. Dim sum was good, but could've been better if they focused on it instead of the seafood buffet. Some dishes were cold. Didn't have chili oil, but the non-dim sum items were great - fresh oysters, crab legs, lobster, nigiri. Asked for sushi without rice, they usually don't do it, but made an exception. Octopus and cucumber salad was the best. Plenty of fresh fruit, but didn't want to work for my food. Dessert bar was decent. Wish they focused more on dim sum. Next to sushi, it's my favorite. Might go this weekend in San Diego."

"Comedy's a crapshoot. Sometimes you hit the jackpot, other times you crap out. This show started strong. Our MC was a real charmer, funny as hell and knew how to work the room. He was raw, but not too rough. Then came the first two comedians. They were crass, swore like sailors and didn't give a damn if they offended anyone.
