One guy even kept going after a woman stood up and told him to move on. What a jerk. But our MC saved the day, patching over those two disasters like a pro. And let me tell you, Jay Reid, the headliner, made the whole night worth it. He worked that stage like a pro, using everything from the stool to the mic stand as props. His jokes were spot-on, tackling tough topics with style. And he hung around after to meet the folks. Now that's class."

"Came here for my 18th birthday with some pals. Happy hour's from 2-6 PM, Monday through Friday. Shame we got there at 7. Had the grilled chicken sandwich - chicken was a bit pink, but I was hungry and didn't wanna send it back. Shared a frozen hot chocolate too. Coulda been better, but I was chewin' on ice the whole time. Service was slow and it ain't cheap, but not by much. Gonna give it another shot soon."

"The Flamingo ain't your granddad's joint no more. Hell, it ain't even your fat, chain-smokin' Uncle Larry's spot from a decade back. I'm tellin' ya, it's changed. Gone are the depressin' 80s decor and the fanny pack-wearin' gamblers. Now it's clean, fresh, and welcoming. Might even take a side chick there, or maybe a girl you're serious about. And who knows, maybe you'll be the one to witness Donnie and Marie finally makin' their move after 35 years of flirtin'."

"Treasure Island, twice I've dined here. Pho, just okay, but it'll do. Smells better than it tastes, probably. Veggie spring rolls, decent, but the peanut sauce, just okay, a bit too coconut-y. Pho Tai, my choice, my friend went veggie. My soup, not super tasty, but plenty of beef, not much noodle. Friend enjoyed hers, bak choy, mushrooms, corn. Pricey, pho, LA, $7, better taste."

"Target's not my favorite. It's too big, too crowded. Feels like half the ASU student body's inside, clogging up the aisles. But, it's got its perks. Plenty of parking, friendly staff, and a hell of a lot of stuff to buy. Just wish it wasn't such a zoo."
"Employees yakkin' away, backs turned to customers. Service suffers."

"Vegas, New Year's Eve. Decided to give this joint another shot, since I'd been there before. Salad bar, meh. Meat, too salty and bloody rare. Service? Forget about it. Waitress showed up three times: when we sat down, when she brought the drinks, and when she handed us the bill. Had to flag down the servers just to get the meat. They seemed to be avoiding us. Not worth the dough."

"We found this joint after bailing on the Bacchanal due to the long-ass line. We were fuckin' famished by the time we got there. It's a small, modern cafe with Top 20 hits blasting, not the best spot for a quiet chat. Portions are decent, but the grub's nothing special. I had a pastrami breakfast sandwich that was lacking something. Could've used some extra sauce or seasoning. The tater tots were crispy and delish, though."

"Cool spot, educational too. Four ecosystems, but Polar/Arctic room could use more. Entry fee? Way too much. Gift shop's got some neat stuff - recycled juice box bags, insect snacks (no kidding), small crystals. Don't bother with the elevator ride to the top of the city. Free view from Mount Royal's just as good."

"Don't judge this place by its exterior. It's a treasure trove of deals. They got everything - clothes, artwork, home decor. I saw 'em switchin' up some departments, so looks like they'll have more rugs and paintings soon. Great for anyone lookin' to spruce up their pad. Had a blast and I'd go back. Just remember, you gotta take your time and dig for the good stuff."
"They killed the Chicken Strip Cheese, and what they got now ain't worth a damn. Rest is still Hooters, wings and fries, but nothing special."

"This joint's for those on a tight budget, lookin' for a basic room. Did the trick for us, but ain't no luxury spot. Saw some eats nearby - pizza, Subway, Fatburger - and a movie theater, bars, and slots. Didn't do much else but catch some Z's. Fatburger? Terrible. Took forever too."

"Saw it on the Food Network, thought it might compare to the Boiling Crab. Seafood was decent, but not as spicy or flavorful as I'd hoped. Get there early, it fills up quick. Went at 11 am on a weekend, place was packed by the time we finished eating."
"Good, honest 3-star red curry tofu. Not flashy, not overhyped. Just a solid, satisfying meal."

"We swung by Cold Stone around 8:30 PM. The line was out the door, but we were determined to get our ice cream fix. I insisted we wait in line, and it took about 15 minutes to get our order. The place was packed, but the staff were hustling to keep the line moving. I ordered the smallest size, but the employee accidentally gave me the next size up for free. Not complaining. The seating area was limited and dirty, but I couldn't blame them - they were busy making orders. We opted for takeout. I'm a fan of Cold Stone's ice cream, and I'm used to the long lines. It's worth the wait for that sweet, sweet "All Lovin' No Oven" flavor."

"This joint brought to mind Whiskey River, minus the beachside riffraff. Folks were kickin' back, enjoying themselves. Dance-offs on the floor, 99 cent Jaeger bombs, and rumors of 99 cent tacos. A wet T-shirt contest, too, though it was a bit of a bust. Still, I'd return."

"Grandview Saloon's got a killer view of Pittsburgh from its patio. Interior views ain't too shabby neither. Their drink selection's decent, food's alright, but nothing special. Patio's nice, but inside's a bit drab. Shame, 'cause a little TLC on the decor and menu'd make this joint one of the city's best. Not the spot for a fancy anniversary dinner, but good for showin' off the city to out-of-towners while sippin' a cold one."
"Good grub, nice folks. Had the Caesar, duck 'n' scallops. Salad, top-notch. Duck, rich, real good. Scallops, meh. Not bad, but wouldn't order again. Solid meal, not a repeater."

"Been comin' here weekly, despite the cruddy weather. Place ain't always easy to spot, but damn, them flowers are a steal. Beautiful arrangements, too. Don't last long, though - couple days, tops. Produce is hit or miss. Got some great tomatoes 'n' peaches in season, but half the stuff's not local. Had a helluva time findin' a local apple. Sku stickers from Cali 'n' Washington, y'know? But hey, some local farmers mixed in, makin' it worth my while. I'll keep comin' back."

"I dig The Coffee Bean, usually. But this one's off, and all the joe inside the Venetian's no good either. Maybe it's the water, maybe it's a plot to drive me loco. Whatever it is, it's messing with my mind. But, it's still better than the room service swill. And I get it delivered to my door every morning by a real stand-up guy. So, for the coffee, one star. But, for the service, two more. That's three stars, total."
"Good joint, lots of useful stuff.  Great savings too.  Place is well-organized, but can get messy with all the other shoppers.  Only issue is the long line to check out.  Worth the wait, though."

"Clean joint. Good service. Koi pond's a nice touch. But the sandwich? Forget about it. Turkey's like something you'd grab off the shelf at the grocery store. Not worth it. Prices are average, but you can do better elsewhere."

I wanted to love it, but it was just okay. Expectations were high after reading rave reviews on Pop's site. I envisioned a fun, delicious experience with a gruff but charming grill master asking me "wit" onions? in a genuine Philly accent. Instead, the grill master was just gruff and didn't hear my order. No onions on my cheese steak. 

The cheese steak itself? Meat wasn't fatty or greasy, but a bit bland. Enjoyed the cheese whiz and the bread was great. Including onions would've made it tastier. Since eating it, I've felt a bit off, but that's not always a sign of whether I'd return if the food's good. (Masochist!) 

Would I try it again? Sure, but I'll also try their competition and yelp the results.

"Tuesday night, Cabo buzzed with activity. We snagged a table quick, two of us. Food fresh, but underwhelming, considering the rep. I expected more zest. Didn't feel rushed, despite the bustle. Catching up with a friend, our waitress, friendly, no hurry. Parking's a pain, like NoDa, circle around. Fun spot for drinks and a bite, not worth a detour."

We returned from Mexico and Cuba, arriving at this airport for a brief stopover. The airport was simple to navigate, with clear signs leading the way. Immigration moved quickly, despite a long line. We had our research papers in order, but the officer barely glanced at us before stamping our passports and sending us on our way. We retrieved our luggage, zipped through customs, and rechecked our bags without issue. Security took the most time, thanks to lengthy lines. The staff worked diligently and remained pleasant. If we had more time, we would have grabbed some local BBQ for our San Francisco flight. Unfortunately, the security line consumed most of our spare time. Our trip to Mexico and Cuba was fantastic; almost every place we stayed, ate, or visited earned top marks. It's a shame Yelp isn't available there. Beyonce and Jay Z also followed the same procedures.

"Hotel's seen better days. Exterior's worn down, in need of a refresh. Rooms ain't so bad, but tile grout's a bit dingy. Didn't hear neighbors, but food's good, especially for a hotel. Decent bar, local brews on tap. Service is friendly. Location's convenient, but it's a hike to downtown attractions. Took advantage of free shuttle, driver Christian's friendly and knowledgeable. Easy access off I-277. For the price, it's not bad."

"Cozy joint, dimly lit. Bar and dinin' area separate. Service sharp, attentive. Beer selection diverse, sample before committin'. Food just alright. Turkey sandwich, salad. Turkey dry, flavor lackin'. Salad forgettable. Not bad for a bar, could be worse."

"Been meaning to hit this spot for a bit, heard good things and checked out the menu. Prices ain't listed online, and now I know why - they're damn steep. Ended up on the patio since the main area wasn't open yet (6:30 PM? Really?). Waitress was friendly and attentive, replaced my water when she saw something floatin' in it, and my husband's glass was dirty too. Brought us out some sample-sized frozen peach and strawberry margaritas, which were pretty good, better than the rocks margarita. No free chips and salsa, which would be fine if they offered somethin' else like Barrio. No happy hour either, which was a bummer. Street corn was decent, but I've had better. Butternut squash tacos were amazing, my husband liked 'em more than his mahi tacos. Can't believe they got the balls to charge $12 for three tiny tacos, and $12 for guac made from two avocados. Don't know how they're still in business with prices like that."

"Good things:

* Kids get a Magna Doodle to draw on.
* Friendly waitstaff.
* Clean restaurant, fresh outta the box.
* Pasta selection? Create your own, buddy! Whole wheat and 5 other types of pasta, 5 sauces, incl. rose. Add toppings, why not?
* Karaoke Fridays and Saturdays.
* Decent grub.
* Prices ain't bad, 'cept if you go wild with extras.
* Unique dessert menu, that's for sure.

Bad things:

* Kids' menu's on the down low, and it's tiny.
* They give kids' drinks in adult-sized cups, what's up with that?
* Took 'em 10 minutes to clean up a spilled glass of milk. Yikes.
* Menu's limited: pasta, pizza, paninis, that's about it.
* Pasta toppings cost $1.50 each, ouch.
* My cannelloni dessert? Underwhelming, to say the least."
"The bouncer gave us the cold shoulder. He was rude, real rude. But we weren't gonna let that ruin our boy's big day. So, we convinced him to let us in."
"Korean grub, this place has it. Don't believe the fool who said it's Japanese. Koreans and Japs may share some culinary similarities, but they ain't the same."

"Red 8's decent Chinese grub. Oxtail soup and Mongolian beef, rice, too. Nice ambiance, good service. Dessert menu's lacking. Pricey, but that's the Wynn for you. Not my top pick for Chinese, but worth a visit if invited."

"Prime rib for $9.99 at Sunset Station? Not bad. But where's the value, Vegas? Used to be able to get a solid meal for under ten bucks. Nowadays, it's like they're trying to rob us blind. 

Went there on a Saturday, packed house, waited 15 minutes for a table. Service was good, food was decent. Prime rib was a bit overcooked, should've gone for medium rare. 

T-bone steak special for $12.99? No thanks. Grand Cafe is better than Denny's, but for a 24-hour spot, it's not bad."
"Place didn't live up to the hype. Food was meh, nothing special. Maybe I'll give it another shot next time I'm in town, but I'd rather hit up the seafood joint at Rio instead."

"Food's good. Best part. Had endless shrimp - shrimp alfredo times two, breaded shrimp, shrimp scampi. Worst part? Wait to sit and be served. Thirty minutes to sit, fifteen to be served. Need better service for a higher rating from me. Food's good, hot. Once served, service was decent. Cheddar biscuits, excellent."
"Sashimi's pricey, but damn good. Fresh fish, well-served. Been there thrice, never disappointed."

"Stayed at the Hilton. Nice room, comfy bed. Bathroom? Motel 6 quality. Bridge to the tower? Pain in the ass. Casino? Renovated, clean. Pool? Great. Staff? Friendly. Check-in? Nightmare. Line stretched to the casino. Thirty minutes to check-in? Lost me as a customer."
"Parking lot full, store empty. Friendly staff. Scored cute juice glasses for sixty-nine cents. That's it."

"I swung by this joint while staying at the Aria on business.  Noticed the patisserie while heading to our rooms and the brightness of the place, plus the cakes, caught my eye.  Next morning, I was jonesing for some joe, so I headed down and grabbed two Americanos.  The multi-tiered cakes were a sight to behold, made me wonder how long it took to whip 'em up.  Waited in line for a bit, then ordered two Americanos.  They punched some buttons on a machine and out came the coffee.  For ten bucks, I expected the barista to take their time, pull the shots themselves.  Coffee was decent, not great.  Wouldn't come back for coffee, but might give it another shot if I'm in the market for a sweet treat."
"Beer's decent, but pricey. Wait for Costco restock. ($30 at brewery, $20 at Costco). Might come back if they open a real joint. Staff's friendly, but that's about it."
"This joint's worth checkin' out. Good eatin', most times. But avoid holidays, service and grub go downhill."

"Tiny plates, delicious but small. Thirty bucks plus for a snack. Fifty to sixty for a real meal, still not enough to fill you up. Nice joint though, red and black decor. Sat at the bar, watched 'em cook. Good grub, bad value. If this is casual dining, they gotta drop the prices, twenty-five to thirty percent."

"Bagel joint. Not the best. Went with the missus. Waited for our grub. Dusty vent. Dirty floors. Slow service. Guy was nice, but slow. Twenty minutes for two bagels and a muffin. Bagels were good. Variety was nice. Muffin was meh. Prices were fair. That's it."

"Disappointment at Pho Bosa. Read good reviews, took the family for some pho. Waitress said no pho available. How can that be? Name's Pho Bosa, right? Should've been told sooner. Food wasn't great either. Staff was friendly, but won't be back."

The stench of the joint can be overwhelming, but the instructors here are top-notch. Shame about the front desk crew, though - they're as friendly as a wet cat. If they had their act together, I'd still be coming here. But it's a hike from my place, so I'll have to look elsewhere for a more welcoming vibe. 

Other than that, they've got a tidy changing area with two showers, fully stocked with body wash, shampoo, and conditioner. You can scrub off all that funky sweat after your workouts. 

Worth checking out: Summer and Stacy. They're both great in their own ways.
"Rob and I shared a hearty breakfast. Eggs, bacon, and pancakes filled our plates. Their sausage gravy stole the show, though. Good eatin'."
"Place wasn't what we expected. Pizza, Classic Maggie, was good but not great. Hubby's burger, charred to hell. Waitress MIA. Typical bar grub and beer selection. That's it."

"Been here a few times. Love their beer. Only serve their own. Food's alright, nothing special. Didn't like the wings. Atmosphere's great though. Good place to grab a drink. Food's a bit pricey, but it's Ahwatukee. Highly recommend their craft brews. That's all they got. Uncle Bear's brewed beer. I'll be back, but not too excited. Okay spot for friends. TVs everywhere, good for football. Allow dogs on the patio, leashed. Bring an 8x10 pic of your pup, frame it, and they'll hang it up in memoriam. That's cool."

"Turkish Kitchen served up a solid, affordable meal for our group on a Friday night. No fuss, no frills. We started with some bread and this mind-blowing dip that stole the show. I mean, damn, that dip was something else. I could've eaten it all night. 

I went for the Turkish ravioli, which wasn't listed on the menu, but hey, it sounded good. It came with a side of salad and rice, but let's be real, they were a bit unnecessary. The ravioli, though? Overcooked and fell apart easy. Flavor was alright, but nowhere near as good as my last Turkish ravioli experience. That was a bummer. 

Probably should've gone for a kebab like everyone else, but I wasn't feelin' it. Everyone else seemed happy with their meals, though. 

One strange thing - our beers came in weirdly sized glasses. Like, smaller than a pint or a large bottle. Not sure what was up with that. 

All in all, Turkish Kitchen's a good spot for a cheap, easy meal with friends. But let's be real, it ain't the best Turkish food in Edinburgh."
"Friday happy hour spot. Chambord marg on point, achiote chopped chicken salad, divine. Trio appetizer, good when half-priced. Manager, hostess, server - all cocky. Two margaritas, forget 'em."
"Pizza? Hype? Don't get it. Just a regular pie, toppings nothing special. Pepperoni, sausage, the usual. Better pies elsewhere, but hey, if you're hungry after Marquee, it'll do."

"Pho was subpar, broth wasn't up to snuff. Boyfriend's cashew chicken was solid though. Friend's chicken fried rice was good too. Prices are decent for college kids. Would return for grub, but not pho. 

Giving three stars 'cause of two things. First, Thai iced tea was a letdown. Small bottle from the fridge, not worth three bucks. Woman behind counter said she was too lazy to make a proper one. Second, restaurant was sweltering hot and humid, even with doors open. Was sweating bullets while eating pho. Uncomfortable. Workers fixing ceiling tiles nearby, unacceptable. 

Food was good, atmosphere wasn't. Still coming back for a quick Thai fix 'cause it's convenient and accessible."

Went to Kings on Saturday, early meal after Xmas shopping. Been there a few times for seafood, service always slow, consistent. Started with chilled seafood platter, 24.95, good deal. Grilled shrimp, scallop skewers, kids burger, combo fried platter. Fried platter, not good, over breaded, gummy shrimp, scallops, small piece of cod. Stick with sanddabs or specials. Really, just go for shellfish platter.

"Burger Factory's just down the road from my joint. Place is hoppin' all day long. Menu's got something for everyone, perfect for them office groups with folks who can't agree on nothin'. Portions are big, so if you're lookin' for a hearty meal, this is your spot. It's a greasy spoon, but hey, that's what we like about it."

"Ping Pong Thai, I've driven past it for years, thinking it was a Thai joint with some adult entertainment. Nope, just food. Not even a single ping pong ball. Place is a bit of a letdown, to be honest. The Panang's watery and bland, but the Pad Kee Maw's got some kick. That's the only reason I come here. Service is slow and forget about getting a refill. To-go orders are a different story, but you'll still feel like just another customer. Pack 'em in at lunchtime, they do. If they had a ping pong table, I'd give it a higher rating. Maybe the owner's a Thai ping pong champ. Now that'd be something worth seeing."

"We keep going back 'cause it's close by and the happy hour's a good deal. But every damn time, I get pissed off about something. They only got three beers on tap, for one. And the service is always hit or miss. They're all over you at the start, then you gotta chase 'em down for the check. Don't make sense. Feels like they're tryin' to screw us over. The grub can be iffy too. Last time, we got two regular dishes and two happy hour specials. The cheap calamari was the best thing we had. The expensive elk meatballs? Bland, dry, and never again."
"Counter guy, helpful. Steered me right, enjoyed my meal. Tilapia, chicken adobo, both tasty."

"Linq's got a new joint, 'tween Harrah's and Bally's. Supposedly, they're servin' up top-shelf liquor in them slushies, but I ain't too sure. Felt like I needed more to get good and drunk. More flavors though, that's for sure. Went with Patron Grand Marnier 'cause it was sour. Staff's friendly, dressin' cute, but they need more signs on them cups. That saxophone cup, damn! It's the sexiest, baddest cup around. ;)"
"Drunk or high? Neither, yet still weird. Second Cirque show, first in Vegas. Acrobatics, great. Production set, beautiful. Trippy, yes. Creepy baby giggles and head. Not their best work, perhaps."
"Ordered delivery through YouBuyAndWeFly. Reasonable price, good eatin'. Had hot 'n' sour soup, sweet 'n' sour pork, orange chicken, chicken chow mein. All good."

"This joint's got a live band, nightly. Great for dancin', just like a weddin'. If I were gettin' hitched, I'd bring the whole crew here. But, it's a cash bar. That's the only downside. Tables fill up quick, but the room's not closed off from the casino. You can always grab a drink and watch the show. Slot machines are nearby, too. Reminds me of old Vegas, when every casino had music playin' in the bars. Nowadays, it's all about the mega clubs and VIP lists. So, it's nice to see some classic Vegas entertainment. Bring your crew, grab a table, and get ready to dance. This is Vegas at its finest."

"Spice Island, been goin' there since it first opened. Early 20s, that makes it a Pittsburgh institution. Menu's mostly the same, except they added booze. Why fix what ain't broke? My favorites are veggie - fried tofu, either sauce is great, and the veggie curry trio. Coconut rice, worth the extra cost. You'll be back for more."

"ABC store's decent here in Mecklenburg. They got all the hooch you need, but they ain't got my favorite cognac. That's alright though. Service is good, friendly folks. Price is a bit steep, but not too bad. Just a little bit more than I'm used to, that's all."
"Scones, divine. Coffee, fine. Dogs, no. Allergic, me. Sign, needed. Service dogs, okay. Scones, delicious. Daily, made. Go, there."

"Entered the revamped joint, made my way to the great hall. Pictures and paintings, visually stunning, esoteric beauty. Contemporary spot, quiet, smaller than expected, but packs a punch. Worth the 80K spent on reno. Medieval vibes, Scottish history, medicine, war, and recording significant events. Busy gift shop, full eatery. Learn something, spend a few bob. Art, science, medicine, Royal Navy, death masks, migrated families, art history. Visited a few months back, keen to return. Above all, go for the culture, cafe buzz, either way, rewarding."

"Been comin' here 'fore I moved to Vegas. Multi-level joint, packed all the time. Located way down at The Forum Shops, connected to Caesar's Palace. Only downsides are the wait and the trek from the casino. But the grub and service? Top-notch. Nearby aquarium and animatronic show keep things interesting. If you're strollin' Sin City and hankerin' for a familiar meal, give it a shot."

"Cafe Zupas, nice to meet you. Hope you're here to stay. That BBQ chicken salad of yours, damn good. Loved the fun drink bar too, made my own Italian soda. Hubby enjoyed his summer chicken salad and turkey bacon panini. And that free chocolate-covered strawberry? Cherry on top. Left feeling satisfied, not too full, just right. Appreciate new joints that are quick, healthy, and affordable."

Siam Terrace, a Thai restaurant in Urbana, is one of my favorites. Their red curry, my go-to dish, is a standout. Don't let that sway you, though - the rad nar, pad thai, and other options are also top-notch. It's not a five-star joint, but it's close. The atmosphere can feel a bit cramped with larger groups, but it's still a great spot. The appetizers are solid, with the shrimp being a highlight. It's affordable, too - prices start at around $8.99 for vegetarian, chicken, or tofu options, and a bit higher for meat entrees.

"I found this joint when I lived in Fort Worth, Texas. It's a Brazilian churrascaria, meaning it's a cowboy barbecue. Sounds plain, but it's not. It's an all-you-can-eat meat fest, and I mean that in the best way possible. They got servers walking around with swords of meat, and you got a little disk to flip from red to green, meaning you're ready for more. The salad bar's got some great stuff too, like prosciutto and nice cheeses. And yeah, they got a full bar, and it's top-notch."
"Tangier, a place of wonder. Brewed tea, sweet dates, fresh bread - a feast for the senses. Gracious host, generous with his wares. Decorations, a delight to behold. A journey worth taking."

Tried a few tacos at this joint, three for ten bucks. They were all different, but the Suadero Azteca, that's the queen's special, stood out. Damn thing was flavorful and tender, topped with some real good veggies. Get your own, don't share. Fried fish and shrimp were solid too. Great spot for some unique tacos, but it can add up. You gotta ask for chips and salsa, they won't bring 'em out otherwise, but they're good when you get 'em.
"Good name, good grub. Take out, sit down, or have it delivered. Family-owned Asian joint with all the classics - teriyaki, orange chicken, and more. Worth a visit, always delicious."
"Solid joint for breakfast, better than those chain places. Omelets are good, biscuits and gravy if you're feelin' reckless. They got sandwiches, salads, and smoothies too."

"Went to Il Pizzaiolo with some colleagues last week. Heard great things about the place for years, so it was time to check it out. Had a swell time. 

Started with some vino. Waitress gave us the lowdown on the house wines - #1, #2, and #3. We went with the Pinot Noir and it was pretty damn good. Shared a couple carafes with a buddy. 

Split some apps - Panzarotti and Fiori de Zucca. The fried zucchini was alright, but the Panzarotti was the real deal. Like a fried risotto and mozzarella ball. Damn good. I even grabbed the last one, risking embarrassment. 

For my main course, I got the Ravioli alla Caprese. Simple, but done right. Can't wait to get back to Il Pizzaiolo."

"Went to #1 Brothers for pizza, but they didn't answer the phone.  So, I went to Ari's, the Japanese restaurant in the same plaza.  Good thing too, 'cause the service was top-notch and the sushi was damn good.  I told the girl on the phone about how I'd ordered the spicy tuna handroll before and it was a bit disappointing.  She said she remembered me and knew exactly what I wanted.  And she did.  It was perfect.  I also told her about my favorite specialty roll at my old sushi spot and she suggested something similar.  It was almost as good.  This place is now my go-to sushi spot.  Thanks, Ari, for treating me like a valued customer and not just another face in the crowd."

"Place is good. Go there regular for pedis. Julie and Tammy do good work. Service is top-notch. Only had one issue with a rough pedicure, but Julie fixed it quick. Salon's always clean. Pay $20 plus $5 tip. Price went up to $22 for summer, still worth it."

"Went in for paint, got great service. Employee knew her stuff, helped me out. First time buyin' paint for a house, needed some guidance. She showed me the ropes, mixed it up just right. Answered all my questions, didn't waste no time. Good service, fair price."

"This joint's got all I need, just a short hop from my digs. Reliable too, when the missus wants some Asian flair in the kitchen. Friendly folk workin' there, happy to lend a hand if you can't locate somethin'. Fresh goods? Meh, they're alright, but the rest? Top-notch."
"Pizza joint with a friendly vibe.  Tasty pies, too.  Olive oil base is top-notch.  Tomato sauce pizzas are meh, but everything else is great.  Salads are big and fresh."

"Been comin' here for years, close to the house and all.  Got a good local crowd, lotta take out too.  Menu's limited, but what they got is hot, fresh, and flavorful.  Hubby loves their sushi. 

You get there, they greet ya, seat ya quick.  Check the specials on the chalkboard by the door.  Like the decor, facilities, plates, utensils, glasses, all clean. 

Staff's efficient, accommodatin'.  Menu's concise, but got enough for most.  Prices are decent, portions are good.  Be back."
"Good burgers. Fresh. Not some greasy mess like that 5 Guys crap. Pricey though. Can't top In-N-Out for quality and cost."
"Dairy Queen doesn't need a review. It's like your mom and pop's place, but for ice cream. Clean joint, quick service, and worth the seven bucks for a waffle cone and a scoop in a cup."

"Liked this joint a lot. Atmosphere was cool, grub was top-notch. Not your average diner. Suggest making a reservation, it was hoppin' when we went. Good spot for kiddos, too. Food was a hit with everyone, great brews, and the dessert menu knocked it outta the park. Service was A+. A swell pick to show our Cleveland pals the Montreal vibe (kid-friendly, of course...)."
"Scottsdale, AZ, had a good one too. Bartenders were top-notch, TVs plentiful, beer selection impressive."

"Mondays, I hit up my local Salisbury's for the weekly shop. It's a big store, but half of it ain't food. That don't make sense to me. Supermarkets should be about grub, not TVs. But hey, it works for 'em, I guess. Just gets frustrating when choices are limited. Freezer section's tiny too. Poor student like me's gotta settle for whatever frozen chips they got. And don't even get me started on the lack of supermarket brands. Sometimes I wanna grab the cheaper option, but they ain't got much to choose from. 

But, I do love their "Oops!" section. It's like finding gold. Reduced meat, perfect for tossing in the freezer. 

Staff's friendly, always chattin' it up. Nice change of pace from the usual supermarket crew."
"Plenty of options here. High-end Euro brands, fancy schmancy stuff. Malt balls, three flavors, not bad. House brand hot cocoa mix, decent. Fun to look around, know all this exists."

"Pets all my life. Observed that when front desk nice, doctors not. Vice versa. Not case at Alta Vista. Hours great. Front desk, techs, doc - friendly, courteous. Price reasonable. Clean, no wet dog smell. Sunday afternoon, pleasant experience."

"View's great here. Food's probably good too, but I didn't try it. Sat at the bar, had a couple dirty martinis with a twist. Service was top-notch, even when one of us had a little mishap with their drink. Doorman at the elevator's cool, just be nice to him and you'll get upstairs for more drinks and a sweet view."

"This joint was our jam, my man and me. Staff was on point, hooked us up with samples of their top sellers. Six dishes, not too shabby for under 25 bucks. Good vibes all around, folks of all sorts gettin' down. Only gripe, cleanliness wasn't their strong suit."
"Atmosphere's top-notch. Bar's where we post up, my man and me. Nachos or enchiladas, don't matter. Service and grub, solid."

"Bun Bo Hue, three stars. Not the best, not the worst. Soup base lacked spice, pork blood was scarce and dry. Rice dish, decent. Coffee, now that's worth mentioning. Coconut flavor, damn good. Check-in, two bucks. That's the way."

"Good eatery in the Golden Nugget. Service was top-notch, even with a party of 14. Food was solid, caprese salad was fresh and tasty. Scallops and Brussels with grits, fantastic. Lobster, amazing. Crab legs, outstanding. Pecan ball, meh. Bread pudding, decent. Minus one star for the lipstick stained cup. Waiters did well, overall a good spot."
"Good spot for Target. Went there often when I lived nearby. Service and stock were top-notch. Part of Surprise Town Center's shopping hub, surrounded by other great stores."

"Walked by the joint on 7th after five, but it was shuttered tight. Ended up at another spot instead. Got myself an XL bean and cheese burrito, American style. Damn thing was delicious. Can't figure why it's only got two stars."

"Mama-Mia-American-Pizzeria, a joint Jungleboy digs. Colorful, multi-level spot with funky decor. We grabbed a table for two and ordered a 9-inch pie with pepperoni, mushrooms, and chili peppers. Damn good pizza, crust included. Friendly service, too. They checked in on us, kept our drinks full, and let us take leftovers to go. Only gripe: it got chilly by the door. But hey, that didn't stop me from wavin' at the peeps outside, wondering what the hell was goin' on in there. Recommended for a quick bite or a fun night out with the fam."
"Cozy joint with a diverse menu. Sat on the patio, lovely atmosphere. Sliders, top-notch. I'll be back."

"Met up with an old buddy at this joint, had a couple cold ones. Beer selection ain't huge, but what they got is good stuff. No need to spend an hour deciding, just grab one and enjoy. Place itself is dark and cozy inside, but the real magic happens outside. Feels like a backyard BBQ, with giant Jenga, chess, cornhole, and three ping pong tables. First thought it was some dude's yard they slapped a bar on, but after playin' some games, realized it's actually pretty damn great. Perfect spot for an afternoon hangout."

"Saturday afternoon, had a swell time at the local pub. Grub was top-notch, beer was pure gold, and the staff knew their stuff. Did a tasting, had a blast jawin' about brews. Place could use a bit of sprucin' up, but the waitress said they host beer dinners and I reckon they'd be a real treat."

"Renovated building on Central, real purty.  Things hoppin' Uptown. Had a swell time with 7, then 8, wait, 9 on First Friday. Staff was ace, owner Dana chatted us up, food was tasty, shared it all. Patio weather, perfecto. These are the days, this is why we stay put."

"Wait wasn't too bad, 'bout forty minutes, even though it was nine o'clock on a Tuesday. Prices were a bit steep, but hey, it's Vegas, right? Did a light dinner with five of us, couple tapas plates each. Gin and tonic, real smooth, nice presentation, nerdy cool ice cubes. Marinated mussels, came in a little tin, steamed mussels, good, order bread to soak up the juice. Meat platter, house cured meat was the best. Brussels sprout salad, delicious! SautÃ©ed shrimp, good, skirt steak with grilled bell pepper, tasty. Asparagus, good, but ten tiny spears for twelve bucks? Nice sauce, good with bread. Quail, small but yummy. Tomato bread, oh man, so good! Service was great, atmosphere was chill. Lovely evening."

"Went to Lenscrafters after striking out at Chandler Mall. Donna, a peach of a gal, helped me out. Tried on a bunch of frames, took a break to feed the baby, and Donna got to work on my insurance. Turns out, the optometrist screwed up my coverage. Donna made some calls, but they were closed. Told me to come back the next day. She had it fixed by then. Got my specs and was happy with the service. Donna and Heather, those two were the real deal."

"This joint's my fave for lunch meetings and dinners with the missus. Got a real local vibe, friendly staff, clean digs, and grub that hits the spot. That green tomatillo salsa? Can't get enough. Salmon and shrimp tacos, highly recommend 'em. Service ain't always the best, but that's part of the charm. Young servers, learnin' the ropes, addin' to the laid-back atmosphere."

"Good grub, friendly joint, modern vibe, gay as hell. That's Switch in a nutshell. Been meaning to try the place for months, but the missus ain't a fan of Sunday brunch. Finally made it last week, too late for the brunch menu and cheap Bloody Marys. But hey, we got a carafe anyway, decent drink for six bucks. Generic, sure, but worth every penny. Had myself a damn fine burger, loaded with guac, salsa, and jalapenos. Nice touch with the house-made ceasar salad too. Service was top-notch, friendly folks. I'll be back for more, especially for that sweet brunch action."
"MadHouse, good joint. But not a review, just a heads up. Can't access their site without getting a trojan warning from my browser. Looks like the site's infected. Hope the owners take note."

"Star Nursery, best in Vegas. All you need for landscaping, they got. Surprised folks, I'm a fan of plant nurseries. First job, 15 years old, plant nursery. Impactful experience, landscape architecture major, ran my own company. Miss it, walking through Star. Top-notch stock, plants, materials, soils, mulches, fertilizers, pesticides. Knowledgeable, friendly staff. Do yourself a favor, skip Walmart, Lowes, come to Star."
"Vegas, baby. Get yerself a fine 'adult slurpee' outside the Imperial Palace. Bring it on in, sing some karaoke, and enjoy. That's how you pre-game, my friend."

"Defalco's, a solid spot, but slow, and limited healthy options. But hey, you know what you're getting into when you walk into a fast food joint. Food's top-notch, like you're in Italy. Ordering system's old school, like back east, adds to the wait. Worth it though. I'm from NY, and good Italian delis are scarce in Phoenix. Friend introduced me, and now I crave it when I'm near. Tried the eggplant, chicken, and cheese steak, all good. Bring a friend, order different sandwiches, share."

"Travel Zoo coupon, app/entree/dessert. Combo app, naturally. Alligator, tough. Frog's legs, tough too. Crabcake, great. Gumbo, good. Jambalaya, great. Not New Orleans, but close. Atmosphere, New Orleans-esque. Portions, large."
"Politician's paradise. White-haired men, dignified. Special occasions, celebrate here. Waitstaff, polite, charming, witty. French cuisine, exquisite. Escargot, a must."

Friday nights, we hit this joint with the crew. Solid grub, the lamb meatballs and Johnny's nachos are our go-to. Their ranch dressing? Not bad, even for a non-ranch fan like me. Guinness stew? It's a winner.

But, it's a bit pricey for what it is. Beers start at six bucks, and most menu items are ten plus. Sandwiches? Twelve smackers. Shave a few bucks off, and they'd be in five-star territory.

Service is top-notch, though. Friendly servers, quick with splits and jokes. They put up with our non-pc shenanigans. No complaints there.

"Rice, price, and spice bring me here. Salmon bowl with brown rice and heat, under $7. Line up, menu on the wall, Japanese fare, chicken teriyaki, options galore. I go for salmon, $5.99, not fried, decent lunch price. Teriyaki sauce too much, light on the sauce. Upgrade to brown rice, $0.25. Condiments, hot chili powder, sauce, sliced green onion. Appreciate the onions. Low scores, Japanese flavors lack punch compared to Chinese and Thai."

"Popular joint, long line. Can't do much about it. Servers were attentive, cleared plates. Minor gripe: they leave utensils on the table. I like to keep 'em clean. Nice touch with the replacement utensils, though. Variety of grub, expensive dishes. Worth the $40 per head. Crab legs, lobster ravioli, prime rib, creme brulee. Complimentary drinks too. Raspberry iced tea, sodas."
"Great joint. Good prices, friendly bartenders - some real lookers too. Screens are top-notch, grub's delicious."
"Clean, new joint. Plenty parking, friendly staff. And, yeah, fat-free. Good spot."

"Marquee's a hot mess, but glamorous, =)
No dress code, some girls in flats and leggings, guys in tennis shoes and tees.
Lines to get in are ridiculous, but bouncers keep it under control, chaos organized.
Navigating's a challenge, stairs are killers, dance floor's too crowded, feels like a can of sardines, but worth it.
DJ and entertainers are great, sound system's crazy, bartenders are good looking and nice."
"Clean, nice joint. Good grub. Went on a Thursday, reserved a table, and had the place mostly to ourselves. Get the Manchurian Chicken - it's tasty."

"Listen up, folks. I got a story to tell. There's this comedian, see? And he's gonna roast the audience, just like that. He's gonna make jokes about race, gender, sex, age, and whatever else he can think of. So if you're easy to offend, you best stay home. Now, I've seen my fair share of comedy shows, and I gotta say, some of his jokes ain't exactly new. But hey, it's still a hoot! Just don't bring the kiddos, 'cause it's rated NC-17/R. \n\nThe venue's small, so you'll feel like you're back in high school or college. And let me tell you, there's nowhere to hide. You're gonna be part of the show, whether you like it or not. So, you been warned."
"Crab cakes, best in town. Salmon Caesar, blacken it. Flank steak, marinated, heavenly. Full-service bar, plenty TVs. Bon appetit."
"Mocha, decent. Hipster haven. Music loud, angry. Took me back, youthful days.\nFood, good. Drinks, cheap. Ginger, whiskey, remedy, want."

"Excalibur's got a good deal goin' on. Room cost me $27 through Expedia, plus a $15 resort fee for some extras like wired internet. Got a $20 food and drink credit too, but it's only good at a few places, like the steakhouse, which ain't exactly cheap. Also got a free play at the arcade, but no match plays. Room was alright, big enough, nice TV, slow internet though. Beds were decent, three pillows, nice touch. Elevators were weird, separate floors for 1-18 and 18+. If you want a quick ride and a high floor, book 18 or higher. Casino was stingy, lots of continuous shufflers at the blackjack tables, not my cup of tea. Minimums were around $10 for most games."
"Went to this joint for the first time. Service was top-notch. Staff was friendly as hell. Definitely coming back. Would recommend it to anyone."

"Reservation at another joint, but wasn't feelin' it. Mood to suit, ya know? Started south, walked 'til I found somethin'. Popped into a few places, kept movin'. Swung through Cosmo, caught a whiff of somethin' good. Asked the concierge, ended up at STK, solo style. Liked the vibe, alive and kickin', DJ spinning tunes. Volume ain't no issue, didn't need no chat. Had the foie gras French toast, bone-in ribeye, Moscow mule. Enjoyed 'em all. Restrooms? Not a fan. Line up, wait your turn, follow orders? Nah, son. Gotta fix that. Be back in Vegas soon, celebratin' my boy's b-day. He'll dig it, just like I did."

"Haven't been to Nello's in a while. Friend suggested it for lunch. Busy place, but we were seated quick. Gotta get the pizza, right? Ordered a large, thick crust with bacon, basil, mushroom, and half with sausage. Damn good, but they forgot the basil. Bummer. Garlic bread was solid though. Waiter was easy on the eyes and gave top-notch service."

"Rio's got a secret. We stumbled on it, pre-show. No reservation, our bad. Hostess hooked us up at the bar. Meatballs, a must. Scallops, sea bass, fresh and flavorful. Going back? Hell yeah. Locals, use your T.Rewards, NV ID for 25%. Showgoers, flash your stubs for 20%. Deal."

I headed to downtown Vegas for a show, stopped for grub at Bar + Bistro. My bad, it was First Friday in the Arts District, and they had a limited menu. Oh well.

I went for two tapas plates and a sweet treat. Started with their roasted tomato soup - damn good. Then, their 5 cheese mac and cheese, a mix of smoked gouda, sharp cheddar, fontina, Manchego, roasted tomato, piquillo peppers, and parmesan crisp. Gigli pasta. Tasty stuff.

Finished with a warm chocolate ganache cake. Also, damn good. Came with a tiny scoop of sorbet. Perfect.

Would've liked to try the full menu, but I still got a taste of their good eats. A bit pricey, maybe. Liked the decor though. Palettes for tables, metal wells. Thought I spilled something a few times, but it was just paint splatters. Got me every time.

"Late night Tempe, we needed grub. Not in the mood to drive, opted for delivery. Took an hour, pretty standard. Food arrived, everyone loved it. Chicken bruchetta pita, excellent though small. Two pitas recommended for the hungry. Traditional hummus, subpar. Four stars instead of five. That's my review."

"Coffee joint with high ceilings, good coffee, and friendly staff. Close to my office, so I stop by for lunch sometimes. Their little toasts are top-notch, loaded with stuff like egg salad, tuna, smoked salmon, and various meats. Desserts look great, but I'm usually too full. Pricey, but the grub's good, so that helps."

"Went to a friend's birthday party at a comedy club. Liked the cozy atmosphere. Not usually a fan of comedy, but laughed at three out of four acts. Next door, a Fetish Ball was happening, which confused me at first. Thought it was part of the comedy club's dress code, but then saw the neon sign and realized it was separate. Great spot for a weekend night out. No need for assless chaps, but they're not forbidden either."

"Thai food, delicious. Server, pleasant. Green curry, extra veggies and tofu, yummy. Ate it all. Friend had broccoli chicken and spring roll, impressed. Ambiance, hole-in-the-wall and kitschy. Don't care. Go for food and service, not disappointed."

"My pug's gotten top-notch care at Squaw Peak. Staff's kind, appointments are easy to come by, and the wait's never long. They treat my dog like he's their own, just like others have said. 

Found a pup at work, brought him in, and he had distemper. Vet said putting him down was best. Asked about the cost, and the vet covered it, no charge. 

They've been cool about billing me for vet care and letting me make payments when I'm struggling financially. But I wasn't stoked about getting a collections notice after making a payment that covered most of what I owed. Billing person said I could make another payment this month, $70, and just needed to call in and arrange it. Considering how well they've treated me, figure it was just a mistake."
"Arrived for grub, heard whispers of this joint from pals. Food's decent, atmosphere's not too shabby either. Not your average sushi spot. Enjoyed my meal, will return."

"Great spot! Loved the vibe, especially the view of the fountain show from our table by the window. Foie gras and hamachi were top-notch. I went for the medium duck, but it was a letdown - underseasoned and too tough. Our server was on it, though, and offered to swap it out for a sea bass. Now that was a damn good choice."

"Came in with a big group on June 22nd in the evening. Sat at a table with games to pass the time. Hubby got the miso salmon, I had a burger and fries. Food was good, service was good too. Till the bill came. They sorted it out for all of us, which was nice. But then I saw they added a gratuity. Now, I ain't got no problem with auto grat, but I got a problem with not tellin' us about it. Some folks double tipped without knowin', which wasn't their intention. Told the others on my side, they appreciated the heads-up. Maybe it ain't the restaurant's policy, but the server's. Still, shady practice, that."
"Best steak in Vegas. Seats comfy, place hoppin'. Lobster apps pricey, but damn good. Staff sharp. Can't wait to go back, sans lobster."

"3.75 stars. First LV store I visited, aside from the one in Japan. Security guards gave me the hairy eyeball, bored outta their minds. Other nice stores at Caesars, they'd smile, say have a good night. Purse bar was cool, associate showed us 7-10 bags, took off the protection tape. Forgot her name, but she was patient, helpful. Disappeared for a bit after we decided, but still recommend it if you're serious. Even if they ignore you, like they did me."
"Good spread at their lunch buffet. Veggie and meat options, plenty to choose from. Desserts are top-notch, especially the garlic naan. Friendly staff too."
"Atmosphere top-notch. Grub satisfactory. Lunchtime options plentiful but not overwhelming. Raspberry soda, a tasty beverage indeed."

"Leaving this joint, I've always been a happy camper. Their bar's got some serious style, bottles lit up like a Christmas tree. But the lighting's crap, like someone's shining a flashlight under their face. Not exactly flattering.

I go for the Sesame Crusted Ahi Tuna, it's a real treat. Slaw's got a great taste, soy dressing, and a kick of wasabi. Not a fish place, but I'm on a seafood binge and their Blacked Fish Sandwich hits the spot. Cooked to perfection, love the sauce. Steamed broccoli's fresh and tasty, but skip the honey roasted carrots, they're drenched in sugar syrup. Gross.

Dessert's not my thing here. Too much white chocolate for my taste."

"This joint's the real deal in Sun Prairie. Been here six times, never disappointed. Steak, fish, whatever you want, it's all good. Kids' meals are just right, they actually eat 'em. Menu and beer selection change up, so it's always worth comin' back. Get busy on Fridays, but that's what happens when a place is doin' things right. Fills a gap in this town."

"Filet Mignon, damn good. Sauce, didn't need steak sauce, but still good. Service, top-notch. Waiter, friendly. Water, always full. Price, reasonable. Frites, too salty. Great spot for lunch, sunny day."
"Clean joint. Spacious rooms. Fair price. Quiet location, less foot traffic. Fresh air. Plenty to do: beach, mall, bars, clubs, spa."

We waited 30 minutes for a table, but it was worth it. Sat outside, great for people watching. Ordered caesar salad, arrived fast, delicious, loved the cheese and dressing. Also got quiche lorraine, brought back memories of my childhood, amazing, filling, couldn't finish it! Friendly, attentive service. Food came quick, barely finished my salad before lunch arrived. Boyfriend had warm chicken and brie sandwich, with apple and caramelized onions, absolutely delicious. Great experience, great food, elegant atmosphere. Will definitely dine here again in Vegas.
"Cool joint. Kitchen gadgets galore. Chrome, high-end, and sleek. Coffee while you browse? Hell yeah. Fun times."

"I like my clothes with a bit of city swag, but I ain't got no problem with that. This place had some nice gear, and I loved the idea of looking sharp without breaking the bank. It was a big joint, lots of variety - from streetwear to suits and everything in between. They even had some accessories. My only beef was the lack of service outside of the fitting rooms. But hey, at these prices, I ain't gonna complain too much."

"Union Pig & Chicken in Pittsburgh serves up some top-notch BBQ. Their brisket's soft, falls apart easy, but watch out for them fatty bits. Service is decent, but slow. Good spot for lunch too. Try their sandwiches, they're damn tasty. And don't forget the mac & cheese, it's freakin' great."

"Smoothies all around at this joint. Hubby, teens, and I, each got our own. Share and share alike, that's our style. Friendly service, too. Just one gripe - prices a mite steep. But hey, worth it for a full meal in a cup."

"Walnut Grill, a joint I frequent for a post-work tipple or a swift, satisfying meal. Their menu, a twist on classic American fare. Wine list, top-notch. Atmosphere, lively. Recently expanded bar area, more seating, cozy booths. Servers, attentive, memorable. Live music, some nights. You'll find me here, regularly."
"Manager read my review, called me up, and apologized. Haven't been back since, but he said it'll be different next time. Fired the server who messed up my order. Lookin' forward to tryin' it again."

"Steak N Shake finally made it to the valley. I'm a big fan of their Frisco melt - it's a juicy, greasy delight. The joint's clean, the service is friendly, but I miss the surly waitresses. Wish they were open 24/7 like the others, but no big deal. The menu's smaller, but I can live without the peppers. The milkshakes ain't up to par, but I'll take my Frisco melt with fries and cheese sauce any day."
"McDonald's, yeah. I get it. But this one's got my loyalty. Fast service, friendly too. Coffee, hash browns, in and out in five minutes, tops."

"Ox tail soup, that's what they're known for. California Hotel, late night spot. Fans of the soup, this is the place. Hawaiian and Filipino influence on the menu. Check in on Facebook, it'll say Home of the Ox Tail Soup. Tips: 1. Wait in line, be prepared. 2. No peanuts, that's the way to go. 3. Validate your parking ticket, don't forget."
"Good grub here. Market fish, tender meat. Duck and pork, tasty too."

"Clean joint. Fridge's stocked, gym's decent. Internet's a pain though - gotta renew every 24 hours, and it costs ten bucks a pop. Breakfast's meh, unless you customize it. Room service tray got left outside my door till the next day. Other than that, no complaints. Location's good, staff's attentive, stay's pleasant."

"Local fella at a liquor store turned me onto this joint a couple years back. Been comin' here ever since, whenever I'm in Vegas. Only had the pizza and wings, but they hit the spot real good, especially after a long night of drinkin'. It's just down the street from the Stratosphere, so it's easy to find. You can tell it's a local hangout, but don't let that scare you off. Good eatin', no frills."

"Crab legs, good. Line, long. Sushi, fresh. Desserts, cute. Gellato, many flavors. Price, high. Bellagio, better. Buffet, aquariums. Tropical desserts, out of this world. Escalator, down. Todai, great. Reasonable prices. Chicken, beef, too."
"Fuel up 24/7 in Vegas. Pit stop, fill up, drink up, back at the strip! Skip Mickey D's and Denny's, hit this joint for real grub that'll keep you full."

"XS, we ended up there after Hakkansan turned us away. Not disappointed, no sir. Inside, gorgeous. Outside, great spot for tunes and fresh air. Danced the night away with Rusko. Definitely worth a visit."
"This joint serves up one of the best spreads in town, and for a steal too. I'd come back for more, no question."
"East coast, noodles, good. Thinking 'bout 'em still. Next time, straight there."
"Good grub here, mate. Vodka cokes for 12 bucks, can't beat that. Had a blonde server, Marcia or Mercy, something like that. She was pleasant."
"Service was slow, but it was noon. Cashier was quick and friendly."

"I checked out some Yelp reviews, then hit up Ingleside Grooming. First impressions weren't great - the lady seemed annoyed with my questions. But I still wanted her to groom my pet. Next day, I was late dropping her off. Told her my pet gets nervous and poops at Petsmart/vet. She was cool about it. Felt good. When I picked my pet up, the same lady gave me the lowdown on how well-behaved she was and how great she looked. Cost was fair too. Give 'em a shot."

"Yelp led me here. Glad it did. Great Sonoran dogs. Two filled me up. First visit, sketchy comms. Asked about dog varieties, got a shrug. Second time, better. Helpful staff, clean joint. Not the ritziest hood, but worth it for the grub."
"Saw a billboard on our way, Seinfeld was performing that night. Couldn't pass it up. Got seats near the back, but the view and sound were still top-notch. Great spot for live acts."

"Liked the show. Some cheese, but mostly excellent. Something for everyone, done with taste and art. 

Twins killed it, big girls owning the stage. Rest of the bodies, lean dancers, real breastsâ€”hooray! 

Choreography, beautiful, tasteful, poignant. Not just shock, but love, lust, joy, pain, pleasure, desire, distress, giving, taking, physical, emotional, silly, fun. Human animal, full circle. 

Standouts: African dancer, suspended bondage, water gymnasts, transvestite torch singer. That red cape, spectacular. 

Must-see. Would go back, enjoyed every minute."

"10am at Poppy's. Bagels, a dozen. My plan? Play Bagel Fairy all day with the best damn bagels in Charlotte. 

Fair distribution, but I had to test the merchandise first. Two in one sitting, no regrets. Coffee was mediocre, but who cares when the bagels are top-notch? A+ in the bagel department. Shame about the cheese and slices though, Bore's Head just doesn't cut it. 

No more Bruegger's for me. No more torturing Owen. Poppy bagels, Poppy love."
"Cool joint, good people, comfy vibes. Affordable drinks and grub, tasty too. Happy hour deals, sweet. Gets packed, but always a blast."

"I did something in Vegas I don't usually do. Ate dinner solo. Party of one, they call it. And it was great. Booking was easy, warm welcome, friendly service. Food was outstanding, foie gras stood out. Reasonably priced, got half-bottles of champagne and Chateauneuf du Pape for $88. Fellow next to me, French-speaking Jason Statham lookalike, also eating solo. Turned out he was from Ottawa, hockey talk and all, killed the romantic vibe."
"Whataburger's my spot for chicken strips. They hook you up with some toast too. That's the way to do it."

"Good grub, clean joint. We had the alloush and June's special - mushroom melt. Both were tasty, no doubt. But a couple things kept it from being a five-star affair. Bread was soft, not crunchy like we expected. And the greens on the sandwich? Limp, not fresh. Maybe that's just me, though. Still, worth checking out. Just know what you're getting into."

"Been twice in recent years. Enjoyed Simon Boccanegra and Madame Butterfly. Great performances, but pricey. Can only afford cheap seats. Narrow up there. Might splurge next time. Check for pre-show lecture. Worth the time, and you might score better parking."

"Starbucks here's a good spot. Service is snappy, even when it's busy. Wi-fi's a crap shoot, but that's not their fault. Problem is, like most places downtown, you gotta watch out for the homeless. They take up tables, beg for change. Can't blame Starbucks for that. City's gotta handle it."
"Strip-side joint. People-watch, drink hard, DJ booth coming. Summer hotspot."

"This joint? Love it. Been coming here since '96. Vegan-friendly, you know? Had the papaya salad and fresh spring rolls last night. Minty, but still good. Dinner number three, that's what I had. Came with a fried roll, coconut soup, and pad thai. Spicy, even though I asked for mild. Never had that before. Service was quick and friendly. I'll be back for one of their lunch deals."

Ikea for Prez.

Imagine a gov like Ikeaâ€”efficient, affordable, useful. Faux wood, real wood, options galore. Help's decent, 7/10 times. Got everything you needâ€”string, bags, dollies, measuring tape, pencils, notepads.

Personally, I dig Hemnes (real wood!). Bought it for my master bedroom, living room. Excellent results. Did Malm too (haven't we all?). Small investment, years of use.

Downside's the directions. No words, just pictures. Need patience, a clear head. Gentleman friend assembles; I hand him the pieces and step back.
"Lived close by, passed it often. Wife called, wanted lunch brought over. Gyros hit the spot, no disappointment. Meat stacked high, sauce just right, fresh pita. Great midday meal."

"Anniversary weekend, suggest DW Bistro to the husband. Had been there two weeks prior with the girls, amazing. Husband impressed by the smell alone, rare for a former restaurateur. Split a house salad, mixed greens, fruit, cheese, nuts - a must-have. Short rib sandwich and salmon, both perfectly cooked, great flavors. Our waiter, top-notch, personable. Looking forward to trying their brunch."

"The performances were top-notch, like something straight out of America's Got Talent. Good mix of acts, solid characters, and some fresh material. 

I paid $23 for a mojito in a skinny glass. It was a damn good drink, but as a local, I couldn't help thinking about all the grub I could've gotten for that price. =p

All in all, the entertainment blew away my expectations. I wasn't sure what to expect, but it delivered."

"Eddie D's got a new regular, 'Sir Robert.' Used to be 'Bobby,' but now he's buffed up and calling himself 'Sir.' Tough exterior, but still the same soft, sweet stuffing on the inside. He's taking gravy baths now, trying to impress the ladies. And it's working - they can't resist the six-inch Robert. But for the bigger gals, he's got a twelve-inch transformation. Don't miss out, lonely lunchers. Hit up Eddie D's and find Sir Robert waiting for you."

"Paradise Bakery, great spot. Friendly staff, but lines can get long when it's busy. Love their apple cinnamon and blueberry muffins, always consistent. Nice rewards program too, easy to earn freebies if you're a regular. Only downside, sometimes pushy home business types hog the booths on weekdays. Whole families with screaming kids on weekends. Other locations don't have this issue, maybe it's the hotel next door."
"Mattress Factory? Amazing. Unique installations. Can't find elsewhere in the city."

"Avalon in Oakland, loved it. Passed one in Mt Lebo, had to stop. Funny clothes in the window, neon sign. Typical layout, pants, shirts, dresses. Nice area up front with bags and jewelry. Higher-end selection too, for the desperate housewives. Good selection, not as stylish as Buffalo Exchange though. Wide shoe selection. Affordable prices. Friendly cashier, talked about our fave stores. Pros: doesn't smell like cat pee, organized, great design, affordable. Cons: could use some inventory clearance, whiny women shop there. Overall: great place to stop when broke, still wanna spend, and avoiding Urban Outfitters. Definitely making it a regular spot."
"This joint's shut down? Damn shame. Good eatery, that one. Now I gotta find some other joint for my grub."

"Nice joint. New, modern, non-smoking. No casino. That was cool. Liked being up high. Could see a lot. Automatic shades, big shower, fast toilet, great tub. Prices in the cafe were steep, but that's Vegas. Appreciated the morning latte. Valets were solid. Checked in early. Nice surprise."
"Food was decent. Fries were lackin' flavor, but the service made up for it - our waitress was a sourpuss when my gal asked for more mayo."

"This joint's my favorite spot in Vegas. Been to over ten hotels in this town, but this one takes the cake. Got the M Life card, so I get treated right. Rooms are big and the staff's friendly. Pool's got a sweet beach vibe, especially when it's scorching outside. Burger Bar's my go-to. Their Kobe burger's top-notch. \n\nOnly two things that bug me. One, it's turned into a family place. Not a bad thing, just not my scene. Two, TVs are old and not HD. But hey, that's just a minor gripe."

"Vanguard's been my haunt for a while now. Great spot for a unique cocktail or something new. Bar's always clean, no problem getting a drink even on busy nights. I'm a man of many drinks, but at Vanguard, it's always the Jack Rose. Apple brandy, maple syrup, black cherry - damn, I'm craving one just thinking about it. Maple syrup, you know? Can't go wrong. Drinks are top-notch, but take a break after a few, you hear me? Weekend nights get loud with the DJ, and Fremont's finest come in for a quick shuffle before they bounce. All in all, solid joint."

"Came for dinner, food was top-notch. Steak and fish, cooked to perfection. But service, slow as molasses. Waited over an hour for grub. They made up for it though, gave my grandpa a box of truffles and a twenty-five dollar card. Food, four-point-five stars. Service, three stars."

"Bamboo Club, good eatery. Outdoor seating, nice. Decor, theme, all good. Got there late, sat outside. Food, good. Pad Thai, appetizers, all good. Tuna, frozen. My bad. Maybe their fault, heard they can get fresh fish. Ambiance, good. Service, bad. Waiter, douche bag. Recap, good place, good food, avoid seafood, waiter needs a kick."
"Bar closes at 10pm. Western theme, wagon wheels, peanuts, fries - all bad. Hamburgers, guacamole - good. Cookies - untested, but rumored to be decent."

"ShooGoo was a solid joint, four stars easy. Good grub, American fare, big servings, attentive staff. But missing that je ne sais quoi for five stars. 

My filet with Béarnaise sauce, top-notch. Mushroom Gorgonzola app, the real highlight. Mmm. 
View wasn't bad either, but that's Sedona for ya. Sunny AZ, yow, bill."

Krispy Kreme, a gift from the gods. Passing by, that neon Hot & Now sign calls like a siren. Can't resist. Never been let down by those melty, glazed dreams. Staff, fast and efficient. Pulls a dozen in no time. Inside, fun for kids. Conveyor belt churns out doughnuts. A place of pure joy. Not just breakfast or snack, but happiness. Only gripe, accessibility. Hard to get in and out. Independence, a busy street. But worth it. Love Krispy Kreme, except for their strange spelling. Onward for Hot & Now doughnuts!

"Pittsburgh's got another dive bar that's worth checkin' out. They got this Penn Pumpkin Roll that's pure gold, but make sure you ask 'em to sprinkle some cinnamon and sugar on the rim. It's like drinkin' a slice of pumpkin pie. And don't forget to try their Sprecher, it's a hard root beer that tastes just like the real deal. They got an upstairs too, if you need some extra elbow room or a sweet view."

"First time at this spot, and it was a swell evening. Seats all around the stage, so the acting's for everyone. Singing was top-notch, wigs a bit cheesy, but who cares? Crowd was mostly old folks, so they'd whisper loud enough to hear themselves. Still, they were having a blast, so no big deal. Tip: get there early, parkings fills up fast. Lots of joints nearby for dinner and a show."

"Kelly's, good joint for meetin' friends, havin' a drink, maybe some grub too. I dig it here. Plenty spots to chill, make new pals or catch up with old ones. \nPricey? Yeah, a bit. Service slow? Yeah, but it's Old Town, what you gonna do? \nAnd if you're feelin' hungry, their short ribs are top-notch. Five stars, easy."

"Passed this joint plenty times, never stopped in 'til an ex wanted to give it a shot. Glad we did. Inside, it's like South Blvd never existed. Classy joint, nice decor. Prices a bit steep, but worth it. Portions big enough for two. Staff top-notch, eager to please. Owner came by, offered free drinks. Not one to turn down a freebie, I'd give it four out of five."

"I like this joint more now that I've been inside. Free drinks for ladies from 10-12am, no line, and friendly staff. The drinks are strong, the place is small but bigger than I thought, and you can sit for free. The lounge is inside, but there's also a bar behind the REVOLUTION letters. The DJ wasn't great, but maybe it was just the music. Good spot for free drinks and chillin' with friends. Some folks were dressed up, but others were casual, like guys in t-shirts and beanies, and girls in denim and dressy tops. The crowd seemed a bit older."

"Food's good, portions just right, service top-notch. But they got a 20-dollar minimum for credit cards. That's a problem for me, since I usually fly solo and don't carry cash. Means I won't be back, 'cause I can get the same grub, service, and portion control two blocks down the road, and use my debit card whenever I please."

"Samosas? Two-and-a-half stars. Potatoes and cilantro? Meh. Naan? Average. Three stars. Kashmiri Dum Aloo? Five stars. Well-spiced, creamy, perfect potatoes. Vegetable Jalfrezi? Four stars. Too much oil. Rice? Perfect. Service? Great. Bollywood videos? Enjoyed 'em. Be back soon."

"This joint's alright, for out here in the sticks. In town, it's just another hole in the wall. But hey, at least someone's giving the locals a decent spot to grab a bite. My pop's taken a liking to the place too, so it's become our go-to when he's feeling hungry. 

The pies are pretty good, and I've had some solid pasta dishes. 

Just remember, it can get pretty packed, so it's best to book ahead."

"Shirts with sleeves, that's the rule for guys in Vegas, no matter how hot it gets. Worth the cost though, the grub and decor make it worthwhile. Plenty of options for your plate, and their desserts? Not bad, not bad at all. Corn on the cob, that's the real winner here."

"Spinach artichoke dip, damn good. Used to be bigger, but who cares? Strong drinks, that's what matters. Our waiter, Matt, top-notch. Helped us choose, had a blast before hitting the town. My friend digs the menu, Weight Watchers friendly. I'm sold, two for $20."

"JD and I were lookin' for a real casual spot to grab some grub after our workout on Saturday. He suggested this place and it was dead on. The chips 'n' salsa were top-notch, either they were really good or I was just starvin' from the gym, prob'ly a bit of both. 

JD gets this cheese crisp thing and I give him a hard time about it, askin' if he's on a diet. Then I eat my words when this huge, greasy, cheesy monstrosity of a pizza comes out. It was friggin' huge! Thin tortilla, loads of melted cheese, cut up into squares like a pizza. Made it real easy to chow down on. I had these Mexican Flag enchiladas, they were alright, but they couldn't compete with that cheese beast across the table. 

All in all, it was a killer meal. Undid all the good I did at the gym, but that's life and I'm a-okay with it."

"Rito's got the best red chile and beans in the world, maybe even universe. Don't let the haters tell you otherwise. Sure, the area might seem rough, but that's just part of its charm. You'll find all sorts of folks here - city workers, CPAs, medical staff, teachers, and the occasional sketchy character. But don't let that scare you off. This family-owned joint serves up some damn good grub. Their menu might be limited, but it's all about quality, not quantity. And don't worry about the prices - you're getting fresh, soulful food, not some heartless crap like at Taco Bell. If you're feeling lucky, grab three tacos while you're there. The guacamole tacos? Amazing. I'd rob old people for 'em. Just saying. Now, if only they'd step up their game and offer fountain drinks... that'd be something else."

"Gold's Gym Elite, now this is a gym worth talking about. Walking in, I felt like I was checking into a high-end hotel, The W, maybe. Modern, stylish, and most importantly, clean. I'm beyond stoked to be a member here. Friendly staff, top-notch equipment, personal TVs on the cardio machines, and a place to plug in your iPod. No pool, but the views make up for it. Watched the planes take off and land at Sky Harbor while getting my sweat on. Not too crowded, either. A breath of fresh air compared to that other gym I used to go to. Filthy bathrooms and way too many people. Glad I made the switch."

"Buffets don't usually sit well with me, but Studio B is an exception. Quality over quantity, and worth the trip. Dinner's around $25 Monday to Thursday, seafood bumps it up to $35 on weekends. Not a bad deal, considering you get unlimited beer and wine. They've got craft drafts and ciders, a few wine options too. Something for everyone - sushi, carving stations, veggie options, and a dessert spread that'll satisfy any sweet tooth. Gelato and milkshakes too. Modern, comfy, and clean, with a view of the Strip. Lines can get long, so come prepared. Check out the M Players Club for free buffets."

"I joined this gym and it's been great. Friendly staff at the counter, always a warm welcome. Plenty of machines to use, variety for every muscle group. Juice bar's top-notch, staff's friendly too. Brent helped me sign up, explained everything clearly. No issues with parking, place is well-kept. Recommended."

"Three of us ate at this joint last night and I'll definitely be back. Service was top-notch, Emily was a real sweetheart, and the owner, Daryl, even stopped by our table to make sure everything was A-okay. Good guy. \nNow, if I had to nitpick, I'd say the apps could've been bigger. They were pretty cheap, so we should've gotten a few more. But other than that, the grub was great. I went for the curried tofu and cleaned my plate. Martha got the Jerk Chicken (real spicy) and Binnie had the Chicken and Dumplings, which was different but damn good. \nAll three of us agreed we'd come back."

The Rio. A classic Vegas joint. Nothing fancy, but solid. They updated the furniture, made it comfy. Weekends get busy, lines long. Staff stays chill. A bit of a hike from the strip, so bring some extra cash for cabs. Still a good spot, Rio. Keep it up.

"Pizza, salad, wine - all good. Owner recommended the Emiliana salad, so we gave it a shot. Split it with the Italian Sausage and mushroom pizza. Both were top-notch. Went with a Tuscan Cabernet blend for the wine, nice choice. Good vibes, good grub, good times. Definitely going back."

"Green chili burro and beef taco, that's all I got. Took it to go, so it wasn't as good as eatin' there, but the green chili was still a must. Not too hot, not too bland. Good tortillas. Taco was decent, but next time, I'll eat in. It's a pretty good neighborhood spot."
"Prince, Friday night. Saw him from the floor and the suite. Great show."

"LaQuinta in Scottsdale, that's where we usually stay. But this time, we needed to be at the courthouse bright and early, so I booked a room at the LaQuinta on Thomas. Big mistake. Pulled up, felt like I was taking my mom on a drug run to a dingy motel. But it was LaQuinta, I reminded myself. We bailed, fast.

Hopped on the 17, couple exits up, saw the Residence Inn, and my mom damn near turned the wheel herself, shouting, "GET OFF HERE!" Just kidding. We were hungry and wanted a comfy room, safe haven. And AAA knocked off 40 bucks, sweet deal.

Place had white picket fences around the AC outside, cozy touch. Studio room, kitchen, they even do grocery runs for you. Breakfast, the works: sausage, waffles, scrambles, fruit. No continental crap. 

Comfy, cozy, great sleep before a stressful day. Thanks, Residence Inn. Oh, and our court case? Victory! Yeehaw!"
"Caf\u00e9 across from McGill, great spot. Coffee's top-notch, Jason and crew are friendly. Pastries, fresh from a small bakery, taste like mom's. Stop by whenever I can."

"Re Salon & Med Spa, great place. Staff's top-notch, give 'em a visit. Been goin' there six months, had my fair share of services - cut, color, mani/pedi. Bethany, the color and cut magician, she's the best."

"Smooth ride, great views, and a taste of champagne. Just as promised. But six passengers in one chopper? Felt like a sardine in a can. Couldn't even stretch my legs. Average size, too. Would've been five stars otherwise."

"Bellagio buffet, solid 4 stars. Reasonable price for good variety, including crabs and prime rib. Always plenty of crabs, no need to stand in line. Snow crabs are better than King crabs, weirdly. Prime rib, very tasty, fast line. Typical casino buffet ambiance, not too fancy. Attentive service, no need to ask for refills or take away dirty dishes."

"Solid spot for frybread tacos, but the real draw's the green chili stew. Variety of dessert frybreads, too. Chorizo with hot sauce hits the spot. Good for a change of pace or satisfyin' your sweet tooth."
"BBQ's not bad. Samplers, big ones, liked 'em all. Meat, falls off the bone, nice. Pork, real good. Atmosphere, like gramma's house. Food, plenty. Go again?"
"Planet Dailies and Trader Vic's, then P F Chang's. Happy. Good grub, decent service, fair prices. Minor gripes, but P F Chang's wins."
"Buzzberry, not the best coffee spot, but it's good enough. Support local, that's what I say. Friendly staff, quick too. Large drink, secret menu, that's the way to go."

"I've holed up in a few joints in Vegas these past couple months, and the Downtown Grand ain't half bad. Retro vibes with them ocean colors, modern furniture that's a pleasant surprise given the price. Flat screen, full-size closet, dresser draws - got everything you need, 'cept a fridge. 

But them hidden fees, man, they get ya. Free internet, my eye - that's just part of the $12 daily hotel fee they didn't bother mentionin'. And don't even get me started on the $50 a day hold for damages. Then there's the self-parking across the street, and let me tell ya, that garage gives me the heebie-jeebies. 

All things considered, not too shabby for downtown Vegas. Restaurants in the lobby? On par with the rest of the Grand experience."
"This joint's not half bad. Decent grub, cold brews, and a friendly crew. Had a swell time."

"Food's decent here. Like a cheesecake factory, everything tastes the same. Friends say let's hit Grand Lux, it's cheap. But we never leave without dropping at least twenty bucks a head, just for grub. Yeah, it's cheap for Vegas, but when you're eating at three am every night, it adds up. Drunk food, you know? If you've only got thirty minutes, call ahead and order. Service ain't quick."
"Dinner was damn good. Waiter, Christopher, was top-notch. Made us feel like royalty. Will be back."

"Hot Dog on a Stick? No thanks. Just the lemonade for me, friend. Three flavors to choose from, but I stick with the classics - lime and cherry. Can't beat that sweet, refreshing taste. Worth every penny, even if it's a bit pricey. Just don't sit too close, or the sound of those lemons getting smashed might ruin your appetite. But hey, that's just part of the experience, right?"
"Best grub in Vegas, bar none. Menu's always changin', drinks are top-shelf. Hidden gem, but worth the search. Had the short rib gorgonzola polenta - damn near perfect."

"Tried their tapas on happy hour, wasn't impressed. Came back for Paella, it was a pleasant surprise. Food was better, ordered Paella, Camarones Al Ajillo, and Brochettas De Pollo. Camarones Al Ajillo, a must-try. BF almost licked the plate."

"Las Vegas weekend, Gordon Ramsey's restaurant. Foodie heaven. Ordered lamb, melt-in-your-mouth goodness. Mashed potato side, equally impressive. Husband's shepherd's pie, a letdown. Watery mess. Courageously complained, waiter fixed it. Free dessert, a nice touch. Wish I could afford this luxury often."
"Solid joint for breakfast or lunch. Grub's top-notch, plenty of light options so you ain't eatin' just straight fat."

"I hailed a cab, pulled up to a desolate mall. Wondered if I should keep my lunch reservation. Glad I did. 

Had the black pepper garlic chicken wings. Crispy, flavorful, not greasy. Loved the salty, slightly sweet garlic spice rub. 

Pork fried rice was meh at first. But after adding some of the wing spice rub, Thai bird chili, and fish sauce, it was great. Pork was cut into thin squares. Prefer thicker, longer slices, typically a bit moister. 

Service was prompt and friendly."

"Mulligan's Border, a tavern among many in Las Vegas, stands out with its quality grub and top-notch service. Their bar food, elevated to the next level, impresses. I've tried most items on the menu, and none have disappointed. My go-to is a simple, juicy burger, cooked medium rare, served with a properly toasted bun. It's a testament to a good burger that keeps me and the missus coming back. We've dubbed it our 'Cheers,' as the staff knows our names. Not a massive menu, but what they have, they do well. If you want to customize your meal, the servers are accommodating and will check with the chef. Service is exceptional. They may not 'Crumb the Table,' but they sure as hell make your visit worthwhile. My wife and I are regulars, hitting it up multiple times a week. Give it a shot."

"This joint's got character, ya know? Funky vibes, good beer, and plenty of veggie options. Art on the walls is top-notch, and they got a killer flier selection. Check it out, especially if you're an ASU student. Oh, and there's a craft fair every second Saturday of the month, put on by local indie crafters. Worth a look, for sure."
"Park's got some sweet singletrack, six and a half miles of it. Good for all skill levels, but watch out for them roots."

"Been to Biaggio's twice this week. Monday and Thursday, both times to go. FiancÃ© ordered pizza and wings Monday. Wings are to die for. Addicted.
