Crunchy outside, moist inside, dipped in ranch and hot sauce. Irresistible. Pizza was good, but nothing special. Pepperoni on one half, mushrooms and sausage on the other. Last night tried a stromboli. Bigger than expected. Chicken with artichokes and red pepper. Loved the artichokes. Stick with the $6.99 stromboli's. Specialty stromboli was $12.99. Both meals were around $30. Pricey for pie and wings. Back for the wings though."
"Devil's Diner's got new blood. Ownership and cook, both changed. Food's better now, tasty and priced right. Atmosphere's more welcoming too. Smile's on our faces."
"Serendipity, Vegas. Frozen hot chocolate, nachos. Always. Long wait, but worth it. To-go window, side."
"Cozy joint, good grub and top-notch service. Save room for sweet treats. Skip the mixed drinks, though."

"Grooming Salon. Katie, the cat handler. Hard to find cat groomers in this town. Vets offer the service, but after today's visit to Petsmart, I'll stick with Katie. She's got a way with cats, even the demon ones. My cat, Josie, is a handful. Adorable with me, but afraid of all pet workers. No idea why. Katie works Tuesday through Friday, starting at 7 am. Perfect. No one else needs to witness the drama my cat puts on. Called ahead to see if Katie could shave Josie's haunches. Didn't want bits clinging to her backside. Gross. Katie put an E-collar on Josie and scruffed her while she worked. Fine by me. The cat was screaming like a murder victim, otherwise, she'd be embarrassing. Job done in less than ten minutes. $6 well spent. Vet suggested sedating Josie and declawing her. Inhumane. Katie's the first professional to work with Josie...professionally. My cat's a total freak, but I can't shave her ass myself. Thank God for Katie at Petsmart. Seriously."
"Been here a few times, never disappointed. Food's good, service is too. Solid choice for a quick bite."
"Pleasant surprise, poutine. Variety, yes. House Special, best. Service, good. Room, plenty."
"Prices fair, plenty grub. Satay Chicken, dry as dust. Pineapple Fried Rice, good stuff. Thai Tea, sweet as sin. Phat Thai, solid. Green Curry Paste Fried Rice, spicy as hell."

"Place was great. Styrofoam, construction noise, no big deal. Unit was huge, comfy, perfect for our six-day stay. No daily maid service, but that's cool. We had a washer/dryer, but it was a little temperamental. Towels were plentiful, though. Pool was decent, hot tub and bar made up for it. Location was top-notch, rooms were clean, kitchen was a bonus. Would stay again."

"Check that one off the ol' bucket list. Visited the Mustard Museum and it was a real treat. Basement's small, but how big can a mustard museum be? Was hopin' for some ancient Egyptian or Roman mustard artifacts, but they had plenty of mustard from around the world instead. Upstairs was the sample area, where I dropped a cool $25. Staff was top-notch too. If you ain't a fan of mustard, best avoid the place."

"Atmosphere wasn't too loud, considering it was the Hard Rock Hotel. Decor was modern, lighting was good. Server recommended their specialties, which I tried. Flavors were great - yellow tail sashimi with jalapeno, black cod miso. Skipped the chef's sashimi, it was just okay. Dessert was good, had many options. Went with vanilla tapioca. Sake was pricey, but worth it. Service was slow, but nice for a relaxed dinner. Would go back for the beef wagyu beef or other signatures. Not a cheap meal, expect to spend at least $150 per person, but worth it for the experience."

"Thursday nights, I hit up this joint for trivia. Always a good time. Menu's got some surprises - salads, wraps, decent pizza. Great spot to catch a game, too. TVs everywhere. But it gets crowded, especially since it's one of the only sports bars around. \n\nOne Sunday night, some drunk dude punched out a window. That was wild."

"Next to Metro Pizza, this place has been around for years. No Fresh & Easy nearby, so I've found a new spot for fresh produce. Super convenient to my workplace, almost never busy. Parking and checkout are a breeze. Got kiwi, peaches, celery, apples, and bananas for $12.05 yesterday. Been coming here more often since F & E closed. Sometimes it's a gamble at the 99 cents store. \n\nClean, fully stocked, and never disappoints. Saw two workers last night, one cashier, one stocking shelves."

"AJ's sushi bar, been goin' there since '06. Sushi chefs, top-notch, four stars easy. But then, turnover, reduced hours, quality and value took a dive. Had to find a new spot for my sushi fix. Update '13, they brought back the old chefs, now it's back to bein' one of my favorites."

"Good joint. Craps tables top-notch. Circle bar decent, cougars abound. Off the strip, 15 minutes, worth the trip. Rooms modern, pool sweet. Ex-roommate tended bar here. Laid-back spot when you need a break from the Strip. Big Bingo Room, bowling alley too. Theatre good, avoid weekends, teens swarm. Across from a shopping center, handy. Same ownership as Green Valley casino, similar vibe."

"Yum! Cran-slam club, good but turkey a bit dry. Cousins had capastrami and Bobbie, so I tried 'em. Bobbie, oh man, so good! Stuffing makes it, not dry like my sandwich. Capastrami, good too. Heard about a Capriotti's in Beverly Hills. Gotta try the Bobbie there!"

"Ramen Sora, good stuff. Not Monta-level, but still solid. Fresh ingredients, distinct flavors. Spicy miso, not too spicy. Could eat it again, definitely. If I lived in Vegas, this place would be my go-to."

This joint's got character, man. It's all Beatles-themed and the grub's got some funny names, but don't let that fool you. The fried cheese curds, they're top-notch. And the jalapeno popper burger? Damn good too. Don't sleep on the turkey swiss and slaw either.

Now, if you wanna make some memories, hit this place up on a Tuesday night. They got this trivia thing going on and Kim, the gal who runs it, she's a real kick. The waitstaff, they're A-okay too. Friendly as can be. And they got some decent brews to choose from.

"Airport pizza joints usually rip you off, but not this spot in B concourse. Decent pie, not the best, but a damn sight better than the rest. Crews come here too, that tells you something. Good eatin', fair price."

"I had the Dynamite Sandwich, a fiery blend of sliced brisket, peppers, chilis, onions, and jalapeÃ±os, all sautÃ©ed with Red Diamond sauce and piled on a jalapeÃ±o roll. It was damn good, and I'll be having more of them. But the real star was the Fried Onion Strings. No breading issues here, just lightly coated and perfectly cooked onions that weren't too strong or sweet. And at $1.95, it was a steal. My only gripe was the small portion size, but that's easily fixed by going on the first Wednesday of the month for the $12.95 AYCE lunch buffet. They're only open for lunch, weekdays only, from 10:30am to 3:00pm. If they expanded their hours and upped the portion sizes, I'd give 'em five stars."

"This joint's our go-to for Asian grub. My fam hits it up every weekend when my old lady's feelin' like whippin' up some stir-fry or pho. They got all sorts of goodies - Chinese, Filipino, you name it. And it's all in one spot, so we don't gotta make multiple trips. Used to go to 99 Ranch, but now that we moved out west, this place is way more convenient. 

I love checkin' out their selection - always somethin' new to try. From hair care to junk food, they got it all. Even got some fancy tea to sip on. And when I was makin' pho from scratch, I found all the ingredients I needed in one spot. They got all sorts of herbs, spices, sauces, and powders. The place is spotless too. If you run into any language problems, just find someone who speaks English. Most of 'em do. 

Their baked goods and deli items are top-notch. I grab pastries for lunch, and their dim sum's always a treat. Better than Orchid's Garden or Chang's, and way cheaper. You should skip Panda Express and hit this place up instead. It's legit and affordable - five bucks for two items, and the portions are huge. Oh, and they'll fry your fish for free!"

"Burgers, damn good. Had the BBQ before, but the I Love Bacon burger, that's the real deal. Brisket and bacon, yum. Tater tots, necessary. Beer specials, hell yeah. Sam Adams, 32 oz, ten bucks, keep the cup. That's I Love Burgers, baby."
"Drive-thru's handy, sure. But this joint's got character. Makes me wanna ditch the wheels, stretch my legs. Friendly folk, too. Always nail my order."

"Steak n' scrimps for $7.77? Helluva deal, boys. Can't beat that. Decent slab o' meat, skewered shrimp, mashed spuds, and a salad. Go for the Caesar, though. Tasty greens. Just get in, order, eat, and shut up. Don't spoil the special with fancy service or ambiance. This is a 24/7 grub joint. Finished off a night of craps here after hit-tin' the hard eight twice. Yeah, you heard me right. Crappers, know the odds. 'Til next time, steak ya later."

"Gave it 4.5 stars. Good eatin' joints, slots, bars, pool, kids' play area, friendly servers. Deluxe room, plenty space, but deducted half star for dirtiness. Table seats had food stains, no Wi-Fi, and in-room internet didn't work. Everything else, great. Stay again, for sure."

"Good eatery...sushi, not so much. I'm a sushi fiend, tried 'em all in Vegas. This spot's decent, but not my top pick. Garlic Chicken and Hamburger Steak, that's what I'm talkin' about! Their Hawaiian breakfast too, sausage, eggs, rice - yum! Not for sushi lovers, but still, a taste of 808 in 702."

"Grand Lux, when will you hit the Bay? Feels like Cheesecake Factory, but with better grub. Variety's the spice of life, and we ordered up a storm: stacked quesadilla, seared ahi, Asian noodle bowl, tomato bisque. Skip the noodles, they're a sad imitation. Ahi and quesadilla were solid, and the tomato soup was a hearty bowl. Portions are huge, so sharing's a good idea. Prices are fair, service is prompt and friendly. You'll leave full and content, all for under $20."

"Went to this joint with some out-of-towners, looking to cash in on a match play deal I saw online. It's your typical neighborhood poker bar, but with a tropical twist - gotta love that little waterfall. Tiki decor's cool too. Any place that'll match my play's a winner in my book. Didn't try the grub, but the bartender offered me a Blue Moon with OJ. That's a winner too. This place is a Steelers bar, so they got promos and prizes going on during all the games."
"Went to this joint with some pals. Liked it. Wife and I had a veggie sandwich, Caprese. Daughter had an Italian. Friend had the Montagu. Cheap for the Strip, but still hungry after."
"Mexico, we go there often.  Back from Baja's tip, just returned.  Tacos, they taste like Baja's.  Good eats, real good.  Clean place, staff friendly.  Two nights in a row, we went."

"Car wash was top-notch. Interior shone like new. Windows spotless, floors tidy. Girl who took order, though. Attitude, rolled eyes. Fast talker. Got under my skin. Guys who detailed cars, friendly and helpful."

"Great spot for a big crew. Rented a two-bedroom villa here a couple weeks back for a buddy's birthday. Place is tucked behind the MGM, near Hooters. Room was huge, kitchen fully stocked. Two full bathrooms, extra pillows and blankets. Sleeps six, but could fit ten easy. Price was right, and it was dead quiet. Continental breakfast was top-notch. Lots of options, something for everyone. Solid choice if you don't mind being off the strip."

"Vegan pizza in Vegas? Hell yeah! 

Wynn's got a secret vegan menu, but you gotta ask for it. It's a damn good list too. I'm eyein' the tofu parmesan sub, but my buddy wants a pie to share. 

We grab a meal deal - side, salad, 12" pizza for 24.95, drinks for 3.75 (thankfully refillable). Not cheap, but a good deal for the Wynn. Pizza's decent too, uses Follow Your Heart instead of Daiya. I like it, good texture and taste. Our veggie pizza's topped with olives, onions, and roasted red peppers. Interesting combo, but not my favorite. Crust could be a bit softer too. Salad's alright, nothing special. Fries are crispy as hell, real good. 

Planning my next trip, definitely coming back here."
"Clean joint, few cars in the lot. Sketchy mall, but this theater's alright. Friendly staff, too."

"Mystery meat, that's what they call it. Fills you up for a couple bucks, but I ain't sure I wanna know what's in it. And them blackjack players, always doubling down when the dealer's got a ten and they got one too. Makes me wanna choke 'em."

"This joint's a real gem. Best breakfast in town, bar none. Don't let the line out the door scare you off - it's worth the wait. I went on a Sunday morning and had a hell of a time getting a table, but the server was friendly as could be. Get the chorizo hash, it's a game-changer. And don't forget to try the sage fried chicken and waffles - it's a real treat. If you're feeling thirsty, go for the Tractor Driver Combo. It's a winner."

"This joint's got a hidden entrance, like a secret speakeasy. Inside, it's got a fireplace, dark lighting, and a nice old bar. Feels a bit too open for a wine bar, but I'm used to smaller bars in LA or NYC. They've got a huge wine list and the bartenders are helpful with recs. It's a mixed crowd, dates, groups of girls, and folks at the bar are all mellow. A nice change from the other bars in Old Town. Definitely adding this to my regular haunts."
"Pittsburgh, always a stop. Few sandwiches, sure. Good, like they say. Service, slow though."

"Airports for drunken revelry? Try these:

1. Narita/Tokyo - Glassy, polite, and a never-ending monorail ride.
2. Chicago O'Hare - Neon tunnel, perfect for a Dark Side of the Moon soundtrack.
3. McCarran - Las Vegas, where 12 hours of debauchery are inevitable. Slot machines and lizards make great companions.

Quarter deposited, cherry picked. Lemon? Damn. Time to board."

"Two-piece chicken special for 99 cents at Popeyes? Hell yeah, that's a good deal. Don't get me wrong, I ain't no fan of fast food, but every now and then, it hits the spot. And let me tell you, Popeyes delivers. Consistent chicken, decent service. Can't complain about that. Throw in some biscuits, and you've got yourself a damn good meal."

"Good grub, noble cause. Feel good eatin' here. 

Love King's Kitchen's concept. Non-profit, give profits to feed folks. Tasty food, too. 

Had a group interview in Uptown, lookin' for a close lunch spot. Cold, rainy day, we're on foot. Someone suggests Jimmy John's, but I ain't walkin' far. Lucky for us, King's Kitchen's nearby. Check out the menu, everyone's happy. Order the chicken salad croissant, comes with a side. Get a mixed greens salad with balsamic. Sandwich is great, side salad's good, too. Fresh ingredients. Fair prices, $9-13 for lunch. Service is attentive, polite folks. Wanna come back for dinner."

"Brunch on the patio with good company. Eggs, great. Pastries, divine. Bacon, satisfactory. Jelly with mini donuts, amazing. But, they shouldn't call 'em beignets. Donuts, that's what they were. Misnamed, my expectations were off. Fluffier pastry, that's what I expected. Bellinis, awesome. Coffee, too small."
"Tacos, good and simple. Small, cheap, order a few. Horchata, good, homemade. Beans, plain. Not the best, but I'd return."

"This joint's the real deal for a downtown chill vibe, no argument. You got your artisanal brews, your classic Schlitz, and a roast beef sandwich that's straight fire. If you're feeling fancy, they got AZ wines too. But listen up, fellas, if you wanna keep your voice and impress the ladies, sit outside. And don't forget about the mixed nuts and olives, they're plenty generous with 'em. Word."

"Fries here are top-notch. Perfect size, shape, crispiness. All Mandalay Bay restaurants seem to serve 'em. Hard to recall what else I had, they stole the show. Cute spot for a quick bite, but not your typical Vegas fancy joint. Get the fries."
"Fans needed for lunch spot. Hot as hell in Tempe. Music's great though. Service was meh during the rush. But damn, those burgers!"

"Reserve a table. Consistently good grub. Sesame chicken, mongolian beef, and fried rice are my go-tos. Don't forget to try the bananas for dessert. Watch out for the bar tab, it adds up quick. $9 margaritas, but worth it."

"Went here for my third time. Great spot, especially when you're in the area and need a bite to eat. Today, I got both specials - swordfish and lamb. Both were awesome. Always order the specials at a tapa place. They won't disappoint. FYI, if you want the happy hour deal, you gotta sit at the bar. A bit silly, but that's how it goes. Menu's smaller, but hey, it's a way to save a few bucks."
"Manager made us feel right at home, like we were family. Staff was real friendly too. This joint's got potential, could be a top spot for grub in no time."

"Good eatery run by solid Vietnamese family. Fresh grub, quick service. Been around since 2011. Traditional Viet dishes and some East Asian faves. Prices fair, portions generous. My Tom Xao Ca Ri, $12.50, loaded with fresh veggies, big shrimp. House specials include Banh Tom Ho Tay, $13, and Ca Kho To, $10. Curries pack heat. Canh Chua, $8, homemade broth, daily. Chef's got principles. Hates MSG, watery stock. Says cooks drown flavor in oil. Petite Tonkinoise's only issue? Decor's lackluster. Zen kitsch mini banquet hall vibe."

"Went to Puck's, last minute, for dinner with the fam. Bright semi-open space, nice small bar area. Only had to wait 10 minutes on a Friday night around 9PM. Staff was attentive. 

Food was good. Had the grilled ribeye steak, probably the priciest entree at $40. Cooked perfect, medium rare, with a tasty reduction sauce. Nice stem of mushrooms and blackened green chiles. A good opening meal in Vegas. Nothing too fancy, but good eat's. 

Tried the tiramisu dessert. Really good. Had chocolate beads in the creamy layer, added a nice crunch. Even though it's mainly pasta/pizza & seafood, safely recommend the ribeye here. Enjoy the eats."

"Chicken and waffles, authentic as hell. LoLo's, that's where I found 'em. Waffles, outta sight, man. Chicken, damn near perfect. Me and the boys, we just ate, didn't say a word. Clean joint, friendly service. You gotta try it. I'll be back, for sure."

"Went to North Lake Mall last night with the fam. Ordered at the counter, food came quick. Busy spot, but service was good. Had the half-chicken plate, wife had pulled pork. Kids got pork sandwich and chicken fingers, grilled not fried. Everyone enjoyed their meals, portions were decent. BBQ sauce came in three flavors, sweet tea was good too. Gave it four stars, place was better than most, staff was friendly and helpful. We'll be back."
"Tacos for me, cheeseburger for him, corn dogs for the kiddos. My tacos, damn good."

"Fries and hash browns not as good as they used to be. Can't get a straight answer on the change. Place still great, atmosphere still top-notch. Indoor and patio dining, grand opening, service improving. Must-try in PV/Scottsdale. San tan hefe, still love it."

"Big portions, good grub. Not authentic, but who cares? Udon noodles are thick, broth is tasty. Add chili oil for a kick. Clean joint, worth the few extra bucks over fast food. Get extra bowls or a to-go container, you'll need 'em."

"Fourth visit to the shop, Bob's cutting my hair. Standard price is $15, but he wants more because my hair's thick. Says it's extra work, wants $25. Never had a barber complain before. Would've walked out, but couldn't leave mid-haircut. Will explore other options. UPDATE: Complained to Ernie, the owner. He apologized, offered free haircut next time. Came back, asked for him, and result was good. Repeat visits over two years, would recommend avoiding Bob."

"Stayed here after a delayed flight. They gave our room away but upgraded us to a better one with a sick view of the strip. Pools were dope, especially the wave pool. Daylight was lit but expensive. Good eats around the casino, but the bars inside were pricey. Would stay again."
"Sweet treats, good eats. Cakes, ice cream, truffles - all top-notch. Red Velvet, my fave. Clean bathrooms, mirrors galore. But, too sweet for me. A couple bites, that's it."

"This joint's got some serious game. Food's always on point, salsa's got a nice kick, and the service is top-notch. Family spot, you know? Chicken fajitas, man. Can't go wrong. And they hook you up with some free soup. Classy move."

"Wings here are top-notch, no question. Big, juicy, crispy. Don't overdo it with the batter, just right. Sauces are solid, not too sweet or spicy. Service is prompt, friendly. Paper towels and wet naps on the table, nice touch. Boneless wings? Hell yeah, huge. This place knows how to do wings right."

"Quaker Steak, six atomic wings. Spicy, but not impossible. Sign a waiver, for show. HabaÃ±eros, no issue. Pro-tip: ask for gloves. No sauce, no pain. More wings: Louisiana Lickers, Arizona Ranch, Golden Garlic. Meaty, flavorful. Overpriced? Maybe. But worth it."

"This joint's alright. Used to come here all the time, but haven't been in a bit. Stopped by last couple weeks, had a late lunch. People who run the place, real nice. That ensalada drink, refreshing as hell in this heat. Usually get the veg papusa, fried plantain. Hubby had the chicken soup, loved it. Then he got the chicken special, loved that too. Glad we came back."

"LALALA ramen pass, last use, awesome, two week LA ramen, Vegas. Smokey, sultry, wood fired bbq char, pork, bold, distinct, subtleties, ramen broth. Waitress, hovered, good time, enjoyed, followed us out. Ramen Misoya Tomi, different, traditional, meticulous, recipes, ingredients, non-traditional, unfamiliar. Decor, improvement, posters, benefits miso, ambiance, perfunctory, fun, not too crowded, groups, big groups, tiny places, packed. Recommend."
"Food's a mite salty, but service is top-notch. If you're lookin' for somethin' special, Stratta's worth a shot. Try the tata beef appetizer, it's a real treat."

"Songbird, it's my jam. Work's just a stone's throw away, so I swing by often. Their pastries? Heavenly. Get the brioche cinnamon roll, you won't regret it. Coffee's top-notch too. Not sure what they're doing differently, but it shows. Seating's limited and prices are steep, but it's worth it for the quality."
"Had the lamb kubideh. Good price, seven ninety-nine. Rice, bread, both good. Make bread there. Tastes great. Ended with baklava. Give it a shot."

"SanTan, good beer, good grub. Not many veggie options, but what do you expect? Fish tacos, meh. Veggie burger, standard. Pretzel, now we're talking. Their apps and beer, that's the ticket. Heard their burgers are solid, can't confirm. Local joint, worth a visit."

"Found this joint a few months back, treatin' myself to a mani/pedi. Great deal, thirty bucks. Pedicure comes with a hot stone massage, warm lotion, and a killer leg rub. Been here a few times, never needed an appointment. They always take me in, get me settled in a massage chair, and start workin' their magic. 

One time, my boyfriend asked for paraffin on his hands. Girl brings out two plastic bags with warm wax, tells him to slip 'em on like gloves. Looked a bit dodgy, but damn, his skin came out smooth as silk. 

Headin' back this Friday, preppin' for sandal weather."

"Villa Deli, a joint I've known and loved for years. Went for lunch today, and they've got some changes. New ownership, and now they're slingin' pizza too. Sandwiches still top-notch, but the service ain't quite the same. Used to be, the old owner'd come out, chat with the regulars, make ya feel welcome. Now, it's just take your order, thanks, and that's it. Shame, really. But hey, the grub's still good. Keep it up, and maybe try engaghin' with the customers a bit more. That's the ticket."
"Food was top-notch, service even better. Waiter was a real pro, knew his stuff. My wife's birthday, July 4th, they brought out this incredible dessert, sparkler candle and all. Highly recommend."

"We stumbled upon this joint by chance and dug it. Lookin' for a spot to dance, some dude outside Caesar's handed us passes for free entry before midnight. We snatched 'em up and hit the casino. Another fella near Pure gave us the same deal, said to hop in the shorter guest list line. We were groovin' inside five minutes after steppin' into the hotel. \n\nPure's a sweet rooftop club with a view of the strip. I boogied for hours, eyes fixed on the Eiffel Tower. Can't gripe about that, can ya? The DJ spun some killer tracks; wish I could recall his name 'cause I enjoyed most of his jams. Drinks cost a pretty penny, but that's Vegas for ya."
"Good joint. Pizza, little oil slick, but flavorful. Salad, solid. Three squares, no problem. They brought grub to our digs too. Worth it when you're beat and need a quick bite."

"Springs Cafe, third time's the charm. Location and view, four stars easy. Food? Solid three and a half. Good eatin', nothin' fancy. Burgers, wraps, pizzas, specials. View's the real star. Definitely worth a visit, especially on a nice day. Sit outside, soak it up."

"Shadyside's got a new gem. Love the vast beer selection, sizable menu, and endless mimosas and Bloodies for brunch. Had the chicken 'n' waffles today - perfect blend of Southern diner and gourmet gravy, topped with bacon maple syrup. Live just 'round the corner, eager to return."

"Sushi sleeper in Henderson. Met a coworker for lunch. Lunch specials, cooked options, sushi. First time, lunch special's a good deal. $12.50, 6 pieces sushi or sashimi, 1 roll, miso soup, salad. Opted for sushi, tried the rice. Simple, beautiful plate, generous cuts, nigiri, roll. Maguro, nama sake, hamachi, spicy yellowtail roll. Surprised, quality decent, rice good. Green iced tea, large glass, quick server. In and out in under 35 minutes. Quiet inside, cherry blossom painted back wall. Nice ambiance. Good lunch spot."

"Food's great here. Vegan joint that's good enough to make non-veg heads happy too. Everything's loaded with flavor and the prices are damn reasonable. You can fill up for under ten bucks easy. Just don't go on a Friday night, it gets busy as hell. My girl didn't even get her drink until after the meal, took 'em twenty minutes to deliver."

"Pizza craving got you down in Vegas? This joint's the real deal. Sure, it's a hike from the strip or Summerlin, but worth every mile. Not giving it five stars, though - nothing compares to genuine NY pizza. Still, grab a slice and enjoy. And hey, if you're feeling reckless, hit up the ice cream shop next door (can't recall the name). Their creamy stuff is top-notch. Just be sure to bring your appetite."
"Clean joint. Comfy seats, friendly staff. This Subway's how it should be done. I'll be back."

"This joint's got that real dive bar vibe goin' on. Cheap drinks, cool bartenders, and all sorts of folks. You got your regulars, your workin' stiffs, your wannabe anonymous types, and them stoners. And let me tell ya, the ladies get treated like royalty 'round these parts. Just don't mind the occasional creepy cousin tryin' to plant one on ya. You can chill with a cold one or get plastered, either way you'll fit right in. Worth checkin' out, especially after gettin' booted from Santisi Brothers. Just don't forget about the single ladies' room, but hey, at least the line's usually short and it ain't always reekin' of piss and sex."

"Patio's sweet. Had lunch inside though. Chips, guac to start. Blackened mahi spinach salad for me. Big ass piece of fish on a bed of spinach. Couldn't finish it. Happy hour deals look good. Be back."

"Small BBQ joints need their own customer service rules. They operate at their own pace, forget orders, and treat customers like guests in their home, not a restaurant. Memphis has this vibe. We arrived right at opening, causing "speedbumps." They were still counting change, putting chairs down, and food wasn't ready yet. But, the good news is, the place is delicious. I had mouthwatering beef ribs with a beautiful pink ring, indicating they'd been smoked to perfection. The coleslaw was unique and tasty, with a sweet and sour flavor from the mustard-based dressing. My husband had the pulled pork, but it wasn't as great as my ribs. He didn't love the sugary BBQ sauce with a peppery kick. Oh well, he should've gotten the ribs. Next time you're in Buckeye, stop by and give it a try."

"Good things come in small packages, like this Vegas casino built in 1906. Classy, simple, and clean, it's got old-style slots and dealers dressed as flappers at night. We joined Club 1906, played joker poker, and scored free room offers. Check it out for a downtown staycation or a drink and some craps. It's a fun spot."

"Buffet, you say? My wallet's been crying, my gut's been grumbling. Weekend with the boys, you ask? Golden Corral, here we come. Food's alright, service is meh, but who cares? It's a damn buffet. Pay peanuts, eat like a king. Steak, chicken, rice, ice cream, what's not to love? Stuffed, satisfied, and still wanting more. Golden Corral, you've got my heart and my appetite."

"This joint's got game. Their selection's top-notch, especially the red velvet. None of that flavor-switching nonsense like at MoJo or Yogurtology. Their new features, bananalicious and hawaiin, are straight fire. Only gripe's they don't got juice poppers. What's up with that? Everyone loves 'em."

"Went for brunch, ordered from grilled cheese menu. Wake and bake, cheddar, egg, maple bacon, maple mayo - amazing. Boyfriend had blarney stoner, open-faced, mashed potatoes, beer cheese, stout gravy, fries, hash - potatoes on bread, not grilled, but yummy. Grilled cheeses come with tomato soup, fries. Fries thick, almost breaded, soft in middle, few different flavors, old bay - can't go wrong. Tomato soup interesting, thick, not bad, served purpose of dipping. Service great, quick, efficient, no complaints. Beer list amazing, will be back."

"The Diamond Pizza, just left of Atria's on the Roberto Clemente Bridge side of PNC Park. Good pizza, great cheese. Enter the park there too, no lines. Friendly ticket taker and bag search, program and promo items. Order by the slice, grab a beer, watch the game on the TVs. Restrooms nearby. Busy spot, no-frills service. They make good food for the money."
"Ross store, gift shopping, turned into self-serving. Love the place, but dangerous for my wallet."
"Steak and lobster, served with veggies and a damn big baked potato. Friendly joint, old-school vibes."

"Holly's review hits the mark. Second time doing this gig, first time was a bike ride, total mess. Not running, just walking the 5K. Always got my beard, no issues there. Park in the north lot, quick exit on Sunset. Don't like the growing number of dogs, at least they kept their business at home. Good entertainment, Jabbawockeez, dancers from Fantasy, flying Santas, makes it a fun event. Walking over the freeway on Sunset, not something you do every day. Main fundraiser for Opportunity Village, a worthy cause in Southern Nevada. I'll be back next year, suit and all."

"NYC transplant, great spot.  Pricey, trendy, menu's a bit tricky with a big group.  Our waiter was top-notch, made sure we were well taken care of.  Joint was jumpin', lots of energy, beautiful people.  If you're with a group, ask for help with the menu.  Couples, you're good to go.  Plenty to try, could eat here 100 times and never get bored."

"Tucked away, forgotten. Friends drove me here, didn't notice how we got there. Inside, funky, dark, small, copper countertops. Character, yeah? Pork enchiladas, shared sautÃ©ed garlic dish. Yummy, wanted more. Garlic must've seeped into my skin, smelled for days. Worth it, check it out."

"Went there a few months back. Damn glad I did. Their tacos are killer, especially the spicy meat one. Went back a few weeks later for a burrito, and it hit the spot. Better than that overrated Chipotle joint. My only gripe is they should tell you what the hell their meat is. Most of it's unfamiliar, and they could use some more soda options or tea. But overall, a great, cheap spot for tasty tacos, burritos, and street corn. Open late too."
"Carne adovada, I love it. But sometimes, too much fat. Hate that. Best chipotle ranch though."
"Chai latte, best in town. Chocolate twist, quiche lorraine, both light, delicious. Ciabatta boule, moist, good."
"Good grub, great service. One of our go-to spots for a bite. Sesame tofu, top-notch. Best I've had."
"Teriyaki Chicken rice bowl? More like a sad, soggy mess. Frozen meal, heated up. Not worth a star. Stickin' with the good stuff - 5-star wraps and salads. Leavin' the 2.5-star bowls for the birds."

"Terrific show. Lead actor killed it. Cozy venue. Wished Angel had more stage time, but enjoyed her in a new role. \n\nP.S. Absinthe's a nice touch, though not quite like the real deal abroad. Appreciate the effort."

"Went back a second time, and they've changed how they make the Wellington. Now it only comes one way - can't order it medium well or any other way. Funny, after my initial review. Still very good, though."

"Jennifer C's review hits the mark. I had a similar experience. Being from Pittsburgh, taking a 'tour' felt strange at first, but it was a fresh way to see the city. \n\nThe only gripe I got is that it was more Segway, less tour. Riding the Segway was a blast (especially when they let us loose) but the tour itself was lacking. The guide shared some tidbits here and there, but I expected more."
"Eat big, or don't eat at all. Gigantic portions, guaranteed food coma. Fries? Top-notch."

"Hosts in restaurants, lately? Zero personality, poor first impressions. But hey, let's talk food and service. Carol, great. Makes up for the podium guards' lackluster vibe. Tomato capresi appetizer, excellent! Classic with a twist - fresh red onion, balsamic reduction, basil. Could be a main course, but I lack self-control. Pasta Franco, very good too. Olives, artichoke hearts, sun-dried tomatoes, a tad salty towards the end, but expected. Would order again. Carol, attentive, not pushy. Ask for her."
"Coffee's good. Soup, sandwiches, smoothies too. Service needs work, but worth a visit."
"Tasty grub, quick service. Thai tacos and mac 'n cheese, a real treat. Burgers done right too. Not gourmet, but good eats all the same."

"Place was hoppin', Monday night or not. Malbec flowed like water, olives marinated to perfection. Sausage and mushroom pizza, just the right size. Decor? Top-notch. Not exactly easy to find, but worth the search. Local spot, hidden in a strip mall behind the tire shop. Check it out, Arden."

"We've only tried the lunch buffet here. That's what this review's based on. \n\n We've been coming here pretty regularly. They keep the buffet stocked, so there's usually plenty of everything. My favorites are the eight treasures and the chicken curry. Bottom line: solid grub for a fair price without any wait."

"Dickey's saved my Thanksgiving. My brother and I decided to do Thanksgiving with friends last minute. No turkeys at Hash House a Go Go. WTF? Same at Mimi's Cafe, Lucilles, and Famous Daves. Double WTF. Needed Thanksgiving to-go, stat. Dickey's had two turkey options for $49.99 - Cajun Fried or Smoked. Course they were sold out of the fried, but had one smoked left. Called dibs! Pick-up was easy - zipped in and out in five minutes. Closed on Thanksgiving, so picked up the day before. Ready-to-heat, oven-safe aluminum pan. Two hours to eat-time. Perfect - my friend just moved to Vegas, minimal bake/cookware. Needed low maintenance. Dickey's delivered. Pretty tasty too. A little worried the smoked wouldn't deliver the flavor, but it was delicious. Not the best, but damn good. Love cooking, but it was nice to skip the large bird and focus on Settlers of Catan and Wii Tennis."

"Walked into the joint, tired from the day's work. Menu was different, couldn't find what we wanted. Waiter still took our order, though. Ended up with a makeshift surf and turf - filet mignon, lobster tail, mashed potatoes, and a sad excuse for a salad. Salad was a mess, just a bunch of wilted lettuce dumped in a bowl. Lobster was overcooked, tough as shoe leather. But the filet and potatoes, they were top-notch. I'm a meat and potatoes man, through and through. Atmosphere was still nice, despite the mediocre grub. Maybe it was the late hour, who knows? Been there before, food was better. Give 'em another shot, sure."
"Sweet joint for ice cream, old-fashioned style. Load up on toppings, make it your way. Fun spot, good service, and the scoops? Top-notch. I'll be back next spring, you can bet your ass on that."

"This joint's not half bad. For a chain, the grub's pretty damn good. Their tacos are loaded with homemade-tasting stew meat. And don't even get me started on the burritos - they're the size of a small child. Staff's friendly too. They'll hook you up with a free cookie or scoop of ice cream for dessert. Not bad for a quick, cheap Mexican fix."
"Wait wasn't long. TV's on, news or sports. Brought my own readin' material. Techs were top-notch. Office staff friendly, bit scattered. Try their best for patients."

"Good eatery, this one. Been there thrice, never had a bad meal. Garlic crab, top-notch. Salt and pepper calamari, tasty, but watch out for the seasoning. Atmosphere's swell, live jazz playing in the background. Great spot for a romantic evening or meeting up with pals. Not the best for kiddos. Parking? No clue, always take a taxi."

"Ravioli, six pieces, covered in rich Alfredo sauce. Breadstick, warm and soft. Filling, perfect portion. Best Alfredo sauce I've had, not watery, full of flavor. Pizza, too pricey. Going back for more pasta."

"NoDa Brewing Co., born from the inspiration of Dogfish Head and Founders.  

Hop, Drop 'n Roll, sharp and citrusy, a true IPA.  Woody & Wilcox, earthy, gentle.  Coco Loco, bold, subtle, a campfire classic.  Other brews, strong, confident, holding their own. 

Taproom, simple, tables, bar, diverse crowd, beer enthusiasts.  NoDa, a work in progress, beer yet to impress.  Return, yes, try Coco Loco, avoid smoking area."

"Naked Pizza, my new fave. Finally, something fresh in this tired town. Anticipation built, I pulled in on a Friday night, snagging a prime parking spot. No seating, just takeout/delivery? No worries, if it's tasty. Ordered a 10\" Superbiotic and 10\" BBQ chicken, both on original crust. Busy bees buzzed in the lobby, warming oven full of pies. Waited 7 minutes, happy with the service. Home, the crust blew me away. Superbiotic, as good as any $19 wood-fired pie. Crust, delish. Not a big pizza fan, but ate every bite. Back Sunday and Wednesday. Welcome, Naked Pizza!"
"Went there twice since opening. First visit, few mistakes on order, but fixed quick. Good grub, fair price. Clean joint, fun vibe. Compare to Baja Fresh, Wahoos wins on value."

"Saturday night, six of us hit up this joint. Table was ready, nice touch. Old spot, loads of character. Busy as hell, staff looked slammed. Took a while to get bread, even longer for apps. Waiter disappeared for long stretches, tough to order more drinks or food. Service was meh, but the grub? Top-notch. Fresh, delicious, some of the best Italian I've had. Gnocchi? Outta this world. Would go back, hoping for better service next time."

"Taco heaven found. Sampled chicken, asada, pork street tacos. Pork, sweet and smoky. Asada, well-seasoned, smoky. Chicken, flavorful but not as much. Husband shared Bombero burrito. Mexican barbecue sauce? Yes! Dining experience worth 30-minute drive. Would sample entire menu. Thanks, Bill B."

"My sis and I hit up this joint after seein' an ad with celebs like Rachel Bilson and Paris Hilton. It was touted as a hot spot for gourmet "college food," so we figured it'd be good. We ordered the mini Kobe burgers, buffalo chicken wings, and some fries that came in a cute little container. The grub was solid, but the prices were a bit steep. Still, it's a trendy spot in the Bellagio, and I'd recommend tryin' the steak, since it's supposed to be one of the best in Vegas."

"Saturday mornin', we hit up this joint in Ahwatukee for brekkie, third day in a row. Place was bustlin' but the hostess hooked us up with seats at the bar. We waited for a table, sippin' coffee, chattyin' with the locals. Chiliquilas, man, they were better than expected. El Jefe, just like they said, no disappointment there. Huevos rancheros, that's what I ordered, came with a killer pancake on the side. Ranchero salsa, damn good too. Service, solid. Busy place, tickets took a bit longer, but hey, that's Saturday mornin' for ya."

"I'm a Penn Brewery devotee, a true beer aficionado. But alas, I can't indulge during work hours. Tragic, I know. Still, I had to come here for lunch, even if it meant abstaining from my beloved brews. And let me tell you, the Braumeister Steak Sandwich and fries were top-notch. Service and ambiance? Spot on. Make time for a visit. It's worth it."

"Good grub. Sipped brews and snacked at the bar with a mate. They got some top-notch IPAs. Not a fan of squid usually, but their stewed calamari was damn fine. Also had a caprese that hit the spot. It's a chill joint, not the best for watchin' a game, but perfect for a romantic evening."

"Went to Zinburger with my buddy on a weeknight. Place was hoppin', but we snagged a spot at the bar. Great view of the joint, nice design. Food was pricey, but worth it. Shared a kobe burger, double truffle fries, zucchini fries, and a bottle of vino. Left feelin' good, maybe because of the wine. Definitely comin' back to splurge. This place was top-notch."

"Benihana's where you wanna be when you got cash and a crew. Once or twice a year's enough. My Iowa pals come visit, we got time and money to burn. Friendly folks, love the cook-in-front-of-you vibe. Fire tricks can be a bit much, but hey. Not a sushi joint, so skip that. Hibachi's the way to go. If you're a kid, get the kiddie meal. I'm 30-something, my little ones are too wild for fancy places. But their fried rice? Top-notch."

"I checked out this boarding joint and I gotta say, it's not half bad. I left my little terrier there for a night and everything was A-okay. Sure, it's a bit pricey, but the place is huge and the dogs get to run around all day. That's worth a few extra bucks in my book. They got different sized play areas for different sized dogs and the staff was real friendly. I'd definitely use 'em again. It ain't perfect, but it's getting there."
"Atmosphere top-notch. Grub, delish. Service, spot on. If in Belmont, stop by. Had a burger, fantastic."

"Tucked away in the MGM Grand, this joint's a gem.  Food's top-notch, especially the pork belly sandwich and caesar salad.  The pizza's good too, but could be crispier.  Still, it's a great spot for a break from the slots."

"Tortillas made this joint. Went at 12:30, got grub and a table quick. Had the bean and cheese burrito with guac on the side. Fresh and excelente, but the tortillas, man...homemade and off the chain. Menu's limited, but prices are right. Cute little spot, too. Dug it even more when I found out America was the owner, not some corny name."

"Tough times, indeed. Can't fill a Cirque du Soleil stadium on a Saturday night? That's rough. Went last minute, kid wanted to see it again. Enjoyed it, prime front center seats. Noticed new things second time around."
"Waverley Train Station's got limited grub options. Sandwiches, saladsâ€”that's about it. And don't expect much after dark. Shelves empty, staff scarce. It's a tight squeeze in there."

"Bam, another contender in the commercial center district, vying for best Thai grub in Vegas. Didn't know much about Komol, but now I do. Had a mid-day craving for something spicy, and this place delivered. First off, fresh spring rolls, not greasy like others. Then, pad kee mow with tofu, spicy level 3 'cause I'm still a rookie. Tofu was surprisingly tasty, but I wasn't sharing it. Lastly, Panang curry with chicken, finally some meat. Level 3 again, but I'll work my way up. Sorry, seasoned Thai foodies, my palate can't handle too much heat yet. But hey, great meal, and I'll be back to update this review."

"Been here twice. First time, 4/20/13. Place was jumpin'. Line to get to the rooftop, packed like sardines. Dancin' was tough, too many people. Second time, 1/10/14. Still busy, but managed to grab a beer and hit the dance floor. Drinks ain't cheap, $17 for a beer and cosmo. Bartenders knew their stuff, though. No problems either time. Good vibes, we'll be back."

"I've been here twice now. Like the way they work together, efficient as hell. Get the job done quick, too. Just had my car painted, so I didn't want 'em to use the high-pressure hoses. They were cool about it, used the regular one instead. Even offered to bundle and save me some cash when I asked for a detail on the inside."

"We stumbled upon this joint while explorin' our new city. Best find so far. \n\nWalked in for a late dinner, got seated quick and easy. Service was top-notch. Ordered some garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, and chicken vidaloo. Food came out fast, and it was freakin' delicious! Tikka masala was smooth, fresh. Beau got his vidaloo spicy, just right. Been back at least 8 times, always leave full and happy. (ITIS!)"

"Food's top-notch. Don't let the cramped space or usual suspects deter you. I'm not a fan of the joint itself, but the grub's worth braving the crowd. Chefs are top-notch, prices are fair. If I need a taste of Scottsdale without the hassle, this is my spot. Would give it five stars, but the ambiance's not ideal."

"Pimpin' ain't easy, but this joint's got you covered. Consignment and new gear, all top-notch. Vargas girl ties? Hundred bucks a pop. Everything else? Eighty-five, every damn thing. Lady behind the counter didn't even look up from her phone. Didn't offer no help neither."

"This joint's got some real nice trinkets. Colorful too. Furniture, sculptures, fabrics, bobbing turtles - they got 'em all. Picked up some decorative tiles for a buck apiece. Unique, cheap gifts. Good spot for an Arizona-themed present."

"Saturday mornin', 9:30 sharp. Seated right away. Service good. Enjoyed my Brunch Des Cantons. Beans cooked just right, pork variety nice. Fiancee liked her Brunch Sucre, but not too impressed. Coffee and OJ, solid. All in all, pleasant."

"September '07. Twice. What the hell?

Allergic reaction, viral something. Throat closed up, couldn't breathe. Nearly passed out.

Nurses? Top-notch. Private room? Bangin'.

Told 'em about my hidden veins, they listened. Butterfly needle, perfect.

Beau, parents, daughter visited. All pleased with my digs.

If somethin' else happens, Meriter's my hospital. Thanks."
"Panera, same in Madison. Quality grub, friendly folk. Busy joint, but they keep things movin'."

"Burgers were decent. Server, Dominic, was top-notch. Joint's clean, friendly, and good for families. Can't recall much about the grub, except for the endless fries. Burger I had was a tad dry. Might come back, but won't order that again. Place gets a second chance, though."

"First time I had Burrito Boyz, it was at a meetin' where the grub was catered. No clue where that mystery burrito came from. My first thought? Best damn burrito I ever had. Brain: 'Holy shit, they got avocado in here too.' What else can I say? They cram everythin' you could want - and stuff you didn't know you wanted - into that bad boy. Been to the Toronto spot a few times, food's still top-notch. But service, quality, and price? Not so much. Don't matter though, you came for the burrito."

"Hubby and I hit this joint on a Saturday night, sushi was fresh and drinks were stiff. Place was jumpin', DJ spinning tunes, but not too loud. Good spot for people watchin'. Our waitress was a peach, knew her stuff too. We'll be back."

"Went here for lunch with the missus. Nice spot. They give you a discount if you bike or walk. Check in on foursquare, use your Amex, get five bucks off. 

 Had a good time. I got the trout, she got the happy hour fish and chips. Food was top-notch. Only gripe was feeling a bit rushed. But the grub and drinks were great. Fish and chips were fresh, crispy. Trout came with green beans and peanuts. Got mash as a side, too. Fish was seasoned just right, green beans nice and crunchy. 

 All in all, a swell joint. Be back."
"Wine snob? No worries, they got you covered. Lobster, crab legs - can't go wrong. Custom dessert? You bet. Sit outside, enjoy the view. That's the ticket."

"Toast, a prime spot for a weekend breakfast. Efficient service, teamwork among staff, prices reasonable. Food exceeds expectations, especially eggs, coffee, corn bread, fruit. A great spot for young families, fast service, moderate prices. Grandparents will appreciate the tunes. If the food doesn't meet your lofty standards, try The Gallery, Cafe Monte, or Zebras, but be prepared to pay double Toast's prices. For me, Toast strikes the perfect balance between quality and cost."
"Surprised by the joint's offerings. Thought it was just another deli, but they got a menu that'll please anyone. Stopped in for a quick bite, but I'll be back for a real meal."

"Rum Jungle, the place to be for hip-hop and R&B fans. Great grub, strong drinks, and a lively atmosphere. I went there twice, first time in '05, had the fire pit, $50, but worth every penny. Little did I know, the joint turns into a club after hours. My crew and I kept the party going, no need to hit up another spot. Last November, I went back, and it still delivered. Same vibe, same genres, same strong drinks. Prices were Vegas-style, but I must've been generous to the bartender, got Bay Area prices for two straight nights, same bartender. Verdict? Top-notch joint, don't bother with other clubs in Vegas, stick with Rum Jungle."
"Good prices, big portions. Almost didn't finish my grub. Been here twice, once for brekkie, once for dinner. Both times, I was satisfied. Friendly staff, quick service. I'll be back."

"Don't judge a book by its cover. We passed by this joint dozens of times, thinking it was just another dive in a strip mall. But boy, were we wrong. Last night, we wanted some good Wisconsin grub, something different. So, I checked out reviews and decided to give this place a shot. My family was hesitant, but once we walked in, they were impressed. The joint was big, well-laid out, and the decor wasn't half bad either. And the food? Top-notch. The only gripe I had was the fish fry. It took forever to come and no one asked if I wanted more. But hey, they were packed, so I'll give 'em a break. Can't wait to go back."
"Worth the wait, my friend. Texas-style BBQ, like Franklin's in Austin. Avoid the crowd at 11, come at 1:30 for a shorter line."

"Fremont Street's where it's at, friend. More laid back, less flashy than the Strip. Historical sites, street performers, and tech, all mixed together. It's got a bit of grit, but that's part of the charm. Took public transit there, cheap but slow. Cabbing it back was the way to go. \n\nDug the vibes of the joints, bars, and eats. Affordable, not too fancy, but comfy. Like stepping back in time, you know? Everyone's chill, it's Vegas, after all. Restaurants and bars, some swanky spots, but cheaper and with character. That video screen's a real showstopper, too."

"Clean joint. Fair prices for quality grub. Simple menu, no frills. Cheesesteaks and fries, done right. Thick cheese on the fries, so be warned. Might be too rich for some. Solid spot, we'll be back."

"Love the furniture joint. Went in search of coffee table, large ottoman. Pricey, sure, but each piece unique. Not too busy, sales folk didn't swarm like vultures. Didn't even say hi, so knocked off a star. Didn't need help, just browsed. Plenty of options for any room. Looked like they had a design center. Didn't find the perfect fit today, but not a loss."

"Met an Aussie mate at the diner, decided to do the whole American thing. Fun times, good eatin'. Friendly staff, laughed with 'em, like we were old pals. Food was top-notch, loved the chilli cheese fries - hard to find that good stuff across the pond. Had the Chicken Philly cheese steak, damn good, cooked just right, served quick. Good prices, too. Efficient service, friendly folks. I'd go back for lunch, no doubt."

A wee Irish pub, all cozy like, with wooden panels inside. Great spot to spend a lazy arvo or chow down on some hearty grub with mates. Perfect pitstop after a museum visit up north. Pints poured just right, drinks cheap 'n good. Food's top-notch, especially the beef, marinated in Guinness (bloody excellent, mate). Give the boxty's a go if ye're feelin' daring. Oh, 'n if ye're lookin' for the joint, it's on Monterey street, near the YMCA.

"Cheese curds, best of my life. Beer cheese soup, too. If you're a cheese fiend, sprint to this joint. 

Notes:
-Big portions, so pace yourself. 
-Curds, glorious curds. 
-Gluten-free bread, three options. 
-Dirt cheap prices. Four people, full bellies, under 70 bucks. 
-Cheese curds, did I mention them?"

"Been here twice now, both times after gambling. Decent spot, affordable. Portions are huge, couldn't finish my salmon. Beignets, better than Disney's. Recommend it if you don't want fancy. Server messed up the bill, barely checked on us. Sunday night, not too busy."

"Coffee, good stuff. Student brings me two cups, Creme Brulee and Sugar N Spice. Spread the love, he says. Give one to co-worker, they like it. Don't live nearby, but support local. Tasty coffee, twist and all. One day, drop by."

"Love this joint. Found it by chance, but been back plenty since. Hubby never tried nothing like it before, but he took them up on their V-Day deal for couples. Now he's hooked, just like me. Feel like a million bucks after our sessions. Thirty bucks an hour, ain't bad neither. They got some talented hands here. Back in Yakima, we didn't have squat like this."

"Been meaning to hit up this joint for a bit. Finally got the chance with some coworkers in Phoenix. Whipped out my GPS, Chino Bandino popped up. Told the crew, they were down. Busy at lunchtime, but some dude came over, asked if he could help. We said we were newbies, he hooked us up with samples - Jade Chicken, Carnitas, black beans, fried rice. All good. Ordered up, stuffed ourselves silly. Snickerdoodle came in clutch for a late-day snack. Good times, will return."

"Viv B., a swell joint with a sophisticated yet youthful vibe. Their jewelry, art pieces, and scents are top-notch, and though their clothing selection is limited, it's carefully chosen. The owner, a sweet gal, named the shop after her grandma, whose portrait watches over the place like a stylish guardian angel."

New patient. Arrived 545, waited 'til 6. Room right away, 20-minute wait for the vet. Told her the issue, she took her back for a full exam. Cost $42 (chihuahua, size varies). Clipped her nails ($10, horrible parent, very long). Needed more done (x-rays, blood tests, two meds). Bill $700, no diagnosis. Pain and barely using left front paw/leg. Sent home with pain meds and anti-inflammatory. Back a month later, same thing. Nice doctors, staff seemed rushed, not concerned. Good overall, back a few times a month for nail clipping.
"Good times here. Grub's on point, service is snappy. Catch a flick then swing by."
"Cinema's not bad. First time here. Restrooms, clean. Theatre, good size. Snacks, decent selection. Be back."

"This joint serves up some damn good grub, no question. But let's talk turkey - them prices are steep, friend. Take the appetizers, for instance. Flavorful, sure, but $14? That's a pretty penny. Now, I ain't one to scrimp on a good ribeye, but the Spackle? That's a mighty fine cut, but I ain't sure it's worth the price tag. Cooked it just right, though. Maybe a bit too well done, but that's just my two cents. Desserts? Solid, but over $20? You could do better elsewhere. If you're gonna shell out that kinda dough, might as well head on over to Harvest Moon Grille. Better food, better value. And it's practically next door to the Blumenthal, so you can't use location as an excuse."

"Pho Kim Long, heard good things, checked it out. Not disappointed. Big place, seated quickly, attentive staff. Menu, impressive, not just pho, apps, entrees, smoothies, more. #11 Rare Steak and Brisket Pho, Chinese Doughnuts too. Doughnuts plain, used peanut sauce, good fix. Fast service, apps good, pho stole show. Steak, brisket, tender, delicious. Noodles plenty, broth rich. Going back."

"Airport's a dump, but that's Vegas for you. Security's a breeze, nothing special. People complain, but what's the point? Just grab your gear and move on. It's not worth sweating in the grand scheme."

"Twice now, excellent service. Great convention hotel, spacious area. Luxurious room, relaxing after long days. Can't comment on price, but thanks to employer. Definitely do it again, love the Venice theme. Like casino and restaurants. Perfect spot on the Strip."
"Solid joint. Killer cocktails, tequila's my poison. Nueva Latina bites, duck empenadas a highlight. Upscale vibes, attentive bartenders. Fun spot."

"Best buffet I've been to. Period. Lamb, prime rib - cooked damn near perfect. Their sliders? Amazing. Ramen, decent. Crab legs, too. Variety? Through the roof. All hits, no misses. Not a buffet guy, but this place's an exception."
"Good workout at the gym during lunch. Hate the teeny bopper crap they play in the men's locker room, though."

"Cheap Chinese joint on Harris. Price is tight. Lunch special's a steal ($5-6, includes egg roll). Tea's a bit off, so I stick to water. Chicken's real, sauces ain't too salty, and veggies are plentiful. Don't expect authentic Cantonese or Szechuan. It's Americanized Chinese, but it's worth four stars for the price."

"Cool joint. Not big, but good vibes. Places to sit: high tops, bar stools, plush chairs, couches. Solid drinks. Great beer selection, like most Madison spots. Heard good things 'bout the grub, especially sandos and wraps. Lookin' forward to tryin' it out."

"First timer here. Loved it. $9 lunch, worth it. Downsides? Long wait, crowded walkways, kids running wild. But hey, that's part of the buffet vibe. Chocolate fountain, cotton candy, sweet tooth paradise. Variety of grub, nothing fancy, nothing nasty. Give it a shot."

"Good grub up north! Fried chicken, damn fine. Generous serving for two. Catfish, decent, but skimpy. Burgers, meh. Why call it Hamburger Hut when the patties are average? Ha! Convenience store with a restaurant vibe. Busy joint, popular fried chicken. Limited parking, only seven spots."

"Eat'n Park, a joint I know well. Lived blocks away, back when Wilkie's Inn was still kickin'. Memories of drunken brawls, but that's another story. This place, it's the real deal. Scrambled eggs, french toast, burgers, pickles - the works. And don't forget them smiley face cookies. Can't get enough. If you're new to Pittsburgh, make sure to stop by. You won't regret it."

"Great hotel, theme park on the roof. Loved it. Family-friendly, amenities galore. Not five-star, but nice. Topless pool up top (when I was there). Water volleyball in the pool, sweet. Amusement park rides on the roof, free for guests. Location is prime, close to the Strip."

"Clean joint. Good for fam and buddies. Pizza's decent, not top-shelf but better than most bar grub. Thin crust, ground beef, tasty. Games galore - pool, shuffleboard, TVs. Focaccias are my jam too. Weekends are prime time for sports."

I took an iPad 2 from work to get fixed here. They fixed it in six hours, no problem. Needed a new glass, cost me $129 plus tax. Happy with the service, they give a 90-day warranty. Wish they were a bit more professional, but they got the job done. Shop's on Mill Ave, easy parking and drop-off.

"Jasmine Tokyo, give it a shot. Big guy, 6'4\", folks think I play for the Cards. Owners probably sh*t themselves when I walk in. Not a glutton, just there for the seafood, sushi, and green tea. Sushi selection beats anything AYCE in the Valley. Twenty types of rolls, real tuna, salmon, snapper nigiri. Fried rice, Chinese sausages, grilled chicken - all delicious. Raw oysters, never had 'em this good in AZ. Service, pleasant. Decor, Claim Jumper vibes. Huge restaurant, huge selection, veggie paradise."

"Bouchon. Never been, despite the hype. Location's a bitch, but who needs a compass in a casino? By the registration lobby, up the elevators. Simple. Small wait for brunch, menu's similar to breakfast, few additions. Chicken and waffles, glorious. Bacon-infused waffles, roasted chicken, can't be beat. Must-try. French toast, meh. Ambiance, dated decor, cramped tables. Single old men, coughing, cringeworthy. Still, highly recommended, especially for chicken and waffles."

"Coffee here's top-notch. Had their red velvet latte today and it's in a league of its own. Employees are friendly and the joint's got a cozy feel. Only gripe's the price, but it's worth it. No high chairs, but that's minor. I'll be back."

"Breakfast at Tableau, top-notch affair. Efficient service, attentive staff. Sat by the window, nice view. Liked the purse chair, cute touch. Had the duck hash, eggs, pancakes looked good too. Classy, elegant, but still casual. That's Tableau."

"Stayed at NY NY in Vegas. Hotel's a mini-city. Big casino, plenty of tables and slots. Food's a plus - cheap eats or high-end dining. Stayed on the 32nd floor of the Century Tower. Best view in Vegas - strip and mountains, lit up at night. Room was spacious, comfy for three guys. A bit dated, but clean and functional. Separate sink room, nice touch. High-end shower, plenty of hot water. Impressed with my stay, would recommend."
"Cheba Hut, never a bad meal. Food's great, subs toasted, yum. Must-try in Mesa."

"First off, my girl and I hit this joint in Vegas. I'm dressed down, the only one in the place who ain't tryin' to impress nobody. But the hostess gives me the stink-eye like I'm some kinda scrub. C'mon, lady, you work in Vegas, you know the drill. Rich dudes and their sugar babies, that's the name of the game. Anyways, the place is poppin', real classy, upscale joint. Food's top-notch, especially the salmon sashimi. Damn, that shit's good. Two days later, I'm still thinkin' about it. New standard for salmon, fo sho. Lobster's pretty sweet too. Prices are steep, but hey, you gotta pay to play, right? Minus the snooty hostess, this place gets five stars from me."

"Cafe grub's good, real good. Eight bucks gets you a blueplate special, comes with soup and salad bar too. Salad bar's top-notch, even got fresh fruit for dessert. Don't expect fancy, just a damn good value. Staff's friendly too. They got dessert specials every month for two bucks."

"Food was top-notch, but service was a bit wonky. You don't order from the sushi chef, you gotta go through the waitress. We got three rolls and some sushi, you'd think the sushi would come first? Nah, they brought out all the rolls and forgot about the sushi till we reminded 'em. But hey, their fish was fresh and didn't taste fishy, so that's a plus. Will be back, and their AYCE deal is a steal with plenty of options."

"Free? Hell yeah, that's the way to do it. Got into one of them LMFAO nights and it was top-notch. Ended our Vegas trip with a bang. Each room's got its own vibe, specially the library. Not too cramped, not too loud. XS still my favorite, but damn, these club designers know how to bring the heat. All about creativity and throwin' a killer party."

"Boardwalk Billy's for seafood. Steampot, extra shrimp, huge meal with potatoes and corn. Clam chowder, wonderful. Thursdays, trivia and two-dollar drinks. Galleria location, prompt and friendly service. Burgers, awful. Stick with seafood and wings, no disappointment."
"Good grub, nice folks. Been comin' here a bit. Prices went up some, but still worth it for the curry."

"We stumbled on this joint by chance. Hungry, we spotted the sign - Chicago Gyros. Family-run, small place. Ordered the usual - Gyro, fries. Damn good. Overstuffed with meat, just how I like it. Fries? Standard fare, hot and crispy. Don't give a damn about fries, but these were decent. Owner, probably his kid too, real friendly, helpful. Food came quick, perfect temp. Like supporting local spots. This one's a keeper."
"Lettuce with spring rolls, plenty of it. Service sharp, attentive. No trouble getting a server's eye. Good experience overall. First pho in Vegas, not bad. Broth could be better, but not bad."

"Place used to be a Starbucks, now it's a bakery. Strange hours, closed some days, open noon others. Called before going, despite Yelp saying otherwise. Went in on niece's birthday, saw stuffed cookies, and was sold. Oreos, cheesecake, snickers, butterscotch inside. Cake pops too, unique flavors like Nerds Rainbow, orange cream, cheesecake, red velvet. Caramel and candy apples, big chocolate-dipped marshmallows. Good service, fair prices. Only issue, odd schedule. Looking forward to going back."

"This joint's part of a chain, but don't let that turn you off. It's got some top-notch grub and brews. I had the flammekuchen with Gruyere and smoked meat, and my missus went for the veggie option. Both were damn good. Next time, I tried the meat dish with ham, pork knuckle, sausage, and a killer sauerkraut. We watched the Habs game at the bar after our meal. All in all, it's worth checking out, especially for the beer."
"Monday nights, five-dollar burgers with a three-dollar beer. Good eatin', good drinkin'. No fuss, no muss."

"My taste buds ain't exactly refined when it comes to Indian grub. My tongue's too used to the bland, and the spices leave me feeling like I've been set ablaze. But I decided to toughen up and give it another shot. Went with the Kashmiri curry, and a cold one to wash it down. And damn if I didn't enjoy it. Each flavor stood out, instead of getting lost in the heat. Not bad, not bad at all. I'll be back for more."
"Sashimi, good. Rolls, plenty. Spice, yes. Tuna, salmon, combo. Room left, HD TV big. Distraction, porcelain cats, Japanese decor."

"Aaron, you got some top-notch customer service skills, my man. Same goes for that brunette bartender. You two are a force to be reckoned with. Now, about those nachos - they were a real challenge, but I'll be damned if I didn't enjoy 'em. Made some new pals too - Greg and Mariam from Cali, and Mark from NM. Give 'em a shoutout when you can. Keep up the good work, and I'll make sure to swing by again soon."

"Yummo! Authentic Cuban sandwiches and pastries, fantastic breakfast. Omelet, tasty, filling, and budget-friendly. Ironbeer and Materva, exciting. Great pastries for the ride home. Not Portos, no crazy lines. Pastries, just as good."

"Lived here three years, still call it home. Noise, parking issues? Sure. Rent's steep, too. But damn, it's beautiful. Inspiring, really. Met some good folks here, expanded my network. Gave it four stars 'cause it's not perfect, but it's close. If you're lookin' for a place, start here. Year minimum, that's my advice. Can't wait for the new village, Sonoran Village. Similar setup, other side of the mall."
"Went to a meetin' at Caesars in May. Been there plenty, but never stayed at the hotel. They put us up in the Octavius Tower. Nice digs. Big rooms, comfy beds, clean bathrooms, great views."

"Solid burger joint. Had the half-pound JalapeÃ±o Jack with onion rings. Meat was top-notch, spices on point, and cheese was flavorful. Rings were great too. Filling portion, left me full. Only gripe was the price, $11 and change for a no-frills spot. Didn't even get a drink. Minor complaint, still a solid recommendation."

"Reminds me of Pompeii, back in Chicago. Ordered carry-out, like old times. Wonder if she thought of it too. Got the salami, turkey, ham, and mozzarella panini. Red wine vinaigrette, real good. Fresh ingredients, well-packaged. Prices, average by Chi standards. Don't mind trying more."
"Burgers, built your way. Fries, served crazy-style. Hot, fresh, cooked to order."
"Been here a couple times. Not as good as Canadian clubs, but better than the rest in the valley."

"Thin noodles, woked chicken & shrimp, scallions, egg, cabbage, Thai spice. Squeeze a lemon, I'm in heaven. One order feeds three, but we get two. Honey chicken, yummy appetizers, spring and egg rolls. Friendly service, no wait. Good Asian food at a fair price."

"Hyde's got a swanky vibe, perfect for a romantic night out. But watch out for those stunning wait staff, they might just steal your attention. Calamari's top-notch, crispy and flavorful. Wine's pricey, but worth it. And don't even get me started on the soda prices, six bucks a pop? Ouch."

"Whoa, this joint's a real behemoth. Don't reckon I've seen all of it yet. Multiple stages, upstairs rooms, you name it. The gals here are a real treat, too. Course, might be 'cause I'm a gal myself. Nah, it's 'cause they're strippers, that's why. Strippers, they're good people, and they smell nice too."

"Aria, two nights. Great hotel, my company paid. Pricey, but worth it. Pool drinks? Expensive. Chocolates and turn-down service? Didn't happen. Bath products? Lower end. Restaurants? Good, especially the Thai place. Casino? Nice, not too smoky. Servers? Quick. Pool? Nice, adult-oriented. Shade and umbrellas? Would've been nice. All in all, great stay."

"New hotel on the strip, modern theme. Pros: chill, classy, relaxing resort. Clean pool, rooms, hallways. Rooms have electric mini-stove, fridge, microwave, dinner table, soft bed. Friendly staff. Cons: not the place for a wild 21st birthday celebration with girls."

"Food-wise, it's a 2.5, maybe 3 stars. But the place itself and the coffee make up for the fourth star. Let's start with the grub. If you haven't had real Spanish food before, you'll be happy. Otherwise, you'll be let down. The olives were good, gambas al pil pil too. Paella was decent, but more like a risotto. Saffron and chorizo saved it. Tortilla was just okay, a bit burnt and dry. Wine selection? Limited. Mostly non-Spanish. What's up with that? They had one Rivera del Duero and one Rioja. Come on, it's a Spanish joint! Now, the coffee. Cold brew and kopi luwak, both solid. Coffee stuff, worth the trip. If you're caffeine-sensitive, watch out. Didn't check for "cafe bombon", a Spanish staple. I'll be back to check that out, and for good coffee!"

"Richardson's, a place that makes me feel warm inside. Been there a few times, always a good time. Atmosphere's great, like a hidden gem in the city. Food's unique, gotta try the green chile potato. I go for the fish or seafood specials, they got a standard menu and specials on chalkboards. Last time I had the blackened scallops, a little salty but cooked just right. Served with rice, beans, and a spicy sauce. Salads are great, and most entrees come with a starter salad. Went with a group, had wine and a plain pizza to share. None of us had room for dessert! It gets crowded, but that's part of the fun. Make a reservation if you can, or sit at the bar or by the fireplace. Can't complain with a drink in hand and the fire going. I'll be back soon, Richardson's!"

"Tucked away in a strip mall, this joint's easy to miss. Went with Elite Emily, and we were the only ones there. Orders were huge, fresh, and damn tasty. Had to ask for a box. Looking forward to trying something else next time."

"Boy don't usually dig museums, but this one was different. Lot of old-timey sex toys, crazy stuff. Videos, movies, demos. Sexual intensity all over the place. Bondage, pics, and a deep look at how sex has evolved. Damn interesting. Would go back. Staff's cool, too."

"Sunday afternoon, no reservation needed. This joint's the cat's pajamas. 

Terrific smells, swell decor, and top-notch service. Mentioned I was vegan, chef showed me what was good to go and what could be tweaked. Who knew oyster sauce was in everything? 

Give it a shot. Can't wait to come back for that green curry and tofu... mmm."

"Visited a couple times, loved it each visit. Last time was with fam and friends, everyone left satisfied. Great cocktails, unique menu. Happy hour, half-price steaks, filets a bit undercooked but mostly spot on. Truffle mac and cheese, Farmer flatbread pizza, bacon, spinach, cracked egg - delish. Desserts, pizooki, homemade doughnuts - to die for. Great food, solid drinks, unique atmosphere. Away from the strip, a gem."
"Patio's grand, perfect for shootin' the breeze with pals. Inside's tidy, service is snappy. Pastries? Mouthwaterin'."

It was a sweltering spring day in Chinatown and I was famished. I'd had enough of my usual Thai food and was eager to try something new. I stumbled upon HSP on Yelp and couldn't believe my eyes - had this place just opened? I made my way to the end of the Chinatown Plaza extension on Wynn Rd and Spring Mountain, where I found a small shop with a variety of poke bowls. The woman working there told me they'd been open for five years, and I felt like a fool for not knowing about it sooner. The quantities of poke were small, but that was a good sign - it meant the fish was fresh. I'm not from Hawaii or an islander, but I could tell the difference between fresh and funky fish. My Shoyu Limu Tuna bowl was delicious, with no trace of funk and only fresh, warm rice sprinkled with black sesame seeds. It was a steal at around $8. I couldn't wait to come back and try more.

"Boys had a blast. Pricey, but worth it for the clean, well-lit atmosphere. WiFi's a bust, grub's mediocre and overpriced. Can't bring your own drinks, but hey, at least they got Pepsi. Games were in good shape."

"Been comin' here since the 80s. Consistent, no frills, good grub, fair price. Service is top-notch. On a cold winter's night, nothin' better than battlin' through the double doors into a warm, invitin' aroma of Indian spices. Watch out for the naan, they only come in feed-the-5,000 size."

"Patio wait time's a bitch. Been here plenty, know they don't take reservations. But a 90-minute wait at 5:30's a bit much. Food's always great though. Get a steak, hubby does skate or short ribs. Service is solid too. If you want the patio, be prepared to wait. People watching's top-notch, but the sensors only work close by in the casino. Worth it in the end."

"Never caught a Cirque de Soleil show before. Nor any Vegas act. But damn, I loved it. Musicians killed it, dancers popped, acrobats took my breath. One hell of a night. And hell yeah, free tix made it sweeter."

"Lobster and shrimp dip, we ordered. Twice, we sent it back. Too cheesy, it was. Chips broke, sauce couldn't handle the weight. Off the bill, they took it. Parmesan chicken and baked potato, we tried instead. Good, it was. Enough for two, it was."
"Good eatery. Unique menu, witty. Food, top-notch. Pierogi sliders, eggplant lasagna, both A-1."

"Good eatery, plenty on the menu. Breakfast too, eggs, taters, that sorta thing. Not sure 'bout the authenticity, but they got good meat. Pastrami, corned beef, can't go wrong. Service top-notch, friendly folks. Popular spot, I'll be back."

"Went on a date night with the missus. Had a swell time. Our instructor, Melissa, was a peppy gal, full of energy. She talked fast, but gave us enough time to paint each step. There was a finished painting to reference. Drinks were average price, five bucks for beer, seven for wine. Last call drinks were half off. Didn't eat there, but people were snackin' on apps throughout the class. Would do it again, and recommend it to anyone lookin' for somethin' fun and different."
"Grave, 7 a.m., Joy. Great server. Saimin, Portuguese sausage, scrambled eggs, rice. Ono after a night out."
"Food, authentic. Spicy, like the name said. Went there twice, happy both times."

"Summerlin's got itself a real pub now, and it's a damn good one. Friendly staff, good grub, and a chill atmosphere. I mean, the chicken sandwich is top-notch, and you can even get it as a wrap if you're feelin' fancy. But let's talk about the bathrooms for a sec. Those sinks are a joke. Who thought a tilted tile would make for a good sink? Not me, that's for sure. And don't even get me started on the house whisky. It's like someone took Triaminic and decided to call it a day. So, bottom line, great spot, but watch out for those sinks and stick to your own booze."

"Been here thrice now, and'll keep comin' back. Best buffet value for locals, and with coupons, a good deal for visitors too. Prime rib's perfect every time, ask for a thicker cut and they're happy to oblige. Crab legs are fresh, and they got several types of shrimp. Somethin' for every seafood lover. Mexican food could use some work, enchiladas been a bit hard, but they got plenty of Asian choices, and the American part's always delicious. And the desserts? Oh yeah, lots of 'em, with plenty of no-sugar-added options for those who need 'em. Servers are professional and personal."
"Family-owned joint, great service. Bagels, top-notch. Breakfast and lunch menus, plenty to choose from. Kitchen's accommodating, too."

"Moved to the other side of town, found a new sushi joint nearby. Service and rolls, top-notch. Happy hour, 4-8 pieces, try a bunch of different ones. Nice spot, loving everything so far. Better than my old spot, I Love Sushi."
Wine and bruschetta, real good. Apple one, best. Live music, nice touch. Outside, needs work. Fire pit, add some life. Great spot, still.
"They take their time with my kids, real good. Got a wait list, too. So call ahead, worth it."
"Pizza impressed me. Mozzarella and provolone blend, not too much provolone. Service top-notch. Been underwhelmed here before, but yesterday they brought their A-game."

"Great spot for a family horseback ride. Setup's easy, paperwork's a breeze. North Scottsdale desert's lookin' good this time of year. Grounds are perfect for a spring ride. Staff's friendly, courteous, and knowledgable. I'd go back in a heartbeat."

"Roller coasters, casinos, hotelsâ€”life's a thrill. Sick as hell, who cares? You're young once. Lines were weird, inefficient. Everyone made a mad dash, 10 minutes before closing. Scary, hilarious ride. Didn't plan my shirt well. Laughed with my girlfriend. Pictures were $15 each, $22 for two. Split it, charged two cards. Employee gave me a look. Be happy, dude."

"Whiskey Dicks may not be in the best spot, but it's still a solid joint. Friendly service, decent beer selection, and fair grub. I ordered a Ranger IPA, not bad for a regular bar. Had the philly cheesesteak with mesquite fries, which were top-notch. Steak could've been more tender, but the veggies were fresh. Overall, not a bad spot for a pint and some eats. I'll be back, especially since it's near my work."

"Eaten here plenty. Used to get delivery at my old gig, then worked just a block away. Hit it up once a week, always the Chicken Pita. Grilled bird, nice flavor. Whole wheat pita, cucumber sauce, hot garlic chili sauce. Perfect. Highly recommend. Eight bucks for a full pita, not bad."

"Place is solid, been here a few times. Staff, A+, friendly and prompt. Vibe, B+, like a Toby Keith's JR. Entertainment, A+, live music is awesome. Bar, A, got everything except Norm. Prices, average. Food, B, pass on the steak, go for burgers and fries. Overall, give this place a SOLID A. Check it out, you'll love the people and atmosphere. We'll be back for sure. Burgers."

"First time here, I came with a seasoned shooter who provided the hardware. Range virgin, I was. Central location, nice setup. Staff, friendly. Two others sought certification, not the paper kind, but the real deal. I needed more practice, so I passed. Tourists swarmed the place, hope they open a local joint. Prices steep, but classes gratis. Monday morning, not too busy, but it picked up. I'll return to hone skills and take the test, but looking for cheaper ammo and targets."
