Watched the barista make my drink, step by step, like a recipe. Ate a few fries before heading back into the mall, before they got soggy. For $7, about 10-12 large waffle fries. Didn't taste much cocoa, just a hint of chili. Drink was worth it, rich and hot, but not too frothy."
"Killed time at Apache, waited for a spot to open. Enchilada plate, red and cheesy, surprised me. Tomato-based sauce, not my thing, but it worked. Six bucks, a steal."

"Coffee was weak, but dad's breakfast special - two eggs, hash browns for 3.95 - was a steal. Korean omelette was flavorful, but won't order that combo again. Cheery owner and chef. Colorful decor. Great morning spot."

"I ain't from 'round here, so when I hit Phoenix, I gotta stop at a Jersey Mike's. They ain't got none of 'em where I live, down in So Cal. Can't wait 'til they open up some more, 'cause their quality's top-notch, way better than that Subway or Quiznos crap."
"Food, worth the dough. Menu, too damn big. Coulda been smaller, like AM/PM deal. Art on walls, nice touch. Burgers, four of 'em, all good. Fries, variety's the spice of life."
"Good eatery. Friendly service, accommodating. Pizza and wings, always solid. One of my joints for a low-key dinner out."

"Friend told me Guy Fieri did a show here, so I figured I'd give it a shot. Rolled in at 6:30 sharp and ordered the enchiladas. Not bad, not bad at all. Expected a bit more, but still, a solid plate."

"McAlp's, across the street from where I worked. Twice a week, minimum. Atmosphere, good. Food, better. Desserts, best. No need for renovations. Classic vibes only. Making me hungry just thinking about it. Need to schedule a downtown meeting, excuse to eat there again."

"Scottsdale for spring training, sought a top-notch steak. Locals pointed me towards Mastro's Ocean Club. Now I understand why. Energy abounds the moment you step in. Bar area bustling, but not too crowded for a drink. Meals - outstanding. Steak? Top three I've had. Recommended, though pricey."

"Wine list? Ridiculous. But that's their shtick. Huge, like a damn phonebook. Organized by price, not variety or region. Serves two restaurants, Cowboy Ciao and Kasmierz. Cowboy Ciao's doing well, location, setting, food's good. Went there with L and my pops and his new wife. Had the K Vintners' highly-rated wine for $200. Better memory with wines than what we ate."

"Driving back from Tempe, I swung by this joint for a bite. Clean digs, friendly folk, and damn good grub. Had their ribeye steak sandwich, a solid 7 bucks, with fries and onion rings. One of the better steak sammies I've had. Onion rings? Not usually my jam, but these were game-changers. Giving 'em four stars for now. Need to try the burger before I can give 'em the full five."

"This joint's the real deal. Heard about it a couple months back, and my wife and I checked it out last Saturday. Then again the next day. Yeah, it's that good. Cozy spot for a cup o' joe and some R&R. Cinnamon roll's top-notch, especially the frosting. Waffle sandwich with Bechamel? One of the best breakfast sammies I've had. Took my wife's cousin Johnny along the second time, and he gave it two thumbs up too. We're makin' it a regular stop, every Saturday or every other. Give it a shot, and don't forget to try the lunch options."

"Steakhouse, good stuff. Salad, veggies, lobster mac, all delish. Service top-notch. Ambiance, music, A+. But steak? Overcooked. Medium rare, my ass. More like medium-well. For real? Payin' premium, expect better. That's a fact."

"Saturday night, Labor Day weekend. Not too busy. Scored a sweet spot in the back, comfy couches. Our waiter, a friendly bloke, gave us the lowdown. Sampled some wine and dessert. A bit steep, but we'll be back. Solid experience."

"Ribs and brisket at this joint? Damn good. Ribs usually ain't my thing, but these fell off the bone, juicy as hell. Brisket had just the right amount of fat, real flavorful. 

They got three BBQ sauces: sweet, smokey, and white thunder. Sweet's your typical BBQ sauce, smokey's my favorite, white thunder's just heat. 

Prices are standard, around $8. Close to work, I'd definitely go back."
"Urban chic, this place. Chai tea latte, top-notch. Breakfast, pricey. Bagels, Sara Lee. Honey-butter, makes up for it."

"Four to five stars, easy. Spicy as hell, but that's what we came for. Fried avocado, oh man. Best thing I've ever tasted. Owner was a sweetheart, too. Friendly, helpful. She knew her stuff. Thursday nights, wine's half off. We took advantage, stayed for hours. Small joint, but packed. Must be the good word from the locals. Summerlin knows a good thing when they see it. Great lighting, too. Don't let the strip mall location fool you. Perfect for a date or girls' night out."
"Smells good. Cheap, too. Sly dig at the recipient's hygiene. Great spot for gifts for menopausal women."

"Best brunch buffet in town. Omelet station, killer eggs, top-notch desserts. Champagne flows like water. My tiny roommate devoured everything in sight. Three hours straight. Food coma ensued. That's how you know it's good."
"Lunch menu, good stuff. Be back next time in Vegas."

"Great spot, got here just before three on a Monday. Only four people ahead of us, but it took around ten minutes to be seated. Don't bother trying to push your luck, the line grows fast as dinner approaches and the smart diners aren't leaving anytime soon. They want to see the dinner selection too. 

A few things disappointed me: eggs benedict was impossible to cut with the provided knife, and when I tried to bite through it, it was rubbery...I love meat, but there were only two options at the carving station (top sirloin and flank steak?)...desserts were cute, but some were off, and none made me want seconds. Had to ask for milk because some desserts were too creamy or sugary (weird, since I've never thought something was too sugary)...left about thirty minutes after dinner started, didn't notice much of a change in what was being served. Dishes were refilled, that's about it. 

Food was good, but I expected to try dishes that I don't usually see and that taste phenomenal. Minus a star for not serving anything I wanted second helpings of."

"Atmosphere and service, top-notch. But let's get down to business. Cocktails, no kick. Two drinks, still sober. Popcorn, good. Albacore tuna, phenomenal. Prime rib, fun presentation. A fun joint, worth another visit."
"Birthday dinner with loved ones. Sushi spread fit for the gods."

"Pizza's good, real good. Tastes better than most delivery joints. Get the 10-incher, it's a solid choice for one person. Staff's friendly, too. They'll chat you up and answer any questions. We'll be back for more."

"EM Cafe, two years old now, packed from the jump. High ceilings, clean walls, local art, big table for groups. Food's simple, but solid - 'cept for the spuds, they've been getting flak lately. Sandos, omelets, French toast, all good. Portions, decent, not massive. Fixed spot in Mile End, rare for Parc Ave."
"Aria or Cosmo? Toss-up. But I know one thing - Aria's got the best poker game in town. That's why I stick with them."

"Food was top-notch. Had the carne asada platter, real good. Friend had some burrito, said it was great. Service was slow, but the guy at the register was friendly. Didn't get our drinks refilled, no one checked on us. Not a big deal. We'll be back."

"I stumbled upon this joint due to its catchy name. It's tucked away in the Noda area, where parking can be a real hassle, but it's got its own private lot, which is a definite plus. They also offer free Wi-Fi, which is always a bonus. 

The place has a cozy vibe, with about ten tiny tables scattered inside and out. They've even got their own roasting machine, which is a big plus for coffee snobs. I'm a fan of strong, sweet coffee, like you'd find in Cuba. But, I made the mistake of ordering a hazelnut cold brew. Don't get me wrong, it's still decent, but I prefer a bit of sugar in my coffee. 

I stopped by to do some research, since we haven't gotten around to installing internet at our place yet. After three hours of sitting there, I decided to try a Chai iced latte and a lemon poppy muffin. The latte was alright, but it didn't blow me away. 

I'll definitely be back, though, for the super friendly staff and to try their Cuban coffee when the weather cools down."

"Had a swell time. Feedback from pals wasn't glowin', but she cleaned up nice. Bottle service did the trick. One CÃ®roc for four gals, we drained it and raised hell. Comfy bench, prime view from up top. Dancin' with pals, props, and dancers made for a wild night. Would do it again."

"Loud joint, but good thing we had a reservation. Service top-notch, food and drinks came quick. No bad seats either. Had the cheeseburger, simple but damn good. Still thinking about it actually. Then had the brownie, felt like I died and went to heaven. Wine list was decent too, some interesting picks. Would definitely go back, solid American grub done right."

"This joint's great. Good eats, cheap. Persian/Middle Eastern grub, casual, fast, and fresh. Lunch with a drink, under 8-9 bucks easy. Kubideh combo, two skewers, ground chicken and lamb, plenty of food. Eight bucks, that's all."
"Coffee shop, inconspicuous, beneath Elizabeth Arden's Red Door Spa. Few pastries, iced coffee, three bucks. Watery, but on a hot day, refreshing. No sugar water, a shame."
"Food's alright, but the service is top-notch. I come here for the game, a couple drinks, and the atmosphere. TVs everywhere, different games on each one. Big screen on the patio, it's a real treat."

"Saturday mornin', still on the road. Laundry time. Real easy access, real clean too. Nice attendant tells me they got fluff 'n' fold for $1.50 a pound. Plenty of machines, wifi, change machine, soap, TVs, A/C, ceiling fans, carts, foldin' tables, seating. And if you're a trucker, this place is on the corner, plenty of bobtail parkin' on the street. I'll be back."

"Love that Cajun barbecue shrimp. Get extra bread, soak up the goodness. Great service, solid drinks, especially before the crowds. Country music, live bands Wednesday through Sunday. And them shrimp, damn."

"I didn't stay here, but I did win a few hundred bucks gambling. Had a good time, but getting drinks took forever. Not gonna let that ruin it for me though. The roller coaster's a blast. Rode it last time, had a hell of a lot of fun. Can't wait to come back and maybe even stay here next time."

"Great concept! Loved the individual portions, fun novelty. Shareable items with a buddy. Highlights: pesto mashed potatoes, prime rib, fried chicken, mushroom risotto, truffled scalloped potatoes. Lowlights: too-salty ramen, subpar sushi, disappointing desserts (rock-hard red velvet cookies). Cool mac and cheese bar, but shareable, rich, and creamy. Save room for king crab legs. Unique items make it interesting, despite fewer options."

"Good eatery. Love their chipotle sausage. Cheese top-notch. Had it on a burger, too. Hushpuppies decent. Moist like conch fritters. Pork, mac, beans all good. Variety of sauces. Signature sauce, vinegar and tomato mix. Brisket, meh. Ribs, fatty and tough. Hope that's a fluke. Support local spots. Friendly staff."

"Husband and I hit up Presto for the first time. Ahi tuna sliders, Greek pide - both solid. Never had pide before, but the non-greasy crust was a welcome change from the usual pizza mess. Service was good, despite some online gripes. Only gripe: pre-made salads kept in a cooler. Wanted the ahi salad, but it sat all day, so passed. Can't say how it tasted, but overall, a good lunch spot."

"The Cosmopolitan, four stars. Didn't stay, but still saw plenty. Casino's a stunner, crystals hangin' like a chandelier. Loved it. Clubs and shops, high-end, outta my league. Sports Book, watched my team win. Better odds than my place. One of the nicest on the Strip."
"North Phoenix, friend's birthday. Mutual pal chose the spot. Authentic joint, Cantonese-speaking staff. Helpful with recs. I'd return if I lived nearby."

We stepped into the bar on Las Vegas Boulevard, dodging the commotion of the strip. My pals and I were eager for a drink and a bite before hitting the cinema at South Point. Aware of the crowded casino, we opted for this spot. My initial visit was uninspiring, but this time proved improved. We settled into a side booth around 10 pm. The staff took their time acknowledging us, but once alerted, they became attentive.

The menu stretched far and wide, a double-edged sword. My first encounter left me unimpressed, particularly with their chili. However, the variety of salads won me over. On Thursdays, they feature BBQ chicken atop cold soba noodles, surrounded by a medley of vegetables. The marinade brought to mind Chinese-style BBQ, albeit saltier than sweeter. The half-portion, priced at 8.95, satisfied my hunger. I aimed for a healthy choice, yet couldn't resist swiping my friend's fries. Thick-cut and golden-brown, they were utter perfection.

An added bonus, the bar played an abundance of 90's alternative tunes. Smashing Pumpkins and Bush transported me back to my youthful days.

"The basement vinyl section here beats the ones back in Milwaukee. Those places are cramped, with records stacked on the floor. I gotta sit on the ground, dig through 'em one by one. This spot's different. Most of the vinyl's in bins, easy to browse. And best of all, it's quiet down here. No crowd, no pressure. I can spend hours going through each album, no worries."

"Moon Doggies, a dive bar that's surprisingly clean, serves up grub that's worth trying. Chris, the owner of Naked City Pizza, told me it's a cool spot, mostly for industry folks. I took my hubs and dad there for lunch, and we skipped the pizza - I mean, when in Rome, right? We went for the buffalo wings instead, and they did not disappoint. They were cooked just how I like 'em, nice and hot. My old man loved his chili cheese hot dog, loaded with all the fixin's. The steak frites sub was a beast of a sandwich, packed with garlicky beef, creamy horseradish, and crispy fries. It came with a side of peppery gravy that hit the spot. Our lunch for three was $25, and we even took some home. I'll definitely be back soon to try the pizza!"

"Saturday afternoon, early, dropped by for lunch. One other table, not many, but new, so understandable. Server, new too, but did well. Ordered Ma Po Tofu, Baked Pork and Rice with Portuguese sauce. Good taste. This place, good for Hong Kong-style western dishes. East side alternative to Spring Mountain Road Chinese restaurants."

"Dish ain't no fancy joint, but it's got its charm. Laid-back, Southern vibes, perfect for a late night bite or nursin' a hangover. Grilled cheese, tomato bisque, deviled eggs - simple, good eatin'. Black bean and rice burrito, my go-to. Jukebox plays some cool tunes too. No frills, just a solid local spot."

"I hit this joint twice in 24 hours during our Vegas trip. Reasonable prices, food's not half bad either. Had the garlic chicken wings, hubby liked 'em, but I thought they could've used a bit more flavor. Crispy garlic was decent, though. Salted fish and chicken fried rice? Hell yeah, that's what I'm talkin' about. Generous portions, too. My pops wasn't feelin' too hot, so I got him some jook - salted pork with thousand year old egg porridge. Not bad, nice balance of saltiness without bein' too watery. Later on, my old man had their curry beef. Can't say for sure how it was, but he cleaned his plate, so that's a good sign. Beef chow fun? Now we're talkin'. Lot of flavor, nice kick from the stove. A few other dishes, but overall, this tiny hole in the wall outside the strip's a solid find. And best part? Won't break the bank."
"Good work, fair price. Took my Audi to Dan, a man I trust. No issues, like usual."

"Went there last night with some pals. Service was top-notch. Our server kept our glasses full and even split the tab for us after we forgot to tell her to. My pizza was damn good. Got a personal pie with artichokes and sliced tomatoes. A bit pricey, but the ingredients were high-quality and I was real pleased with it. Everyone else at the table raved about their grub too. Didn't see a single slice of pizza left at the end of the night. Worth going back for, just wish they had more options on the menu."

"Food's better than your average pub grub. Got some real interesting dishes, like that tomato soup with goat cheese, goat cheese fritters, and butternut squash croquettes. They got a good selection of local beers on tap too. Atmosphere's cozy, just like you'd want from a pub."

"This joint's always bumpin', but not so packed the staff can't take care of you. I've chowed down here a few times and the grub's always been top-notch. Their pasta dishes are where it's at, haven't had a bad one yet. If I'm feelin' frisky, I'll go for the flank steak salad. It's still damn good. And their Italian sodas? Hurricane's my jam. This place is my new go-to for Italian and it's a must-try."

"Great joint near Concordia, good for a fast lunch or a spot to hit the books. They got everything - good eats, drinks, and even poetry readings on the weekends. The panini and soup combo is a steal for a student like me, and the lavender lemonade is top-notch. It's not too sweet, which is nice since most lemonade is watered down. It's a cool spot, laid back, and good for whatever you need - studying, chillin', or just grabbing a bite. Would be great to see them bring back the shisha, though."
"Saturday afternoon, lunchtime. Food came quick. Tasted good. Had Pa-nang curry, pineapple fried rice, Mongolian beef, chicken pad Thai. Spicy, but needed more. Order at 11, maybe you'll get lucky."
"Lunch was good. Service? Not so much. Came here after Qua Spa. Pizza? Amazing. Toppings galore, crispy crust. Server? Unresponsive. Water glasses empty. Meal unchecked."

"Told this was the best buffet in Vegas. Don't see how anywhere else can compete. Snow crab, king crab, steak, prime rib, shrimp. All the usual suspects. A bit pricey, but worth it if you're in Vegas. Crab alone was worth the cost. John Wall chillin' outside? Must be good. Everything was tasty, full of flavor. Going back next time I'm in town."
"Great bar. Friendly bartenders. Good beer. Try the red ale. Memories of Lulu's tuna poke on Maui. BJ's held its own. Nice take on the dish. Avocado egg rolls, too. Not greasy. Good spot for sports."

"Best joint on Mill for grub, hands down. Chicken ceasar salad, phenomenal. Fussy about my ceasar dressing, but this one's spot on, not too fishy. Margarita pizza, great too. Woodfired, so might be a tad dark, but just tell your server to cook it less if that bugs you. Service top-notch, dig the vibe."

"HH, a joint for the cash-strapped, offers a sweet deal on Mondays. Used to be a medium 1-topping pizza for $5.55, but now it's a large for $5.99. Not bad, considering you don't need to buy three pizzas like at other places. The taste? Pretty good. Thin crust, sausage or pepperoni, and a few added toppings. They don't drown the sauce or skimp on cheese, and the pizza's still decent reheated."
"In we came, for dinner. Enjoyed it. Ordered masala, spicy. Not like others, too bland. Here, flavorful, hot. Staff, friendly, attentive. P.S. Love Indian food."

"Southern grub, delicious. Cornbread, damn fine. Ribs, beefy, vinegar-slathered. Mac and cheese, gooey. Collards, tangy. Yams, sweet 'n' savory. Charlotte dinner, satisfying. Prices, decent. Service, good. Parking, tricky. Structures, your best bet."

"Chipotle be damned, I found a new fix. Tortilla soup, enchiladas straight from the oven. Why didn't someone think of this before? Parking's a bitch, but worth it. Snickerdoodles and Mexican wedding cookies too. Arrrgh."

"This small shop suits me just fine. No need for the chaos of that behemoth up in north Scottsdale. I prefer the peace and quiet here. Sure, they don't have everything, but they've got the essentials. And no crowded food court or rowdy bar to contend with. Just a simple, straightforward shopping experience. I stop by after hitting Trader Joe's."
"Chicken's good. Been there a few times, simple menu. Only issue's the chicken, sometimes it's rubbery. But that's on the bird, not the cook."

"Sierra Gold's got a real cozy vibe goin' on. Good grub, too. You can score some solid satisfaction whether you're there for the game, poker, or just hangin' at the bar. Happy hour's every day, 3-7 and 12-4. That's right, half off all drinks and pizza. Now, let's talk food. Thin crust pizza, not my thing, but it's decent. Wings, they got 'em in a bucket, and they're pretty great, especially the garlic parmesan. Curly fries, yep, they got 'em too. And don't even get me started on the Zookie. It's like a warm hug for your taste buds. White chocolate macadamia nut cookie, vanilla ice cream, whipped cream, and chocolate and caramel drizzle. Service ain't bad either, even at midnight. Open 24 hours, this place is a gem."
"Thai Taste, a college haunt of mine. Green curry, my heart's desire. Later, fate took me to Thailand, devouring dishes I once savored here. Thai Taste's renditions? Sublime."

"Hill with a view. Clear days, see for miles. Observatory, columns, unfinished monument. Summer, unobstructed sunshine. Photography, sunrises, sunsets, amazing. Venue for art, performances. Beltane Festival, Winter spring Equinox. New Year's Eve, Hogmany, fireworks. Residents' blessing, not many tourists. Quiet walk, busy City, meters away."

"First dim sum joint for me, Great Wall. Know zip about dim sum, so take my two cents for what they're worth. Food tasted good, atmosphere lively, demo unlike anything in Phoenix. Worth the trip up the highway. Find it in the first shopping plaza east of 35th Ave, just north of Camelback."

"Pizza joints claiming to be the best in the States? Been to a few. This place? Not bad. Motorino in New York City and A16 in San Fran still top my list. But hey, good pie. Cool spot. Friendly service. I'd go back."

"Friday night, me and the boy hit up Tamari. Reservation was for around nine, but we had to wait a few minutes 'cause the place was hoppin'. Hosts were real friendly, though, and got us drinks from the bar while we waited. They've got a good selection of drinks, some interesting cocktails, and decent wine and beer.

Now, the tapas. They've got some real creative combos. I was impressed. Didn't even need to eat much, just wanted to try a couple things. Had the lamb lollipop, real tender and tasty. And the red snapper, man, that was good. Came with mussels in a saffron broth, real different, real yummy.

The boy didn't like the empanadas too much, but he loved the hangar steak. Said it was worth way more than the $2 price tag. They're small servings, sure, but quality makes up for it. Haven't tried the sushi yet, but I'll be back. Oh, and Sam Worthington was there. From Avatar. That's worth an extra half-star, according to the boy."
"Arrive early, seats disappear fast. Love this theater, unique flicks and plush seating. Prices steep, crowds swell, parking a pain on Saturdays."

"This joint's gotta be my fave sports bar. Atmosphere's top-notch, screens galore, and not a bad seat in the house. Plus, they got a sick patio - one of the best in town, easy. Been there twice in the past week for Suns playoff games. Grub's solid, especially for bar food. First night, we shared some wings, potato skins, chicken quesadilla - you know, the usual health nut stuff. Second night, we went for the prime rib, mashed potatoes, and asparagus. Twelve bucks, and it was on point. Finished it off with the skillet cookie - best thing I've ever had, period. Only downside was the waitstaff. Had to work for our drinks a few times. But hey, that's minor. Great spot, and we'll be back."
"Clean, fresh grub. Great addition to any town. Owners on the ball, giving folks what they want: organic, healthy options."

"This joint's got a killer vibe, perfect spot to grab a drink and let loose. We hit up the dance floor hard during a private shindig and had ourselves a real good time. Apps and drinks were top-notch, bartenders kept 'em coming quick. Loungey feel, bumpin' tunes - this place has it all. If you're lookin' for somethin' a little more chill than XS or Tao, give it a shot."
"Villa Antonio's lunch buffet, ten bucks, all you can eat. Baked chicken, roasted veggies, salad, mashed potatoes, cheese ravioli, Italian specialties. Worth every penny."

"Jason's, my usual haunt, delivers. But if you're feeling restless, the salad bar's worth the trek. Small, but well-stocked, it's a solid choice for $7.99. Unlimited trips, mind you. And don't forget the Captain's Wafers - those bring back memories. Skip the patio, though. Vagrants tend to loiter. If you're looking to stay on task, they deliver too ($3). Turkey reuben's my pick. Good stuff, under 550 calories with baked Lays and a pickle."

"Vegas, four days. Level 107, two nights straight. Loved it. Seven of us. Service, top-notch. Food, damn good. Martinis, buy one get one free. Appetizers, half off. Not a martini guy, but caramel and raspberry, hell yeah. Go, you'll have a blast."

"A sunny joint near our digs in Brossard. Ate here a few times during our two-week stay. Fillin' plates, they do. Crepes, waffles, pancakes, omelets, blintzes - got 'em all. Free joe with your grub, too. Keep it topped off, they do."

"Weekday crew doesn't speak much English. But weekends, they got a hostess and some others who show up. Mostly, they speak English good. Didn't have no trouble gettin' what we wanted."

"Don't know 'bout them other bad reviews. Maybe folks up here got higher standards than what I'm used to back home."

"First Watch, a place where healthy meets delicious. Consistently serving up great meals, with service to match. Never had a bad experience, always leaving me wondering why I don't come back more often. Chickichanga, my personal favorite, but everything on the menu is top-notch. Love that I don't feel like I've consumed a ton of grease after eating here. A truly fantastic spot for breakfast."
"Pastries, breads, breakfast, lunch, dinner. Cozy joint with a fireplace, plenty of tables. Cash only, pay up front, they'll bring it out to you. Free refills on joe. Never disappointed."
"Peru, been there a few times. Food's good, real good. Went for lunch, came back for dinner. Owners and staff, they work hard. Make sure you enjoy yourself."

"My kid took us out for our anniversary last month. Decent joint, not bad for Arizona. Used to live in San Fran, so I know my Chinese grub. Pricey, sure, but worth it for the vibe, service, and eats. Still on the hunt for a non-chain spot with some real dim sum."
"Good pho joint. Special combo's solid, but portions vary. Big one day, sad face the next. Only pho game in town, though. Service is top-notch. Hope this helps."

"Chuck Wagon, that's why you hit up Longhorn Casino. Takes up a good chunk of the joint, like it should. Decent grub, fair prices. My go-to's are the breakfast items. Stampede, eggs, bacon, hash browns, toast. But the real draw's the S.O.S. My old man, a retired Marine, gives it the thumbs up. If he don't know good S.O.S., who does?\n\nService is top-notch. Minus a star for the smoke-filled casino and the wait."

"Never again, County Market. Old Time's got what I need. Customer appreciation card, 10% off, $200 purchase. Sausages, good. Special flavors, applewursts, classic bratwursts, mild and spicy italian. Flank steak, good. Bulk italian, worth it. Spaghetti sauce, scratch. Helpful staff, special cuts."

"Fuzzy's Tacos, been there a few times. Good experiences, always. Taco Plate, my go-to. Two tacos, two sides, six forty-nine. Veggie, tempura shrimp, both solid. Chips, salsa, plenty. Burritos, eh, stick with tacos. Hot sauce, sufficient. Waited a while, few times. Suggestion: grab chips first. Good spot for tacos, chips, sports. Give it a shot, buddies."
"Burger joint serves up top-notch grub for a steal. Smash fries and fried pickles, damn good. Friendly service, quick too. In N Out can't compete."

"Wine shop, good one. Went there for a CMYE, though don't drink much wine. Organic, sustainable wines for the eco-conscious. In Atherton Market, plenty of parking, but the Vin Master's hard to find. Tucked away, hidden behind a pizza joint. Thankful for signs and GPS or would've missed it. Shop's bigger inside, exposed brick, high ceilings, pleasant lighting. Couple chairs, tables, folks sipping wine. Nice touch, trying before buying. Owner Chris, super friendly, certified sommelier. Helps you pick the right wine. Check it out, worth it."

"Closed for reno, two weeks now. Pricey? Maybe. But for a Berto's plate, I get a nice seat, good salsa, and some heat. Service is solid too. Problem is, the food's a mixed bag. Great ingredients, but the protein's a letdown. Shame, really. If your pals rave about Macoa's, this place will blow 'em away."

"Love the joint's focus on fresh, local ingredients. Atmosphere and decor? Top-notch. Service? Impeccable. Water glass always full. Goat cheese appetizer? Damn good. Beets added a nice touch. Smokey burger? Flavorful, but a bit messy. Fries? Spot on. Sirloin steak? Decent flavor, but chewy and gristly. S'mores parfait? Delicious. Would definitely return, maybe try the prime rib or fish next time."

"I'll level with you, I didn't have a damn clue what was happening. But it looked pretty cool, like a full-on assault on the senses. Not sure I'd pay to see it again, but it was definitely something."

"This joint's alright. Good lighting, decent grub. Me and the boys come for the pizza deal. Half off after midnight, ain't bad. Thin crust, best I've had. They got games too, pool tables, TVs. Don't know what they're called, but people play 'em. Jukebox, couple songs for a buck. Place is hidden, but worth findin'. Across from Smith's, past 10, they'll buzz you in."

"Newk's never disappoints. Soups top-notch, especially the lobster bisque. Had the Ultimate Lobster today, despite my aversion to shellfish. Fresh caesar salad, crunchy and flavorful. Toppings bar offers roasted garlic, hot peppers, pickles, capers, parmesan cheese, and crispy breadsticks. But let's be real, the real MVPs are the oversized plastic cups. They're perfect for hydration at work, and we've got a stash of 'em in the cupboard. It's the small joys in life, folks."

"Tasty deals at this joint - two for $5 fro-yo or boba. I stick with taro milk tea and pearls. They give you a stamp card, too. Every purchase earns a stamp - waffles, crepes, fro-yo, or boba. Double stamps for the twofer. Waffles are great, but take a bit. Shaved ice is good, too. Regular with fro-yo, three toppings, shaved ice, and condensed milk. Solid spot. Give it a shot."

"Another SinCity burger, please. Delectable. Egg, bacon, cheese. Drool. Smash Fries, good but inconsistent. Salads, not bad. Dressing on the side, necessary. Five stars, almost. Inconsistent fries and drowning salad dressing, sorry, four stars."
"Took CCW course, instructor knew his stuff.  No gripes, made me a better shot.  That's all I need."
"Great bar in Pgh. Wide selection of brews on tap. Daily specials. Delish apps, stacked burgers, yummy wings. Get the sauce for the wings, teriyaki or honey BBQ. Highly recommend."

Chick-fil-a, comfort grub for me. Original chicken sandwich, add honey mustard. Grab another for dipping waffle fries - sometimes skimpy, but still good. \n\nSaw a talented balloon artist, best I've seen. Not there every week, but on some Wednesdays for "kids eat free." Mesmerized while waiting in line, didn't notice the wait or the crowds of kids. Chick-fil-a does family well, kids' meals come with educational toys, promoting literacy.
"Family-run joint. Small, but clean. Good chow. Eat in or take out. Fast delivery. We tried a few things. All good. Leftovers for another meal."
"Steak, bacon, and sweet potato tots with a dash of hot sauce. That's how I started my day. My friend Scott went for the Hawaiian breakfast. We both left satisfied."

"Suicide by soda and sweets? Rocket Fizz's got you covered. Childhood memories abound with odd sodas and candies. Jelly Belly Strawberry Jam soda, grab it while you can. Great prices, plenty of options, and a sweet tooth's paradise. The Fizz, it's a good time."

"Coupon for a free glitter ball in my email, so I took my little man for a free toy. Plenty of glitter balls to choose from. Signing up with the email rewards club is a good idea, they got events for kids, freebies, and great coupons. Took my little guy here when Ozzy Osbourne was signing his new book, it was wild, line around the building. But I cut in front, no one said anything 'cause I had my baby. Met Ozzy, had a blast. Staff was a bit overwhelmed, but they handled it."

"Rest in Peace, Chocolate Swan. You fought hard against the whims of consumers and trends. Your sweet treats brought joy to many, especially the brides who sought you out for their special day. Your legacy lives on in the hearts of those who savored your delights. My condolences to your loved ones."
"La Condesa, it's a real treat. Salsa bar's got some kick, tacos too. Had the shrimp, steak, and mole chicken. All good. Service can be slow, but it's worth it. Check it out if you're nearby."
"Went with pals for all-you-can-eat. Cheap, food good. Seated quick. Server sharp, kept drinks full, brought more meat. Great start to finish."

"I've been hitting up this PetSmart pretty regularly over the past couple weeks. Got a new pup at home, and he needs his fair share of treats, kibble, and toys. Howie's a fan of Blue Buffalo, no surprise there. It's the good stuff, no soy, gluten, or corn, and no meat byproducts. Yeah, it's pricier, but hell, I eat healthy too, so why shouldn't my dog? The toy selection's alright, I guess. People might not wanna shell out for fancy toys, but come on, give a guy some options. And the collars and leashes? Forget about it. I've got a boy dog, and I'm a girl. Some variety would be nice. It's his outfit, after all. He should look sharp every day, coordinated with his coat. The staff's been cool, though. They're dog lovers, and they've given me some handy training tips. But I ain't taking Howie into PetSmart. It's a germ fest in there. You never know what sicknesses other animals might bring in. Not everyone's got their animals vaccinated or takes care of 'em right. It's nice to shop with your furry friend, but they're better off at home."
"Solid joint for a quick bite. Been here a dozen times, still good, but not as impressed this trip to Vegas. Sandwiches are always on point, but skip the salads."

"Good grub, that green chile burger hits the spot. Don't mind ordering a burger from a Mexican joint, it's damn good. They bring sopapillas after your meal, and they're freaking delicious. Service can be slow, but who cares when the food's this good?"

"Went in based on good reviews. Didn't disappoint. Had machaca breakfast with rice, beans, and tortillas. Asked for more tortillas, didn't know there was a charge. Two small flour tortillas for $1.50? Ridiculous. Food was good, but little things like that don't sit well. Free refills or extra salsa, come on guys. Will bring it to their attention next time."

"Service was top-notch, even though it was a busy night. Our waitress hustled her butt off, keeping our glasses full and our plates clean. Props to her for a job well done. 

The menu at this local sports bar had everything - burgers, sandwiches, salads, and more. We went for the Western burger, which was a solid choice. The patty could've used a bit more seasoning, but the BBQ sauce made up for it. Frings on the side were crispy and well-seasoned, too. 

All in all, a great spot to catch a game and grab a decent meal. Good selection, good grub."

"Amore Pizza Discovery! \n\nI was sniffing out some grub in the kitchen and found last night's leftovers from Amore in the fridge. Grabbed a slice of deep dish and chowed down cold, no warming up necessary. Damn thing was tasty, like sitting on your folks' couch kinda good. Don't know how to feel about it, but that pizza was better cold than fresh from the oven. Flavors popped that I didn't notice before. Keep a cold one on deck for when your little bro or bro-in-law swings by."

"Good spot for a bite, doesn't matter if it's a snack, appetizer, or meal. Especially useful when you don't know what else is open on Xmas and you gotta kill time 'fore you get sat at Sam Woo or Dim Sum. 

Pork Buns - decent size for $1.30, straight outta the oven at 11:30. 
Chicken Pot Pies - not worth it unless you're hankerin' for a classic American spin-off. 
Shredded Beef w/ Green Onion Roll - only good 'cause the rolls last all night, perfect for them hangover snacks. (costs more than the pork bun).

Honey, I wanna see your Pork Buns in Vegas, baby Vegas."

"Parking lot, easy peasy. Bar first, Crown Royal, no dice. Un-freakin'-believable. Breadsticks, hot, perfect. Grilled shrimp, clams, great. Angel hair, marinara, meatballs, excellent. Busy, service good. No room for dessert, next time."
"Pizza in Madison, WI. Good stuff. Crust, meh. Toppings, wow. Had it again after five years. Glad I did."
"The joint had space, lots of it. You could dance on the water and not feel cramped. A good time was had by all."
"This spot's my fave for a boa. Staff's friendly, helpful. Gets busy, sure, but that's 'cause all the retailers bank here. Don't mind it, though. When you're done, plenty of grub spots around."
"A decent spot for a casual breakfast. Food was good, but you gotta fetch your own stuff - silverware, condiments, drinks. And no booze, so forget about that Sunday funday vibe."
"Birthday bowl at GG, 7/5. Nice of 'em to extend the offer. Good eatin', veggies cooked right, sauce a bit salty. Sixteen bucks for two, not bad. Thanks, GG."

"Good layout here. Custom baby store, but not just for rich folks. Quality stuff at different prices. Some made me and the missus do a double take, but we're old pros now. Third kid, nine years later, lot's changed. Staff was top-notch, gonna register for some essentials."

"Solid joint. Not Two Sisters Thai or Sala Thai in Phoenix, but still good. Flavors are above average, not exceptional. Go there often since it's close to home. More authentic than trendy Scottsdale spots. One thing, if it's packed, leave. They can't handle a full house."

"Burger joint, great. Went on Memorial Day, place was jumpin' but not too packed. Grabbed two seats at the bar, easy peasy. Wanted a boozy milkshake, but the missus was feelin' frisky, so we went for a cocktail instead. Brown cow float, that's what I got. Light, but still needed a hand from the missus. Damn good, taste the booze, you bet. Love a good root beer float. Burgers, we both got 'em. Steakhouse burger, egg on top, nice touch. Funghi, that's my jam. Cooked just right, generous portion, damn delicious. Truffle flavor, Gruyere melted perfect. Refined mushroom and Swiss burger, yessiree. Fries, just okay. No excuse for subpar fries, but props for includin' 'em in the burger price. Service, good from the bartenders. Shakes and burgers took their sweet time, though. BF said his cocktail was on point. We'll be back, and next time, I'll make sure my fries are crispy."

"Two blocks from my place, I saw the joint prepping for opening day. Stoked, I tell ya. Been there 15 times now, and it's a dream come true - cheap, tasty tacos just a stone's throw away. Pork tacos, sublime. Beef, decent. Chicken, healthy and decent. Carne Asada, meh. Fish taco, not great. But hey, they got organic cabbage and tomatoes, so that's a plus. Flavored lemonades? Fantastic to meh. Three huge tacos for $4.50? Hell yeah, I'm sold. Not authentic, but who cares? It's healthy, cheap, and the owner's a peach. Once a week, easy."

"Le Rive review. Show was like expected. Not what you'd think though. Too much goin' on. Can't take it all in at once. Storyline ain't exactly clear. Clears up in the end though. Synchronized swimmin' with red heels, that was cool. Arena was neat, 360 pool view."

"XS may have stolen Tryst's thunder, but I still dig this joint. Always a good time. Love how the dance floor spills outdoors by the waterfall. Fresh air, you know? Layout's got character, not like those cookie-cutter clubs. Staff's top-notch, way better than TAO. Getting in's a breeze, never a hassle. Drinks come quick, and the bathrooms? Adorable."

"Decent joint for a burger. Not the best I've had, but still tasty and filling. Fresh veggies, plenty of toppings to choose from. Prices are fair. Tip: Jr burger's plenty, no need for the large. Fries, too - small's like a large elsewhere. Clean atmosphere, quick service. Good spot for a burger."

"I hit this spot every two weeks. They got a killer selection of organic veggies, always rotating so you ain't stuck with the same old thing every week. Employees are generally solid, happy to lend a hand. Just watch out for some quirky cashiers. But hey, they mean well. Some folks gripe about long lines, but I ain't never had that problem. Guess I'm just lucky, or maybe it's 'cause I go during the week. Either way, I dig shopping here."

"Tiny bakery, nestled among other shops. Across from big church, near Jeanne Mance Park. Good food, but small space. May have to wait outside if busy. Friendly staff, delicious pastries. Went for croissants, but had to wait. Decided to try almond chocolatine and petit pain brioche instead. Excellent choices. Will return for more."
"Good eatery. Plenty grub options, no wait. Sugar-free cheesecake, a highlight. Worthy indeed."

"Food was good, not great. Atmosphere was stuffy, overdone. Broccoli for ten bucks? Rip-off. Service was top-notch, though. Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Would I go back? Sure, but with lowered expectations."
"Fresh grub, 'cept the meat's frozen. Service is good though. For nine bucks, you get a heapin' bowl of food, rice, soup, noodles, and a drink. Clean joint too."

"Solid Japanese grub, I reckon. Originally from Cali, studied in NYC, had my fair share of good Japanese food. Chaya's up there, no doubt. Best I've had? Nah, not quite. But enjoyable? You bet. 

Prices are a mite steep, if you ask me. Some menu items, I just can't justify the cost. But hey, they can charge what they want, I guess. Good service, though. Friendly folks, attentive, always checking in, offering water refills. 

Want traditional Japanese cuisine in Pittsburgh? Got some cash to burn? Give Chaya a shot."

"Just landed in Phoenix from the Pacific Northwest. Found this joint called Big Heng on Yelp. Food was decent, portions were generous. Had some minor mix-ups, paid a bit extra for stuff that usually comes with the meal - like egg drop soup. Had to ask a few times for mustard and sesame seeds, too. They're usually a given where we're from. Ordered the kung pao chicken and a combo plate (#3). Food came quick, which made me wonder about the freshness. But overall, it was good grub and we'll be back."
"Bibimbop, good. Normal bowl, expected. No hot pot, menu said no dolsot. Kimchi, good too. Server, pleasant. Price, ten bucks. Reasonable. Glad to have bibimbop near me."

"Love this joint! Great sushi, all you can eat for $25. Quality's always been top-notch. Busy as hell, especially during mealtimes. Noise level's a bit high, but that's the price you pay for popularity."

"This joint's got a lively bar scene, downtown Phoenix, near the US Airways Center. Family area's separate, which I liked. Plenty of seats, but it gets packed on game nights. Parking's a pain, especially if you're just there for grub and drinks. I paid ten bucks for parking, oops. Ordered a Long Island Iced Tea, strong and tasty. Hubby got wings, seemed impressed. Fish tacos were solid, cilantro sauce was a bit thick and ranch-like, but the salsa was alright. Friendly bartenders, attentive service. All in all, great spot."

"Tao's my jam for dinner. Food's great, service is A+, and the joint's got style. Salads are a fusion of American and Japanese, and they're so good I could make a meal out of 'em alone. Seabass is top-notch, almost as good as Sushi Samba's skewers. Desserts? Amazing. I've tried 'em all, and they're worth saving room for. And the lounge? Perfect spot for a pre- or post-dinner cocktail."

"Amazing grub, veggie-friendly too. Reminds me of a joint in the Meatpacking District, but cheaper. Never had issues with the crowd, but the service can be slow. If they stepped it up, I'd give it five stars. Great Italian food without the marinara sauce. Worth a visit if you've got time to kill."

"Crab cakes, perfect. Flavorful. Dim lights, candles, romantic. Tables too close. Server, good jokes. Ribeye, big portion, lacking flavor. Average. No dessert, too full. Waiter, anniversary plate, chocolate, Happy Anniversary. Night made."

"XDC event, been here a few times. Only seen one track, but that's not all. Next to it, a lake, big as hell. People drive their water vehicles, do jumps, skiing. Get burnt, sure, but that's part of the fun."

"Good spot for a snack while crossing campus. Wright St., just off the quad. Decent flavor, fresh too. They stopped making my fave, Earl Grey truffles. Bummer, minus a star for teasing me with something I can't have."

We hit up Delights after a night of drinking at the Signature. The grub was solid. I had the Las Vegas Blvd sandwich - skirt steak, fried egg, caramelized onions, and a tasty sauce. It was a damn good sandwich, but the portions were a bit small and it was on the pricier side. I shelled out $12 for it, but it was worth it. No major gripes.

"Doug's Place is top-notch. Five meats, two sides, and a bread for around eight bucks. Ribs, beef ribs, fried chicken, catfish, and perch. Collard greens, black-eyed peas, sweet potatoes, mac and cheese, sautÃ©ed veggies. Corn muffins, hush puppies, or dinner rolls. Sweet potato pie and lemon cake for dessert. Doug cooks in the back, his wife does the rest. Solid grub, no frills. Fried chicken is choice, crispy skin, juicy inside. Mac and cheese, collard greens, too. Pork ribs were lackluster, but better the next day. Ten tables, takeout available. Not busy on a Wednesday night, but still worth it. Doug's trumps Kip's, in my book."
"Food so good it'll make your taste buds dance. Pho, fried rice, rice plates - all winners. Don't take my word for it, try it yourself."
"Rigatoni Bolognese, a dish divine. My go-to order at this joint. A taste of Italy in every bite. Delayed post, but still worth the share."

"Took a gander at Joe's Diner with a master chef and food historian. Been comin' back ever since. Classic American diner vibes, but the grub and joe are top-notch. Sandwiches for a tenner, done just right. Arbuckles Ariosa cowboy coffee, straight up. Waitress was a peach. Real nice spot in the Melrose District."

"Happy and full, I've been here a few times. Drink menu's great, especially the red headed stepchild and stoney bah-loanie. Pure vesper's good too. Food's always on point. Pork belly, nancy with pork belly, charcuterie, pork tostadas, and the TOT of the day are must-trys. Can't see myself having a bad meal here."

"I called, they came out, checked the serial numbers, gave me a real quote. Honest folk, third quote I got, a bit higher but they guaranteed their work for a year. Cooling my place down in a day, middle of summer, called me twice to make sure all was well. Good, honest service."

"Good grub, friendly folk, swell joint. Not the cheapest in the MGM, but worth it. Four of us had drinks, plenty of victuals for $300. Oysters, mate, they're top-notch. Don't bother with clams, they're mediocre at best. Meat selection's limited, but what they got is decent. Rib-eye's the real deal."
"Went to the lunch buffet with friends. First time there. Amazing spread. Tons of veggie options. Loved it."

"This joint's where my old man and I grab drinks, browse books, and play games. Not exactly hip, but it's reliable, open every day, even Sundays when I'm grading papers. Friendly staff, too. They'll order a book for you if they don't have it, and their game selection's pretty decent for a big bookstore. Scored myself a copy of Pandemic there once. Always fun to spot other teachers hanging out."

"Stay here if you don't need frills. Not luxurious, but good experience. Went with friends to Vegas, booked two suites for three nights. Full kitchen, washer/dryer, two bedrooms, living room, flat screen, couch, chairs, dining table. Comfortable, homey feel. Clean, plenty of towels. Nice pool, no glass, solo cups okay. Relaxing, quiet. Would stay again. Only issues: suite wasn't ready, bathroom door had a hole."
"Food and service, top-notch. No frills, just damn good quality. Every dish looked and smelled like a winner. I'll be back for more."

"We caught the late show, unsure what lay ahead. But damn, it was a treat. Variety acts, plenty of 'em. Adult stuff, no kiddies allowed. Seats? Tight fit, like a too-small saddle on a horse. But hell, it's worth it. Good time, that's for sure."

"Wildflower Bread Co., a spot where you can grab a solid sandwich and not feel like you're in a stuffy joint. One of the founders even hit me up after I gave 'em a good review, just to address some minor gripes. That's service. They got a variety of sammies, salads, and pastries, all made with fresh bread. My missus' Caesar salad? Top-notch. This spot's got some perks too - power outlets under the booths, a chill lounge area, and a private room for bigger groups. If you're in the area, give 'em a shot."

"West Elm, love it. Great stuff, bedding, pillows, everything. Big store, but not all designs from the site. Wish they had more. Prices differ from online sales. Friendly staff, helpful. Glad Vegas has West Elm. No Crate and Barrel, sadness. One of the best home decor spots in Vegas."

"Ethiopian grub, love it. First had it in Frisco, courtesy of an uncle's connection. Damn good. Then, a family friend from Ethiopia, introduced me to more. Would eat it daily, no problem. Blue Nile, first Ethiopian joint I tried in Phoenix. Always passed it, till one day, decided to give it a shot. Impressed, it was! Don't recall the names, but had the chicken with mushrooms, lentils, and that spongy bread. Eating with your hands, awesome. Wish I could've tried more dishes at once, but oh well...Cafe Lalibela, holds a special spot. I'll be back, and I recommend giving it a go."

"The Old Fashioned ain't what its name suggests. It's got plenty of life and sits smack in the middle of a college town in Michigan. They serve up good mixed drinks at a fair price, and their grub is top-notch. Now, I know you got your own tastes, but let me tell you, their cheese curds are something special. Best appetizer I've had in any joint, and they come with a bunch of different sauces for dippin' (just be prepared to shell out a bit extra for each). Worth every penny."

"Cool joint. Dig the tree stumps, rough tables, chalkboard menu. Friendly staff, solid coffee. Went for iced latte, but that bacon-chocolate chip cookie...damn. Bacon makes everything better. Can't wait to try their wine."

"Great joint. Atmosphereâ€™s spot on. Lighting, space, and barâ€”top-notch. Bartenders know their stuff. Drinks ainâ€™t your average pour. Anything on the menuâ€™s a treat, but the special was too smoky, like chewinâ€™ on a log. No big deal, though. They took it back and fixed me up with another. 

Had the chacatuire and fried Brussels for apps. Both excellent. Strip steak for my main courseâ€”also great. Only gripeâ€™s the waygu was too fatty and underseasoned. Desserts? Phenomenal. Pecan pie and chocolate mousse. So good we almost got seconds. 

Place never fails to deliver. Karen, our waitress, was ace. My Cincy friend kept sayinâ€™ they ainâ€™t got nothinâ€™ like it back home. Kudos to Meat and Potatoes and the â€˜burgh for bringinâ€™ big-city grub to our town."

"Whole Foods, a decade in NYC. Still, I check out new spots. This one's nice, maybe 'cause it's new. Second-floor outdoor seating, nice. Not NYC prices, though - four salads for $4? Soup's decent, but hot and cold buffet's just okay. Plenty of parking downstairs."

"Bakery discovered through Yelp. Craving almond croissants, we arrived early Saturday afternoon. Unfortunate, they were sold out. Settled for apple pastry and pistachio eclair. Delicious. Eager to return."

"Sandwiches, good. Open 24 hours, convenient. Late night visit, line still long, tables taken. Crispy bread, nice. Recommendation: Original. Horseradish, unexpectedly enjoyable. Returning, updating review."

"Good eatin' at this joint. Grilled steaks, burgers, chicken, all that jazz. Rustic but clean. Prices fair, selection decent. Service top-notch. Off the US 60, take the Idaho exit. Give it a shot, won't regret it. Only downside, snowbirds flock here."
"Labwork, wife busy elsewhere. Empty room, just me. In and out in seven. Now closed, damn it."
"Been meaning to hit this joint before work for weeks. Finally made it last Friday. Their doughnut and coffee deal for a buck fifty? Hell yeah, it's worth it. Pastries too. Stop by if you can."
"Flew with them once, Phoenix to Portland. Enjoyed it. Terminal 2, easy parking, quick security. Would fly again if heading back to the PNW."
"Pasta's my weakness, being Italian. But this joint? Fresh stuff. Sauces, too. Helpful staff. Good for guests."
"Jambalaya, good. GF's fish and pasta, loved it. Bee outside, annoying. Drinks, great. Food, plentiful. Atmosphere, calm."
"Hunan Park. Your go-to spot for Chinese takeout. Quick, reliable, and delicious. General Tsao's chicken, a must-try. Don't forget utensils, or bring your own. Solid choice for dinner."

"Food was top-notch, especially the salmon. Waiter was a character, had a bit of an attitude when we asked questions, but the price was right so I'll give it four stars. First time here and I'm not one for rude service."

"This joint's a gem, off the strip but still top-notch. Renovated with millions, it's a steal for those on a budget. The pool's the real draw - a shark tank with a slide right through the middle. A sight to behold, believe me. Admission's just $20, a bargain compared to the strip's pools. Downside? Air quality ain't the best, but smokers won't mind. Non-smokers might find it a bit bothersome."

"Tea Station's a joint that'll perk you up, late night. Me and the boys hit it up before we paint the town red or after chowin' down. It gets wild 'round 9-11. Real laid back vibe, but the service used to be lackin'. Nowadays, they're on the ball, friendly too. Got all sorts of teas, boba included. Taro milk tea's my poison."
"Food, top-notch for a brew pub. Beer, some of the best I've had. Service, prompt and friendly."

"Great spot for a burger and beer. Good for the whole fam. Solid selection of craft brews. Not the best burgers, but still good. Reminds me of SmashBurger or Big Daddy's. But hey, the beer makes up for it. One of the best casual dining spots in Charlotte."

"Dependable. Consistent. That's what I like about the Cheesecake Factory. Big menu, always good. Not gourmet, but worth the price. Their curbside pickup? Genius. Convenient as hell. They were the first, far as I know. And the cheesecakes? Damn good. Variety, too."

"I'm writing this in December 2016, so by the time you read it, it'll be March 2017. I've tried most of the Strip buffets, and let me tell you, this place delivers. Sure, they've got those tiny pots and baskets for some dishes, but they're cute and you won't need much more than one. The seafood selection is solid, and the bone marrow? Damn good, but don't start with it or you'll be too full for the rest. Desserts? Plenty to choose from, including macarons. Service is top-notch, attentive and friendly. The only downside is the hike to get there, but hey, that means shorter lines. So, grab a plate and get ready for a food coma."

"Tucked away in a corner of the grand canal shops on the Venetian side, this little hole in the wall restaurant is a gem. Family run, authentic Italian, and the wait staff are straight from Italy. They know their stuff, and their recommendations are spot on. I went for the linguine fruti de mare - clams, calamari, and shrimp in a spicy marinara - and it was a winner. My mom opted for linguine in clam sauce, and my aunt went for the swordfish piccata style with steamed veggies. All hits. The garlic knots were a nice touch, and the tiramisu, despite looking too creamy, was a surprise delight. Light, delicate, and a perfect way to cap off a great meal. Glad to hear they're expanding. They deserve it."
"Chicken rice noodle soup, good. Fried egg roll, good too. Husband had chicken curry soup, didn't like it much. Thai coffee, good. Go back, yes."

"Caballero Grill, what a joke. Name's got nothing to do with the grub or atmosphere. Place needs to shut down, like Goodyear needs another pizza joint. But hey, we gave it a shot. Had a damn good burger and fries for six bucks during happy hour. Wife had a couple of their fancy drinks, decent deal at four bucks. Rest of the menu? Meh. Trio dip, overpriced at five bucks, mini chimis, not worth four. Club sandwich sliders, too much bread, not enough flavor. Domestic drafts half off during happy hour, microbrews, twenty percent off. Not bad, but not great either."
"Good grub and attentive service. Cozy joint, not too big. Sat down, and a server came over right away. Will be back to sample more from the menu."

"Took the family and grandkids to Joe's for breakfast. Left without breaking the bank and everyone was pleased. If you like bacon, get five sides of it - you won't want to share. French toast, breakfast burrito, pancakes, and cinnamon buns were all devoured. My son and I had the biscuits and gravy - soft biscuits and perfect gravy. Would go back just for that, and it's only $2.99. More than enough food too."
"Pho, good stuff. Broth's rich, portion's generous. Rolls, done right. Been here a few times, worth the drive. Shared a few dishes with friends, plenty for all. Even let us in late, nice folks."

"Sushi at your own pace, no need to tell the chef what you want. Quality's good to excellent, surprising for a conveyor belt joint. Prices are reasonable. Staff keeps the dishes fresh and cold, no warm or lukewarm sushi here. Selection's average, more rolled sushi than nigiri. Hope they give out ginger and wasabi to all customers. Not a place for power meetings, but good for groups and families in a casual setting."

"Went there for grub and drinks. Place was swell. Pretzels were huge and soft, slathered in butter and cheese. Rich, but good to share. Prices were fair, patio was nice. But the real kicker? Music. They played some great tunes."
"Whole Foods, fresh grub, decent prices. Employees? Rude, lack personality. Cashiers, glum, little chat. Four stars, despite the staff."
"Brunch in Montreal. Worth the wait? Hit it midweek, avoid crowds. Did just that, ran into GSP. Eggs Benny and a UFC legend. Not bad."

"Charlotte's got its own mini Central Park, The Green. It's a peaceful spot, with sculptures and quirky signs. Take the kiddos here after ice cream, let 'em burn off energy. Or stroll with your sweetheart, feelin' the sun. I threw a penny in the fountain, watched the big fish swim. Weddings happen here, but I'd pick somewhere else. I just like walkin' the paths, chillin' out."

"Craving Asian grub, I hit up PF Chang's. Flying solo, I worried they'd ignore me or stick me in some cruddy spot. But the service was top-notch. My food arrived quick and tasted great. Had the lettuce wraps, crab rangoon, and a cup of their hot and sour soup. All three, excellent. Definitely recommend this joint to business folk staying nearby."
"Wi-Fi in my room, fast and strong. Nice work, whoever's handling it."

"Tiny shop in Bellagio, smaller than Aria's. Chocolate fountain, a sight to behold. Confusing line, packed with people. Limited seating. Excited for individual desserts, missed the rose oil detail. Didn't enjoy my raspberry macaroon, but friends loved theirs."

"Food's great here, vegan options galore. Date spot, you bet. Order's been messed up a few times, but staff's on it. They fix it, no fuss. We pay full price, no freebies. Drinks are top-notch too. Always coming back."

"This joint's got some serious mojo. If you're a fan of Mexican grub, you owe it to yourself to give it a shot. Their flour tortilla chicken flautas are top-notch, and the free chips, salsa, and beans they serve up before your meal are a nice touch. They also do a killer Sunday brunch spread, loaded with homemade tortillas and all the Mexican breakfast classics - eggs, ham, chile verde, and of course, bacon. It's a solid spot with live tunes to boot."

"Pike's Place Market, a fan's paradise. Two reasons why: price and variety. Breakfast, $8.95 before 10 am, or brunch, $13.95. Buffet, perfect. Stick with breakfast. Golden Corral, plastic, boxed food, disgusting. Pike's, heavenly goodness. Fresh fruit salad, biscuits and gravy, grits, cheese/potatoe hash, muffins, scones, pastries, eggs, egg benedict, sausage, bacon, blueberry french toast. Crispy, fluffy, moist, all very good. Limitless. Friendly servers, packed by 10:30. South-end location, key. Give them a try."

"Oyster shots, mate! Fresh as can be, straight from the ocean. Bartender's a real character, knows his stuff. Four different kinds, each one unique. Sampled 'em all, chose the best dozen. Seafood special's a bit lackin', but still good. Sit at the bar, get friendly with the bartender, and you'll have a swell time. Fifty bucks well spent."
"Cozy joint, great pastries. Staff's friendly, lots of seats too. But watch out, they give out free samples. You might leave with more than you bargained for."
"Ten minutes, that's all it took. They called my name and it was done. Fastest oil change I've ever had. Cost me $38 and some change, but I got a $5 discount for the ladies' special on Wednesdays."
"Amazing view and ride through the mountains. Recommend it to anyone in the area."

"Restaurant's got a new look, feels bigger than Nix. Bar's been pushed back, more room for mixin' and sittin', vibe's hipper now, leather chairs, red lights. My favorites? Cowbell Chili, Smoked Cornbread, black bean burger, sweet potato croquettes, Dali's fries with garlic aioli, buffalo, Parmesan, fresh herbs. Full review's on the blog, these are the highlights."

"Killer flavors here. Real good. Tacos galore and cheap too. Open late, so that's nice. If you're into real Mexican food and want some interesting meat options, give it a shot. \nOnly thing keeping it from five stars is the line situation. It's a bit of a mess. Just ask someone which line to wait in and you'll be good. A few signs would fix that though. That's all I'm sayin'."

"Years of visits. Happened to pass through today. Stopped in. Should've ordered one sandwich. Split it instead. Enough for both. Saved the other for later. Fried okra? So-so. Zucchini's better. Prices? Fair for what you get. Didn't eat outside. Too damn hot. Brought it home. Pretty good. Be back next time."
"Good grub, good sizes. Service? Meh. Still, I'll be back."

"Eggspectation, tried and true. Kitchen's still got it, service stepped up. Four stars, no question. Menu's changed, puns and quirks gone, but eggs still rule. Missing the old variety, but they've honed in on what they do best. Flavors are solid, brunch game still strong. Worth the hike."

"Went with two girls. Squash blossoms, great. Ambiance, perfect. Pork chop, thick, grilled medium rare. Juicy, flavorful. Quail, showstopper. Highly recommend. Menu's seasonal, will check back. Wine list, AZ-made. Didn't partake this time. Next trip, definitely. Very sensual experience. Yum."

"This mall's the best of the three. No vacancies, gets busy. Great steak joint, too bad it shut down in Springfield. Like the specialty shops here - kitchen, kids', GameStop, departments, pet store, etc."

"In Vegas for a nursing conference, September 18, 2013. On the strip, my friends wanted to eat at the Bellagio. We settled on The Noddle. Food was better than expected. I had shrimp pad thai, very good, much better than expected for a strip Asian restaurant. Friends had soup/noodle dishes, good but beef slightly overcooked. Highly recommend."

"Went to Praying Monk Saturday night with the missus. Dig the joint's vibe, staff's friendly. Belgian beer fan, so their selection's aces. Had a St Bernardus ABT12, wife had Triple Karmilet. 

Food's where it's at. Brussels sprouts, light and fresh, not oily. Soft pretzel, tasty, served with rad mustard butter. 

Burger, flavorful, juicy. Sriracha Aioli, just the right heat. Arugula, always a yes. 

Wife had the Kale salad. Fresh, crunchy. Dressing, spot on. 

Next time, gonna try the Lump crab."
"T-bone steak and eggs, a hidden gem on the menu at one of my go-to spots for cheap eats. Check out the photo."

"This joint gets two thumbs up, despite the worst waiter ever. We had a blast, though. Two locations, side by side, and we mixed up our meetup spot. Classic Vegas. 

Both visits, service was solid, grub was good, and variety was on point. Shame about limited menu options, but we made do. 

Both spots were clean, well-kept, and we got seated quick. That's key in Vegas, especially when you're feeling the night. 

That's all she wrote. It's like Cheesecake Factory, but not necessarily a bad thing."

"Lines stretch long at this joint, worth the wait. Chicken sandwiches, both times, hot peppers, amazing. Other, meh. Coffee, top-notch. Greek salad, fresh, decent quality. Open 24/7 in Planet Hollywood. Food arrives quick, line moves fast."

"Wing Haven, a hidden gem in Charlotte, I found on a Bike!Charlotte Bingo Ride. Started in SouthEnd, we rode through downtown, Noda, Plaza Midwood, and the greenway, ending at Wing Haven. Never heard of it in my 17 years here. Tucked away in a neighborhood street, between Dilworth and Sewlyn. The houses surrounding it must be used to the business, but the 'NO WING HAVEN' parking signs in front of their yards suggest it can draw a crowd. A great spot for bird lovers, outdoor enthusiasts, and those seeking unique places. You can rent the space for small events, and there's plenty for kids to do and see."

"Salt n Pepper Shrimp, fried chicken wings, cocktail shrimp, snow crab legs, raw oysters, greens, and fish. Clams, mussels, crawfish too. Kids love it. Print out the 10% off coupon online. Better than your average Chinese/Asian buffet."
"Lounge/bar review. Loved the vibe and decor - balcony overlooked the casino, colors shifted. Plush leather seats, pricey drinks. Boogie enough to impress, Vegas style."

"Lululemon, my dear. Can't help but think of you as "The One." Charming, well-built (all that yoga and running, must be working hard), polite, attentive, good sense of humor, kind heart... and always taken by the prettier girls! I adore Lululemon's clothes because they last forever, but with the price and limited colors, it's a luxury I allow myself only once a year. It's missing a star, but let's face it, "The One" isn't perfect. Can't help but visit my dear Lulu regularly, hoping for a more durable relationship, living happily ever after."

"Food reviews? Read 'em elsewhere. Service here's top-notch. Yolanda, our server, even emailed to thank us for bein' great guests. Broke a glass with my iPhone, no big deal. Bartender William's a hoot. Now, the grub. Loved the tomato soup, roast chicken, and steak. Portions ain't huge, but quality's outstandin'. All food quibbles'll get ironed out, 'cause the service shows they give a damn. Me, I stick to wild-caught salmon or sustainable stuff. Can't afford the rest. Raw tuna dishes were good, but a bit rich. Ordered four desserts for five of us - all good, except the potato chips with the ice cream. Angelo's got the important things down, the rest'll follow. Thanks."
"Five bucks for the works. They scrubbed her down good, dried her off proper. I'll be back."

"Saks Fifth Avenue, my go-to spot for top-notch service. Friendly folks, always ready to greet and offer a drink. They let you roam free, checking in just enough without being too pushy. Makeup counter, best in the valley, no contest. YSL and Dior, a duo of excellence. They know their stuff and aren't afraid to suggest alternatives. Last visit, they showed me their concealer and even ran to the Nars counter for a better match. Just wish they had a bigger shoe selection, but that's a minor gripe. All in all, a fantastic experience."

"Gyros, I love 'em. Been eatin' 'em since I was a kid in the burbs outside Chicago. Had my first one from Mad Pita Express and it was the best I ever had. Meat's tender, fresh veggies, and that pita bread, soft and fluffy. 

Went back with my fiancee and she got the lemon rice soup, real lemony and good. She also had some baklava, special stuff. 

Five bucks for a gyro, good deal. Soup's three bucks, worth it. 

Place is cozy, couple minutes wait, but we liked lookin' at the family photos, plants, and artwork. 

Small joint, counter service, eat in or take out. We sat down, they brought the grub, plastic utensils, and napkins."

"Health issues? Limited diet? No problem. Found some great raw options at this joint. Chile rellano, coconut curry spring rolls - outta sight! Vanilla cupcake with coconut strawberry frosting? Even better. This place is my go-to for raw food."

"Love the Destihl in Bloomington-Normal, had to try this one. Co-worker and I, dinner on a Thursday night. Not too busy, but enough business. Decor was cool, booths were neat. Waitress was rad. Same menu as Bloomington-Normal, except beer selection. Had the Beer Battered Asparagus, delish! Usual is White Cheddar Stuffed Poblano Peppers, but switched it up. Potato Crusted Rainbow Trout, fantastic flavor! Co-worker got my usual, loved 'em. Went for dessert, Creme Brulee. A bit runny, not as smooth as I like. Great food and service though. Love this joint."

"Good grub, good times, packed with Philly fans. Tucked away in the city, this joint's got game. I went for the Philly sub, and it passed with flying colors. Fresh roll, that's the key. If you're lookin' for somethin' else to do, grab a stogie and head to the shuffleboard table. They got friendly poker games once a week, too. Just show up and play. Staff's friendly, don't mind chattyin' it up. Only downside, place ain't exactly spotless. But hey, you know what you're gettin' into. Enjoy!"

"Clean joint, a tad pricey, but worth it. Felt like royalty, got a gel mani, white tips with glitter, $42. Not bad on my natural nails, but the fake ones, not so much. Looked a bit chunky, but blended okay with the rest. All in all, not bad."

"Solid joint. Good value, too. Went for the 3-meat combo, didn't spring for the fancy stuff. Had a few plates of it, though. Can't recall the cuts, but one was eye of round. Sukiyaki style is the way to go. Sweet soy has more flavor, and the udon noodles are better. Add some minced garlic for extra depth. Noodle and veggie plates are premade, which can be a bummer. Meat plates are done right, sliced to order. You can watch 'em put it together, too. Four stars, mostly 'cause I messed up and got the shabu shabu instead of Sukiyaki. Made do with Anthony M's leftover broth, but a staffer topped me off with shabu shabu water and it got watered down. Not his fault, but I didn't get to taste everything in Sukiyaki."

"I found this joint on Yelp, 3000+ reviews, 1 buck sign, 4+ stars. Only one like it on the strip. Had to check it out, needed a break from those $75 lunches. EoS is solid, variety of sandwiches, all tasty, easy on the wallet. Close to half the strip, even a $15 cab ride's worth it. Breakfast menu 'til 11 am, didn't make it, but their hot sandwich menu's my jam. Had the Chicken Chipotle Avocado, then the 1786 original. Needed more sauce, got it with extra, awesome. Can't go wrong for $7 a pop. Note: Sandwich ain't huge, but I don't eat much. My boys might need two. Note2: If you hit it for dinner, check the Pleasure Pit in the PH, you'll see..."
"Forty of us feasted on fine fare at this joint. Grub and service, top-notch. Even had some strings playin' outside, classy touch. I'd go back, no doubt."

"Thrifty's, where the ice cream flows like liquid gold. I'm an 80's kid, so I know a thing or two about good eats. Circus animal flavor, snickerdoodle, and sugar cookies - my sandwich game is strong. Who needs calories when you've got Thrifty's? Not me, that's for sure. 

Their cookies used to be a bit crunchy, but not tonight. They were soft, just how I like 'em. And let me tell you, their scoop of ice cream is no joke. It's huge, and worth every penny. Sure, some might complain about the price, but when you're getting a treat like this, who cares about a few bucks? 

The staff is friendly, the place is spotless, and there's plenty of room to move around. Plus, they've got some rad arcade games and unique sodas. If only they had some MJ, Madonna, Boy George, and Cindy Lauper playing on the radio, and maybe a little Ronald Reagan on TV, this place would be pure 80's heaven. Give it five stars? You bet your ass I would."

"Tuesdays, $2 Signature dogs. Who can resist? Maybe those who don't eat pork, but they're missin' out. These dogs are delicious. I'm workin' my way through 'em, and they keep changin' up the game with local brewery-inspired dogs. They grill 'em to perfection, and the toppings are endless. Great house chips and onion rings too. I usually do takeout, but the patio's a great spot to grab a beer and enjoy the spring evenings."

"Loved the crispy crust of the pizza. Super good. Worth a visit if you're at San Tan Mall. Went on a double date. Pretty good experience. Small dining area, though. Long wait. Got loud on a Friday night. Not ideal, but still worth it if you love pizza. Might stop by for lunch sometime. Avoid Fridays, too busy."

"Good grub, good people. Art, the owner, takes care of his customers like they're family. Had a swell time chattin' with him last visit. Food's solid, too. Roasted turkey's my jam. Fresh bread, decent cold cuts. Mozzarella's tasty, too. Turkey chili's a winner on a chilly day. Drinks are huge, so be ready. Typical 1/2 sandwich & soup lunch deals, too. Give it a shot, you won't regret it."

"Arena's easy to find, parkin's a breeze. Garage or street lot, both right next door. Decent size, mostly hockey and grads. Box Office is a bit off, but close enough. Restrooms nearby, prices fair. Seats comfy, ice rink covered for events, still feels chilly."

"Stayed at the Palazzo for a few nights, then headed to the Cosmopolitan with some pals. Total different atmosphere than your typical Vegas joint. Classier, more expensive, but still got that edge. No tacky statues or faux-European decor. Rooms were clean and welcoming, casino felt fresh too. It's in Citycenter, so be ready for a trek if you wanna hit up TI, Wynn, or them fancypants places up north."

"Pancakes, best I've had. Fluffy, warm, buttery, moist. Crisp outside. Maple syrup, warm. Eggs, phenomenal. Apple-smoked bacon, avocado, jack cheese omelet. Deconstructed. Pure egg whites, scrambled well-done. No high chairs. Service, meh. Facelift needed."
"Dinner with the missus last night. Small white pie, cheese steak with onions and Cheez Whiz. Dee-licious. Highly recommended."
"Great grub, separate dining from the bar. Love the burger options. Caught a hockey game on the big screen. Go on a Monday, burgers are $5. Not worth $8-11, but that's just me."

"Inside Circus Circus' wild indoor carnival, we found a meaty haven. Three of us gorged on steak, sides, and drinks for two hundred bucks. Not bad. Earlier that day, I raced in a half-Ironman triathlon and still devoured a full ribeye and sides."
"Had a killer meal here, three years back. Spicy shrimp, lit AF. Service and vibes, top-notch. My man and I still rave about the Mexican feast we had. Give it a shot."
"Friendly staff. Flights get busy during snow season. Crowded gates. Get here early."

"Breakfast here's top-notch. Started with a Fat Boy bloody mary, loaded with bacon and string cheese. Damn good. Crab Benedict was off the charts. My crew went for the Denver scramble and prime rib hash. Both raved about their grub. Finished with cookie dough egg rolls. Evil, but oh so sweet. Carrot cake's my usual go-to, but they've got a mean wait on Sundays. Plan ahead, grab a drink in the lounge, and kill some time 'til your table's ready."

"Verrado Grille, last night. Got there at 8:30, closed at 9. Expected poor service, but the waitress was nice. Had a pint of Verrado Ale, ordered the Almond Encrusted Basa. Beautifully cooked white fish, delicious Orzo/Risotto side. Price was right, would pay a bit more. Great experience, recommend it for sunset dinner. View over the golf course and White Tank Mountains was amazing."
"Always open, always friendly. Girls who work here, nice as can be. Chat us up, clean place, snacks galore. We'll be back, sure as sunrise."

"Good Blockbusters abound. One's near my crib, but the selection's weak, the staff's rude, and it's a straight-up dump. This spot's huge, got a killer selection, and the employees are A-okay. They're funny, too. Got the online thingy, works like a charm. In-store exchanges? Bam! Quick as can be. Other place had issues with that. This is my go-to Blockbuster in the valley. Two things keeping it from five stars: crappy parking lot and it's not right next door. That's how it is."

"Reservation time, sat promptly. Bread, one measly roll. Waiter rattled off menu. Spinach salad, good. BBQ shrimp, four tiny ones for twenty bucks? Rip-off. Seabass, lamb shank, decent. Blueberry cobbler, great. Maybe come back for lunch."

"I came here 'cause it's close by, good for a student like me livin' in Campustown. They got good hours, never had a problem gettin' an appointment. Price is right too, ain't broke the bank for a GUYS haircut. Been to pricier places in the NW, same quality. It's quick, no waitin' around. Stylists are friendly, one of 'em always jokes with me, says "That'll be a million dollars, please." If you're lookin' for deals and wanna pay cash, you can get your 10th haircut free."

"Yoshinoya's got fans beyond Cali, kid. New Yorkers dig it too. Me and my buddies hit it up all the time when I worked in the city. Packed joint, good grub, quick service. Only gripe? It's a haul from Phoenix. But hey, it's just a minute off the highway. Wish they'd bring it to the city limits, though. And yeah, that clam chowder trick? Crazy, but it works. But if you're new to the beef bowl game, start with the basics first. Enjoy."

"Kickass margaritas at Los Dos Molinos! ðŸ¹ðŸŒ®ðŸ‘Œ

Near downtown, this place has got the best margaritas in town. ðŸ’¯ Grabbed a pitcher with some amigos and we had a blast! ðŸŽ‰

Chill atmosphere, outside seating area's got some character. ðŸ˜Ž Random decor, but who cares when you're sipping on some top-shelf margaritas? ðŸ˜

Ordered some apps to share, that adovada ribs tho... ðŸ—ðŸ‘€ Spicy as hell, but damn good! ðŸ¤¤ Flour tortilla was on point too! ðŸŒ¯

Chorizo pizza, oh man... ðŸ•ðŸ”¥ Another spicy bombshell! ðŸ˜µ Thin crust, crispy and loaded with that spicy chorizo. ðŸ‘Œ

Highly recommend this spot for some kickass margaritas and delicious eats! ðŸ™ŒðŸ¼ðŸ´ Cheeeeers!"
"Rachel's kitchen, small wrap and burger selection, but the real magic's in the smoothies. Highly recommended."

"Chandler's got a killer gyro joint. Guy's from Chi-town, too. Haven't hit up the Italian beef yet, but I'm stickin' to the gyros and plates for now. Been there 20 times and still lovin' it. Shame about their website though, it's a real letdown. But hey, don't judge a book by its cover, their grub's the real deal."
