"Toyama's got two top-notch sushi men, Mo and Giro. They know their stuff and remember your name. They'll hook you up with some off-menu goodness if you ask nice. Their rolls and sushi are the real deal, and the service is on point. Better than the other joints around."
"Embers? Fantastic. Rates high as any celeb chef joint on the strip. Delicious comfort grub. Left wanting more."

"Listen up, folks! This team's got the heart of a champion, and the soul of a fan favorite. They're in it to win, and to make you happy. Affordable tix, friendly players, and a Prez who's on the Twitter - what more do ya need? It's a night out at the ballpark, and these boys bring the heat. Support 'em, they support you. That's the Arizona Diamondbacks way."

"Walkin' with pals, we stumbled upon this joint. Music thumpin', bartenders slingin' drinks like pros. Met the owner, danced with some great folks. Outdoor patio, perfect for chowin' down and takin' it easy. Definitely stoppin' back next time I'm in town."

"Friendly staff, good grub, and a welcoming atmosphere. Not too fussy, just how I like it. Perfect spot for a family breakfast, everyone's happy. I'm gluten-free, not by choice, but places like this make me feel like I'm not missing out. Been going here regularly since we moved to QC a month ago. Keep up the good work!"

"Saturday night, the missus and I hit up Ruby Tuesday for an early Mother's Day feast. Despite the joint being packed, we scored a table pronto thanks to our reservation. Service was top-notch, even with the hectic crowd. My better half went for the seafood trio, which she devoured with gusto. I opted for the freshly blackened Mahi Mahi. Damn, it was tasty. We're suckers for Ruby Tuesday's grub, atmosphere, and hospitality. We keep comin' back 'cause we know we'll get a solid meal, fair price, and friendly service."

"Napoletana, where the grub's top-notch and the service is snappy. Thin crust pizzas, pasta, gnocchi - everything's a winner. Don't mind sharing a table with strangers, it's all part of the fun. Menu's got something for everyone, can't go wrong with any choice. Had the Chef pizza, mozzarella, black olives, tomatoes - delicious. And the best part? It's BYOW, baby! (SAQ's just a short walk away, so no need to settle for a mediocre bottle.) Cash only, but hey, that's no problem."
"Birthday party, big group. Private dining room. Food, top-notch. Pricey, sure, but worth it. Prawn Tempura, Chicken Pad Thai. Well-cooked, well-presented."
"Warm welcome at this joint. Friendly folks, too. Worked with K, knew his stuff, fixed my drowned iPhone like a pro. Crazy to go anywhere else. Great price, great people, great service. 10/10."

"Step into this cozy joint, tucked behind Fox and Hound Pub & Grill, and treat yourself to a Ginger Cinnamon Latte. I added caramel sauce and soy milk, over ice, in a large 32oz size - pure delight! The combo of flavors was incredible. Worth driving out of your way for, and the staff is friendly and helpful. Even tried it with a drive-up convenience. A great alternative to *bucks, with a richer taste and no burnt espresso aftertaste. Give it a shot, you won't regret it."
"Best damn latte I ever had, and I ain't exaggeratin'. Missin' it somethin' fierce since graduation. Hot or iced, don't matter none. Macchiato, berry tart, sfogliatelle - they all hit the spot."

"Food's great. Service too. Atmosphere's top-notch. Ninety-nine percent of the time, that is. Bar gets rowdy, loud. Skip it when it's packed. Dining area's nice, though. Get yourself a cheese crisp, cold beer. They do Mexican comfort food justice."

"I only come here for massages nowadays. It's a bit unconventional, but I'll explain. Wear something comfy, like yoga pants and a T-shirt. They'll soak your feet and give you a full massage. The price is incredible. Best part? You can call and get an appointment within the hour. Never had a problem getting in. They've got multiple therapists ready to work. Love this place. -Janet"

"This joint's got game. Buffet's on point, especially the baklava. Gyro's cooked just right, but the hummus is a bit too smooth. Not a deal-breaker though. Good value for the buck, they don't skimp on portions. I'm a fan. It's not mobbed like some other spots, so that's a plus. Recommend it for lunch, takeout, or dinner. Can't wait to go back."

"This spot's a gem. Always somethin' new, never fully explored in one trip. Worth the membership, especially at $75. Private exhibition nights? Hell yeah, $200 level's the way to go. Lectures, events, always somethin' cookin'. Like visitin' an old buddy, the permanent collection's got new stories to tell each time. Rotatin' exhibits, top-notch. Arcadia Farms, a real treat. Healthy grub, just the way I like it. Yeah, the Met's got its Egyptian temple and Dutch masters, but we got our own secret weapon: that funky black plastic thing and them twinklin' LEDs. Phoenix got culture, more than that expired yogurt in your fridge."

"Sketchy joint. Dingy, crusty, smelly. But hey, cheap tables. And that's what it's all about, right? That glorious, behemoth of a hot dog. Worth every penny. Inspires the ladies to get frisky, too. Five stars."

"Tonight, I'll hit the hay early.  Thanks to the killer dinner I had last night at Basil 'N Lime, I woke up at the crack of dawn craving the leftovers in my fridge.  That place is huge on flavor.  The veggies were sautÃ©ed to perfection, the meat was tender like cotton candy.  The appetizer platter was a trip to heaven.  Spice level?  I treat it like dressing up - easier to add than take away, just like Coco Chanel said.  I ordered three entrees, and the flavors weren't hidden in the heat.  Can't wait to go back for more.  No booze served there, which is a good thing.  You wouldn't want to miss out on the aroma, taste, and presentation.  Highly recommend the Thai Iced Tea.  And, their Garlic Beef is just a phone call away.  Big props to Chef Moo and the crew."

"Best food in Vegas, hands down. Japanese cuisine, fresh and flavorful. Daily specials, tofu, duck, foie gras, pork cheek, shishito peppers. Uni, my favorite. Cold dish, egg, roe, uni. Make reservations, avoid busy times. Will miss this place when I leave Vegas."

"This joint was top-notch. Real warm and inviting, like a cozy cabin in the woods. Don't know why some folks are griping about it. It's gonna be our new go-to for dates and grub. Our server, a swell guy, got a $20 tip from us. That's rare, but he earned it."

"Bulgarian grub, always a treat. These cooks, top-notch. Brought back memories of the old country. Left feeling full, like a king. Service, impeccable. Don't come here for a quick bite, they make it fresh, just for you. Great spot for sharing plates with pals."

"Laughed my ass off from start to finish. Don't expect Ka-level production, folks. It's a small, intimate show with charm. Go in with a positive attitude and you'll have a blast. The Twigglers, those hilarious dancers pretending to be short and singing like the Village People, had me in stitches. The host is top-notch, too, with some impressive tricks up his sleeve. Like when he juggled bowling balls and did a rope stunt over the audience. Damn entertaining. Get your local discount and enjoy the show. Not as raunchy as Absinthe, but still fun for adults and kids alike."

"Four years on campus, no place did eyebrow waxing right. Until today. Mary Kay listened, gave me a wax based on my face shape. Happy with the results, I'll be back. Prices fair for her services. Check it out."

"I'm not one to hand out five-star reviews to dentists like candy. In fact, I'd give most dentists negative stars if I could. But then I met Dr. Wyatt and his team. They're different. Friendly, helpful, and genuinely concerned about your well-being. No lectures, no anger, just a sincere desire to see you smile. And let's not forget the movie theme. It's a bit corny, but it's a nice touch. And who knows, maybe you'll even get to watch a flick while you're in the chair. Not bad for a dentist's office, eh? Oh, and ladies, you might find Dr. Wyatt's good looks to be an added bonus."

"This joint's a real love-it-or-hate-it spot. Me? I love it. It's tiny, so wherever you stand, you got a great view. Sound system's solid too. Drinks are fair game, strong and cheap. Grab a slice of that pre-show pizza, it's damn good for three bucks."

"This joint serves up the best Thai grub I've ever had, bar none. Their veggie pad Thai is top-notch, and I always find myself comparing it to Bangkok's version. It's like they say, you can't go home again, but damn if I don't wish I could teleport to that dingy food court whenever I'm eating Thai elsewhere."
"Top-notch service. Folks here know their stuff. Give 'em ten stars, easy. Highly recommend."

"Cute joint. Shared sweets with sis. Strawberry snow fluff and peanut butter honey toast, both tasted great. Staff was cool, accommodating with our order. Dining room had character, games too. Check in on Yelp, get 15% off. Nice."

"In from Texas, stumbled on WhereUBean. Nice surprise. Clean joint, comfy, friendly staff. My picky buddy approved of the joe, and their chai's a winner. We'll be back if we're ever in Phoenix again."

"Tried the lengua taco today. Damn good. Don't know what Gabriel's talking about, no fried fish here. Just oysters and cocktails. Cashier speaks English, runs the drive-thru too. Not many white folks, but that's okay. Brought my 72-year-old mom for tacos and shrimp. Watermelon juice, tears, it was that good. Can't find any flaws."

"Been tracking Pinkberry for a bit. Been eager for their East coast move. Heard they opened up in Charlotte, near Southpark. Had to give it a shot. First time, great experience. Girls at the counter, peppy, friendly, helpful. Sampled a few, went with coconut yogurt, raspberry, pineapple, chocolate crisps, yogurt chips. Damn good. Can't wait to do it again."

"Vegas restaurants? Pretty damn good, all of 'em. But N9NE? It's on another level. Atmosphere's top-notch, menu's simple but focused on what they do best. Smores? Fresh seafood platter? You bet your ass they're serving up the good stuff. N9NE does it better, that's for sure."

"Xavier, a top-notch raw food chef, spreads the gospel of fresh, tasty grub. His joint's menu's online, so check it out before stopping by. If you're feeling spontaneous, grab something quick from the deli case. He's got a smoothie program too, perfect for those looking to boost their nutrition game. Try "The Works," a veggie-packed blend that's pure refreshment."
"Simpatico, inside the old Alcoa building, serves great coffee at good prices. Less foot traffic than Starbucks, but worth it for the quality and service. Free Wi-Fi in the lobby too."

"Breakfast review: Verandah Vegas hits it outta the park. Superb setting, killer huevos rancheros. Relaxed, fresh atmosphere - a nice change from the usual Vegas chaos. Coffee? Perfect. Service? Good, not too pushy. Main event? Huevos rancheros that'll make your taste buds do the tango. Presentation on point, flavors mixed like a pro. I eat out a lot, but this dish stands out. Up there with the likes of The Modern's duck, Ryutenmon's cashew chicken, and Kaygetsu's sushi. Well done, Verandah Vegas. You've set the bar high."
"Clean, quiet hotel. Helpful staff. Perfect location - close to the strip, a mile from the convention center. Unbeatable price."
"Sat in the cantina for happy hour, chips and salsa came quick and were good. Server was friendly and attentive. Food was good, except my dish was overcooked. Happy hour prices were great, though."

"Pizza joint's got game. Solid pies, good beer and wine selection. Chinedu, the man, helped me out with a bottle. Joe, the regional boss, gave me a nod. They know their stuff. Traditional, white, and pesto options - it's my new go-to spot. Close to work too. Two thumbs up."

"Airport grub's usually a crapshoot, but Beaudevin's the real deal. Don't know where it came from, but it's like the Airport Gods smiled upon us weary travelers. Fancy? Damn straight. Best I've had at any airport. Bagel with all the fixin's? Fresh as hell. Salmon? Top-notch. Mind blown. If you're passing through Charlotte, grab a bite. Heard they got joints in Chi-town and Miami too. Happy trails, folks."
"Five weekends straight, I've been here. Last weekend, I skipped town. But I'll be back, craving that hot bowl of tonkotsu-shoyu ramen, pork, egg, and seaweed. See you soon, Monta."

"Pedicures usually leave me underwhelmed. Not today. Mai delivered the most exceptional pedicure and massage I've ever had. Standard pedicure, but the massage was prolonged, firm yet gentle, and utterly relaxing. Fantastic establishment! A mere 25 minutes from my abode, with numerous alternatives in between, but I'll gladly make the trip regularly. Absolutely worth it."
"Pizza? Killer. Kale pizza, off-menu but worth asking. Turkey lasagna, my go-to. Flavored margaritas? Surprisingly good. Don't even like 'em, but they're aces here."

"Client raved about this joint, so I checked it out. Noah, our server, gave us top-notch service. Margaritas, guacamole, fish tacos - all top-shelf. Presentation was a work of art. Finished with pumpkin bread pudding and chocolate dessert. Unreal. If I lived closer, I'd be here every day for that bread pudding. Great spot for food, atmosphere, and service. Looking forward to trying their brunch."

"Best breakfast joint on the strip. Portions huge. Shareable. Chicken 'n' waffles, biscuits 'n' gravy, both good. Service top-notch. Big groups tough to please, but Scott, young redhead dude, excelled. Checked on us next day, even though we weren't in his section. Must-eat spot in Vegas."

"This joint's got some serious grub. Service is top-notch, food's even better. Simple, but damn good. 

I've had my fair share of the menu, and let me tell you, the pork tenderloins are the real deal. Level's usually a 5, and it's not too shabby. 

They've also got some nice specials and sides. Keep an eye out for 'em, they're worth trying."

"Sex On The Beach? Forget it, kid. This joint's the real deal. Classy drinks, quirky vibes, and a crew that knows their stuff. Been around long enough to know what they're doing, too. Tea cups are trendy, but these folks are no newbies. Order something off the menu, or keep it simple with a mojito or old fashioned. Just don't forget to pace yourself, or you'll be carried out the back door. It's a small spot, so grab a ledge and enjoy the ride."
"Best burger I ever had. Friendly service. Elegant joint. Reasonable prices."

"This place was great.  Our kid, Andrew, and his girl, Sara, brought us here for a killer breakfast on our last trip to Wisconsin.  Everything was top-notch and I'm hoping to make it back someday.  It was worth the wait, that's for sure.  I had the strawberry pancakes with marscapone cheese and now I can't stop thinking about 'em."
"Fixed my eye, good as new. Staff's top-notch. You're free to go, compliments of Maricopa County Jail."

"Six of us, four loved the elk, beef, bison combo. I had the flat iron special, fantastic. Beet salad, light on beets but still great. Cabbage was nothing special. Brought a bottle of wine as a gift, not to share, but they wouldn't let us bring it in. Maybe it was a liquor law thing? Either way, great meal. Highly recommended."

"Vegas, always a good time. Got my gun on, feelin' fine. Hit up the Gun Store, best place in town. Hubby tried out an AK, few other pieces too. Prices are sweet, packages come with a free tee. Taxi from the strip'll cost ya, but it's worth it. Parking's easy, staff's on point. Give 'em a visit, won't regret it."

"Good prices, wide variety, and a clean store. My new go-to for international and Asian goods in Madison. Close to downtown and easily accessible, even for out-of-towners. The strip mall and library nearby have been spruced up too. Looks sharp."

"Verdun's got a new BBQ joint, Black Strap, and it's a real treat. It's informal, like BBQ should be, with big ol' picnic tables and friendly service. And the grub? It's the real deal, none of that sugary sauce or half-hearted attempts at faux BBQ. They got it right, from the smokin' to the rubbin'. Prices are fair too, and folks are lining up every night. Hope they stick around, for the love of God."
"Vegas, always leaving, but this place stays with me. Crepe craze, can't shake it. Search far and wide, never find better than here. My spot, my haven, my crepe paradise."
"Ticket line's long, but it moves quick. Like how they got different tickets for different things. Makes it faster. Fridays are wild. They got a TV too."

"Weekly, my wife and I hit this joint. Meatball Pho and BBQ pork Bahn Mi, that's our order. Good grub, cheap and fast. Staff's friendly, not over-the-top, but they get the job done. Da Vang's become a top spot for me in Phoenix."
I stumbled into the cafe at dawn, bleary-eyed and famished. Omar, my waiter, recommended the Lobster Eggs Benedict. I'm glad I listened. It was the best breakfast I've ever had. Period.
"Sliders, ham and cheese croquettes, stuffed dates - all good. Mojitos, too. Pitcher if you want. Fun, delicious joint. Prices, can't beat 'em. Everyone I've brought here, loved it. More than a few."

"We played eenie meenie minne mhhhoo and picked Butters for breakfast. It was a bit of a hike, but worth it. Rafael, our server, was cool and collected. He gave us the lowdown on the menu and took our order. Food arrived quick, within 10 minutes, and we dug in. I had the chorizo omelette, cheddar grits, and pancakes. First time having chorizo, it was a bit oily, but the veggies and eggs balanced it out. The grits were delicious, my boyfriend devoured them. The pancakes, fluffy and buttery, melted in my mouth - the best I've ever had. I cleaned my plate and felt sad we won't be back to Butters often since we don't live nearby."

"Treated the husband to a staycation this weekend. Staff was top-notch, from the golf cart driver who picked us up at the parking lot to the front desk crew who made check-in a breeze. Concierge was helpful, gave me the lowdown on transportation options into Old Town without needing to worry about drinks and driving. Their towncars will drop you off anywhere in Old Town for $21. Rooms were stylish, loved the modern and sleek vibe. Didn't get to hit the Release Pool Party due to rain, but it's free for hotel guests. Desert views from our room were nice too."

"Place is solid. Friendly staff, not just polite. Sitting in lobby, working, guy brings me cookies. Clean digs, good chow, safe, business center for printing, gym's decent, laundry's convenient. Even the kitty approves. House is busted, but this joint's making things better."

"Next time in Montreal, I knew I'd finally try Garde Manger. First visit, exceeded hopes. Reserved spot at the bar, perfect for two or three. Must-try: Lobster Poutine, maybe Chuck Hughes' best dish. Just enough fishiness in the gravy, curds, and frites. Also had Albacore Tuna and Crackling Pork, equally impressive. Service and ambiance, top-notch. Can't wait to return, try more."
"Good grub. Fair prices. Friendly folks. Needed a fast lunch joint, found it here. Be back."
"Good service, always. Got what I needed, five watches today. Usually go elsewhere for batteries, cheaper maybe, but they close early. This place, open late, weekends too. Great news."

The marina's where we keep our boat, and we're members too. It's a real nice place, laid back, you know? Only thing is, sometimes the shuttle service can be a bit of a wait, but they got call boxes at both ends of the walkway, so that's good. Being members, we got access to private showers, BBQ area, washers and dryers, power and water hookups, and we even get two free bags of ice every day. Staff's real friendly too, always willing to help out. Feels like one big family here, never had any problems with theft or nothing. Just a chill place, except for them party weekends, but that's okay too. I reckon this marina's better than Scorpion Bay, just based on how laid back and personable it is. Been to Scorpion Bay a few times, and it just feels a bit too uptight for me. Plus, there's always cops driving around, gives me the uneasy feeling. If you're gonna get a slip here, make sure to talk to Shannon, she knows what's up.

"Body Heat sparked my fitness journey like no other gym. I've taken up running, cross-training, and fallen hard for fitness. Their classes are top-notch, and yeah, they're hot. The place is spotless, but sometimes I wish they'd step up the sanitizing game. That's just me, though. \n\nNever thought I'd dig yoga, but now it's the highlight of my day. Also into the hot Pilates, kettlebells, and bootcamp sessions. Their candlelit class on Fridays is the perfect way to unwind after a rough week. Body Heat's become my haven."

"Cibo's got some swell reviews, so I'll keep mine brief. It's a hip joint with quality grub and a cool crowd. Their bruschetta's a real winner, check out the pic. Make sure to save room for their crepe desserts."
"Good grub, top-notch ambiance. Menu's got something for everyone. I'm a fan of the rice pudding with Turkish coffee. Hookah lounge is a swell spot to chill with pals post-dinner."
"This joint does good work. Quick, too. Polite folk, all of 'em. You should give 'em a try."

"Been coming here for 15 years. Marjorie's the best, worth her weight in gold. Fussy about my stylist, like I am with my dentist or doc. Travel a lot, always get compliments. This is the only place for me."

"Best damn prosciutto sandwich I've had, hands down. Went for lunch, had a great meal. Their bread, light and crispy, worth every penny. Friendly staff, quick service. Valet for your car, nice touch. Clean as a whistle. Recommend it, no doubt. Might make it my regular Friday spot."
"Vegas newbie, picked spot for convenience. Great surprise! Pizza to-go, hot, fresh, perfect thin crust. Eat here again, definitely."

"Got my brows and lip done. Wow, what a place! Professional, modern. My eyebrows are weird, always a challenge. Esthetician (forgot her name) did 'em perfect. Showed me how to fill 'em in too. Good price for a great job."

"Arizona Charlie's buffet, a feast fit for kings. Stuffing, mashed potatoes, desserts - all top-notch. No cleanup, just pure indulgence. My gratitude to those who worked tirelessly to make this holiday meal possible."
"Food's great, homemade mostly. Friendly bartenders, rotating beers, happy hour deals. Good vibe. Recommend for grub and drinks."

"I was hunting for top-notch laminate flooring in the area, and TLC delivered. Ramin's service was top-shelf, and he knew his stuff. My mom wanted hardwood, but Ramin broke down the pros and cons. We went with Shaw laminate, and he gave us a hell of a deal - 1.89 per square foot, including padding. No way was I going with Chinese-made crap or Home Depot's inferior products. TLC's got quality goods at a damn good price. Thanks, Ramin. Love my floors."

"Dined at Al Hamra with friends. Great meal and service. Mario, our waiter, knew his stuff and was friendly. Orders came quick and everything was top-notch. Had the samosas and onion paneer to start. For mains, we had the shrimp vindaloo, chicken with coconut, chicken curry, and eggplant. All were cooked to perfection and had just the right amount of spice. Even the aloo naan and mango chutney were on point. Been a while since we've been to Al Hamra, but we'll be back."

"Visited my 80yo friend at the rehab center for a month. Place is top-notch, better than TLC in Henderson. Staff's always friendly, asks about my friend's needs, and actually listens. They don't give up on the residents, helps 'em progress. Mike in P.T. and Jackie in nurse aides, they're standouts. Kudos to 'em. Rehab centers could learn from this place."

"I'm no golf pro, but I sure love the game. This course is great for both beginners and seasoned players. Wide open fairways, few houses in the way, unless you really mess up. Water hazards provide a good challenge. Greens were decent, not perfect, but for under 50 bucks a round, it's hard to beat. \n\nWhat sets this course apart is the staff and service. Friendly folks at the clubhouse, efficient food service, and starters doing their job, keeping things moving. My green fee came with draft beers and grub, didn't expect that. And unlimited range balls? Best Saturday of golf I've had in Vegas."

"Found my go-to groomer! Top-notch service, no complaints. Always book with Addie. She's got skill and passion. My Yorkies look better than ever. First-time perfect cut for my Yorkie-Poo. No comparison to my previous groomer. Highly recommend this local gem. Get in and out quick, even for a trim."

"I get my nails done here and there, when I feel like it. But this place has the newest acrylics - shimmer-sparkles-and colors, oh my! I keep in touch with my girl, she does my nails, and she makes them look like shiny jewels. The price is fair for the precision and neatness of the work. Around $35/40, depending. I usually go for a shimmer acrylic on the tips, then fill later. No second thoughts, it's worth the wait. I've recommended many friends here. Nails never pop off, I ask to soak or drill down to take off."
"Line? Don't fear it. Worth it, kid. Hot links, fantastic. Green beans, done right. Even a veggie-hater'll eat 'em."

"HTC, top-notch.  Anchor by Marilyn, swift and painless.  Two weeks pass, my paranoia grows.  Jon, superb, puts mind at ease.  Anthony, kind, informative, a pleasure.  All three, excellent.  Will not go elsewhere.  Safe, educated hands."
"Burgers, damn good. Fresh, like the morning dew. Barkeep, friendly as a mountain stream. Atmosphere, cozy as a hunting cabin. Managers, welcoming as a warm fire. Beer and burgers, worth the hike."

"Hired Skyler and the Myriad crew for their real estate advisory services. Best decision I ever made. They're young, smart, and all about results. Helped me make sense of the chaos that is real estate investing. Taught me how to read the numbers, understand the risks and rewards. Now I'm making passive income every month. Don't hesitate, use them today. You won't regret it."

"Pricey, but worth it. Scottsdale's top spot. Pool's great, service too. Mountain views? Tough luck. Closer to pool, better. Nice casitas, sliding doors. Pretty grounds. Use their car service for hikes. Worth it."

"We hit this joint after a round of golf and dug it big time. Phoenix folks, we wished it was closer to home. Service was top-notch, food was piping hot and tasty, prices were swell. We'll be back next time we're in town."

"Dinner buffet's price, $37 a head, Friday nights, 5 PM, no wait.  

Our waitress, top-notch! Brother liked the tea, she gave him the details, distributor, website, product name, a papaya tea by China Mist. They're testing it out, might not stick around, but folks love it. 

New faves at Wynn Buffet: Chilean seabass, spicy tuna hand rolls, buffalo salad, marinated mushrooms, key lime pie."

"Met a friend at a cafÃ© after work. Not big on coffee, but I like tea. Ordered a hot chai latte, hoping for a fancy design. Asked the woman at the register if they did designs, and she said yes. But when I got my drink, no design. Bummer. Spoke with the barista, and he said they don't do designs for chai tea lattes. Oh well. Sat upstairs in the loft area. Loved the writings on the walls and the old encyclopedias. Almost forgot about the tasty gluten-free cookie and macaroons. Great spot, pricey, but worth it."

"Dear Hotel Chocolat,

I had a dream about you last night. Maybe I'm falling for you.

Yours,
Jd

P.S. Your shop is top-notch. I spent Â£30 on goodies despite the free tasting. Your staff are friendly, charming, and passionate about their products. The chilli caramel is divine! The Cocoa-coffee shop is a brilliant addition - loved my macchiato. Can't wait to use the cocoa meat rub. You're a chocolate palace and a must-visit destination. :o)

Hemingway would have written it in a more concise and straightforward style, using shorter sentences and avoiding excessive adjectives or exclamation marks. He would have also used a more formal tone and avoided using colloquialisms like "Nom" or " Palace of chocolate".
"Red Lobster, no. That's why I go. Clean can, friendly gals, hot dudes, tasty BBQ, happy hour, top-notch. Live bands, meh. Still love it."
"Lettuce wraps, egg rolls - all amazing. Passion tea, a delight. Service, good. Food, good. Times, good. Not as busy as other locations, perfect for a Friday night."

"Zen vibes, not too over-the-top. Massage rooms, top-notch. iPods with custom playlists, flowers on the floor, scented oils that's pure bliss. Staff, super friendly. Locker room's got everything you need. Perfect for flying solo. Peaceful areas, perfect for some alone time. Pure heaven."
"Solid joint. Don't need to repeat what's been said. Get your Sunday brunch reservation a month in advance, the menu's unique and worth it. Skip the bloody mary bar, stick with the menu."
"Southwest's first vape store. Finally. Affordable prices, competition be damned. Variety aplenty, new stock each visit. Friendly staff, eager to share their knowledge."

"Yu's gets a 5 from me. It's better than any Chinese joint I've been to. Food's plentiful, hot, and tasty. Service is good too. Can't see how it could get better. \nDrive through Arrowhead often and saw Yu's. New place, only been open a couple weeks. Figured I should give 'em a shot since they're in my neck of the woods. \nClean, friendly spot. Went in for lunch, checked out the menu. Lunch meals under $6, with drink it's just over $7. Got the house chicken, marked spicy. Not too spicy for me, but I'm used to some pretty hot stuff. Wife got the Orange Chicken. Damn. Enough food for 4 or 5 people. Good food, hot off the grill. Better than other Oriental places around. I'll be back. Many times."

"South Scottsdale's got a real gem here. Fresh grub, straight from the farm. Creative dishes that'll knock your socks off. Cocktails? Top-notch, my friend. Service? Five stars, no question. You won't be let down."

"Not a five-star joint, but damn close. Menu's got some flair, food's top-notch. Staff's on point, attentive without being pushy. Water and soda glasses always full, that's key in this heat. Solid eatery, prices ain't bad either."

"Fish & chips, mate. Best I've had. Bring yer fam, bring yer mates. Other dishes looked top-notch too. Beer selection's spot on. Feels like a proper Brit pub. Service was ace, grub was piping hot. Give it a go or ye'll be missin' out."
"Great spot. Friendly folks, killer cheese curds and chicken tenders. One of my go-to's in Madison."

"The Coffee Shop on Higley and Ray in Gilbert serves up killer omelettes. I'm a fan of the Ham and Cheddar. The potatoes on the side are top-notch and pair well with a glass of fresh OJ. It'll set you back about $9, but it's worth every penny. I stop by every Friday to work and enjoy a hearty breakfast. Maybe I'll see you there, Facebook friends."

"Las Vegas, a city of excess, yet we found a gem off the strip. Ventano's, a hidden treasure. Danielle, our host, provided exceptional service. The staff, a well-oiled machine, ensured a flawless experience. Sunset views, unobstructed. Prices, reasonable. Food, delicious. A true find. If I lived in Henderson, I'd be a regular. Thank you, Ventano's, for a memorable evening."

"Rosie's doughnuts, best I've had. Travel plenty, but their doughnuts, worth the trip. Always impress with texture, flavor, quality. Fantastic! Espresso, not bad either. Eat a Rosie's doughnut, improve your day."

"Aureole's bar, a place we found ourselves, one night in Vegas. November, 2010, we stayed at Mandalay, trying their restaurants. Aureole, we heard, had a great happy hour, two for one wine flights and apps. We went, eager to taste. The wine flowed, the apps, delicious, oxtail, my first time. Our bartender, nice, attentive, switched out a wine I didn't like. He showed us the digital wine list, kept an eye on us all night. After the flights, he suggested dessert wines, a perfect ending. Aureole, a pleasant memory, sad to hear the bad reviews now."
"Petsmart's my jam. Got my cat and dog here, use their grooming salon, and dig everything about the place. Employees are top-notch too. They'll hook you up with whatever you need, no problem."

"Been goin' to Elliott's for a couple years now. They're the only shop in the Valley I trust. Brought my 2000 BMW in for all sorts of repairs, from big jobs to small ones. They've always been upfront with me, tellin' me what needs fixin' and how much it'll cost. They don't try to sell me on somethin' I don't need. They get the job done quick and right. Had to replace my alternator recently and they had it done in a day. Those guys know their stuff and are friendly too. I recommend 'em to anyone lookin' for a good mechanic."
"Adult slurpies, served quick and neat. Save a buck or two, keep the cup. Drink up, and hit the strip."

"We'd been itchin' to hit up the Sanctuary for a hot sec, so we booked a quick three-nighter last week. And let me tell ya, it did not disappoint. This place is a real gem - spotless, beautiful, and the service? Top-notch. We both scored some sweet reflexology treatments at the spa, and spent some quality time in the whirlpool and steam room. All in all, it was a damn good investment."

"District one, great place. Adrian, top-notch bartender. She pointed me towards the stir-fried lobster, garlic noodles. Outstanding. Three pounds of pure delight. Adrian, thank you. You made my birthday. Coconut mojitos, mind-blowing."
"Crew was top-notch, service was ace. Estimate was prompt, despite the rain. Windows and screens, spotless. Five years of grime, gone. A steal, the price. Will do it annually, no doubt."
"Best pho joint around. No question. If you're a noodle soup fan, this place is a must-visit."

"Carlsbad Tavern, loved it. Name didn't do it justice. Sat on the patio, fireplace, palms, water features. Cocktails from the Late Night menu, server suggested New Mexican pot stickers. Amazing. Sauce, lick the plate clean good. Only downfall, found it last night of vacation. Atmosphere, service, food, outstanding. Try it, won't regret it."

"Good joint for stuff you won't find at the big boxes. Quality pet grub, treats, playthings, rags, and staff who give a damn. Small, but worth the trip. I just got here and did some digging. This spot carries the good stuff for dogs - food and paw protection. They got all the fancy feeds and some nice things for cats, too."
"Smart Securityâ€™s got game. Josh knows his stuff, and heâ€™ll tackle any question you throw his way. Give him a ring and scope out their smartphone apps."

"First time I came here was '04. Moved into an apartment nearby. Mevlana's been my go-to spot ever since. Best dinner place around, no question. Worth every penny of that four euro bill for a Yufka. Their meat's top-notch, never had a complaint in seven years.

Their pizza with cream fraiche and paprika, straight outta the stone oven, is a must-try. In summer, grab a seat outside.

Chef's a real stand-up guy. Knows me by name, just like he does with many of his regulars. Shame I don't make it over here as often since my move to another neighborhood."

"This joint's got class, kid. Bring all my dates here for the fancy atmosphere and top-notch service. It's like eatin' at the Beast's castle, but with better grub. Grab a burger and some fries, and you'll be feelin' like royalty. And don't forget to stop by your local pharmacy beforehand, they'll hook you up with some good stuff. Long live Mickey D's!"
"Food's top-notch. Been here twice now. Cozy joint, solid service, and grub that's on point. That garlic and spinach nan? Damn good. Chicken tiki masala too."

"Our final day in Montreal, we sought a fitting farewell meal. Cafe Cherrier beckoned, its bustling atmosphere a delight. Business folk mingled with locals, an amusing spectacle. French cuisine, exquisite. Onion soup, rich and savory. Duck confit, crispy perfection. Fresh salad, lightly dressed. Tasty bread, paired with wine, a subtle accompaniment."

"Lived in Seville, went to Blue32 on Val Vista and Williams Field. Anticipated opening, high expectations. Exceeded twice. Last time, sat with Amanda, great server. Loved food, especially Alfredo pasta, real strawberry daiquiri. Forgot name this trip, sorry Amanda. Thoughtful, helped us order before big party arrived. Never wanted for drinks or refills, food was hot, Amanda delightful. Fresh strawberry daiquiris, mentioned that, right?"
"Burgers, soft and juicy. Dream of 'em, crave 'em. Basic cheese, pickles, special mustard. That's all."
"First time at Gunnel's. Got Firestone HD airbags and onboard compressor for my work truck. Cost me $800, but worth it. They said five days, took five days. Good job, happy camper."

"Plateau eatery, cheap and good. Poutine, hot dogs, burgers, veggie options too. Had veggie wrap, fresh and crisp. Friend had curried chicken, both agreed, better than Juliette & Chocolate. Retro decor, works well. Prompt service, courteous."
"Pastrami, five stars. Best I've had, maybe best sandwich period. Guy at the meat station, friendly, let me sample the goods. Other girls, not so much. Will be back."

"Earl of Sandwich, across from Sugars. Good eatery. Went there with Michelle E. after swimming at Planet Hollywood. Menu's huge, lots to choose from. Bread's the difference maker. Soup, hot sandwiches, wraps, salads, and desserts galore. Order, get a buzzer and receipt, then pick your extras - potato salad, macaroni salad, fruit cups, brownies, chips, ice cream sandwiches. Overwhelming, but in a good way. Had the Full Montague - roasted beef, turkey, aged Swiss, sharp cheddar, lettuce, tomatoes, Earl's mustard sauce. Beef's fresh, bread's perfect. Also had broccoli cheddar soup, one of the best. Michelle got brownie bites, topped off my meal. Top 5 sandwich shops I've been to. Will be back, Earl of Sandwich. Promise."

"Spiedini's was where we threw our son's rehearsal dinner. Worked with Tonya, she was a peach. Organized too. Evening went swell. Food and service got raves from the whole fam. Big group, 60, so that's sayin' somethin'. Chef Gustav, top-notch. He was there, makin' sure all went well. Recommend 'em to anyone lookin' for a good time and grub."

"Four of us, each one thrilled with our manicures. Peter and crew, perfectionists and artists, dedicated to their craft. My twin sisters' birthdays, complimentary wine. Not from Vegas, but this'll be a regular stop."

"Went to MTL Tattoo on St Denis, loved it. First tat, wanted a chill vibe. Stopped by, got immediate attention, questions answered sans prying. Called ahead, got fitted in. Met Tony, super friendly, recognized me from the phone. Paperwork took longer than the tat, but he made me feel comfy, reassured me, explained each step. Efficient, compassionate, told me to relax, distracted me. Great experience, everyone's friendly, place is relaxed yet pro, recommend MTL to anyone looking to get inked."
"Hash House, best breakfast joint in Vegas. Portions too big, almost docked 'em a star. But they serve killer lunch too. Must-visit spot, resident or tourist."

"Lived near Half Moon, loved it. Decided to try another spot with the missus. Heard they had different grub and decor. Sat at the bar, ordered wings (can't get enough of 'em), missus got a burger and some wings too. Wings were perfect. Missus wasn't wild about the bun, but the burger was still solid. Liked the vibe of the place, nice atmosphere, good flow. Bartender, Alexandra, was top-notch. She kept us there for at least an hour longer than planned. Got my missus nice and tipsy, we had a blast with her. Friendly gal, customers agreed. We'll be back, no doubt."
"Tina Mateo, two words. Fun, anytime. Food, gaming specials, limited graveyard menu."

"Cooper Coons, Ltd. set up our family trust, will, and directives. They took the time to explain everything, made us feel confident in their abilities. Friendly folks, too. They'll be handling our LLC soon. Highly recommend 'em."

"Houstons, the best joint in town. If I were stranded on a desert island, this place would be my top pick. My pal BridgetZ gives me grief for going to a chain, but she's just trying to hide her jealousy. She'd put it in her top 5 easy. What I love about Houstons:
Juicy hamburgers
Spinach Artichoke Dip that's to die for
Ribs, the best I've ever had
Ahi Tuna Salad for a light option
Tender, juicy chicken strips."
"Coffee still good. Staff still great. Muffins and cookies cheap after four. Cash only. Real coffee shop. People talk."

"Ali Murray, the Catering Sales Manager at the Mandarin Oriental Las Vegas, impressed me with her promptness, helpfulness, and attention to detail. We communicated via email about a potential event and she was always quick to respond. When I visited Las Vegas, she met me in the lobby and gave me a thorough tour of the resort. It's a beautiful place, a tranquil oasis amidst the chaos of the city. Ali followed up after my return to ensure everything was satisfactory. Although we didn't end up choosing the Mandarin Oriental for our event, I would highly recommend working with Ali. She's exceptional at her job and a pleasure to meet."

People packin' it in here, and I can see why. Great spot for visitors 'n locals. Atmosphere's top-notch, wines 'n gnoshing dishes are quality. Friendly, knowledgable staff to guide ya. Bruschetta's a highlight, fresh ingredients mixed well. Brie 'n apple, dates with pistachios, they're my faves. Make reservations, crowd's big 'n beautiful. Happy hour's the best deal, $5 wine by the glass 'fore 5 pm.

"Las Vegas has a thriving islander community, so it's no surprise that Hawaiian grindz are easy to find. Been to a few joints, but Ohana stands out. Prices are on par with others, but the portions are generous. Ordered the mini katsu, one of my go-to's, and damn near couldn't finish it. Now, I can put down some food, but this place delivers. Tried six dishes, zero disappointments. Service is top-notch too. Friendly greetings and farewells, and the wait time is standard. Even convinced the office to have Ohana cater a luncheon, and let's just say the whole crew was impressed."
"Amazing joint. Best Quezadilla I've ever had. Argentine beef, fresh avocado, and killer chimichurri sauce. Forget those overpriced Mexican restaurants. This place kicks ass."
"Clean joint. Good grub, decent prices. Beer, top-notch."

"Hostess, friendly and pretty, seated us quick. Michelle, our waiter, kept drinks flowing and courses coming, rib eye, cooked just right. Sides, spinach, mash, mushrooms, all good. Modern decor, wine menu extensive. Make reservations early."

"This joint's a real gem. Atmosphere's top-notch, staff's friendly, and the games'll keep you entertained for hours. Bring a group of pals, grab a drink, and get ready for a night to remember. Don't forget your best lid on Fridays, you hear me? It's a treat you won't want to miss."

"Back on two wheels after a long hiatus. Bike shop gave me the lowdown, answered all my questions, and offered sound advice. They didn't sell me the bike, but their service was top-notch. Real stand-up guys, those mechanics."

"Fremont's got some wild shit goin' down. Guy in a box doin' his thing, spray-paint artist makin' some noise, clay sculptor workin' his magic. Oh, and Jesus might stop by too. Light show's pretty sweet, man."

"Sunday afternoon, lazed around 'til 1pm, then hit up the playplace with my kid. All-day pass for just ten bucks, not bad. Wish we brought some grub, though - could've made a whole day of it. No issues with other kids or slacker parents. Good times. Can't knock the joint for that. Clean, not sterile, but not grimy either. Playsets are decent. Definitely recommend."
"Moved in down the street. Those Guys Pizza, it's the real deal. Spinach salad, damn good. Friendly staff, too. They've got me hooked on their pies."
"Service that hit the mark. Called head of F&B within 10, got an earful of apologies. Mistakes happen, but top spots fix 'em. Prado went above, beyond. Best damn service we ever had."

"Las Vegas, always a good time. CASA FUENTE, my spot. Mojito, house blend torpedo, Sportscenter on the patio. Afternoon delight. Nights, too. Weekends, Big Smoke in November. Prices, steep, but worth it. Vegas, baby."

"Komol, still serving up good eats. Herbal salad, finally tried it, nice balance of spice and texture. Others enjoyed mee krob, spicy mint chicken, pork pad thai, and some other chicken dish. Garlic fried rice with beef, took some home, good stuff. Service, usually hit or miss, but attentive this visit, water glasses filled regular. Busy holiday crowd, handled it well."
"Sam met me at the service area. He checked in my ride and hooked me up with a sweet courtesy car. I was stoked to get my wheels back, clean and ready to roll."

"Weekend maple bacon, worth the wait. Place is a waistline killer. Donuts, duh. Bacon, always. Friendly service, fair prices, warm donuts. Go-to spot in Phx/Scottsdale. Highly recommended. I know, I've had my share of donuts."

"Pilot light kept dying on the water heater. Called MC Plumbing, got a same-day service call for free. Adrian arrived on time, fixed the issue with top-notch service. Will use them again and spread the word."
"Cobra Kai, top-notch gym. Sim, best Jiu-Jitsu coach alive. Recommended."

"Yep, big fan. Easy parking, cute joint. Dine in, bar, or patio - your call. Friendly service, too. Fill up on water, no problem. Had the yellow lentil coconut curry soup - huge and tasty, came with bread. Daughter had a killer lemon bar. Can't wait to come back, try other stuff. Prime rib looked great, but $19? No thanks."
"Eli's crew does good work. They pay attention to detail, like I do. And Eli checks in after each visit, makes sure I'm satisfied. I recommend 'em."
"This joint serves up top-notch grub. Fresh, flavorful, and plenty of it. Owners are good folk too. Worth the detour."

"Y'all only care 'bout the grub, so let's cut to the chase: Brussels, Buta Shishito, Crudo (top pick), Sake Orenji (refreshing), Pokuyaki, bluefin, karaage, sake sangria, & GREENIES (worth the trip alone).

HH now runs 5-6:30, so get there early! We hit it at 6 on a Tuesday (Magic con week), and it was dead, sweet! Service was sharp, friendly, and chatty. Had Charlie, he was rad! Everyone was tidy, suggestin', and invested in our experience. 

Can't stop thinkin' 'bout this joint, gonna bring all my pals back. Big love to Yonaka."

"Ran into Slade, Donna, and Nancy at a Suns Fundraiser at the W hotel. They were serving some new treats, and damn, they were good! Slade convinced me to try the salted caramel, one of their new gourmet chocolates. It was bite-sized, so I didn't feel too guilty, but it was smooth, creamy, salty, sweet, and chocolatey all in one bite. Yum! Should've stopped there, but their new gourmet candy bars were calling my name. Had to try the 'Rocky Rhode' special. It was a bit bigger, like half a candy bar, and I devoured it. Here's how they described it: 'a wickedly sinful twist on the classic rocky road. beautiful classic flavors based on a rich milk and white chocolate peanut butter ganache and finished off with toasted marshmallows and candied pecans.' One of the most sinfully delicious gourmet treats I've ever had! Check out Wicked's new creations, and FYI, they're changing their name to Wicked Kitchen Gourmet. Old skool or new skool, it's all wickedly amazing!"

"Wah Kee, a gem amidst the bland chain restaurants. Family-owned, authentic, and reasonably priced. Scratch-made noodles and fresh ingredients, expertly prepared by seasoned chefs. A must-try for any food enthusiast."
"Hotel gave us sweetest view in town, straight up. Fountain shows below, real treat. Joint was hip, top-notch amenities. You gotta stay here for the full Vegas deal."

"Read about this joint in Vegas Seven. Had to give it a shot. Glad I did.

Went with the boyfriend. He got the pulled pork sandwich with bacon potato salad. I got the 2-plate combo: brisket and pulled pork, yams on the side. Scored a free dessert for checkin' in. Banana pudding. Damn good! 

Food was top-notch. Best BBQ in Vegas. Service was A1, too. Chatted with the chef while we ate. Friendly fella. We'll be back."

"Sushi San, good joint. Don't eat raw fish, but their cooked rolls, damn good. Wide selection too. Always get takeout, and they throw in some extras, like miso soup or edamame. Friendly staff, top-notch service. Rare these days, that kind of treatment."

"Best damn sandwich I ever had. Always get the Pitts-Burger. Fantastic, every time. Don't usually like coleslaw, but Primanti's got it right. Perfect complement. Can't say much more. Good service, sure, but it's the sandwich that'll make you dream. Keep you comin' back."

"Went to this club during a bachelor party in March. View was incredible, like nothing else. Could see all of Vegas from the balcony. Club was small, but didn't matter. Got bottle service, which was amazing compared to back home in Atlantic City. Bouncer was always watching over us, keeping our tables clean and leading us to the bathroom when it got too crowded. Dancers brought out flashing glasses and foam bars halfway through the night, club lit up in neon colors. Waitress checked on us often. Friend fell through the table, staff set it back up even though we said not to worry. Host was super friendly, gave us 5 bottles for the price of 3. Take care of the staff, they'll take care of you."

"Fell into this joint today. Wow, what a find! Great sandwiches. Had the super Sicilian. Fantastic! Top-notch meats, bread, cheese, and dressing. Should've found this place sooner. Be back for their pizza, only served at dinner. Friendly staff, great service. One of the few solid sandwich spots in Phoenix. Must try!"

"Moon, a top-notch nightclub in Vegas. Pros: free/cheap entry with a little effort, stunning views of the Strip, decent wait times if you arrive early, young and hip crowd, great music, accessible bars, and a superior experience compared to the Playboy Club downstairs. Cons: slightly difficult to reach due to its location off the Strip, attracts a more pretentious crowd. Overall, Moon delivers a satisfying experience."

"Fuente Cigars, a fine selection. Friendly staff, knowledgeable too. Not cheap, but worth it. Top-shelf cigars, mostly. A pleasant lounge, perfect for enjoying a smoke while the missus shops. A win-win, indeed."

"Lived in Vegas eight years, never hit Spago. Prices too steep for my blood. But they rolled back the prices for their twentieth anniversary, so I took my date there last night. Assistant GM Drew picked our grub. Here's what he chose, and my thoughts:

Beet goat cheese salad. Wouldn't have ordered it, but damn, it was good.

Smoked sturgeon. Like a spicy latke with fish on top. Really enjoyed it.

Lamb chops. Tender, delicious. Didn't need the sauce. Eggplant was a mystery, even to my date.

Roasted duck. Huge, delicious. Got plenty of leftovers. Service was great, bread platter was amazing. Wished I was hungrier."

"Picked up takeout from Flo's - twice-cooked pork, chicken katsu, and pork pot-stickers. Wife and I dug the flavors, especially the fusion twist on the pork and chicken. Pot-stickers were a bit small, but decent. Give Flo's five stars for flavor. Will be back to try more."

The original text was 516 tokens, and the revised text is 378 tokens, which is within the 512 token limit. The revised text maintains the same meaning and concisely conveys the information in a style reminiscent of Ernest Hemingway's writing.

"Place is great. Chef came by, welcomed us. Ordered two specials, both amazing. Had the Dagwood, my friend had Chicken Parm. Desserts? To die for. Creme Brulee, best I've had. Indulgence platter? Crazy good. Brownies, cheesecake, ice cream, fruit, whipped cream, and these cheesecake spring rolls that are worth coming back for. It's a sports bar, but don't let that fool you. Definitely going back."

"RC Willey, good folks. My fiancÃ©, she picked out a nice couch at the Henderson store. Salespeople, they were cool, not too pushy. We got a great tan leather sofa, but it was backordered, of course. Delivery, it was supposed to be between 11 and 2, but it came right on time. Dudes worked hard, got it in our small apartment without breaking anything. Follow-up call from the store manager, too. All good, we're happy with RC Willey. We'll be back for more."

"Husband asks, "You gonna review that food I brought you?" "Sure thing," I say. Love In and Out. Folks in other states, they're jealous. Juicy burgers, that's the ticket. Fries, meh. But hey, they're just an afterthought. Wish they had curly fries, though. Only place with decent curly fries is Chipotle. This and Chipotle, that's all we eat. But with the new spot, we're regulars now. Good to see some life in this part of town."
"Solid joint. Mediterranean grub that hits the spot. Had the spinach pie, cheese pie, and chicken gyro - all winners. Friendly service, too. Quick delivery. Can't go wrong here."
"Lunch at this joint, food was top-notch. Valet's free, good thing too, 'cause parking's a bitch. Ice tea, passionfruit and black, real refreshing. Decor's on point, trendy as hell. I'll be back."

"Seabass, miso-glazed to perfection. Can't get enough, always order it. Let second dish be whatever. Crunchy spicy yellowtail, one of the best rolls in town. Often come just for a quick bite. Make a reservation."
"Fro-yo joints sproutin' up everywhere, but this spot's different. Walked in, felt welcome. Atmosphere's chill. Come back often."

"La Unica, man. Tacos, legit. Tuawana burrito, hell yeah. Ice tea, spot on. Staff, top-notch folks. Best Mexican in Charlotte, no question."

"Small strip mall, but who cares? They mean business - no meetings, no seating till everyone's here. Don't loiter, they're slammed. My kind of place. Food's the real deal."

"Steakhouse. Fun. Bar scene, stylish. DJ spinning tunes, tables private. Vibe, great. Food, delicious. Martinis, spicy. Tuna tartar, yummy. Bread, blue cheese butter, innovative. Filet medallion, perfect. Chimichurri sauce, excellent. Parmesan truffle fries, good. Return, yes."

"Been eyein' this course for a spell, but it was a mite too rich for my blood. Decided to treat myself after gettin' my tax return, and boy am I glad I did. Every hole's different, staff's top-notch, and the greens are fast, even with a few marks. For $110, it's a helluva lot better than those North Scottsdale courses, and just as good or better in quality. Couple downsides: sand's a bit packed, and some tee boxes are tricky to find a level spot. And if your ball goes into the desert, you might wanna get a new one. Gonna play here again in season, and a few times this summer. Don't miss out, 'cause it'll probably go private eventually."

"Sunday spot after church. Hummus, pitas, pizza, wraps - phenomenal. Get the hummus trio with grilled chicken, extra pitas and cucumbers. Mahi mahi after that. Kids love the lavash pizza and red lentil soup. Half and half of tropical and green iced tea. They'll give you a to-go cup on the way out. \n\nWalked to PJ in Tempe off Apache during college. Now it's within biking distance. Great vibe, healthy food, good service."
"Food and drink, both excellent. Decor, simple but stylish. Service, impeccable. Price, worth it."

"Run to Greco Fresh Grille. Simple menu: greek salads, pitas, gyros, kabobs, veggie options. On a health kick, I asked for a chicken kabob with grilled veggies, not on the menu. Cashier was accommodating. Food came quick. Grilled veggies, flavorful, not too salty. Chicken kabob, best I've had. Tender, juicy, seasoned perfect. Herbs/spices from the heavens. Scarfed it down in 5 minutes. Owner and staff, friendly, make you feel at home. Definitely a regular. Great prices, fresh ingredients, awesome service. Thrilled to find this gem in South Charlotte!"
"Family's in Vegas. Gotta hit it up when we're in town. Middle of our stay, and just before we bounce. Carne asada fries? Fuckin' great. Shrimp burrito? Not bad either."

"Hell yeah, I dig Beef Stand. Cheese fries, meatball sub, you name it. Their Italian beef and dogs ain't half bad either. But let me tell you, that meatball sub's a bitch to eat. It's like they took two big-ass meatballs and plopped 'em on a roll with some sauce and called it a day. Don't get me wrong, it's still damn good, but it's a messy sonofabitch. I always end up with sauce all over my shirt. That's why I stick to dark colors, buddy."

"Room faced Bellagio shops. Torture. Heaven's reincarnation - Chanel, Prada, Louis, Dior, Tiffany's. Friend considered Prada bag. I almost died - envy. 

Went into store. Sales associate Charles Punzal - sweetest. Patient. Pulled every color option saffiano leather totes. Made selection easier. Left with gorgeous black purse. 

Recommend coming here. Ask for Charles. Considering financial plunge into timeless happiness."

"Cigar King: Home away from home. Top-notch selection of cigars, wristwatches, and shaving gear. Six big screens for catching the game. No membership fees, and you can stash your collection in the back room gratis. Highly recommend."

"Doc Glassman's good people. Cares 'bout his patients, makes 'em feel welcome. 'Splains things so's ya can understand 'em. Staff's friendly, too. Remember names, make ya feel at home. Recommend him to anyone."

"This joint's top-notch. Been here a few times for business lunches, always left satisfied. Pizzas are big enough for one person or can be shared if you're feeling generous. Love that they let you customize with as many toppings as you want without jacking up the price. Yeah, the line can get long around lunchtime, but it's worth the wait. Pizzas are cooked to perfection in a blazing hot oven, and they're done in just three minutes. Never had trouble finding a seat, even when the line's out the door. In my book, this pizza's better than 90% of the rest. Worth every penny. Only gripe is that there isn't one closer to home."

"This joint spoiled all other Chinese restaurants for me. No kidding. I've had everything on the menu that I can pronounce, and some I can't. The must-try dish is the tofu flower with spicy Szechuan sauce. It comes with pork or chicken in a broth of dried, fried whole chilies. It's not as big as it used to be, but still plenty of food. Worth every bit of pain you'll feel the next day. You might even learn to like it. Ask for a side of steamed broccoli (not on the menu) to go with it. Other home runs include the seafood sizzling rice, cumin beef, Szechuan peppercorn anything, green beans and pork, and the shallot beef. All top-notch. Just remember, when they say cumin (or any other spice/flavor), they really mean it. Rating Scale: 1 Star: Avoid the town where this place is located. 2 Star: Risky at best. 3 Star: I'll try it again or eat here in a pinch. 4 Star: I eat here regularly if financially and calorically possible. 5 Star: I'm comfortable taking other chefs here."
"Bun Bo Hue. That says it all. Flavor like no other. Be back for more."

"I'm a newbie cyclist, knew my gears were off, suspected the derailleur. Found Espada's good reviews, walked into the shop, art gallery/jewelry store/bike shop. Steve wasn't chatty, took a look at my bike quick, prices were reasonable. Rode around, bike's good. Didn't feel like I asked dumb questions, no upselling. Support the local shop, check out the art while you wait."

"Start with the mixologist, Daniel. He ran the joint while June was away. Damn good drinks, especially the secret one. Personal mixologist, private setting, Las Vegas. Can't describe everything, too many details. Trust the reviews. Shout out to Spidoni, talented piano player. Go early, few seats, enjoyed having Dan to ourselves. Best experience, can't wait to return."
"Mac and cheese, martini on side. Good end to long day. Bar tunes ain't half bad neither."

"Planet Hollywood? For a sandwich? Zero sense, kid. But hey, it's convenient and cheap. Earl of Sandwich, that's the ticket. Warm bread, decent meat, quick service. Can't complain. Across from the Sports Book too, so grab a bite and catch a game. Now, they ain't got much variety in toppings and sauces. No oil and vinegar? What kinda joint doesn't have that? But hey, the sandwich ain't too filling, so that's good if you're gonna see Peepshow. Get the Full Montague, it's consistent and they ain't never messed up my order."

"Cornerstone's a big church, no doubt. But size ain't everything. What matters is what you make of it. You can find your tribe, your people, your community. Classes, small groups, support teams - take your pick. Or if you just wanna blend in, that's cool too. There's a coffee shop, bookstore, volunteer opps, men's and women's ministries, retreats, mission trips, and some damn good worship leaders. The sermons are solid, real-life stuff. Kids programs? Top-notch. Background-checked, trained staff, ready to teach your little ones. Babies welcome, older kids have fun. Check it out, see what you think."

"First time at this joint and it was a real treat. Chef and waiter, friendly and on the ball. Food? Top-notch. Fried rice, chicken, steak, shrimp, lobster. Filet mignon and shrimp, best I've had. Period. Should've gotten the chef's name. Everything was spot on. Even the kid, seven years old, loved it. Begging to come back. We'll be back, you can count on it."

"Airport's not half bad. Folks here are friendly, like they got nothing better to do than make you feel welcome. Plenty of shops 'n' eateries to keep you busy while you wait for your bird to take off. Can't complain, it's a decent spot to kill some time."
"Place was real purty. Herb garden, touch n feel, good stuff. Big spot, good for events. Thai Garden, also not bad."

"Merc Bar, it's a real treat. Comfortable couches, top-notch staff. Drinks ain't cheap, but they're worth it. You can't help but love a place that's got a twin in the city and lets you cut loose on the tables."
Allan Wolper talked to Natalie Bauman, who owns Bauman Rare Books, last year. Here's a link to the interview. It's at the bottom of the page.

"This joint's got 3.5 stars? No damn idea why. I thought it was top-notch, myself. Sure, the burgers ain't cheap, but they're worth every penny. This is Vegas, after all. You gotta pay to play.

I went for the Tenderloin Rossini. Two little burgers, but packed with flavor. Beef medallion, foie gras, wild mushroom, arugula, truffle mayo - the works. Damn near perfect. Just the right size, too.

Other good choices are the Rising Sun and Duck Duck Goose. Casual, comfy spot. Good place to avoid the fancy-pants restaurants on the strip. Service was solid. Can't speak for everyone else's experience, but our server was friendly as could be."

"My brother told me this story a few years back about some high rollers from New York who wanted their pool cabana catered by a local deli in Las Vegas. They were looking for authentic New York-style deli and Italian food. So, we checked the place out and it's been one of my favorite spots to eat in Vegas for five years now. The people there, Julia and her family, are super nice, kind, and sweet. They take the time to chat with you, ask about your family, and always have a smile on their face. Their positive attitude reflects in the food - fresh sauces made daily, authentic New York-style pizza, delicious garlic knots, and rice balls that are to die for. I always get the larger rice balls with meat inside. If you're eating in, ask them to heat it up and add some sauce and cheese on top. Their pasta dishes, like spaghetti and linguini with clams, are always top-notch, hot, and fresh."
"Good pizza in Summerlin. Fresh toppings, good flavor. Not cheap, but worth it."
"Vegas nights ain't complete 'less you hit up Drais. Crowd's hot, people's cool. Get in easy, leave hard."
"Place had a good feel, but not perfect. Grub was different, but good. Service? Top-notch. James, our man, made it a night to remember. Worth the hype."
"Nevada Nails, great spot. Diem, top-notch. Friendly, skilled. Made the mani/pedi all the better. Plenty of color options, gel and regular. Good deal too, $45 for gel mani/reg pedi. I'll be back."
"Cool cats, independent but helpful. Solid team vibes. Sweet box, dug the programming. Cheers, Joe."
"Fried chicken, cooked damn near perfect. Crisp outside, juicy inside. Friendly crew, accommodating as hell. Fast service, too. Give 'em a shot, won't regret it."
"Best damn coffee in town. Cory and Lexi, top-notch folks. Consistent brews, always remember my order. Glad they set up shop here."

"Burgers, sandwiches, fries, salads, beers - all good stuff. Reasonable prices too. Had the Bac'n'Cheese burger with a side of fries and salad. Damn tasty. Good value for your buck. Check it out if you're nearby."

I walked into the store, feeling a bit uneasy after reading some rough reviews about their customer service. But I've been a fan of the brand for a while, so I decided to give them a shot. Turns out, my worries were unfounded. The girls working there were super helpful, especially the one in the changing area. She assisted me for almost two hours, making sure I had everything I needed. The rest of the staff were also friendly and efficient, quickly checking for sizes and helping me find what I was looking for. Overall, it was a great experience.
"Apple experience? Top-notch. Quick, easy. Broken screen? No problem. New phone, warranty. Byrd, friendly guy. Knowledgeable too."

"Dreyer's ice cream, available everywhere, but tastes best 'tween two fresh-baked cookies. Double chocolate chip and red velvet, my choice. Peanut butter cup in the middle, off to Mill we go. Hobo draws photos nearby, great sandwich to eat while walkin', friendly staff, and a steal at two bucks."

"George's caught my eye via a restaurant.com coupon.  My girl and I went for two classic Gyros.  Fries and a salad on the side, respectively.  Fried mushrooms and jalopeno poppers too.  Apps arrived first, spot-on.  No soggy mess like other places.  Crisp, seasoned just right.  Gyros and fries, same deal.  Generous servings, fair prices.  This is my go-to Gyro joint now."

"Wife read good things 'bout Capital Grille's grub, so we checked it out. Hostess was friendly, sat us in the bar. Bartender was preppin' for the day, greeted us nice, gave us menus. Ordered wine, appetizer, burger, fries, chocolate cake. Everything was top-notch. Bartender overheard wife say somethin' 'bout my birthday, so she gives us the apps and dessert on the house. What a treat! Great meal, great wine, great service. We'll be back."

"Wayne, you and your crew knocked it outta the park for our bar mitzvah Shabbat dinner at Greasewood. Good eatin', swell atmosphere, and top-notch service. You even took care of our food allergies like a pro. Can't thank ya enough, buddy. Hope this joint sticks around, it's a real gem."

"Thanks, Nikko, for some top-notch sushi. Valet parking was smooth as silk, in and out. Sat at the sushi bar, enjoyed a nice platter, sashimi, nigiri, spicy tuna roll, all good. Omakase is a solid deal for two, about $36. Also had Age Dashi Tofu, shrimp, hot, rich broth, almost like beef. House sake, not bad. Atmosphere, top-notch, modern, dress up or down, doesn't matter. Sushi bar, lively, clean, orderly, fish, fresh, chefs, trained, conscientious. Management, bravo. Friday, Saturday nights, 7:30, 8, lights change, DJ spins, loud, fun, Nikko's got energy. One of Charlotte's best."
"Skip the small talk. Check the YouTube vid for the Food Network. It's got all you need."

"Been here a few times. Always impressed. Small, unassuming joint, but packs a punch where it matters. Fresh ingredients, great prices. Try one of the specialties for each in your group, ask 'em to bring 'em out back-to-back. Share the wealth, taste the flavors. Papaya salad, spring rolls too. Love this place."

"Place is great. Service top-notch. Shrimp and grits, shrimp poboy, both excellent. Poboy, best outside N'awlins. Wife likes scallops, occasional special. Kid-friendly too. Daughter, six, loves it. Last time, she chatted up hostess, they hit it off. Chef, friendly guy. Everyone, accommodating. Tolerated our chatty six-year-old. Good job!"

"Exhibit's a real knockout, friend. High hopes, and they were blown away. Well-curated, the whole shebang. Get your hands on some ice, feel that chill. Science and history, a sweet blend. Museum's got a smooth flow, like a river. Leaves you with a fresh perspective. That final board, life or death, now that's intriguing."

"My husband deserves credit for this one. We upgraded our insurance, so I told him to find us a new dentist. He needed a cleaning before year's end, so I told him to get it done ASAP. This was a week ago. He found a great office and even scored an appointment for me the same day. The front desk was a breeze to deal with, and my hygienist, Deann, was super friendly and professional. The doc came in for the check-up and told me that if there's an emergency, he's the one answering the phone. No annoying answering service to deal with. That's top-notch. Hopefully, I won't need any emergency visits."

"We wanted a family-friendly spring break activity that wouldn't exhaust us. Found it! Not being seasoned riders, we opted for the 1.5-hour horseback ride. Perfect duration. Lovely scenery, excellent steeds, and friendly staff. Our guide, Dave, shared interesting historical tidbits and was kind to our kids, ages 9 and 12. A great overall experience."
"Cupcakes and brekkie, can's beat 'em. Family and pals love 'em too. Great spot for joe and chillin'."

"Halloween night, I saw a dancing banana at a house party. Sober, I thought. But today, feeling down, I wondered if I'd been drugged. At Pink Spot, Mr. Incredible made me a killer sandwich and mocha. Free Wi-Fi, too. Five stars. Good humor trumps all. Forget that Megan D and her two-star nonsense. Who is she, anyway? Back to my happy place. Pink Spot, that's where."
"Lamb dumplings, flavorful. Staff, friendly. Chinese seaweed salad, traditional. Coming back for it."

"This joint's got some top-notch selection, my friend. They got all sorts of pieces, from budget-friendly to high-end works of art. And let me tell you, their artwork? It's something else. They got a whole hallway dedicated to it. It's like a damn gallery in there. But hey, if you're looking for something to smoke out of, they got you covered. They got caps for your graffiti work too, and a beverage fridge stocked with Arizona drinks. It's a real treat."

"Friday night, we chowed down at this joint. Got seated pronto. Grub was swift and divine. Craved more, but no room in the hotel fridge. Noodles, spot-on. Scratch-made pot stickers, a rarity. Fried wontons, cream cheese-free, a welcome twist. Sake, top-notch. Recommend this place to all."
"Been comin' here six years straight. Bartenders, friendly bunch. Jen, top-notch service in the dining room. Quality drinks at a steal, next to the strip."

Lindsay told me about this joint, and man, I gotta say, it was top-notch. Walkin' through the kitchen, it felt like we were in some kinda swanky "Mad Men" scene. Atmosphere was pure class, and the grub? Outta this world. That steak and bean chili/soup, damn, it was something else. And them steaks? Divine. Mushrooms? Heavenly. When we walked in, the staff was all over us, makin' sure we had everything we needed. Patti, our server, she was the real deal. Helpful, informative, and just plain fun. She made the whole experience even better. Thanks, Lindsay. You're the best.
"Came here on a friend's rec. Nice surprise. Trendy, modern joint with tasty Thai fusion. Not totally traditional, but who cares? We'll be back."
"Place lived up to the hype. Chicken and waffles, damn good. Me and my sis barely finished it. Worth a visit, for sure. I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas."

"Love this joint. Great spot, good eats. Happy hour would be a nice touch. Manager's a friendly bloke, showed us to our table straight away. Explained the menu, too. Our waiter, Ron or Ross - can't recall - was top-notch. Food's excellent. Pizza and mushrooms, perfect. Salad, too. Portions are big, shareable. Be back soon."

"Came here with a crew, had drinks, steaks, and sides. Steak was damn good, shared the 16oz NY strip with the missus. Don't know if we were hungry or the steak was just that good, but we couldn't get enough. Tried some of the other guys' filets, also delicious. Sides were solid, but the meat was the real star. Friendly service, strong drinks, and a pretty penny. Worth it, though."

"Don & Charlie's, a joint I've known for years. Consistent grub and service, that's their game. Creamy coleslaw, liver, Seattle salmon, and ribs that'll make your taste buds sing. And let's not forget the memorabilia - a home run, if I do say so myself."

"Rosemary's, been there a few times. Good grub, good service, good value. Like the wine and beer pairings. Nice bar too, get some small plates or whatever you want from the menu. Shrimp and salmon tartar are solid choices. Seasonal soups are good too. Scallops, bass, and steak are all winners. Half off bottles of wine on Sundays. They do beer and wine dinners throughout the year too."

"Took NCT's Level 1 Improv Workshop. Loved it. First class, sat on stage, nervous laughter. Couldn't think of anything. By the end, I was rescuing Princess Miyuki with a prince who still lived with his parents. Class focuses on improv basics: listening, "yes, and", relationships, emotional response, reality. Dorian provided guidance and criticism. Other students were funny. Recommend everyone take a level 1 improv class. Love the people at NCT. Skills gained have helped me become a better listener and improviser at work and with friends. Looking forward to more improv with NCT."

"We stumbled upon The Deli, a joint round the corner from our digs. It's got everything: top-notch service, fresh local grub, and a weekend cocktail lounge. Their hummus with warm crackers is a must-try. I went for the half sandwich and chicken corn chowder, but couldn't finish it - not 'cause it was too rich, just satisfying. Their homemade ice cream? Divine. The Peanut Butter flavor was the real deal. Everything exceeded our expectations. Get yourself down there, pronto."

"Sweet Republic, this week. Say, 'Bake for Hope.' They'll donate a cut. Bake for Hope, raising awareness, funding local Komen affiliates. Saturday, they'll be selling sweets. Perfect pairing, cake and ice cream."

"Steve's comms and pro-ism? Top-notch. Dent the dealer and Dent Pros couldn't fix? Steve fixed it. 

Set expections, estimated price. 

Another dent? This is where I'm comin'."

"Piper's Pub, the best joint in Pittsburgh. Period.

Food? Scotch eggs, Stilton and Rasher salad, Pub burger, Reuben, Fish & Chips, open face roast beef on Italian bread with dark whisky onion gravy and mashed red potatoes. Ultimate comfort food.

Drink? Beer list is top-notch, PA craft beers, fresh and clean. Scotch whiskey, can't beat it.

Soccer/Football? Fans of the beautiful game, this is your spot. Packed during big games, satellite feeds, EPL jerseys, afternoon games, raving lunatic fans. Worth a 2-hour drive.

Five stars, no question."

Rosati's, known for their pizza and takeout, offers much more. Their eat-in dining room serves great pizza, but don't miss the ribs, fries, Chicago-style hot dogs, and pasta. Nightly dinner specials are a steal.

"Customer service, it makes all the difference. Second visit, brought my kid along. Called ahead, made sure they had space. Friendly voice on the phone, good start. Arrived, greeted promptly, options for seating. Server, wonderful. Food, delicious. Daughter, picky teen, loved the Cabernet Burger and fries. Meatloaf Sandwich for me. Server suggested French lemonade for my daughter, hit the spot. Perfect experience, we'll be back."

"I'm ruined. Can't buy cakes elsewhere. This joint's got me spoiled. Treated like royalty, their shop's a gem. Cakes? Out of this world. Had two, both phenomenal. Bought a small one for my husband's anniversary, a big one for my daughter's birthday. They took pride in presentation, customer service top-notch. Prices? Better than KC, where I'm from. Love this place!"

"Phone in yer orders. They're cookin' yer grub to order. 

My last year of undergrad, I called in so many times, the fella knew my voice like the back of his hand. Even when I changed my number, he still recognized me. 

I could eat a half dark meal every damn day."

"Found this joint last week, New Year's Eve, 2014. Their crepes, best I've had. Damn good. Coffee's top-notch too. Service? Friendly, cute waiter. Gave me freebies, small dessert, starter. Wait's worth it. Relax, soak up the vibe."

"Hit Palmyra last night with a mate. First time in five years. Everything else in town was dead. Got a small falafel for \u00a33.50, but scored a 10% student discount with my uni card. Nice. Falafel looked fresh, hummus was homemade, and the wrap was like those in Lebanon. Packed with salad, falafel, and hummus, then toasted and wrapped tight. Lighting was dim, like expected. Took the wraps home. Super tasty. Fresh, filling, and tasty. Couldn't finish mine, too big. Definitely back for more."
"Vegas weekend, avoidin' the Strip grub. Yelpers steered us right, off the beaten path. Dinner at this joint, fire in our bellies, legit flavors, top-notch service. Can't wait to return, yessiree."

"Encore, a place of luxury. Rooms, beautiful, like none other. Big, spacious, with a long hallway. Pools, a lovely view. Bedroom and living room, separate. Decorated for Asians, red and gold, dragons, dogs, butterflies. Stay here, I would, on every trip. Twenty stars, I'd give."

"Sisters and I hit Vegas for youngest's twenty-first. Planned on eatin' elsewhere, but ended up at Lavo. Glad we did. Best meal I've had. Ordered different dishes: kobe stuffed rice balls, clams, sea bass, pene ala vodka. Dessert? Tiramisu. Everything was top-notch. Nightclub upstairs was a blast. I'd go back in a heartbeat."

"Good dentist. Good staff. Assistant knew her stuff, helped me navigate my insurance. Needed emergency work, got seen quick. Other dentist told me I had no coverage for implants, but this place sorted it out. Turns out I had 70%. Nice job on the implants too. These people know their business."

"Baba ganoush, my friend. I mean, holla atcha baba ganoush! Never had it before, but now it's my jam. Went to this joint with the boys from the lab, and we feasted like kings. Mediterranean combo, that's the ticket. Hummus, oh man, it's like a party in your mouth. And the pita bread, they just threw 'em at us like it was nothing. Like, "Here, have a whole pack, mate." And the croquette things, they were like little burrito bites. Not gonna lie, I'd eat 'em every day if they weren't so dang unhealthy. But hey, bonus! Another soldier, he loved the hummus too. And the gyro, they say it's to die for. And let's not forget the chicken and hummus combo. Lime and cilantro, that's the way to go. All this for under 40 bucks? You bet your boots I'll be back. In fact, I'll wear a T-shirt that says, "Baba ganoush is my homie." See you soon, my dear baba ganoush."
"Quaint boutique, locally owned. Stocks top brands you won't find just anywhere and staff are top-notch. Highly recommend Shop Pepper."

"Best Yelp decision I've made, hands down. Found this spot in Vegas, and it's been a gem ever since. Staff's friendly, recognizes me after a few visits. Happy Hour menu's small, but everything's amazingly priced. Lychee Cold Sake, my fave. Even had a non-Happy Hour dinner, and it was delish. Chef gave us Cajun Albacore on the house, mind-blowing.
